properties.neighborhood_overview: Being located in the middle of CBD, the apartment conveniently located across the road from Spencer street train station and spencer Outlet Retail stores, over 50 plus of your favourite well know retail shops  and foodcourts with abundances of different cuisine.  For your necessities and grocery shopping COLES just located across the road  or you can take 15 mins walk to QUEEN VICTORIA MARKET for fresh food options on the weekend.  Fast food restaurants such as burger edge, nandos, hungry jacks, McDonalds , and subway all located just within 150 m away and most of them open 24/7 .  The apartment is only walking distance to ETIHAD stadium, DOCKLANDS , CROWN entertainment precinct, Exhibition centre and FEDERATION SQUARE, Melbourne central shopping precinct.   We are lucky we Surrounded by restaurants, bars and cafes in the most liveable city in the world.
properties.notes: This apartment is private apartment and you wont be sharing this unit with anyone else. I will ensure you will have your privacy and feeling comfortable at our apartment.  Please let us know your arrival time so we can then greet and hand keys to you personally or organise one of the late check in preference .  LATE CHECK IN Is after 2 pm and available 24 hours  We understand sometimes flight can be delay or if there is change of plan. We offer this methods if you are arriving late as we don't live nearby  SELF CHECK IN  Extra 20 and available 24 hours. You will need to pick up keys from a safe spot about 300 m away from the apartment. We will send you the information by text msg  NO EARLY CHECK IN  NO LATE CHECK OUT  If you want to leave your luggage before checking-in or after you check-out, there are affordable luggage services and paid lockers across the road on Spencer St at the Southern Cross train station. They charge anywhere from AU10 to AU16 per locker for 24 hours worth o
properties.transit: This apartment is located about 200 m from Southern cross station also skybus station to and from the Melbourne airport just across the road.  You can hail cabs from spencer st which is only 100 m away from the apartment. Catch buses from the melbourne main bus station in the Lonsdale street located about 50 m away from the apartment.  Public transport in Melbourne is so accommodating and the location of this apartment is in the middle of it all.  Most importantly, all trams within the city are FREE. Just look out for the "FREE tram zone" signs.
properties.access: You will be allowed to access the:- 43" Smart TV with netflix, dvd player, books, dvd movies and blue ray collections. Free wifi, Lobby, Lifts, Apartment units, kitchen and all equipments ,Pools, gyms and other amenities such as spa, sauna, and communal garden.
properties.interaction: We will interact with you as many as you wish or as little as you required We can be reached via airBNB, what'sApp, Email, Sms or you can call us when necessary We will reply or attend your need ASAP  We try our best to ensue that your stay will be as pleasant as possible and so that you can enjoy Melbourne just as much as we do :)

properties.host_about:
Hi there my name is  Mon . I came to Melbourne 14 years ago . This city is full of surprises and it's still amazes me everyday. From the city laneways, easy access to the public transport and diversity of people and the choices of restaurant cultures and entertainment. 

I love being a host and I love meeting up with new people and sharing stories with them. I love cooking, eating out, trying out new restaurants, going out for brunches and having coffee, shopping and entertaining people. 

I welcome you to the world most liveable city - Melbourne :)

properties.host_about:
Hi, my name is Paul, owner of Complete Host apartments! I am a seasoned traveler and have been fortunate to have visited most countries and experienced the way the locals live by staying at amazing airbnb properties all around the world. From these experiences I have learned a lot about what sort of experiences people are after when visiting a foreign city.

After spending the majority of the last 15 years overseas I am living back in my home town of  Melbourne and now run a short stays business called Complete Host.  As such, I have on offer a number of very comfortable properties in some of the best locations of Melbourne.

If you are interested in one of the properties l have listed but the dates are unavailable, please check my other listings under my profile or email me an inquiry as l will very likely have another property available that will suit your requirements. 

I cant wait to meet you and make your stay in Melbourne a memorable one!

Paul, Complete Host

properties.name: Spacious Heritage Listed Central CBD Apartment
properties.summary: Experience Melbourne like a local in this well appointed apartment in a quiet and secure heritage listed building in the CBD Free Tram Zone. Five minute walk to Queen Victoria Markets. Free WiFi, Netflix, and Stan. No cleaning fee. Late check-out.
properties.space: My apartment has 3.5 metre ceilings and polished concrete floors throughout and is cool in summer, warm in winter. There is a large private courtyard with fake grass, generous open plan living area (with queen size sofa bed), full kitchen, laundry, separate bedroom and an en-suite bathroom.  Being at the back of the building on the ground floor, it is wonderfully quiet with absolutely no traffic or construction noise (incredibly rare in the CBD!) and no bright sunlight to wake you in the morning.   -Free WiFi internet and home phone -Fetch TV (includes catch-up TV), Netflix and Stan (streaming services) -Sonos music system with Spotify Premium and Apple Music  -Stove top coffee maker, french press with organic coffee and a selection of teas provided (and milk!) -Fully equipped cook's kitchen with high quality pots, pans, gadgets and microwave, along with a well stocked pantry bursting with (mostly organic) herbs, spices, oils etc for use during your stay -Dishwasher, washing machine, c

properties.notes: -Check-out is flexible, but check-in no earlier than 10am. Where possible, please let me know your arrival/departure times at time of booking -I'm happy to accept inquiries from first time users, but only with a completed profile including a photo and some basic information, along with verification. It's nice to know a little something about potential guests before welcoming them into my home
properties.transit: Public transport is easily accessible from my apartment- Flagstaff Station is a 5 min. walk, Melbourne Central Station is a gentle 8 min. stroll. The nearest City Circle Tram stop is 4 mins. away on the next block and other trams heading in all directions are a 4- 10 min. walk. All trams are free in the CBD Free Tram Zone and Myki cards are supplied for all other travel. Public Transport also operates 24 hours on Friday and Saturday. There is a taxi rank across the street, and plenty of Uber drivers in the area. Street parking is free overnight, and there is a car park next door with cheap early bird rates and a 7 flat rate on weekends and public holidays.
properties.interaction: I always welcome guests on arrival with a brief tour of the apartment and to hand over the keys. I am then available 24/7 via email or phone for questions or to help solve any issues. If I'm working or out of the country, either my best friend or one of my fantastic neighbours will be available.
properties.house_rules: Please respect my home, our beautiful heritage building and my neighbours (no parties!) Smoking is permitted in the courtyard only There is no cleaning fee, so at the end of your stay please strip the bed and place linen and used towels in the hamper in the bathroom
properties.host_about:
I’m a 40 something professional who works on a freelance basis in festival and event operations. I’ve travelled extensively, having lived and worked overseas for more than a decade with a great chunk of that time spent in Ireland.  
I adore Melbourne, but I travel often and house sit for friends and colleagues a lot- that's when I'm happy to make my home available for guests.
properties.street: Central Business District, Melbourne, VIC 3000, Australia

properties.name: A truly Melbourne experience...
properties.summary: This 2 bedroom apartment offers all the comforts of home in the best possible CBD location.  Located in a historical building on Hosier Lane, with Fed Square, Flinders St Station, the city & Melbourne's famous sporting precinct on your doorstep, it promises a truly Melbourne experience!
properties.space: My apartment offers all the comforts of home (probably because for most of the time, it is my home).  It's got a great feel and heaps of space. A full size kitchen with everything you need to prepare a complete meal including a thermomix, coffee grinder & coffee machine (it wouldn't be Melbourne without them). Two good size bedrooms, each with a queen bed.  One overlooks the back lane where you can watch graffiti artists updating one of Melbourne's most iconic alleys.  The second faces internally for a darker, quieter sleep. The large living space has a dining table, couch and desk area.  There is a flat screen TV, DVD player and bluetooth stereo (for dancing around) and fast WiFi throughout (in case work is more your thing). The bathroom has a shower over bath, bidet (which I've never used) and a washer & dryer.

There is a flat screen TV, DVD player and bluetooth stereo (for dancing around) and fast WiFi throughout (in case wo
properties.neighborhood_overview: The location of this apartment is incredible - you can't get any better.  It's in the best spot in the best part of the city.  Inside it's calm and quiet, but once you step out onto the street you're in the heart of the city with all of the top sights within walking distance.  It's 150m to Flinders St station which connects you with all of Melbourne.  15minutes walk to the MCG, Rod Laver Arena & AAMI Park.  Fed Square is directly over the road.  All of Melbourne's best restaurants and bars are on the surrounding streets (on and off Flinders Lane).  This apartment offers a truly Melbourne experience!
properties.notes: The apartment is in a very secure building, which has security card access into the building and then onto the specific floor.
properties.transit: All public transport is right on your doorstep - take your pick.
properties.access: You will have access to the whole apartment... mi casa es su casa.
properties.interaction: I'll be available during your stay if you want tips or need help with anything, but happy to stay out of your hair if that's what you prefer.
properties.house_rules: Like you would at your own home.  No smoking please.
properties.host_about: I am an Australian 33 year old chick who loves travelling and experiencing different cultures and lifestyles.  I have always worked in tourism so have been fortunate enough to travel a lot.  I love cooking and eating & drinking with friends & family.  I am way too addicted to bad television and entertainment news, but I can't help myself.  My celebrity gossip knowledge is second to none so I'm always a great addition to any trivia team.  I don't read as much as I'd like, but try to keep up with current events and news.  A good coffee is always appreciated - especially in the morning.  I also really like to stay fit and always try to do keep active - I have a cute little white dog, Monkey, who keeps me motivated. My favorite activity is snowboarding - I lived the dream in Canada for a few years, but that's now becoming a distant memory.  I am happy settled down to life in Melbourne, which is such an awesome city (if you haven't been).  I have a bunch of funny friends that always keep me entertained and are great company - we all enjoy a nice glass of wine, a good meal and great conversation.  Life is pretty damn good!  I hope maybe our paths cross one day - until then....
properties.street: Central Business District, Melbourne, VIC 3000, Australia

properties.name: Clean & crisp, modern living in Prahran
properties.summary: My top-floor abode is blessed with most amazing natural light. Newly renovated & tastefully decorated, this large 2 bedroom apartment comfortably sleeps 4.  5 min walk to Alb Park Lake &  St Kilda. Public transport on your doorstep!
properties.space: Hello! My apartment is conveniently located in the most amazing location, just off St Kilda Road in Prahran/ St Kilda.   Newly renovated, my top-floor, 2 bedroom apartment is only a  5min walk to Albert Park lake and to Fitzroy Street in St Kilda.  Set amongst the treetops, it's a refuge of peace and quiet.   It's just a 10 minute stroll to the famous Chapel street, or St Kilda beach.  You can walk into Melbourne's city centre through beautiful parklands, or catch a tram. The apartment comprises 2 large bedrooms, 1 bath/shower, modern kitchen, huge living area, and a separate toilet.  Being on the top floor (3rd floor), there are stairs involved and no elevator in the building.  It's only the 3rd floor, and my 70 year old dad runs up them, no sweat! The apartment is bathed in natural sunlight, with a queen-size bed in one room and a double in the second bedroom.   There is also a pull-out futon bed for extra guests.  Provisions provided: Tea, coffee, salt & pepper, olive oil, balsamic
properties.description: My top-floor abode is blessed with most amazing natural light. properties.neighborhood_overview: I love my location, as do many of my friends, as I am walking distance to Melbourne's best! Our amazing beaches, botanical gardens, shopping, public transport, food food and more food, live entertainment in the amazing surrounding parks over the summer months, and night markets, pubs and clubs. Alfred Hospital just a 10 min walk away..What more can you ask for really??  This is the world's most liveable city after all.
properties.notes: I am an easy going and friendly human being. As I have travelled extensively myself, I appreciate what makes a comfortable and welcoming place for the weary traveller.   I look forward to having you stay in my humble abode!!!
properties.transit: Should you wish to check out more of this amazing city, and there is a lot going on, public transport is right on your doorstep! Trams will take you to any desired location in central Melbourne. Or conveniently link you up to all main train stations if you wish to travel further. Trams heading north take you direct into the city. Stop off at the botanical gardens, head in for a night at the moonlight cinema or live theatre in the summer months. Then wander a little further and climb the steps of The Shrine of Remembrance", with its incredible views of our amazing city. From there you are almost down town, so hop back on the tram or  just enjoy the leisurely 10 min walk and you will find yourself at the entrance of the city. The amazing Arts Centre, a flagship of the performing arts in Victoria, and the focal point of Melbourne's cultural. Then right next door you have Southbank so take in the breath taking views of an evening as you walk along the Yarra river.  This fantastic city offe
properties.access: Entire apartment is yours.  Please treat my property with respect, as I would like to ensure future guests have a nice, clean space too.  Thanks, Jen.
properties.interaction: If you rent the entire apartment, then I will only interact with you during your stay, should you have a question or require help. I respect your privacy...  I am a friendly, and a genuine person :)
properties.house_rules: My neighbours are lovely people and their respect is really important to me.  All guests are requested to respect my neighbour's right to peaceful and quiet enjoyment of their homes, so please take care with noise, and everybody will get along fabulously.   I am a non-smoker, but there is a balcony for smokers if they wish.  Strictly no parties.  My place is not suitable for loud and large gatherings.  It's a home. Unfortunately my apartment block doesn't allow pets.
properties.host_about:
Hello,

I'm am a well travelled person who has been lucky enough to zip around the world several times. I re-settled in Melbourne a couple of years ago.

I love meeting new people and introducing them to this beautiful city.

Currently I spend my time as a full time student studying design and working part-time as a stylist to finance my studies. So although I am a social person, I have a heavy workload.

I love life and all it has to offer so I try make sure it is full of the things I love to do. Life is too short to approach it any other way!

I look forward to welcoming you to my home and this fun filled city!

Kind regards,

Jennifer
properties.street: Prahran/Windsor, Melbourne, VIC 3004, Australia

properties.host_about:
I live and love to travel.  Having visited over 40 countries, I am still planning for more trips and vacations.  My personal goal is to hit a total of 50 countries in two years time.  Travelling is in my blood, you can say.

When I am not on foreign soil or some exotic land, I hit the gym, swim or hike around the beautiful Aussie outback. Love the great outdoors and when hungry, I indulge in spicy street food.

I travel within Australia and overseas at least three or four times a year, enjoying the best of Airbnb accommodation most of the time.  Huge interest in scenic photography.  Enjoy making friends and learning different cultures from all over the world.  

I work in the gaming industry and live quite close to Melbourne CBD.  Started hosting in May 2016, I am still quite new to the Airbnb community, but determined to do well and be a great host.  I sincerely hope you will feel at home in my cozy apartment.  Have a fabulous time in Melbourne – the world's best and most liveable city.   

My Motto in Life – Life is too short to be anything but HAPPY! So enjoy, be merry and go on a HOLIDAY!

properties.host_about:
Hi there, Welcome to Melbourne.
My name is Lim Khee Leng from Singapore but  live in Melbourne with my wife Angie and our family. I am a production engineer by profession and have been giving talks and teaching production planning using computer programme for the production factories in varies countries for over 35 years, but now I am retired. I love good food and my favourite is the Peking Duck. I enjoy the music by Richard Clayderman. 
I am from Singapore and I know how it feels to be away from home. The feel of a cosy place to set and rest your feet after a day's of travelling is heaven. I have been travelling a lot in the past and I have learned three important things. Firstly, the room have to be clean, simple and tidy in a quiet enviroment. Secondly, the shoes determine how you feel when you go to bed. Thirdly , the mattress determines how you feel when you wake up. That is why me and my wife would like to make your stay in Melbourne City enjoyable and comfortable by providing a good apartment with good location and a good mattress but not the shoes.

properties.neighborhood_overview: I love Melbourne's CBD and the neighborhood.  I am providing a list of "must do's" in Melbourne as well personal tips and favorites to see while you're here.  Literally everything is within walking distance or reachable via tram within 5-10 minutes: - the Arts Centre & Hamer Hall - Federation Square & Flinders Street Station - Southern Cross Station & Victoria Harbour  - Queen Victoria Markets - Southbank, famous for its Crown Casino - Degraves Street, famous for its Cafés  - Graffiti Lanes - No. 35 Tram - Circle Line (free to use) It's all right in front of the door and doesn't get any more central than this!
properties.notes: It is a shared
properties.transit: Getting around in Melbourne is very easy. The location of the perfect to enjoy some days in the most livable city in the world - within Melbourne's CBD (Free tram zone - also see photo).  Trains: Metropolitan Trains depart from Southern Cross Station every 10 to 20 minutes - depending on the line.  Regional Trains depart also fro Southern Cross Station. Please check the time tables of the V-Line service on line for more information.  Trams:  There is one major tram stop right in front of the building. Tram No. 11, No. 12, No. 48 & No. 109 depart from here.   Another tram stop is around the corner (Tram No. 96), which brings you directly to St. Kilda Beach with nice restaurants and St. Kilda Peer. Bike Hire: - there is a City of Melbourne bike hire stand around the corner at Southern Cross Station. Biking is a beautiful way of getting around the city with a lot of bike lines and special bike tracks along the beach and river. Uber: - uber is the alternative to a taxi. Usually an uber dri
properties.access: The Apartment/ Space Enjoy the privacy of your own bedroom in the 4th highest building of Melbourne's CBD. The room is equipped with: - queen size bed  - lots of wardrobe space with mirrors - floor level windows  - fresh cozy linen & towels - spectacular views onto Melbourne's Skyline and Yarra River Shared kitchen, dining & living room with access to: - microwave, fridge, freezer, gas stove, toaster, water boiler, smoothie maker - potts, pans, cutlery, plates, glasses  - spices that I use can be used as well - washing machine with free laundry liquid  - drying rack, vacuum cleaner Shared bathroom with access to: - a large shower, toilet, sink &  - hairdryer in the cupboard  Building Facilities: - gym (3 rooms: cardio-, weight- & stretch room) (from 7:00am to 10:00pm) - swimming pool, whirlpool & sauna (from 7:00am to 10:00pm) - change rooms with shower
properties.interaction: As this is my home, I do live here as well. I am very happy to share my 2 bedroom apartment on level 59 with people from all over the world.  I am usually very active and busy during all days of the week. As I do work in hospitality I start working around lunch time and usually come home at around midnight after the gym. That means you do have the apartment mostly to yourself. I am much more free on my days off (usually Thursdays & Friday) to chat and show you around the city.  I do provide 2 Myki cards for the use of the public transportation as well a list of attractions and "must do's'' in Melbourne.
properties.house_rules: HOUSE RULES: I usually look for common courtesy and respect while you are a guest at my place. That includes treating my interior and belongings respectfully. I kindly ask you to take off your shoes, as the carpet is light and very sensitive with stains. Please tidy up after cooking or using things in the apartment. Smoking is allowed on the balcony or outside in front of the building only. NO DRUGS, NO PARTY, NO PRE PARTY DRINKING and NO SMOKING INSIDE please. Friends and other people are allowed to be there if I’m informed in advance. However, it is not allowed to let extra people stay over night. CHECK OUT INFORMATION: Check out time is 10:00am. Before you leave the apartment, please make sure you do have all your belongings. I kindly ask you to leave the room and apartment in an appropriate condition. Please make your bed, wash your dishes or put them in the dishwasher and place used towels in the laundry bin provided in the bathroom. The keys as well as the Myki card(s) can be lef
properties.host_about:
Hello everyone. 

My name is Hauke - a 29 year old German guy from Hamburg. I have been traveling the world a bit but fell in love with Melbourne, Australia. Therefore I have decided to live in the most livable city on this planet and fight for the dream to spend the rest of my life here in Australia.

I am a trained hotel professional with over 12 years of experience within the hospitality industry. I'm currently studying Project Management and have a part time job in Melbournes CBD. It's been time for a change and I'm looking forward to what the future now holds for me. I know what it's like to work hard for your dreams. 

What can you expect from me: I am a very reliable, hygienic, clean and tidy person. I treat other peoples properties and belongings with respect and expect the same from my guests. Additionally, I am a very friendly, very down to earth and easy going person with a sarcastic sense of humor - soooo German :-). 

I have a passion for photography, travel, aviation and car industry and try to keep my body in shape by going to the gym a lot. 

If there's anything else you would like to know, please do not hesitate to ask me.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Needless to say, surrounded by trams, trains, cabs, buses and situated only 150 meters away from Southern Cross station, getting around is not going to be a problem at all. It is a newly well developed precinct with rising energy from the innovative and creative industry. It is a very quite and relaxing neighbourhood to live in. We are in the area of law firms, financial companies working area in Melbourne CBD. Our apartment has a prime location. It is very close to tram stop, Skybus Airport shuttle, Coles supermarket, pharmacy, cafes downstairs and along little Bourke Street, banks and ATMs. Within 3 minute walk, you can get to Spencer Outlet shopping centre. Downstairs to King street. And you can walk all way to Chinatown.
properties.notes: I expect all guests to respect our property as if it was your own. Keep clean ! Keep clean !Keep clean ! No smoking No drinks or food in the bedroom No cooking  Wash after using.  Please be respectful of the neighbours and keep the noise down after 10pm Enjoy and Relax!

Airport transfer:  I recommend using Skybus. You can pre-purchase tickets online or at their kiosk at the airport for 19. The bus departs every 10 - 20 minutes and will take you directly to Southern Cross Station in about 25 minutes. We just opposite to skybus station. If you choose to get a taxi, it will cost you around 45-50.

properties.neighborhood_overview: AIRBNB'S CBD OVERVIEW: https://www.airbnb.com.au/locations/melbourne/central-business-district You are in the very heart of Melbourne's CBD, all that the city has to offer is on your doorstep. Your home sits up the quiet end of Flinders Lane which is famous for its restaurant scene and unique laneways. Check out my guidebook for my personal recommendations nearby the apartment.   For business travellers, the apartments central CBD location makes it very easy to get to any meetings you may have. It is a short 16 minute walk to the Melbourne Convention and Exhibition Centre, and walking distance to other conference locations.
properties.notes: DISCOUNTS: Please note I do not offer additional discounts above those already provided for weekly (7+ nights) and monthly (28+ nights) stays. My listing is competitively priced and I take pride in offering guests more than just a place to sleep.    HOT WATER: The apartment is fitted with a small hot water service  which only supplies a limited volume of hot water per day before it runs out. >95% of past guests have not experienced any problems by keeping to one shower per person, per day.   APARTMENT SIZE: The studio is 32 square metres in size (345 square feet), and is quite compact and cosy. A floor plan has been included in the photos for reference. Depending on your personal preferences you may find the apartment great, as a lot of my guests have, or you may find it a little small (as a minority guests have).    NOISE: The apartment is located on the 4th floor, so street noise is naturally diminished. Also it is a quiet part of the city, so the noise is quite low by city standards
properties.transit: TRAMS: The apartment is located in the free tram zone, and is a short tram ride, or walk to both Flinders Street (6 minutes) and Southern Cross (13 minutes) train stations (for access to the airport via Skybus).    I provide myki (public transport) cards as part of the booking which can be used if travelling via train, bus or the tram network. Of course, being so central in the CBD you can also walk everywhere! CAR: Those travelling with a car or thinking of hiring one during your stay, there is paid timed street parking and parking garages located within a 100m walk of the apartment. If considering this, I can provide more detailed information during the booking process.
properties.access: The whole apartment is yours to enjoy on your own with complete privacy.   I offer a simple self check-in process so that you can arrive at any time after the official check-in time of 3pm.
properties.interaction: BEFORE ARRIVAL: I strive to ensure you have all the information you require to ensure an easy arrival, from clear directions from the airport to detailed self check in instructions. AFTER ARRIVAL: Once you've arrived, you’ll find clear information on the apartment, plus a local map combining the best place to get a coffee, to where you can pick up some basics. I like to message you occasionally during your stay to check in, and am happy to provide additional recommendations if asked. MEETING: I don't usually meet you, unless of course you choose instead to stay at Cecil, my private room in Fitzroy! ISSUES: If an issue arises I'm usually not far away, plus my sister and partner help co-host. So you are in good hands!
properties.house_rules: More than anything I want you to make yourself at home and enjoy the studio! In order for you to be able to do this I simply ask: Prior to sending an INQUIRY please ensure you have read through the information listed within the "Description" under "Other Points to Note" on DISCOUNTS. Prior to BOOKING please ensure you have read and are comfortable with the information listed within the "Description" under "Other Points to Note" regarding the HOT WATER, APARTMENT SIZE and NOISE. SECOND BED: If you’d like to use both beds (queen & sofa) for sleeping during your stay, please let me know in your initial message to me when booking so I can ensure additional linen is provided. OTHER CONSIDERATIONS:  • Please treat the space with respect  and leave it as you found it.   • Please be considerate to the other residents living in the building.   • Please report any breakages or damage sustained to the apartment during your stay, it allows me to repair/replace it in time for the next guests.  • Pl
properties.host_about:
MY AIRBNB LISTINGS:
Entire Apartments: https://www.airbnb.com.au/s?host_id=2246291
inc. Cohosted: https://www.airbnb.com.au/wishlists/88445178

HOSTING:
I dived into the world of full time hosting in November 2015, after a restructure at my former employer prompted me to explore an idea which had been kicking around in my head since 2013. 

I’ve since hosted over 150 groups, however I feel like I'm just getting started, with more ideas than hours in the day! My current plans are for four listings spread around Melbourne, each offering different experiences and styled in different ways, each reflecting a little part of my personality.

My hosting style is all about:
— Providing great spaces to guests which surpass expectations 
— Taking the stress out of arriving in a new city by providing clear directions, self check in instructions & being very responsive with communication,
— Sharing local insights on Melbourne and its surroundings, so as to provide guests with a local experiences, and to enable them to discover things they may not have found sticking to the usual tourist haunts.

A LITTLE MORE ABOUT ME:
I was born in Melbourne, have lived in the Pilbara (Western Australia), have flown around the world a couple of times, am very good with airport security, and have an affinity for problem solving, organising spaces and improving things.

I have lived full time in the world's most liveable city since 2014, and love the coffee culture, craft beer, amazing food and street art the city has to offer - I'm looking forward to sharing this knowledge with my guests through my guidebooks.

AIRBNB TRAVEL:
I first stayed with Airbnb in their hometown of San Francisco in 2012. Since then I’ve stayed in peoples homes in Sydney, Munich, New York, Vancouver, Tulum, Mexico City, Courmayeur, Beaune & Amsterdam. I love being able to stay in uniques spaces, meet interesting hosts and explore neighbourhoods off the tourist track.

properties.host_about:
I was born in Melbourne, and know the attraction of Melbourne is very much about its lifestyle. While it’s still got its “Hustle & Bustle” the magic about Melbourne is how it balances this hectic activity with the arts, sports and entertaining. Melbournian’s have passion for living life and that’s a major element towards Melbourne being voted as one of the world’s most liveable and friendliest cities (EIU's Global Liveability Ranking)

I have spent most of my life on the Mornington Peninsula (one hour south of Melbourne). I work in Melbourne’s CBD and have now also moved into the city to live. I’m an avid traveler, but with so many destinations still explore both in Australia and overseas. 
My greatest memories of traveling are often the people you meet and the experiences that are not found on the main tourist trail. I always love talking to a local character getting that special place to visit or café to dine (usually a cousin’s cafe). 
I have now come to a stage in my life I’d like to share some of Melbourne’s special places with others. These are not only my places of interest but also those hidden secrets that previous guests have found and have been excited to share with us.

I like to think “Abode 316 & 317” are special!  They are less than a year old and designed to be functional, yet have a touch of sophistication. They are fully optioned for the traveler and create that home away from home a hotel just can’t offer. 
Accommodation can often make or break a holiday, but I know the accommodation and hospitality my apartments will add to your Melbourne experience.
Rob

properties.host_about:
Welcome to Melbourne!

This is the city we live, play and work, it's incredibly beautiful, vibrant and diverse!

Imagine a city where nobody is judged by the color of their skin, the money they make, their religion, address or sexual preference. Imagine a city where people relate to each other as one big community. 

That's what we're out to find out....

properties.host_about:
G'day!

Mybnb here and it's nice to meet you! We look after multiple properties throughout Melbourne and the Sunshine Coast in Queensland. We're a complete management solution, meaning we take care of absolutely everything. From creating your listing to having you place cleaned, we do it all! 

Whilst managing properties through Airbnb, we've learnt a lot about the various areas and different nuances Melbourne and the Sunshine Coast have to offer. On top of that, we love meeting honest, genuine and interesting guests, some of whom have become friends too!

Living in the sporting and cultural hub of Australia has it's perks. It's a great city to visit and an even better one to live in. We look forward to sharing it with you!

See you soon :-)

Blake (Mybnb Manager)

properties.name: Classic Collins Street Apartment
properties.summary: Classic Collins Street for two. Our north facing, third floor, one bedroom apartment is 100 steps to the Town Hall. Secure and private with a view over the plane trees on Collins Street. Yes, you really are in the heart of Melbourne.
properties.space: We have always loved intriguing, artistic, intimate, urbane, innovative, thoughtfully designed, living spaces... so we created one.  We think you will like our light bright north facing apartment. The architect has thoughtfully retained original timber floors, high ceilings and art nouveau window. A modern bathroom and kitchen along with new furnishings provide relaxing and congenial accommodation for one or two people in our open plan apartment. Did we mention your view over Collins Street? There is plenty of cooking equipment. Yes, wine glasses, coffee and teas included. All linen provided.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Melbourne is a lot of things for all of us. Great shopping, fine buildings, good weather ( mostly ), parks and gardens, friendly and most liveable. Melbourne is also different things for each of us.  We love exploring the lanes, riding the trams, walking in the Fitzroy Gardens, shopping on Gertrude St, wandering into any gallery (our favourite is NGV at Fed Square), eating any time of day at Cumulus, European, Marion, Slowpoke etc etc etc. What will Melbourne be for you?

properties.summary: Convenient CBD living, public transport is just outside of the apartment. Females only please.
properties.space: Convenient CBD living, public transport is just outside of the apartment.  Live right in the middle of Melbourne CBD, you cannot get more central than this -- tram, bus, and train are within three minutes walk. Right opposite of State Library and above Melbourne Central, on Swanston Street, abundant restaurants and 24/7 convenience (7/11, Hungry Jack's, McD, Stalactite (Greek restaurant), China Bar, etc.) Abundant parking space around city and Fitness First gyms are just at Melbourne Central and QV buildings (two minutes walk). Wi-fi, gas, water, electricity, fridge, and stove if you want to cook. Coles and Woolworths are just beside my apartment. But why cook if there are plenty restaurants around to explore? Restaurants and Chinatown is just five minutes away, and walking distance to Docklands, Southbank, Carlton (Lygon Street), Melbourne Exhibition Centre, Crown Casino, Royal Exhibition Building, IMAX, etc. Nice view from level 10, you can see as far as Shrine of Remembrance from your room.
properties.notes: We are a small family (myself, my wife, and a eleven-month-old baby). We are Indonesian born Chinese and I have been in Melbourne for more than 15 years. Our baby may have occassional crying, if you do not mind with this, please do apply. This place is suitable if you need a place to sleep and shower, and more time on hand to explore what Melbourne can offer. There are coin operated laundry and dryer machines on each floor. Non smoker only please, as we have a baby and UniLodge on Swanston is a 24/7 non smoking building. Essentials are not provided as we do not like to waste things, but you can get them easily downstairs from Woolworths, Coles, or BIG W (Coles and Woolworths open until midnight).

properties.name: Bourke Street Retreat
properties.summary: Make yourself at home in a light-filled studio apartment at the top end of Bourke Street. The apartment is a quiet and secure space that comfortably accommodates two people. The location is central and close to everything that the city has to offer. It is the perfect location for visitors to Melbourne.
properties.space: Bourke Street Retreat is located at the rear of a small block of apartments away from street noise. The apartment has an open plan and is comfortably furnished. It has large windows with an attractive urban view and overlooks a verdant courtyard garden. The apartment has all the amenities needed for an enjoyable stay. There is a well-appointed kitchen if you decide to cook. The lounge area has a three seater sofa, an armchair and a side table. There is a 43" smart television and a speaker through which you can play your music wirelessly. The bed has a comfortable queen-sized mattress. There is a spacious wardrobe for you to unpack and store your belongings. Off the main room is a bright and clean bathroom with shower, sink and toilet. The apartment has ducted heating and cooling, so you will be insulated from the vagaries of Melbourne's weather.

properties.neighborhood_overview: The Bourke Hill precinct is one of the city's best locations, bordering Chinatown and the Treasury Gardens. It is a neighbourhood with much character and appeal. There is an interesting mix of heritage buildings, laneways, restaurants, cafés and bars. There are many casual and fine dining options nearby, offering a wide range of cuisines and food styles. There are also numerous places to enjoy a coffee and have a drink. It is close to Melbourne's premier theatres, museums, galleries, parks, gardens and sporting attractions. The location is perfect for indulging in some shopping at the city's best department stores, arcades, designer boutiques and shops. Everything you need for the quintessential Melbourne experience is at your doorstep.
properties.transit: The apartment's central location means you can discover many of Melbourne's attractions on foot. The apartment has excellent access to public transport. It is within the Free Tram Zone and close to the City Circle Tram, so you can easily explore central Melbourne. Parliament Train Station is only a short walk away. Tram routes 86 and 96 are at your doorstep, providing access to the Inner North, St Kilda Beach and Southern Cross Station from where you can catch the Skybus to Melbourne Airport. A Melbourne Bike Share station is within walking distance.
properties.access: The apartment has free unlimited wireless internet and television streaming services (Netflix and Stan). We provide bed linen, towels, shampoo and soap. There are also beach towels if you decide to go swimming. Tea, coffee and a few basic foodstuffs are supplied in the kitchen. Guests have access to a free communal onsite laundry with both washing and drying facilities. Laundry detergent, an iron and ironing board are also supplied. Two Myki cards are provided for you to use on Melbourne's public transport system.
properties.interaction: We meet all guests upon arrival. Throughout your stay, we can be contacted by telephone and email should you need any assistance. If you require an early check-in or a late check-out, please ask and we will do our best to help you out.
properties.house_rules: The apartment is for 2 guests only. No parties or events can be held in the apartment. Please keep noise to a minimum after 9PM. Please turn off the heating/cooling, television and taps when you leave.
properties.host_about: I'm an avid global traveller but a Melburnian at heart. I enjoy travelling to new destinations. I own an apartment in central Melbourne which is available on Airbnb.

properties.neighborhood_overview: The best location in Melbourne Opposite the famous cafe Kettle Black.  Minutes from the CBD, NGV, CASINO, St Kilda, South Melbourne Market, Chapel Street and South Melbourne Beach. The Royal Botanical Gardens are at the top of the street. There is also a children's garden within the main gardens which has a lovely man made river and fountains for kids.  A short walk from the apartment is Albert Park lake which is the perfect place for a walk or jog. It is also home to the Melbourne Aquatic centre which has a wave pool as well as the usual gymnasium and swimming facilities.  The South Melbourne market is a must visit. Since 1867, South Melbourne Market has been a treasured inner city landmark and a favourite amongst locals and visitors. It is the quintessential village market, a place where people come not only to purchase fresh food, but to meet, eat, drink, shop, discover, share and connect.
properties.transit: Right near the apartment is the Domain tram interchange which is one of the busiest in Melbourne, with so many trams passing through. You can catch  trams to the city centre, Crown Casino, St Kilda, Docklands, Toorak and sit in comfort as you wait in a very safe environment no matter what the time. There are wind breaks so you can sit on both sides and still see your tram come. It has electronic time indicators if you don't have tram tracker on your phone to see when your tram is coming. Great view of the Shrine gardens. There are free Melbourne bikes available in Park Street which is a few minute walk away. Kings way is at the other end of the street which will quickly get you onto the Westgate freeway if you are day tripping to the Great Ocean Road, or the M1 freeway which takes you to the Eastern suburbs, Chasten shopping centre and out towards Phillip Island or the Mornington Peninsula.
properties.interaction: We are available to answer any questions at any time via text. We will try and meet you at the apartment to run through how everything works. However if you are arriving late in the evening or early in the morning we will make other arrangements for you to collect your keys.
properties.house_rules: Strictly No Smoking inside the apartment or the building.  If you smoke in the apartment you will be charged 150 extra cleaning fee to cover the cost of removing the smell.  The apartment is in a luxury residential building. No parties or functions and please respect the other residents in the building (please keep the volume low!).  The apartment is furnished with high quality items so please take care and treat them with respect.  If something gets broken i.e. a glass just let me know so we can replace it for other guests.  If the keys or fob are lost there is a 200 fee to have them replaced.  When cooking if your food starts smoking please open the door to the balcony, never the door to the hallway as this evacuates the entire building calls the fire brigade and you will be charged by them around 3000 We have a "use but don't abuse" policy on the wifi. Please enjoy it but don't download movies etc
properties.host_about:
Hi my name is Taylor my husband &  I are a couple in our thirties with two kids and a lovely old dog named Billy. We both love travelling. I always dreamed of owning a property and having a few cottages as bed and breakfasts. Now my dream has come true with my business Tailored short stays. 

I am a people person who just loves spoiling my guests. That's what makes Tailored short stays different. I pay attention to the details and believe it's the little extras that make all the difference. 

In my spare time I love relaxing down at our little caravan by the sea. My ideal evening is relaxing in the recliner under the stars with a glass of French Champagne listening to the roar of the ocean with David by my side, our dog Billy at our feet and our boys tucked up in bed.

properties.neighborhood_overview: ***Local Attractions***  • CBD at your doorstep, you in the middle of the CBD • Large Supermarket, chemist, ATM, gift store, medical practitioners: 2-5 min walk  • Café's, restaurants, pub: 2 min walk  • Flagstaff Gardens 3 min walk,  • Royal Botanic Gardens 10 min via tram • Melbourne Zoo: 15min via tram  • Melbourne Convention Centre 7 min tram or 15 min walk

properties.host_about:
Hello World, I'm sharing my local knowledge with the world... one guest at a time.

I have traveled quite extensively every 2-3 years for usually 3-4 months at a time. The first time I traveled Overseas alone was when I was 16, to the US and Canada.  I lived in the UK for 2 1/2 years and again for 3 months last year and most of my traveling has been backpacking and used other sharing economy websites, staying on couches and letting out my couch.  I used AirBnB during my 3 week trip to New Zealand in 2013 and thought this is perfect for me living right in the heart of the city and working in Tourism and Events I can share my local knowledge with the world... one guest at a time.

I work in Events Management and have worked on such exciting events as the London Olympics 2012, The Commonwealth Games, The Australian Open and the Tim Burton Exhibition Opening at ACMI.

I love horse riding, travel, theatre, comedy shows, live bands and seeing and experiencing what the world has to offer.  I have traveled extensively but I am in love with Melbourne and its many faces.

I am a frugal traveler and love to share my tips and there is a lot to see and do in Melbourne that is free.  I currently work in the Tourism Industry so I know this place pretty well and living in the city well, it give life a completely different flavour, I love it.

Why AirBnB?
Simple as a keen traveler and loving my city I want to share it.  I live in a central location and I have had many friends across the world stay, some whom I have met on my travels, some who became friends after they stayed.

AirBnB will help me stay in my apartment, living in the city can be quite expensive so by utilsing AirBnB I can continue to live in the city I love.

AirBnB has helped me renovate upstairs, removing my carpet and replacing with floorboards.  Installing a custom blind of Melbourne's art centre and skyline.

Next goal your stay is contributing to:  Upgrading the kitchen Kitchen.

Our homes are set up to be just that; homes We always include the following for our guests: - Luxurious linens and Sheridan towels  - Complimentary High-speed wireless internet  - HD TV's with Netflix (some units with Apple TV)  - A portable Bluetooth sound system  - A kitchen with all the cooking essentials from tea spoons to oil and balsamic vinegar.  - Guests staying longer than 7 days will have an optional mid stay freshening of the home  - All essential household items, including designer toiletries, laundry soap, tea towels, makeup removal pads, hair dryer and much more.  - A concierge service that will
properties.transit: Melbourne uses Myki cards for all public transportation. If you are within the CBD and docklands, you are likely within the free tram zone. You will not need to have a Myki card or pay any fare. The tram operator will let you know when you are leaving the free tram circle. If you are traveling outside the free tram circle you will need one for each passenger. You can get your myki card from any major train station or 7-Eleven.  We can provide myki cards for your holiday. There will be a 10 replacement fee if the Myki cards are not returned and a 5 (+negative balance) top up fee if the cards are left with a balance owing. Melbourne also has a bikeshare program throughout the city. They are easy to find with the bright blue bikes and stations. There is a minimum age of 15 and you will need an adult to subscribe for anyone under 18. When the weather calls for it, and sometimes when it doesn’t, we suggest walking the city. You’ll find little shops that you didn’t even know you would love
properties.access: The Building We love this building’s amenities that are located on the 33rd floor. You have incredible views from the gym and yoga studio as well as the pool and spa. We haven’t tried looking out from the dry sauna but I’m sure that has a great view as well.  **We do require Government Issue ID at time of check in. If you are not able to produce your ID, we legally cannot grant you access to the property.** General Information Check in time: 2pm  Check out time: 10am **We do require Government Issue ID at time of check in. If you are not able to produce your ID, we legally cannot grant you access to the property.** We are happy to check you in at any time. We do charge a 50 surcharge for check-ins from 22h00-08h00 as this is outside normal operating hours. If you have a late flight, we have teamed up with a car service company that is able to check you in to avoid the surcharge. They will verify your ID, have you sign the required paperwork from LittleStay, and, finally, hand you the
properties.interaction: We would love to welcome you to the apartment and show you around. If you have any issues, concerns, just need a restaurant recommendation or just need ideas to do, we will be a phone call away. **We do require Government Issue ID at time of check in. If you are not able to produce your ID, we legally cannot grant you access to the property.**
properties.host_about:
LittleStay is a boutique short stay company specialising in homemade hospitality. We are passionate about traveling, exploring, and sharing. Bitten by the travel bug when we were young, we love to jump on a plane and explore the world. Spending our days and nights away from home with new friends, exchanging our experiences, and building new unforgettable memories. LittleStay is here to help create those memories. 

That's the idyllic part, but in our real life we all have bills, mortgages and obligations that we wish we could leave at home and don't have to travel with.

Consequentially LittleStay was born to help with that dream, a company that allow people like us and others to travel, live, experience or start a new life without the everyday struggle of life back “home”.

LittleStay wants you to feel comfortable entrusting us with your largest asset. We will consider your home our home while we manage it. It is our reputation on the line if something is amiss. We do not take that lightly.  LittleStay wants you to be a part of our LittleFamily. We value your partnership and thusly, if you are holidaying and want to stay at one of our properties, you’ll receive insider rates. You can even reserve your own property for your family and friends that are visiting. 

We take care of virtually everything. Our level of cleaning is second to none. Our customer service is beyond compare. Our commitment to you, the owner, our guest, our community is unquestionable. 

We believe a happy home is a filled home so if you have a property that is not happy, please contact us to see how we can help you. 

Or if you're one of our amazing guests helping us, please let us know how we can make your stay more enjoyable. 

Warmest Regards
The LittleStay Team

Hi, my name is Paul, owner of Complete Host apartments! Paul, Complete Host

properties.host_about:
Inspired by and dedicated to Australian contemporary artists, Canvas Suites aims to provide boutique hospitality experience to our guests. Each of our Suites are handpicked, acquired and directly owned by Canvas Suites before being meticulously prepared and setup as the place our guests call home when in Melbourne.

At Canvas Suites, we believe that no visit to a place is complete without immersing oneself in its unique culture and central to any culture is its art. We view each of our art-inspired Suites as carefully curated galleries with walls adorned by original Australian works of art which our guests may enjoy in private during their stay.

But great spaces with great art do not by themselves create great hospitality experience. We know what counts for our guests to have a great stay in Melbourne – a friendly face to meet them, top-of-the-line chiropedic beds made with pristine sheets, the towels and toiletries taken care of to our exacting standards. We also know that our guests want the space and freedom to experience what Melbourne has to offer at their own pace. So we are available 24/7 for when our guests need us, but we step back when they do not.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Amazing location!! (Technically it's considered Melbourne but most consider it to be St Kilda). Can walk to many great places such as Albert Park Lake, St Kilda Beach, Luna Park, Chapel St (website hidden) Kilda road is a big business st with lots of cafes. But right next door is Albert Park where the F1 race is held with a beautiful lake. Then St Kilda with all it's fun, restaurants, cakes, beach and bars are super close.
properties.transit: There is A LOT of public transport out front if you prefer. Trams go past to take you to the city etc every few minutes! St Kilda Rd is one of the biggest business streets of Melbourne.  Being close to St Kilda junction means you have a lot of highways close by to travel many directions easily.  Windsor train station is about 10 minutes walk away if you prefer.  A major hospital (the Alfred Hospital) is only a few minutes away. From the Airport you can either: A. Take Uber. You cannot drop your pick up pin in the airport area, so just drop the pin outside of the ‘no pick up’ area, call the driver and ask them to pick you up from the airport.  The easiest spot to wait is the ‘Ring & Ride’ area where there are specific labeled pink signs.  (For example: You can tell the driver to pick you up from the ‘Ring & Ride’ area at sign 2D.)  I would estimate a fee of around 50. (Taxis are about 80, and much worse service). B: Take the SkyBus St Kilda Express. The St Kilda Express operates seven

properties.host_about:
We are a happily married couple with a son named Justin who is 3 years old and a daughter, Chloe who is 8 months old. We love getting away travelling and attending events. We enjoy using AirBnb when travelling because it allows us to communicate with a local and the accommodation makes us feel at home and suits our needs with 2 small children. When we went to Europe in 2013 we used AirBnB to find accommodation in Spain (Barcelona, Madrid, San Sebastian and Valencia) in UK (Bath, Kensington and Plymonth) and in Malta. We met some lovely people and had some great experiences, and would definitely use Airbnb for our future travels.

As AirBnb hosts we enjoy meeting people from around the world who come to visit this great city of ours. We hope to provide our guests with a welcoming, relaxing and positive experience and we hope they enjoy our apartment just as much as we do!

properties.name: Stylish 'Home Away From Home'
properties.summary: Our architect-designed apartment is located right in the centre of the top end of town.    It is in the famous 'Hero' Apartment building. All Melbourne's attractions are a short walk away.  This is our 5 night minimum stay price. Please enquire re shorter stay availability and price.
properties.space: This is a 'loft' styled apartment.  Your bedroom is linked to a generous bathroom (with bathtub) via the walk-in closet that is ready for you to store your things.  As our guest/s, you will be welcome to make yourself completely at home downstairs. Help yourself to whatever you want / need in the kitchen or laundry.   Our upstairs bedroom and bathroom are 'off limits' to guests. We live on the Mornington Peninsula and make this apartment available to Airbnb guests when we do not need to be in the city.  You will have the place to yourselves.
properties.description: Our architect-designed apartment is located right in the centre of the top end of town.    It is in the famous 'Hero' Apartment building. All Melbourne's attractions are a short walk away.  This is our 5 night minimum stay price. Please enquire re shorter stay availability and price. This is a 'loft' styled apartment.  Your bedroom is linked to a generous bathroom (with bathtub) via the walk-in closet that is ready for you to store your things.  As our guest/s, you will be welcome to make yourself completely at home downstairs. Help yourself to whatever you want / need in the kitchen or laundry.   Our upstairs bedroom and bathroom are 'off limits' to guests. We live on the Mornington Peninsula and make this apartment available to Airbnb guests when we do not need to be in the city.  You will have the place to yourselves. The apartment is fully equipped - Nespresso machine, hair dryer, washing machine/iron, TV/DVD, wireless WiFi, iPod player and so on.   No car parking is included (you
properties.neighborhood_overview: This is just the best location - you can walk to nearly everything.  If you are a runner, it's a pretty short run to the famous 'Tan' track around the botanical gardens.  Walking around the Treasury Gardens early in the morning is lovely too.  The 'Paris End' of Collins St is a few metres away with its designer flagship stores.  There are so many restaurants and coffee shops nearby you are spoiled for choice.  The National Gallery, Federation Square, The Arts Centre, Southbank, the major department stores and the new 'Emporium' shopping mall, the Melbourne Cricket Ground, the Tennis Centre - everything is walkable. There is a yoga studio, French patisserie, chic Japanese restaurant and lunch/breakfast cafe downstairs in the Hero building, along with some lovely designer clothes shops. If it's raining, you don't need to go anywhere!  The Kino Cinemas are a block away, and supermarkets are nearby.
properties.notes: This apartment is on a low floor and across the street from a large building and so there is no view of the city.  It has huge windows and so there is a ton of light.  For a central city location, it's not super noisy unless you are there during Melbourne Cup Week or when the Grand Final is on. A couple of mornings a week the garbage trucks do their thing and that's about it.  Neither Russell Street or Little Collins Street are major roads, and so there are no trams rolling down the street all day and night.  If you are planning an extended stay, there are good options for grocery shopping.
properties.transit: It's a short tram ride (from either Collins St, Bourke St or Swantston St, all a block away) to all of Melbourne's funky inner neighbourhoods - Carlton, Fitzroy, South Yarra, Albert Park, St Kilda, South Melbourne.   There are many taxi ranks nearby too.  Melbourne now has a bike hire system and helmets are easily/cheaply bought.
properties.access: The apartment is fully equipped - Nespresso machine, hair dryer, washing machine/iron, TV/DVD, wireless WiFi, iPod player and so on.   No car parking is included (you don't actually need a car unless you are touring). If you are touring, there is a good commercial car park across the road in Little Collins Street.
properties.interaction: We will meet you on arrival and will be as helpful and available as you would like /need  us to be.
properties.house_rules: This is our city home, and so we expect that you will to take as much care with our things as we do and leave it as you find it.  The apartment is fully equipped.  We run an 'honour' system - if you consume things in a major way, then please either replace or leave a few  so we can.  Minor consumption we can handle! No parties, smoking, babies/kids, pets or extra guests please.  Upstairs is 'off limits' to guests. Please note:  if you are a smoker and leave the apartment smelling of cigarettes and/or cigars, you will forfeit your bond.
properties.host_about: We have travelled a lot over the years and have been Airbnb guests in the US, Switzerland, Italy and here in Australia.  Now we are hosting, we are really enjoying meeting our Airbnb guests. We lived in the US for ten years (DE/NY) and had a great time. I split my time between our home at the beach on the Mornington Peninsula and this apartment in the city.  We love outdoorsy things and Melbourne 's wonderful festivals and food.

properties.host_about:
Hi, my name is Paul, owner of Complete Host apartments! I am a seasoned traveler and have been fortunate to have visited most countries and experienced the way the locals live by staying at amazing airbnb properties all around the world. From these experiences I have learned a lot about what sort of experiences people are after when visiting a foreign city.

After spending the majority of the last 15 years overseas I am living back in my home town of  Melbourne and now run a short stays business called Complete Host.  As such, I have on offer a number of very comfortable properties in some of the best locations of Melbourne.

If you are interested in one of the properties l have listed but the dates are unavailable, please check my other listings under my profile or email me an inquiry as l will very likely have another property available that will suit your requirements. 

I cant wait to meet you and make your stay in Melbourne a memorable one!

Paul, Complete Host

properties.name: Manhattan Suite - Melbourne's 'Paris End'.
properties.summary: Bright, modern and brand new, this gorgeous apartment is located in the prestigious 'Paris End' of Melbourne's downtown, just a few minutes walk from the central pedestrian shopping street - and just a few steps away from the city's best theatres, cafes and restaurants. Comfortably appointed with reverse cycle air conditioning, its the perfect pad for the perfect Melbourne shopping, eating and sight seeing stay. And enjoy your first breakfast of croissants, coffee and fresh fruit on me!
properties.space: Huge north facing  windows in the living area provide a sunny aspect and a birds eye view over one of Melbourne's premier inner city streets. Black-out blinds keep the apartment dark at night and double glazed windows assist with thermal and noise control. Both the main bedroom and study/second small bedroom have black glass sliding doors to close them off at night.  With one of the best cafes at the door and Euro style bistro's a short walk away - the best of the inner city is at your fingertips. The study/office can be used as a second bedroom and is equipped with an excellent single bed and quality brand new mattress.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Melbourne's downtown area is lively and unique. Streets lined with bistro's and cafe's lend the area a vibrant atmosphere and the world renowned street art laneways, theatres and galleries are all just a short walk away. In the 'Paris End' you are close to much of the city's best - the wonderful Florentino restaurants, institutions such as Pellegrini's and 'fun for all' bars such as Madame Brussels. The fabulous  Princess Theatre is just a short walk away and makes a great night out. Most other sight-seeing can be easily accessed by Melbourne's excellent public transport system and the downtown area is easily walkable.
properties.notes: There is no parking associated with the apartment but I am happy to provide suggestions for parking close by. Free trams are at your doorstep. The main bedroom has dark glass sliding doors opening onto living/kitchen and black-out blinds for night time. There is also a study/office with a single bed.
properties.transit: Free tram is at the doorstep. Myki transport cards are provided for free for adventures further out!
properties.access: Guests have access to the entire apartment. Fully furnished  including TV,  DVD player - A good range of DVD's is provided.  Microwave,  Bar Fridge, Gas Cook Top, Electric oven, Toaster, Electric kettle, Cooking utensils, crockery and cutlery, fresh and luxurious 800 tc linen and all other bedding. Iron and ironing board. Hairdryer.
properties.interaction: You will have the apartment to yourself but I or my 'helper' are available if you need assistance or information. I will meet you to hand over the keys and if you'd like a chat or coffee am more than happy to help out!!   I will respect your privacy unless you specifically ask. Alhough I reserve the right to enter (in line with Airbnb policy) I will not do so without advising.
properties.house_rules: Please take exceptional care with my apartment and leave it in the condition that you found it.  Smoking is strictly prohibited on the building premises and please do not cook with oil.  Please respect other residents by keeping noise minimal.  In the unusual event of something malfunctioning or breaking in the apartment please let me know immediately.  Note that if you wish to invite visitors inside please check with me first. Thank you.
properties.host_about: A travel lover myself, I love to host people wherever I am in the world. I have been living and working in China for three years - in Nanjing and Shanghai - and my life continues to be a "Tale of Two (Great Design) Cities" - Shanghai for business, friends and pleasure, and Melbourne  which is my home and family base. Professionally I am a Landscape Architect, an artist, writer and photographer. Along with architecture and design I have a passion for great food and coffee - see my blog 'Letters from Cafe Noir'  for more tips on great coffee in Melbourne -  Australia's Coffee and Culture Capital!! I look forward to meeting you and to sharing my  spaces in Melbourne's fabulous CBD.

A wrought iron double bed in the bedroom complete with built-in wardrobe and space to keep your personal belongings, ensures a comfortable stay. Open-plan lounge and kitchen complete with floor to ceiling windows over-looking the city makes the place feel open and bright.  The adorable balcony is the perfect place to relax and unwind after an exhausting day of shopping. Pour yourself a local wine from the Yarra Valley and watch the city come alive as the sun sinks away.

properties.neighborhood_overview: From the 6th story balcony you can look directly down Hardware Lane, a cultural hub littered with more cafes, bars and restaurants than you could count! A 15-second walk down the street brings you to 1000 £ Bend, my personal favourite cafe that turns into a bar at night, serving delicious burgers and local beers.  Bowery to Williamsburg is another café you can spot from the balcony, serving up bagels and many more New York style delights.  Melbourne is an international shopping destination, and you'll be right in the middle of the action. Bourke St outdoor Mall is a five minute walk away, Collins St high-end designer shopping is a ten minute walk away and eclectic Brunswick St is an easy ten minute tram - or a lovely 25 minute stroll on a nice sunny day. Should you decide you want to take advantage of the full-sized kitchen and cook a few meals, there is a Coles in Melbourne Central or a Woolworths in the QV building (a five minute walk), however, I would highly recommend The Queen Vic
properties.transit: Literally around the corner from Melbourne Central Station, you will be incredibly close to any train/tram/bus you may need during your stay.

properties.interaction: I will be contactable during your stay, via email. However, I will be away for work so will not be physically present.  I do have a person managing the property that will be available to help should anything arise.

properties.name: Historic, Iconic and Central CBD
properties.summary: The 1893 former headquarters for the Victorian Railways was converted into apartments in 1997. Grandeur and serenity, with high ceilings and excellent amenities. Enjoy your Melbourne experience from a convenient and easily accessible central location. Located within the free tram zone, a few minutes walk from the Skybus airport terminal and Southern Cross train station. Cross the river to the Crown Casino & Entertainment Complex, or to the Melbourne Convention & Exhibition Centre.
properties.space: A comfortable and inviting 2-bedroom apartment offers you accommodation to make your stay in Melbourne memorably enjoyable. Walk through the main door of the building, and leave the hustle and bustle of the city behind. Glide up the Grand Stairs and experience how the building was when it opened in 1893. The apartment has 6m (23ft) ceilings, with a mezzanine floor added for the bedrooms. Downstairs is the main living area, laundry and extra toilet. I also live in the apartment, so all the normal facilities are available. You will see from the photos that the bedrooms have a balcony, open to the lounge below. They are not fully enclosed. If the open plan layout will make you feel uncomfortable, please do not book the room. I want you to have a positive experience both here and in Melbourne. The windows are double-glazed for a peaceful night's sleep. With one meter thick external walls, the temperature inside the apartment is stable, rising gradually during the summer months and falling

properties.neighborhood_overview: I am just five minutes walk from the Southern Cross Railway Station and Skybus terminal from the airport. If you are carrying a lot of luggage, it's just a gentle downhill walk. Positioned right on the boundary of the old city CBD and the vibrant new Docklands, the building in the ideal location to experience Melbourne. At the end of the block is the Yarra River. Cross the river to the Crown Casino and Entertainment Complex, or to the Melbourne Convention and Exhibition Centre, and right next door is outlet shopping!
properties.notes: I like espresso coffee, so I have my own machine. You are welcome to help yourself to real coffee. The beans are fair-trade, and freshly roasted in a family business. As I mentioned above, the bedroom is not totally enclosed, so please do not book the room if that will make you feel uncomfortable.
properties.transit: With the Southern Cross Railway Station and Skybus terminal from the airport, getting in and out of Melbourne couldn't be easier. From Southern Cross Railway Station, you can catch a train to regional Victoria or interstate. Trams are free within the CDB, so catch one of the historic City Circle trams and have a free tour of perimeter of the downtown area, or if you know where you are going, just jump on a tram and travel directly to your destination. Trams give you easy access to the Victoria Market at the north of the city, the Arts Centre and botanical gardens to the south, or parliament house the Paris end of Collins Street to the East.  Taxis are plentiful in the CBD, you can hail a passing taxi, and there is a taxi rank just across the road in Flinders Lane.
properties.access: The building has a security system to restrict access to residents and guests. As I am now retired, I will be available to give you access to building when you return from outside. From the main entrance, you can call my apartment directly.  All parts of the apartment are accessible to you, although at 100 square meters, there is not so much space! We will need to share the bathroom, and there is an extra toilet on the lower level. Free, unlimited Wifi is available, with superfast download speeds (see the photos). Other facilities in the building are also available for your enjoyment. Take a swim in the heated pool, relax in the spa, sweat it out in the sauna, or work out in the gym. As you are working your way through these, you may want to take a break and cook up a barbecue!
properties.interaction: I am recently retired, so I am available to help you enjoy your stay in Melbourne. If you like, I can show you around or at least point you in the right direction.
properties.house_rules: 1. Due to the historic wooden flooring, and for general cleanliness, outside shoes should be removed. I can supply slippers. 2. Inside the building is smoke-free. Smokers will need to smoke outside.
properties.host_about:
I have been fortunate to have travelled throughout my working life, including working in China. I have visited around 30 countries, but Africa and South America are still on my list. When I travel, I like to take the back roads. It often means discovering interesting places off the worn tourist routes.

I was in a professional technical role, but decided to retire early. Now I am happy to give back a little and provide a positive experience to Melbourne visitors.

I enjoy cycling, art, architecture and history. I try to keep abreast of current events. My musical tastes are fairly broad, but I am not across the latest music. I don't have much time for celebrity culture.

Free wifi is also available for all your devices. We offer a hearty full breakfast which features re
properties.neighborhood_overview: Where do you start?  Located right in the centre of the city there's everything on your doorstep.  The Queen Victoria Market is a short 5 minute walk.  Sporting venues such as Etihad Stadium, the MCG (AFL football, cricket), AAMI Park (soccer, rugby) and Melbourne Park / Rod Laver Arena (Tennis, concerts etc) are within walking distance or catch a tram.  Southbank and the whole city precinct is a short stroll away. There is an endless array of eateries in Melbourne.  The same goes for bars.  Explore one of the many lane ways and just open the concealed door to find the hidden gems. Melbourne is a shoppers paradise.  Whether you want designer boutiques in the Paris end of town, outlet stores at harbourtown or South wharf or the Melbourne institutions, Myer and David Jones, you'll find it all within walking distance.
properties.notes: We have a cat so if you have a cat phobia of any sort, this probably isn't the place for you.
properties.transit: Being right in the centre of Melbourne there is an abundance of public transport.  We are seconds from Flagstaff train station, which is one of the Melbourne city loop underground stations.  We are also walking distance from Southern Cross station which is the terminus for the Melbourne Airport bus (as well as the main bus terminal and city train station). For those with a car, there is car parking at Harbour Town (next to the Melbourne Observation Wheel).  The car park is open 24 hours with the maximum charge of 10 per 24 hour period.  The car park is a 15 minute walk from our apartment or a 5 minute tram ride on the free trams in the city centre.
properties.access: Access to the apartment is via secure card access.  You will have your own door key to come and go as you please.
properties.interaction: We live in the apartment and are in and out doing our thing.  Ken is a keen cook.  The apartment has a full length balcony overlooking Flagstaff gardens.  Join us on the balcony for a drink (of whatever takes your fancy).  We're happy to engage as much as you want.  If you want to do your own thing, sit and chat or ask questions about Melbourne we're fine with it all.
properties.house_rules: Please respect our neighbours and keep noise to  an absolute minimum when leaving or arriving at the apartment. No smoking in the apartment. The room and our apartment is not baby/child friendly so we are unable to accommodate children under 10 years old. We're not prudes and want everyone to enjoy their stay, but unfortunately we cannot allow joiners (unregistered guests) to stay the night.  The reason for this is security.
properties.host_about:
Hello, we are Ken and Mark.  We live in Melbourne Australia.  Mark works in IT and Ken is a Chiropractor.  We love to travel and in the past few years have been on trips to Europe, Middle East, US, Asia and South America.  We love cruising because it's an easy way to see cities and places of the world without having to see the inside of an airport or lug a suitcase.  In 2013 we did a Transatlantic cruise from Rome to Fort Lauderdale and another from Buenos Aires to Santiago Chile.  When on land we like to stay at b&b's, homestays or private apartments.  The knowledge of local hosts and quality of accommodation in great locations is what we look for.  Local knowledge is invaluable.  

Our favourite cities and places include Rome, Berlin, Jordan (you have to go to Petra and Jarash), Bangkok, Cambodia (try the train trip from Bangkok to Cambodia), Barcelona and Santiago.  
Our bucket list includes Cuba, Galapagos Islands, a Baltic cruise, more of Cambodia and lots more of Europe.  We also want to see more of the USA.   Whilst we think we've done a lot of the US we've only just scratched the surface.  Our bucket list includes driving the winnebago from West to East coast (with lots of zig zagging along the way).   

Ken is an avid cook and Mark an avid Collingwood (AFL) supporter.  Don't hold that against him.  We're long time Melbourne locals.  Both born in Victoria we've lived Melbourne inner city, South, East and on the Mornington Peninsula.  We've also lived in various cities around Australia (Sydney, Brisbane, Perth, Mildura, Warnambool, Bright and Darwin) and have been lucky enough to experience life living overseas in New Zealand and the USA.

There is no shortage of things to see and do from laneways, cafes & events. The apartment features fantastic views over Flinders Street Station to the Royal Botanic Gardens, AAMI Park Stadium and Eureka Tower (Melbourne's tallest building). Flinders Street Station is directly across the street where you can catch a train and there are multiple tram stops and taxi ranks at the doorstep. Also, most things that you could want or need are only ever a short walk away.
