properties.name: Designer Suite in Central Deco Icon
properties.summary: Commanding views across historic City Hall and Paris End Skyscrapers, this centrally located apartment sits within the famous 1924 early modernist/Art Deco Capitol Theatre Building, designed by Frank Lloyd Wright trained architect, Walter Burley Griffin. Griffin also did the original design for Canberra.
properties.space: A modern one bed apartment in the absolute heart of the CBD overlooking the Second Empire style Neoclassical Melbourne Town Hall built in 1870.  At just under 50 sq m (Melbourne inner city apartments are generally not as large as in suburbia and space is a premium) it is equipped for stays for one or two people. Features include comfortable queen size bed, Euro galley kitchen and contemporary bathroom. With public transport, restaurants, bars and much more at the doorstep, it is convenient to everything Melbourne city has to offer from  'Paris' end Collins St. shopping, to the Arts Precinct and Laneway coffee and food - it's all at your doorstep or within 10-15 minute walk. The Capitol Theatre building is heritage listed and as such,  the original features such as the huge windows, and interior column detailing dating from 1924 are there to appreciate in original condition as a contrast to the more recent interior renovations and modernisation. The heritage listing also exerts it own c

The Capitol
properties.neighborhood_overview: Breakfast is on me if you want to stay 'in'!   Cereals, bread for toast, croissants, vegemite (it is a Melbourne invention), honey, jam, fresh fruit, and milk are provided -  or there are plenty of local alternatives a minute or two walk if you have a little more time. HOWEVER - Melbourne is internationally renowned for its food scene and brunch is an institution. Melbourne will only reveal its best to those who do a little curious research and get out and into it!  Laneway cafes at the back entrance to the building offer great  food from breakfast to dinner - just head out the building's 'back door' and some of the city's best are right there in the 'back garden'! DeGraves Street and Centre Place  are famous for their cafe's and are only a 5 minute walk away.  Federation Square is  a short 6 minute walk and underground there you will find the Melbourne Visitor Centre for all your tourist information and booking needs. Drop by the Arts Precinct to catch a show or an exhibition  or go s
properties.notes: Fresh provisions: Bath towels provided (I supply enough fresh linen & towels once every 7 days of your stay and we do not change the bed linens or clean the apartment during your stay, unless specifically agreed at the time of booking - extra charges may apply).  Body and hand wash are supplied as well as shampoo, conditioner, makeup remover pads, and a hairdryer.  Fresh fruit, milk and OJ.  Heating and Air conditioning -  Wall 'space' heating plus portable heater for extra cold days.  Ceiling fans plus portable reverse cycle air conditioner is brought in (to replace portable heater) December to March.  'Insite' Melbourne information:  I am a docent in my spare time - providing exclusive customised architecture and food walking tours for a top international walking tour company.  For pics and more on Melbourne coffee and architecture see my 'lettersfromcafenoir' Instagram. Also my 'Guide' notes on this site.  Booking:  I would be very appreciative if you could provide some information
properties.transit: From Tullamarine Airport you can take the fast and efficient Skybus to Southern Cross Station, then short taxi ride or Skybus Shuttle (free if you have taken Skybus) to the nearest hotel to the apartment - Westin on corner of Swanston and Collins or The Causeway in Howey Place - or other at their discretion. Skybus tickets can be purchased ahead of time online. Alternatively take a  taxi direct to apartment from the airport. SkyBus runs express between Melbourne Tullamarine Airport and Southern Cross Station, 24 hours a day, seven days a week. The service takes approximately 20 minutes to get from the airport to the city centre. SkyBus runs  every 10 minutes from 6am to 11pm and every 15 to 30 minutes at other times. A single Skybus return ticket costs 30.00 or 18.00 per adult one way. Taxi from Airport to CBD is around fifty-sixty Australian dollars(URL HIDDEN) Sightseeing: From the apartment its a short 300m (6 minute) walk  to the main transport hub at Flinders Street Station. Tra
properties.access: Fully furnished  including TV, fast wifi/internet is also set up for streaming YouTube and other eligible internet channels (ie. You can log into your Netflix, Stan etc from your smart phone) through Chromecast and the TV.  A good range of DVD's is provided or play your music library from your smart phone through the quality speaker system.   Euro washer/dryer combo, Microwave,  Fridge, Gas Cook Top, Electric oven, Toaster, Electric kettle, Cooking utensils, crockery and cutlery, fresh and luxurious 800 tc linen and all other bedding. Iron and ironing board. Hairdryer.
properties.interaction: You will have the apartment to yourself but I or my 'helper' are available if you need assistance or information. I will meet you to hand over the keys and if you'd like a chat or coffee am more than happy to help out!!  I will respect your privacy unless you specifically ask. Though I reserve the right to enter (in line with Airbnb policy) I will not do so without advising.
properties.house_rules: Strictly No Smoking inside the building.  Please don't cook with oil unless prepared to do a thorough clean up afterwards! No parties or functions and please respect the other residents in the building (please keep the volume low!).  You are not required to strip the bed or do anything else except tidy after yourself, but if rubbish builds up please put it in the street bins on Swanston Street - would be appreciated. Above all I would love to know that guests have relaxed and enjoyed themselves. Love it and look after it like your own home!
properties.host_about: A travel lover myself, I love to host people wherever I am in the world. I have been living and working in China for three years - in Nanjing and Shanghai - and my life continues to be a "Tale of Two (Great Design) Cities" - Shanghai for business, friends and pleasure, and Melbourne  which is my home and family base. Professionally I am a Landscape Architect, an artist, writer and photographer. Along with architecture and design I have a passion for great food and coffee - see my blog 'Letters from Cafe Noir'  for more tips on great coffee in Melbourne -  Australia's Coffee and Culture Capital!! I look forward to meeting you and to sharing my  spaces in Melbourne's fabulous CBD.

Keys must be left INSIDE THE PROPERTY in the cutlery drawer. Ensure that where applicable, in some cases you must remove your car from the parking garage first before returning to the apartment to leave the keys in the cutlery drawer.  Lockboxes: In cases where there was a lock box used for key collection, please ensure that the lockbox is brought inside the property and left on the dining room ta
properties.host_about:
Hi, my name is Paul, owner of Complete Host apartments! I am a seasoned traveler and have been fortunate to have visited most countries and experienced the way the locals live by staying at amazing airbnb properties all around the world. From these experiences I have learned a lot about what sort of experiences people are after when visiting a foreign city.

After spending the majority of the last 15 years overseas I am living back in my home town of  Melbourne and now run a short stays business called Complete Host.  As such, I have on offer a number of very comfortable properties in some of the best locations of Melbourne.

If you are interested in one of the properties l have listed but the dates are unavailable, please check my other listings under my profile or email me an inquiry as l will very likely have another property available that will suit your requirements. 

I cant wait to meet you and make your stay in Melbourne a memorable one!

Paul, Complete Host

properties.neighborhood_overview: What's not to love about this Neighbourhood! It's the very centre of the city, close to anything and everything on your 'to do' list and so much more. Shopping, dining, art gallery, concert hall, theatre, shows, cinemas, sporting events. You can find, buy, eat, drink and be entertained in every which way, and when it's time to relax you have a perfectly beautiful studio apartment to embrace you.
properties.notes: Latest possible check in is 9pm
properties.transit: No problem getting around, only challenge is deciding where to go because there is so much to do.  TRAMS: Trams are located outside on Collins Street and all surrounding streets (Swanston, Elizabeth & Flinders). I have the timetables available for you in your apartment, along with a Myki to use during your stay. *Download the tram tracker app and you'll have up to date timetables whenever you need them. TRAINS: Our main metro station Flinders Street is one block away. Walk up to Swanston Street turn right and in 1 x block you'll see it on the opposite corner. When you get to know the area better you'll see that you can continue down our lane through into Degraves St and then you're just across the road from it - and this way you can have a great coffee, snack or meal along the way.
properties.access: To the entire studio apartment
properties.interaction: I am available via phone and email at all times during your stay to provide you with guidance, assistance and to ensure you are comfortable and have all you need.

Restaurants and Chinatown is just five minutes away, and walking distance to Docklands, Southbank, Carlton (Lygon Street), Melbourne Exhibition Centre, Crown Casino, Royal Exhibition Building, IMAX, etc. Nice view from level 10, you can see as far as Shrine of Remembrance from your room.
properties.notes: This place is suitable if you need a place to sleep and shower, and more time on hand to explore what Melbourne can offer. There are coin operated laundry and dryer machines on each floor. Non smoker only please, UniLodge on Swanston is a 24/7 non smoking building. Essentials are not provided as we do not like to waste things, but you can get them easily downstairs from Woolworths, Coles, or BIG W (Coles and Woolworths open until midnight).

properties.house_rules: NON SMOKERS ONLY PLEASE. Common courtesy applies. We will share living room, bathroom, and kitchen.

properties.summary: Delightful, light filled apartment on 7th floor of Heritage Art Deco building in Melbourne CBD. Quiet, secure & secluded only minutes from the bustle and vibrant culture of Melbourne life.
properties.space: This Art Deco apartment has a large, tastefully furnished living area with open plan kitchen and dining adjoining. Views to the the north and west and windows on 3 sides fill the space with natural light. Fully appointed kitchen with stove top and oven, microwave, espresso coffee machine, toaster and kettle. Tea, coffee and basic staples provided (sugar, flour, salt, herbs and spices, olive oil, butter, sauces, UHT milk). The bathroom has a spacious shower. There is a combined washing machine/dryer in a laundry cupboard. The main bedroom has a very comfortable queen size bed with latex mattress and the smaller bedroom has a king single bed which can convert into a double bed or into two single beds.

properties.summary: Live in the heart of Melbourne and enjoy the arts, food, entertainment and sporting culture right at your doorstep. The location is the best in Melbourne. Jump on a free tram right outside the apartment on Flinders Street (stop number 6) and explore.
properties.space: Heated for warmth in winter and super cool airconditioning for hot summers days you will be comfortable any time of the year in your 108 Flinders street apartment.  The apartment has everything you need from crisp bed linen,towels,all kitchen utensils and free high speed Wifi Flat screen smart TV Washer~dryer Comfy Queen sized bed and one double bed with soft pillows Stylish natural stone and marble bathroom with a rain water style shower head. Gas stove top, Miele oven and dishdraw will encourage you to cook up a storm. Hairdryer,iron,tea,tissues,soap,toilet tissue,danish original lounge suit,four seater dinning table,laundry detergent,dishwasher tablets,juicer,kettle,toaster and extra blankets. Original art work from contemporary Australian artists adorns the walls. The award winning architecturly designed building is new and has an incredible internal hanging plant feature that is a must to see.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Truly there is no better CBD location, so close to the river if you want some nature but so close to the thick of what a city life style is all about. Flinders lane houses all the top restaurants and best art galleries {Chin Chin and Cummulus are yum and Arc one and Anna Schwartz are the hippest galleries}. The Flinders street side has Federation Square which is the real city centre. It holds all the festivals and community events. There is literally something on there everyday. Free live music, Sport up on the big screen or free  fitness class, Food and cultural festivals and the afternoon sun.The National Gallery Australia is also in Fed Square and it is free, it houses a sensational collection not to be missed. Right on the river you can escape to the sanctuary of the gardens and watch the rowers pass by. Situated in a lively lane way this apartment is a buzz at night with the sounds of the city.Street art mixes in with historical architecture in this most liveable city.Head down to
properties.notes: 5 min walk to the famous MCG, Rod Laver Arena and all the central sporting and arts venue in Melbourne. Literally all within a one kilometre radius. That is a ten min walk or a two min tram ride. Trams at your doorstep. Things to do in Melb include The Shrine of Rememberance, climb up for the view and the eternal flame at night so haunting.Queen Victoria market for a lunch of a cheese and spinach Borek hot out the oven, see the fast moving queue and hand over 3 then head up to the slow moving queue for a bag of freshly made jam donuts. Head into the State library and see the reading room with incredible dome roof. I will stop now but let me tell you another time about the Share bikes, the crepes, the roof top bars and our lush parks to get lost in.
properties.transit: From the airport the best option is a Taxi. Taxi ranks are located right outside all terminals. The address is 108 Flinders street. Taxi should cost 65 aprox. Jump on a free tram at stop number 6 outside the building and Flinders Street  or take a train from the iconic Flinders Street Station within 2 minutes walk.  Tourist shuttle buses also depart from Flinders st at Federation  Square to tour you around the best city and outer city highlights and hot spots.  Larger coaches depart here to to take you to the rural retreats of Victoria (Great Ocean road, Winery and Philip Island tours) Free walking tours depart from Federation square and Cycling tours too.
properties.access: Fully equipped gym with all the machines and free weights open from 6 till 10pm.  Dual entry at Flinders Street and Flinders lane gives easy access to the river and the city. I want the apartment to be your home but it is also the home of your neighbors so we will all appreciate noise to be kept at a suitable level. Respect the apartment as your home. The complex is Non smoking
properties.interaction: Check in time is from 2pm checkout time is 11am I will be in contact to find out your arrival time so I can know exactly what time to meet you with the keys. Flight details are very welcome. I will be waiting at apartment to let you in and give you the keys. Buzz apartment number 501 on the external intercom to gain access to the building and take the lift up to level 5.  To make the most of your stay feel free to ask for advice on things to do. I am happy to give you ideas so you can plan your trip before you arrive.
properties.house_rules: Please message me on booking so I can confirm that the apartment is suitable for you. On booking please advise your arrival /check in and out time so I know when to meet you with the keys. Check out time is no later than 11am.  Please leave the keys in the 501 letterbox located in the lobby if I am not able to see you off. The building is fitted with CCTV cameras and your access key advises your location in the building so please respect your neighbors and we will all enjoy this fabulous building by acting responsibly in all common areas. No smoking in the building  (including the apartment ) No noise after 10pm *pls dispose of rubbish *put towels in the washer  *put dishes in the dishwasher *pls turn heating/cooling  Thanks so much and enjoy marvelous Melbourne
properties.host_about: I love Melbourne and I love being able to share this great city with AirBNB guests from all over the world and all walks of life. Being a host is such fun. Meeting such adventurous people has enriched my life for the better. All our guests have been so friendly and open. So many birthdays or re uniting family and friends  to excited migrating new bees. I love to travel and art in all forms, live jazz, music to boogie to, cooking with the seasons, the great outdoors, running in the park, baked goods especially french, philosophy, reading things enriching, old and new movies, friendly people, fresh air, my family, anything vintage or well crafted, dumplings, the freedom that only a bicycle can give. But most of all my talented husband.

properties.name: Melbourne City Centre Aptm + Views!
properties.space: THE APARTMENT  I live in a modern apartment in the best location in the centre of Melbourne city! Perched on the 29th floor, you will have breathtaking endless views of Melbourne's north, with natural light flooding the apartment from sunrise to sunset. Best enjoyed by stepping out onto the balcony with a glass of wine. Double glazed and tinted floor to ceiling sliding doors mean you can make the most of the view, without hearing a thing from the city below. Fridge, gas stove, kettle and oven are available. A powerful air-conditioner will keep you cool in the summer heat. Flat screen TV. THE ROOM You are guaranteed a good night's rest, on the hotel quality Queen sized bed. The bedroom also comes furnished with a bedside lamp, bedside drawer and a desk. Fresh linens, towels and a quilt will be provided.  You will have access to one small wardrobe to hang your clothes. In the bathroom you may use the body wash, shampoo and conditioner, or bring your own. LOCATION Walk to Melbourne Centra

properties.host_about:
About myself, I was born in Hong Kong, grew up in Sydney Australia, and now living in the awesome awesome city of Melbourne. I've also lived in Toronto and Perth. 

I've travelled to Asia, North America, all around Australia, and Europe. When I travel, I like to see places that are different. South East Asia has become a favourite, and I tend to end up there once a year. I have been slowly but surely getting round to the many expreiences it has to offer. 

I love my work as an Engineer for a budget airline, and make the most of the benefits! 

Interests
Listening to music 
Seeing live music 
Mountain Biking 
Travelling 
Reading
Philosophy

Music, Movies, Books
Hip-hop, Pop, Jazz 
Anything that is unique, world music and exploring the classics. 
I love discovering new genres. 
Don't mind a bit of orchestral/classical either. 
I tend to read non-fiction books, often pop science and economics.

Types of People I enjoy
I get along with everyone! I'm inspired by the positive, independent, motivated type, that values having fun and enjoys meeting new people :)
Teach, Learn, Share
Music 
Engineering 
Planes 
Science 

One Amazing Thing I've Seen or Done
Visiting a school for disadvantaged Cambodian kids, and being asked to teach an English class 
Cycling alone around Banff, Canada and bumping into a black bear 
Crossing the Thailand-Cambodian border solo by foot

properties.host_about:
Hi, my name is Paul, owner of Complete Host apartments! I am a seasoned traveler and have been fortunate to have visited most countries and experienced the way the locals live by staying at amazing airbnb properties all around the world. From these experiences I have learned a lot about what sort of experiences people are after when visiting a foreign city.

After spending the majority of the last 15 years overseas I am living back in my home town of  Melbourne and now run a short stays business called Complete Host.  As such, I have on offer a number of very comfortable properties in some of the best locations of Melbourne.

If you are interested in one of the properties l have listed but the dates are unavailable, please check my other listings under my profile or email me an inquiry as l will very likely have another property available that will suit your requirements. 

I cant wait to meet you and make your stay in Melbourne a memorable one!

Paul, Complete Host

properties.name: St Kilda Road apartment with views.
properties.summary: Light filled apartment. Botanic Gardens, The Shine, City Skyline, Event Fireworks visible. Walk to Grand Prix, Golf Course, "Hatted" restaurants & casual cafes. Trams run every 3 min. Located 2 k from Flinders St. Station. Crown Casino a 20 min walk.
properties.space: The apartment faces east and north with beautiful light especially in the morning. At witching hour the view is magnificent and a drink on the verandah may beckon.  The apartment is decorated minimalist but with comfort, enabling the space to function well. Comprising 2 bathrooms and 2 bedrooms privacy can be maintained if 4 choose to stay. While centrally located the accommodation is not noisy.
properties.description: Light filled apartment. Botanic Gardens, The Shine, City Skyline, Event Fireworks visible. Walk to Grand Prix, Golf Course, "Hatted" restaurants & casual cafes. Comprising 2 bathrooms and 2 bedrooms privacy can be maintained if 4 choose to stay. While centrally located the accommodation is not noisy. The full apartment is available for guests as well as the shared indoor heated swimming pool, gym and tennis court and outdoor communal b-b-q area. No on site car parking included in the overnight fees, but this can be offered at an additional cost of 20 per night. We offer a premium foxtel package as well as free WiFi.  Music via Ipod / Iphone ca
properties.neighborhood_overview: We are on the city edge - close enough to walk to the city where the National Gallery is located, the Arts Center, Federation Square and more.  Across the road are the Melbourne Botanic Gardens and The Tan -  our famous running track. The Grand Prix track is behind and walking distance and noisy during the Grand Prix week end.   Fun runs in April, July, October, November and December runs past.  The start location is walking distance and makes competing in these events a breeze to get to and from. We have a number of "hatted" restaurants within walking distance as well casual eateries and some very cool breakfast joints. To be honest you feel like you are in the city but minus the congestion.
properties.notes: The apartment is on the 13th floor, unt 136.  There are two lifts. CCTV  is 24/7 in common areas and a remote control is required for all street level access as well as  internal common doorways e.g. bin area.
properties.transit: Trams trundle by every 3 minutes to take you to the city or the suburbs.  A 2 km walk (or 9 tram stops) takes you to Flinders Street Station where you can train to any destination. Uber rides usually arrive in minutes, or hailing a taxi on Melbourne's main thoroughfare is easy to achieve. There are share options within 3 directions as well Melbourne council hire bike is 75 meters away.
properties.access: The full apartment is available for guests as well as the shared indoor heated swimming pool, gym and tennis court and outdoor communal b-b-q area. No on site car parking included in the overnight fees, but this can be offered at an additional cost of 20 per night. We offer a premium foxtel package as well as free WiFi.  Music via Ipod / Iphone can be played on a Bose speaker. Respect for other residents is required - i.e. no parties and no loud music. Access can be 24/7 for arrival/departure.
properties.interaction: A guest book is available in the apartment with recommendations around the area as well as notes on apartment quirks.  We will endeavor to greet you on arrival.
properties.house_rules: The apartment is non smoking as are all other common areas of the building.  The fridge and pantry are available for guests but we ask that if an item is entirely consumed, then please replace on exit.
properties.host_about: I love the outdoors - running, swimming, gardening and summer.  I can't live without fresh herbs for cooking, fresh flowers. I travel a bit both overseas and domestically, and love to stay somewhere with a view and walking distance to activity.  Having stayed at many hotels worldwide and experienced differing levels of service I try to replicate the best for our apartment.

properties.name: The Best View In Melbourne! Top Floor Flinders St.
properties.summary: Overlooking Federation Square, Yarra River, The Arts and Sports Precincts, and with long views to The Dandenong Ranges, this top floor, one bedroom plus balcony corner apartment is stylish, secure, completely central, full of art, clean, quirky and comfortable.
properties.space: This brilliantly located and very clean one bedroom apartment has unbeatable views of Melbourne and the Dandenong Ranges, plus comfort, art, style, and many extras. A swipe card entry, lift access to Level 12, then a sweeping curved staircase to the top level of this converted 1936 'Quiet Deco' apartment building, and you arrive at the most magnificent view of Melbourne City.  The corner juliette balcony looks directly down into Federation Square, and along both Flinders and Swanston Streets. The Arts Centre Spire is straight ahead, Government House rises above the Botanic Gardens a bit further away, and your eyes can follow the Yarra River all the way to the Crown Casino flame show. You are directly opposite the heritage listed and iconic Flinders Street Station, there is an Indian restaurant in the building, a 24 hour convenience store next door, free trams out the front, and EVERYTHING is walking distance.  Inside the apartment you will find:   A brand new queen sized Miracoil pillo
properties.description: Overlooking Federation Square, Yarra River, The Arts and Sports Precincts, and with long views to The Dandenong Ranges, this top floor, one bedroom plus balcony corner apartment is stylish, secure, completely central, full of art, clean, quirky and comfortable. The Arts Centre Spire is straight ahead, Government House rises above the Botanic Gardens a bit further away, and your eyes can follow the Yarra River all the way to the Crown Casino flame show. You are directly opposite the heritage listed
properties.neighborhood_overview: This apartment is in the middle of everything. You can see what's happening on the Federation Square Stage (and hear it if the windows are open!) and you'll have a birds eye view of every Melbourne fireworks display, Young and Jacksons is a few doors one way, and funky Degraves Street a few doors the other, you can walk to NGV, Southbank, The Bourke Street Mall, Emporium, Melbourne Central, and QV shopping precincts. The MCG is very close (you can hear it, too, on a still day!), Crown Casino is just down the river, and you can tram or train to anywhere from just outside the door.  For dining out, there are many restaurants in Fed Square. Chin Chin, Cumulus Inc, the Movidas and Tonka are all very close, and  Grossi Florentino, Vue de Monde, and the China Town and Hardware Lane restaurant precincts are within stroll-home distance.  Staying in the heart of Melbourne means there is always some city noise going on around you, and (especially in the warmer months, when you might have the win
properties.notes: The kitchen has basics for independent cooking. No-one ever does, though... it's the middle of Melbourne! There is a Nespresso coffee machine and pods, a brimming bowl of coffee sachets, tea bags, hot chocolate chai, etc, on the bench, some cereals and snacks in the pantry, and fresh milk, butter, and basics in the fridge. There will be plentiful clean towels, body and hand wash, and shampoo and conditioner for you to use, plus a cabinet full of the sorts of things that are handy in a bathroom, in case you've forgotten an essential. Please be aware that the accommodation for any more than two guests is on a high quality auto-inflate raised airbed, and/or the long blue couch, which I will have made up and ready for you. There is plenty of room for four people in the apartment. If you are a twosome, but require more than one bed, please contact me for pricing.
properties.transit: Trams are free in the CBD, and you're staying on the corner of the two main thoroughfares of Melbourne (Flinders and Swanston Streets) so just hop on one that is heading in the right direction. Flinders Street Train Station, Melbourne's oldest and grandest, is right opposite, and Southern Cross Train Station (where the Skybus from the airport arrives) is a few blocks away. Let me know if you'd like me to leave Myki's (the public transport top-up ticketing cards) for you to use during your stay, to take trains out of the city, and I will explain how they work. Skybus from Tullamarine Airport runs every 10 minutes, and costs 19 one way. Please ask for directions and instructions if you plan to use this, and I will advise. A taxi from the airport will cost about 55 There are many carparks very close to the apartment, and they will cost from 15 per day on the weekend to about 70 per day during the week. Please plan carefully, and study the price list completely, before you use any of t
properties.access: You'll have full and private access to the apartment, to live in Melbourne as if you belong. The apartment is extremely secure; you'll need a magnetic fob to get into the building, and a programmed swipe to get into the apartment. These are very time consuming and expensive to replace, so any loses will incur a 100 deduction from your security deposit. Please be careful.
properties.interaction: I respond to Airbnb messages immediately, and am always available if you want tips, advice or help. Otherwise, I'll leave you to enjoy the apartment as if it is your own, and Melbourne as if you live here.
properties.house_rules: Please take good care of the apartment, it's fixtures and fittings, and report any damage or concerns as soon as they are evident. Unreported breakages or significant mis-use repair costs will be deducted from your security deposit.  Please turn the lights and heater or air-con off as you leave, take all your belongings and leave the apartment as close as possible to the state you found it in.  The apartment swipe key and magnetic fob are very particularly recorded and programmed, toward providing high level security. Both are expensive and time consuming to replace, and loses will incur a 100 deduction from your security bond. Please be careful! Only booked guests may stay in the apartment. No extra guests without prior arrangement, and certainly no parties. Strictly no smoking in the apartment (ok on the balcony, and please close the door).

properties.host_about:
Hi Everyone,
 I wish you will go through all my listings, 
https://www.airbnb.com.au/rooms/1747852
https://www.airbnb.com.au/rooms/1863200
https://www.airbnb.com.au/rooms/2327860
https://www.airbnb.com.au/rooms/8341907
https://www.airbnb.com.au/rooms/11656757


Being a Airbnb , it is been almost 3 years. I love being a host, because I know that when people, different group of people and family they came to our place, when they feel, it is worth it. I love it and enjoy. That's the happiness that other job may not able to find it. I really love to see when my guests they start to step to the apartment and feel wow and impressed.
Honestly, being a host, it is not easy decision.
We have to make sure every details things in our place are the best to our guests. 
From check-in to check-out. It is an experience not only for guests. it is for us as well. It is the whole responsibilities. 

That’s what I think, the reason which motivates me to be a host.

Melbourne is a very multi-cultural city 
My objective is, if someone come here they should be connected to the right place.
Me, as a host, I think is kind of connecting these different peice together, a kind of connection.
The high point of my stay was how you made me feel. And how you made me feel, it sticks. It sticks with you.”
I have the traditional way to believe.
We believe it is the relationship that provide to the guests they will enjoy,  love the place to stay.
They trust me and I trust them. And that’s the reason it works.
So hospitalities if you ask me, is about care. It s about welcoming. This is about welcoming with open heart.  Welcome you to my Melbourne Apartment.

properties.host_about:
Welcome to Melbourne!

This is the city we live, play and work, it's incredibly beautiful, vibrant and diverse!

Imagine a city where nobody is judged by the color of their skin, the money they make, their religion, address or sexual preference. Imagine a city where people relate to each other as one big community. 

That's what we're out to find out....

My apartment is conveniently located in the most amazing location, just off St Kilda Road in Prahran/ St Kilda.  10min walk to St Kilda, 10 min walk to Chapel street. 8min walk to the Alfred Hospital  Newly renovated, my top-floor, 2 bedroom apartment is only a 5min walk to Albert Park lake and to Fitzroy Street in St Kilda. Set amongst the treetops, it's a refuge of peace and quiet. It's just a 10 minute stroll to the famous Chapel street, or St Kilda beach. You can walk into Melbourne's city centre through beautiful parklands, or catch a tram. The apartment comprises 2 large bedrooms, 1 bath/shower, modern kitchen, huge living area, and a separate toilet. Being on the top floor (3rd floor), there are stairs involved and no elevator in the building. It's only the 3rd floor and my 70 year old dad runs up them, no sweat! properties.neighborhood_overview: I love my location, as do many of my friends, as I am walking distance to Melbourne's best! Our amazing beaches, botanical gardens, shopping, public transport, food food and more food, live entertainment in the amazing surrounding parks over the summer months, and night markets, pubs and clubs..What more can you ask for really??  This is the world's most liveable city after all.
properties.notes: I love my location, as do many of my friends, as I am walking distance to Melbourne's best! Our amazing beaches, botanical gardens, shopping, public transport, food food and more food, live entertainment in the amazing surrounding parks over the summer months, and night markets, pubs and clubs..What more can you ask for really??  This is the world's most liveable city after all.
properties.transit: Should you wish to check out more of this amazing city, and there is a lot going on, public transport is right on your doorstep! Trams will take you to any desired location in central Melbourne. Or conveniently link you up to all main train stations if you wish to travel further. Trams heading north take you direct into the city. Stop off at the botanical gardens, head in for a night at the moonlight cinema or live theatre in the summer months. Then wander a little further and climb the steps of The Shrine of Remembrance", with its incredible views of our amazing city. From there you are almost down town, so hop back on the tram or  just enjoy the leisurely 10 min walk and you will find yourself at the entrance of the city. The amazing Arts Centre, a flagship of the performing arts in Victoria, and the focal point of Melbourne's cultural. Then right next door you have Southbank so take in the breath taking views of an evening as you walk along the Yarra river.  This fantastic city offe
properties.access: You will be sharing a two bedroom apartment with myself. All amenities are there for you to use.  Please treat my belongings with respect, as I would like to ensure future guests have a great stay also! Thanks, Jen.
properties.interaction: I have a busy lifestyle, full time studies and working part time as a stylist. I respect peoples privacy although always here to answer any questions you may have. Love a glass of wine when time permits :)
properties.house_rules: My neighbours are lovely people and their respect is really important to me. All guests are requested to respect my neighbour's right to peace and quiet in their neighbourhood, so please take care with noise, and everybody will get along fabulously. .  I am a non smoker, but there is a balcony for smokers if they wish.  Strictly no parties. My place is not suitable for loud and large gatherings. It's a home.  Unfortunately my apartment block doesn't allow pets.
properties.host_about:
Hello,

I'm am a well travelled person who has been lucky enough to zip around the world several times. I re-settled in Melbourne a couple of years ago.

I love meeting new people and introducing them to this beautiful city.

Currently I spend my time as a full time student studying design and working part-time as a stylist to finance my studies. So although I am a social person, I have a heavy workload.

I love life and all it has to offer so I try make sure it is full of the things I love to do. Life is too short to approach it any other way!

I look forward to welcoming you to my home and this fun filled city!

Kind regards,

Jennifer

properties.name: 2 Bedroom CBD Melbourne Apartment
properties.summary: Located in the heart of the "World's Most Liveable City", our 2 bedroom apartment is the perfect space to relax and unwind from the hustle and bustle of your trip.  Whether you are taking advantage of Australia's sporting capital by hitting a tennis/cricket/footy game, indulging yourself in Melbourne's famous foodie scene, or you have a date with one of the thousands of fashion stores around the city, you have the convenience of these all being right at your front doorstep.
properties.space: The space has everything you will need for a comfortable and hassle-free stay in Melbourne. Both rooms have double beds and can comfortably sleep 4 people. There are wardrobes in both rooms where you are more than welcome to use to hang up your belongings. There are also two small balconies located in the apartment one is off the main lounge and the other is off the first bedroom.   The kitchen comes fully equipped, and includes a fridge/freezer, gas cooker and microwave. This gives you the flexibility to cook at home if you get sick of eating out in the city (highly unlikely!), or simply want to whip up a quick brekkie before heading out on your next adventure.

The kitchen comes fully equipped, and includes a fridge/freezer, gas cooker and microwave. This gives you the flexibility to cook at ho
properties.neighborhood_overview: Melbourne has it all, and the CBD is the beating heart of this vibrant city. It is a city that offers absolutely everything to everybody: shops and shopping centres, restaurants of all kinds, museums, theatres, markets, parks, world class sporting facilities, trams, nightlife...you get the picture. This  is all reflective of Melbourne's rise as a major city of international status and standing, and its presence displays awesome cultural, intellectual, financial, economic, sporting, and investment muscle.  Melbourne has long been the home to infamous sporting events like the Australian Tennis Open, the Australian Formula 1 Grand Prix, the Spring Carnaval Horse Racing and the AFL Grand Final- to name a few. If you're lucky enough to be in town while one of these are on, the CBD is the perfect location to commute to these. A 2 minute walk across the road is the QV, which hosts a wide range of shops- Dan Murphy's (liquor store), Woolworths (supermarket) are among these, along with a host o
properties.notes: If there is anything you need during your stay please do not hesitate to contact me I will be happy to help.
properties.transit: The apartment is within the Free Tram Zone, and getting around is cheap and convenient. Taking a City Circle Tram will give you a good indication of the parameters of the CBD (plus you will learn a bit out the city and get to ride in a cool old tram).  If you don't fancy public transport, taxis and Ubers are plentiful and can take you to wherever you need to go.
properties.access: All parts of the apartment are accessible for all guests.
properties.interaction: I will be one text message/call away if you need anything.
properties.house_rules: No Smoking in the Apartment  Please smoke downstairs outside the building No extra people than what the apartment has been booked for No parties- Please do not try to have a sneaky party or have more people in the appartment then what is booked,there is full CCTV in the building and I i will be notified plus your booking will be cancelled. Check in is from 5pm please enquire first before booking if you need an earlier check in
properties.host_about:
I'm a Kiwi currently living in Melbourne. I love exploring new places whether it be beaches, restaurants or sports games. I have a keen interest in rugby, cricket and tennis, having played them to a sub-par standard over the years, and love to hit games whenever I can.

I enjoy a wide variety of music, and consider myself a bedroom rock star on the guitar; alas no public performances have come onto the radar just yet. I developed a love for old-school rock in my younger years courtesy of my parents, and have been around the live concert ring of The Eagles, Eric Clapton, Cat Stevens etc. So I love talking and sharing experiences about music in general, if you're that way inclined!

In my unripened age, I haven't done a lot of traveling, however I have big dreams to build a list with my partner in crime, and tackle as many adventures as we can. So if you have any awesome stories of your home land or travels, an eager pair of ears aren't too far away!

Hailing a can on St Kilda Rd is easy any time of the day plus there are numerous Uber cars within a few minutes.

Centrally located in the heart of Melbourne, with soaring 4.2 metre ceilings and polished floors you will love the feeling of space this apartment offers. As well as the shops, bars, theatres, galleries and restaurants on offer, you are also a 60 second walk from Melbourne's hub - where you can hop on a train or tram to St Kilda, Richmond, Albert Park, the MCG, Fitzroy, Collingwood, Chapel St or just about anywhere else!
properties.space: We love it and am sure you will to! Enjoy the modern finishes, timber floors, huge table perfect for a substantial work space with super fast internet access or just dinner with friends. The light, character and space offered by the building and the apartment itself is second to none. We have done everything we can to help people have an amazing time while they are i town. properties.neighborhood_overview: What can we say about Degraves Street? It is almost the neighbourhood that needs no introduction, whether it is a shopping trip, business trip, or just a a night in Melbourne for the convenience of the city our place is in the heart of it all and we just love it. Truly a serene place to relax and quiet amongst the hustle and bustle of the city.
properties.notes: We also have the option for a double or two single beds in the second bedroom. Let us know before you stay and we can customise the sleeping arrangements, how good is that!
properties.transit: The subway to Flinders Street Station and the Transport Hub of Melbourne is literally a stones throw from our doorstep. There is no place easier whether you are heading to the airport, the suburbs or anywhere in Australia!
properties.access: We would love to meet you and show you around but we also know this isn't always possible and some prefer their own space when travelling. Either way we will be there for you, whether it is easy instructions to the key safe for entry or a personalised check-in and a quick coffee, whatever you want we can provide!!!
properties.interaction: We will be available absolutely throughout your stay, you can call, email or message us anytime and we are never too far away to assist.
properties.host_about: First and foremost I am an accomplished omelette chef for my beautiful wife, Lucy. Other than that I run a business and and also go on a daily chocolate run which I am trying to change from daily to weekly. I read, write and am down the beach unless the city calls for work. With a background in property I have been professionally managing properties to help travellers make some extra money while they are away. This has given me the flexibility to spend more time doing the things I love, like getting married, travelling and cooking up a storm.

Melbourne is an international shopping destination, and our apartment is centrally located.  Emporium, Bourke St Mall and Collins St is a mere a 9 minute walk. Foodie paradise Carlton is a 10 min tram ride, or a 20 in stroll, while Hipsterville Fitzroy is an easy tram away.
properties.transit: The apartment is around the corner from Melbourne Central Station, you will be incredibly close to any train/tram/bus you may need during your stay. We are also within the Free Tram Zone in Melbourne CBD. The Free Tram Zone includes the area from Queen Victoria Market, across to Victoria Harbour in Docklands, up to Spring Street and over to Flinders Street Station and Federation Square. The Free Tram Zone signs at tram stops will identify the boundaries of the zone. Alternatively, we are in walking distance of most things or Uber and taxi's are readily available.

properties.host_about:
We're a fun-loving couple who set up our first home together in the city some years ago! We've since had to find some extra room with a new addition to our family so we've decided to list our cosy little space on Airbnb. 

It's a space that's filled with many fond memories, including jaunts to the many nearby cafes, eateries and restaurants in the city, and of course, watering holes in Melbourne's iconic hidden laneways. If you can't already tell - food and drink features rather greatly in our lives. For your morning cup of joe, head to Mr Tulk at the State Library where you can also dig in to brunch, and our local is Captain Melville where you can grab the Captain's Burger and a pint. 

We hope you can find a home away from home in our little city retreat and that your stay would be filled with as many great memories as we've had.

properties.name: Jazzy Travellers Retreat in Melbourne CBD
properties.summary: This is a comfortable and stylish two-level apartment overlooking Melbourne's arts, sport and cultural precincts. Melbourne's many moods have it buzzing by day, and sultry as the sun goes down as the clubs, galleries and restaurants light up.
properties.space: Love and cool has been put into creating this stylish CBD retreat, perched on Level 14 of ‘The Mark’ in Collins St, Melbourne. The apartment is poised at the centre of Melbourne’s arts, sports, business and shopping precinct.  The Botanic Gardens, Yarra River, MCG and Rod Laver Arena are a few city blocks away, all within walking distance or tram ride. Melbourne offers free CBD zone tram rides, and there is a stop right outside your door.   Spencer Street railway station, the gateway to regional Victoria, is a few blocks away. The Melbourne Airport Skybus, an AU18 trip that takes under 30 minutes to domestic and international terminals, is also on Spencer Street. Bike hire and bike tours are a wonderful way to get to know this friendly city, and Melbourne City Council has gone to great lengths to include bike lanes throughout the city.  Entry to the apartment is by secure, swipe card access. Using the lift, travel to the top floor of ‘The Mark’ ,and enter the apartment. Entry and the

properties.neighborhood_overview: The apartment is smack-dab in the middle of Collins St, with the business district at one end, and up-market shopping and theatres at the other.  Flinders Lane, with its wonderful cafes and restaurants, is a block away.  There are hundreds of eateries, bars, shops, and entertainment venues, all happening around you. Check out The Age Good Food Guide or Broadsheet for tips on Melbourne's best, and remember to book if there is somewhere special you'd like to go! The apartment is a retreat, quiet and removed from the hubbub, with double blinds to close out the lights at night. Melbourne is known for it's cafe culture, and you won't have to venture far to grab a hot brew. Degraves St is simply wonderful, lined with hole in the wall cafes, reknown Italian eateries and edgy little shops offering arty delights. Chocolate shops abound, Lindt, Haighs (our favourite!), Ganache and many more can be found up and down Collins St. Take time to stroll through the beautiful Block Arcade, with its magn
properties.notes: This apartment is best suited to one or two people. The sofa-bed is available in the living area to accommodate extra guests. We only provide extra linen for this bed when additional guests are booked.
properties.transit: PUBLIC TRANSPORT FROM THE AIRPORT:  *You can catch a taxi to the apartment, but why bother. Melbourne airport's Skybus provides a 20-30 minute express service between Tullamarine airport and Southern Cross Station. From there it is a short walk, or tram ride, straight down Collins Street to the apartment. TAXIS: There is a taxi rank across the street from the apartment BUS / TRAMS:  *Trams run from 5.30am till late at night, with a number of lines 1-5 minutes walk from the apartment that take you to destinations all over Melbourne and the surrounding areas.  *City Circle Tram - Hop on this free tram service which operates in a circular route passing major tourist attractions, as well as linking with other tram, train and bus routes in and around Melbourne. TRAIN STATIONS:  *You have access to a number of the major train stations including Central Flinders Street station and City Southern Cross station within a short and easy walk.  CAR PARKING FACILITIES *There are many secure car-park
properties.access: You will be provided with a swipe key to access the building. The whole apartment is exclusively yours to use during your stay.
properties.interaction: Our rental manager, Linton, or one of his team will greet you when you arrive at Travellers Retreat and will be available during your stay to answer any questions that might arise.
properties.house_rules: All we ask is that you treat the apartment and our neighbours with respect, consideration and care.  Please leave the apartment clean and tidy.  Please make sure your children do not destroy our property, especially 40 year old record player! 'The Mark' has a blanket no smoking rule. There are penalties that apply for smoking in the apartments or on the balconies which we will pass onto you, along with an extra cleaning fee. We clean the apartment thoroughly in between guests, supply fresh linen and make sure you arrive to a comfortable space. No additional guests other than those authorised through the booking, no animals, happy for you to have other guests, but no parties and again, no smoking. Please be mindful of the keys and FOB as they are expensive to replace. A charge will be applied if either are lost.
properties.host_about:
Hi, we’re Geoff and Tanya. 

We work in music, research and communications. We love music, food and travel.

We've been lucky to work and play everywhere from Everest to Palau, London to Cairo and Cheju to Amsterdam.

We hope you’ll come stay in our city apartment located on Melbourne's most historic avenue, with everything the world’s most liveable city has to offer right at your doorstep.
 
Our rental manager, Ignacio, or one of his team will greet you when you arrive at Travellers Retreat and will be available during your stay to answer any questions that might arise.

You are in the heart of it all, with public transport just at the end of the street, not that you'll need it as you can walk pretty much everywhere. properties.host_about:
I was born in Melbourne, and know the attraction of Melbourne is very much about its lifestyle. While it’s still got its “Hustle & Bustle” the magic about Melbourne is how it balances this hectic activity with the arts, sports and entertaining. Melbournian’s have passion for living life and that’s a major element towards Melbourne being voted as one of the world’s most liveable and friendliest cities (EIU's Global Liveability Ranking)

I have spent most of my life on the Mornington Peninsula (one hour south of Melbourne). I work in Melbourne’s CBD and have now also moved into the city to live. I’m an avid traveler, but with so many destinations still explore both in Australia and overseas. 
My greatest memories of traveling are often the people you meet and the experiences that are not found on the main tourist trail. I always love talking to a local character getting that special place to visit or café to dine (usually a cousin’s cafe). 
I have now come to a stage in my life I’d like to share some of Melbourne’s special places with others. These are not only my places of interest but also those hidden secrets that previous guests have found and have been excited to share with us.

I like to think “Abode 316 & 317” are special!  They are less than a year old and designed to be functional, yet have a touch of sophistication. They are fully optioned for the traveler and create that home away from home a hotel just can’t offer. 
Accommodation can often make or break a holiday, but I know the accommodation and hospitality my apartments will add to your Melbourne experience.
Rob

Brand new one bedroom apartment located on the 47th floor of one of the highest buildings to grace the Melbourne skyline.  Welcome to the heart of Melbourne city, with Southern Cross train station around the corner and Spencer / Collins St Tram stop a few steps away from the building, the city beckons at your doorstep. Using Melbourne trams is a breeze, and it is free for you within the CBD zone and Docklands as you are in the Melbourne CBD Free Tram zone. We will provide you with a Myki travel card so you can venture further than the CBD if so you should wish. The apartment comes fully equipped with a modern kitchen
properties.neighborhood_overview: Being in the centre of Melbourne CBD puts all of Melbourne at your doorstep. With Southbank shopping and fine dining along the Yarra River, Flinders St station, Southern Cross train station and the Melbourne Arcades all a short stroll away, you don't have to plan your day according to a map. Walk or take the free tram to Etihad Stadium, Queen Victoria Market, Melbourne Central, Docklands or the State Library. Simply take the elevator from the 47th floor and you will find yourself in the middle of it all. If you want to go to the beach, hit up St Kilda, relax in the Royal Botanical Gardens or admire the Shrine of Remembrance, simply catch a tram, touch on your Myki that we will provide for you, and be there in 20 minutes time.
properties.notes: Be mindful that other people also live in the building. Please watch noise levels during the day, and especially after 10PM.
properties.transit: Getting on the tram is free, and you can easily travel within the free tram zone (CBD and Docklands). This will get you to everywhere from Queen Victoria Market to the State Library, even to Etihad Stadium (which is actually just a short walk away, as you will see from your window). We will also give you a rechargeable Myki card to touch on for using public transport outside the free tram zone to get to St Kilda, the Beaches, Lygon Street etc. (1 per person for the duration of your stay). A 7.70 recharge will give you one day unlimited access to all the Melbourne public transport, including trams, buses and trains.
properties.access: Guests have their own set of key and key-pass. This provides full access to their own room, and all amenities including heated pool, gym, spa and sauna all located within the building at guest's convenience. (Gym, pool, spa, sauna opening hours: 7AM - 10PM)
properties.interaction: Enjoy complete privacy in the apartment. The keys will be handed over to guests in person, and given a quick induction to the building and amenities available. Whenever required, we're a quick text / phone call away, otherwise we'll be out of your hair.
properties.house_rules: Strictly no parties, please. Strictly no smoking, please. Range hood to be turned on and windows opened while cooking. Sensitive fire detector, so please be careful of it, we will give a quick rundown during your induction. Guests will receive one set of keys that gives access to your room and all amenities within the building (Gym, pool, spa, sauna) Nominal check in time of 2PM to 10PM and check out 10AM or before. Will arrange specific times in advance. Please do not hesitate to ask if you require any further flexibility we will endeavour to be as flexible as possible to accommodate any reasonable requests.
properties.host_about:
A little about us:

(Adam:)
Born 25 years ago in beautiful Budapest, moved to Melbourne at the age of 12 and have lived here ever since. 
Currently completing my Masters in Mechatronic Engineering at Melb Uni, I enjoy making the most of my time off. I love to cook, photograph, travel, discover and be awed by this world and its mysteries with my beautiful wife, Anita. We have travelled, lived and worked together across 3 different continents, and have recently married in our birth home, in a small town near Budapest, in June, 2014. Although we have recently moved into our brand new apartment high up in the skyline of Melbourne CBD, we still love being tourists exploring our new home town of Melbourne.
We have, throughout our travels used AirBnb as guests with great pleasure, and through the positive experiences we decided to open our doors to host. We hope to meet many more travellers to tell us of their adventures, and share with us all the stunning places in the world to discover!

Anita & Adam

properties.neighborhood_overview: It really is the heart of Melbourne with amazing views. I'm not kidding. Whether you’re here for shopping, food n wine, business, visiting family or sightseeing, this location will take you anywhere you need to go in Melbourne!  My apartment is right opposite the iconic Flinders Train Station and Federation Square with the Melbourne Visitor Centre to help you with all your tourist and booking needs. There are also currency exchange tellers and 3 travel agents all within 50 metres from the apartment building (STA Travel, Backpackers World Travel and Student Flights). There are also free tourist guides (dressed in red), free Melbourne walking tours and the free City Circle Tourist tram right opposite the apartment building - but you can ask me for further information once accommodation is booked. It is walking distance to Melbourne Convention and Exhibition Centre which is also next to the Direct Factory Outlets (DFO), RMIT, Southbank Promenade, Crown Casino, Docklands Stadium, St Kilda
properties.notes: Here are some FAQs. I think the more information the better! ***The shower tub ceiling height will be a little low for tall people.  ***A pedestal fan is provided for hot days. There is no air conditioning (AC) and it can get hot in summer. This is compensated by the economy pricing of our apartment and the convenience. Keeping the blinds down for the morning sun helps.  ***Lifts go to level 12, and then there are stairs to level 13 (pictured).  ***What are the check in/check out times? Standard check-in time is 2:00pm / 1400hrs.  If you arrive after 5.00pm / 1700hrs, please confirm with me first for my availability to meet you for key handover. Late night/early morning key handover between 10.30pm to 6.30am will incur a 35 fee as I outsource this to a person named Margaret and Jeremy from Personal Concierge. Standard check-out time is 10:00am. In the event we have another guest checking in/out on the same day, then standard check in/check out times apply. But it is flexible as someti
properties.transit: Flinders Street Station is the main public transport hub to all of Melbourne and is right opposite the apartment, about 20 metres away! Trams in the CBD area is free! To plan your travel around Melbourne, use the PTV journey planner website. You can borrow and top up our MYKI cards (your one card to use any public transport in Melbourne) provided in our apartment or buy one from manned train stations, convenient stores or the Airport Sky Bus terminals. City CBD trams are free! Taxis are 100 metres away at the taxi rank at Flinders Street Station. No parking included but there is paid parking at Federation Square. I don't recommend it because there really is no need for a car. To get to the airport, use SkyBus.  If you have 3 people or more it's usually cheaper to catch a taxi which is only 100 metres away.  SkyBus runs express between Melbourne Airport and Southern Cross Station, 24 hours a day, seven days a week. The service takes approximately 20 minutes to get from the airport to th
properties.access: The entire apartment is exclusively yours! The apartments in the building are mixed use and is occupied by long term tenants who are either students, owners and full time workers, so it may not instantly appeal to more mature visitors. Access to common facilities (also known as the basement level) include coin-operated laundry with washing and drying machines, a meeting room, large lounge room with a large screen television and free cable FOXTEL TV, pool table and table tennis. All can be accessed via the lift or stairs using your key cards.
properties.interaction: I won't be present during your stay but I am more than happy to be your search engine of Melbourne by phone and email. I am easily contactable via call, sms text, Viber, Whats app and email. We will try to accommodate you check-in and check-out times as best as possible so please confirm with me in your request. Otherwise standard check in/out times are 2pm/10am. Collection of keys are at the reception desk Mon - Fri 9am to 5pm. Reception is closed on weekends and public holidays. If you arrive outside these times Tim (my wonderful partner) and I am more than happy to hand over keys and recommend a few places to go (love food and cocktail bars!). Late night/early morning key handovers between 10.30pm to 6.30am will incur a 35 fee as I outsource this to a person named Margaret and Jeremy from Personal Concierge. Please let us know in your request as I work full time but can be flexible with enough notice.
properties.house_rules: No parties. No smoking. No pets. But most of all, treat it like your own home! We don't provide additional cots or kids amenities, but additional infants & children (under 12) are absolutely welcome at no extra charge. There is a spare doona and pillow you can use. Please note our standard check-in time is 2pm and check-out time is 10am - however let me know your desired arrival and departure times (flight times too) and I will do my best to accommodate them between guests.
properties.host_about:
I love riding my bicycle, discovering new places and amazing food whether it's cheap n street food, mid-range or fine dining! Most importantly I LOVE MELBOURNE! I've lived here since I was a little 1 year old baby. With the arts, music, food and wine scene constantly evolving, I am always rediscovering my own backyard in the nooks and crannies of Melbourne!

I travelled a lot when I was in my 20s to over 20 something countries but now I'm enjoying life with my gorgeous kiwi partner Tim, who loves surfing. 

Why Airbnb? Well I've always wanted to retire running my own Bed and Breakfast with 3 private cottages somewhere surrounded by nature and in tranquil peace (maybe NZ!?). All while Tim chops wood and I make granny treats and welcome couples. But that's a pipe dream when I'm old and grey so I thought I'd get a taste for being a BnB host while young! So instead of being surrounded by nature, you'll be surrounded by Marvelous Melbourne - right in the heart of it all!

properties.host_about:
Inspired by and dedicated to Australian contemporary artists, Canvas Suites aims to provide boutique hospitality experience to our guests. Each of our Suites are handpicked, acquired and directly owned by Canvas Suites before being meticulously prepared and setup as the place our guests call home when in Melbourne.

At Canvas Suites, we believe that no visit to a place is complete without immersing oneself in its unique culture and central to any culture is its art. We view each of our art-inspired Suites as carefully curated galleries with walls adorned by original Australian works of art which our guests may enjoy in private during their stay.

But great spaces with great art do not by themselves create great hospitality experience. We know what counts for our guests to have a great stay in Melbourne – a friendly face to meet them, top-of-the-line chiropedic beds made with pristine sheets, the towels and toiletries taken care of to our exacting standards. We also know that our guests want the space and freedom to experience what Melbourne has to offer at their own pace. So we are available 24/7 for when our guests need us, but we step back when they do not.

Welcome to Melbourne!

This is the city we live, play and work, it's incredibly beautiful, vibrant and diverse!

Imagine a city where nobody is judged by the color of their skin, the money they make, their religion, address or sexual preference. Imagine a city where people relate to each other as one big community. 

That's what we're out to find out....

properties.host_about:
I was born in Melbourne, and know the attraction of Melbourne is very much about its lifestyle. While it’s still got its “Hustle & Bustle” the magic about Melbourne is how it balances this hectic activity with the arts, sports and entertaining. Melbournian’s have passion for living life and that’s a major element towards Melbourne being voted as one of the world’s most liveable and friendliest cities (EIU's Global Liveability Ranking)

I have spent most of my life on the Mornington Peninsula (one hour south of Melbourne). I work in Melbourne’s CBD and have now also moved into the city to live. I’m an avid traveler, but with so many destinations still explore both in Australia and overseas. 
My greatest memories of traveling are often the people you meet and the experiences that are not found on the main tourist trail. I always love talking to a local character getting that special place to visit or café to dine (usually a cousin’s cafe). 
I have now come to a stage in my life I’d like to share some of Melbourne’s special places with others. These are not only my places of interest but also those hidden secrets that previous guests have found and have been excited to share with us.

I like to think “Abode 316 & 317” are special!  They are less than a year old and designed to be functional, yet have a touch of sophistication. They are fully optioned for the traveler and create that home away from home a hotel just can’t offer. 
Accommodation can often make or break a holiday, but I know the accommodation and hospitality my apartments will add to your Melbourne experience.
Rob

properties.name: Beautiful Northcote home with heart -close to city
properties.summary: Our 3 bedroom 1940's renovated home is light, open and full of charm. The large garden and nearby creek create an urban oasis only 20 minutes from the city by public transport (a short walk to train station and tram stop). Just minutes from CERES organic markets / farm and the restaurants and shops of High St. A safe and quiet neighbourhood. Room is perfect for solo traveller and hosts can help as much or as little as needed.
properties.space: Our home is close to lively shopping strips, quiet creek walks and public transport. The guest bedroom room is spacious, peaceful and light with floorboards, queen bed, wardrobe, chest of drawers and large windows looking onto a native garden. You will have plenty of privacy as the room is down its own end of the house. You will have the bathroom / toilet to yourself aside from the  short time we shower there - the rest of the time we use a second toilet and sink at the other end of the house.  House is tidy and clean, pet free and non smoking.  Our large deck is the perfect place to relax in summer shade or catch some winter sun. Lovely outdoor settings to enjoy the garden. Native birds often perch on the large gum tree in the back garden. Your hosts are keen on yoga and you are welcome to loan yoga mats etc and do your yoga practice on the deck of in your room (plenty of space). Includes: Wireless internet access and local calls, fresh linen including towel & face-washer, electric ke

properties.neighborhood_overview: We are in 15 mins walking distance of High St with an incredible choice of restaurants and boutique stores and a short tram ride from the fantastic Brunswick St (brilliant for shopping, food and all things hipster) Also 10 min walk from the wonderful CERES environment park – a demonstration site for sustainability projects and every day organic food markets, shop and cafe. Also a lovely cycle to the city if you have access to a bike.
properties.notes: Prefer guests aged 30+ with planned work or activity itinerary.
properties.transit: 7-10 minute walk to tram 11 and tram 96. 12-14 minute walk to Croxton train station. Express train gets to city in 20 mins. Trams will get you to the city in 25  - 30 minutes. We can loan you a MetCard (you will need to top it up with credit at local milk bar or charging station).

Welcome to use microwave in kitchen or store items in fridge but prefer kitchen use is limited (not full meal preparation). Check in 4pm onwards (this may need to be negotiable as we like to greet guests at the beginning of their stay)- check out 9.30 or 10am (depends on day)
properties.interaction: We are quite social and would love to sit down and have a cuppa with you but if you would prefer to keep to yourself, or the main focus of your visit is work and evening rest,  that is fine too.
properties.house_rules: Kitchen not available for meal prep. Please respect negotiated check out time. Turn off heater when going out. Keep showers to reasonable length. No visitors unless negotiated with hosts.
properties.host_about: Hosts Tania and Stephen are keen travellers and hikers. We are interested in healthy living and healthy food. We are passionate about building community and supporting environmental and social equity. We enjoy being around people who are also interested in these issues. Steve is learning the guitar (don't tell him I mentioned it :-)) and I love singing. We love Melbourne (it's full of diversity, art and entertainment) and have plenty of ideas for recommended destinations and activities.

Hi, we're Chu and Maris. We've been calling Melbourne home for over 10 years and we're loving it.

We would love to welcome you to our comfortable and exceptionally clean & tidy apartment. Enjoy your privacy while staying with us and we're just a message/phone call away should you need anything. 

Melbourne has lots to offer. From vast selection of cuisines, intriguing sights, sports, art & culture, outdoor activities and nightlife. Tell us what sort of activity you're interested in and we'll be more than happy to make recommendation based on our real experience. We hope that you can come to love the city too. 

Chu and Maris

properties.name: Quiet Laneway Apartment Near Bourke Street Mall.
properties.summary: Stay in the absolute centre of Melbourne in this comfortable, near new, very clean and chic apartment. Steps from the tram (free, and straight from the Skybus drop off), very close to the Bourke Street Mall (Melbourne's central shopping precinct) and at the Paris End of the CBD, with theatres, fine dining, cafés, and China Town very nearby. Walk to everything, then escape to the calm and quiet of this laneway hideaway.
properties.space: This brilliantly located apartment has everything you'll need to stay comfortably and safely in the heart of the world's most liveable city. A few steps up Bourke Street from The Mall, and hidden down a quiet and quirky Melbourne Laneway, you can walk to anywhere, or take the free tram from the end of your lane. Interesting cafés and designer shops on the ground floor of the building, very quiet location, double glazed windows, and complete safety via the triple stage building security. Clean, practical, well equipped and easy.

properties.neighborhood_overview: This apartment is just off Bourke Street, a few steps from The Bourke Street Mall, Melbourne's historic and premier shopping precinct. You can walk through Myer and David Jones, and follow the continuous arcades through Emporium, Melbourne Central and QV shopping centres. China Town is half a block away, The Paris End of Collins Street is half a block away, The Yarra River is two blocks away, and you are in the centre of the CBD free tram zone. There is a groovy café right under your balcony for the early morning coffee run, as well as a short walk to many of Melbourne's premier restaurants.
properties.notes: There will be plenty of clean towels, body and hand wash, and shampoo and conditioner for you to use, plus a cabinet full of toothpaste, makeup remover, moisturiser, some hair products, tampons, condoms, etc, in case you've forgotten an essential. The kitchen has everything you'll want for cooking meals; a full sized oven, glass cooktop, single drawer dishwasher, rice cooker, microwave, full sized fridge, pots and pans, utensils, a pantry with some staples. Don't plan too much cooking though - you're staying in the middle of Melbourne! There is a Nespresso coffee machine and pods, a brimming bowl of coffee sachets, tea bags, hot chocolate chai, etc, on the bench, some cereals and snacks in the pantry, and fresh milk, butter, filtered water in the fridge. Please note the bed configuration is one Miracoil pillow top queen sized bed in the separate bedroom. Third and forth guests sleep on the long couch, and/or the raised air-bed, which I will have made up for you with quality linen, donn
properties.transit: If you are arriving on Skybus from the airport, you will be dropped at Southern Cross Station, on the corner of Bourke Street. Take any Bourke Street tram (free) four stops, to the top of The Mall, and you are very close to the apartment.  All trams are free in the CBD, so just hop on one that's heading in the right direction! Trains require a Myki card, which I can leave for you, and explain how to use. All the City Loop train stations are walking distance from the apartment.  There is a public carpark at the end of the lane. Please ask for directions and prices if you really have to bring your car, as it's very expensive to park in such a central location, and a car is a very slow way to move about the city.
properties.access: You'll have full and private access to the apartment for the duration of your stay.
properties.interaction: I respond to Airbnb messages immediately, and am always available if you want tips, advice or help. Otherwise, I'll leave you to enjoy the apartment as if it is your own, and Melbourne as if you live here.
properties.house_rules: Please take good care of the apartment, it's fixtures and fittings, and report any damage or concerns as soon as they are evident. Unreported breakages or significant mis-use repair costs will be deducted from your security deposit.  Please turn lights and heater or air-con off as you leave, take all your belongings, and leave the apartment as close as possible to the state you found it in.  The apartment swipe key and magnetic fob are very particularly recorded and programmed, toward providing high level security. Both are expensive and time consuming to replace, and loses will incur a 100 deduction from your security bond. Please be careful! Only booked guests may stay in the apartment. No extra guests without prior arrangement, and certainly no parties. Strictly no smoking in the apartment (ok on the balcony, and please close the door).
