Transport, shops, theatres and our local cafe culture are all at your doorstep and you can walk over to Southbank and down the river, everything is convenient. Our studio apartment is simply stunning. It is very inviting, intimate, cosy and comfortable. It is small, but it has everything you need at your fingertips: the fluffy pillows, the comfy bed, storage, big TV, fireplace, complete kitchen and bright bathroom. You will love this brand new space. We laid beautiful timber lam flooring, installed designer stone bench tops, quality cooking appliances, double drawer dishwasher, wine glass cabinet, an amazing fire place, large flat-screen TV and a gorgeous queen size bed with large under-bed drawers for you to use as storage. We've also installed a convenient closet/robe space at the end of the kitchen where you can hang your suits, shirts or dresses and jackets, tuck away your shoes, and sit your other
properties.neighborhood_overview: Flinders Street - Is home of our architecturally renowned Flinders Train Station and Federation Square. Both are visited and used by thousands of people every day, so expect the streets to be busy all the time. You are in the heart of our transport hub and cafe central, so you don't have to walk far to find what you need.  Shopping - Well, where do I start! If you're after food to eat or cook we have Woolworths (supermarket) located right beside our building (turn left as you exit), and Coles (another supermarket) right around the corner in Elizabeth St (turn right as you exit, and then right into Elizabeth St). Then there are lots of cute little cafes dotted along Flinders Street, and around the corner in Elizabeth St, or walk up to Swanston St and you will be flooded with busy cafes and all the takeaway giants, like Mc Donalds, KFC, Hungry Jacks (Burger King) etc - you will never go hungry when staying at our place! :D Degraves Street - When exiting our building, turn left from our f
properties.notes: We spent many hours deliberating over how we were going to make our studio apartment feel spacious, user friendly, space saving, cosy and relaxing. And I think we hit the nail on the head! :D Most of the time you will be out enjoying the city life, and returning to our place to unwind, ready for the next day to see and do more. :D
properties.transit: Right across the road is the entrance to the Flinders Street Train Station. There you can buy your MYKI card (a commuter card required to access all public transport, but all trams are FREE in the CBD! You don't need a MYKI to travel in the CBD!). If leaving the CBD you will need 1 MYKI card each, and you can 'top up' your card right beside the train station entrance. There are also trams that run on Flinders Street, Swanston Street and Elizabeth Street, and the trams that run on these lines can take you to just about anywhere in Melbourne (or connect you up to other areas around our beautiful city. There are also buses that run along Flinders Street. Simply visit the local journey planner / timetable website to find a service and time/day that suits you to travel. Or, if you go inside Flinders Street Station you can visit the Transport booth where they can help you get to where you want to go.
properties.access: The entire studio apartment is available for you to use. Although, you will find we have a locked mirrored cupboard in the bathroom, this cupboard holds all of our cleaning products so we can make it nice and clean for you to use. And there is one locked drawer under the bed in the corner, this drawer holds essential items, also for cleaning, like the vacuum for the floor. ;)
properties.interaction: We will be available to communicate with you during your entire stay - if you need our assistance, and on many occasions you will have us greet you on your arrival. If we are unable to meet and greet you in person we will provide fantastic instructions on locating the door keys, and will be right beside you on the phone if you need us, to ensure you have the perfect arrival, stay and easy departure.
properties.house_rules: We have put a lot of time, thought, consideration, money, energy and love into providing you with a beautiful, relaxing (and romantic!) space as well as modern, stylish apartment to enjoy. We use this space as well, so we wanted to share with you all the quality creature comforts so you can sit back, relax, unwind and take in the beautiful ambiance of Melbourne and what we have to offer you in our world famous 'Most Liveable' city. ;)  We simply expect you to look after our little home like it is your home.  Be gentle and careful with all items; the quality linen, the blinds, the TV, fireplace, stone bench tops and appliances, all are high quality and we'd like them to last so other guests can also enjoy them. :)

properties.neighborhood_overview: Melbourne City - voted one of the most liveable city in the world!  You will be in the heart of the CBD right opposite the Southern Cross Station, which is the main hub connecting to the Melbourne International and Domestic Airport, Interstate trains, Bus terminal, Tourism departure point and lots more! Want to explore the city? The location is pretty much close to everything! China town, Crown Casino, Etihad Stadium, Docklands shopping area, Direct Factory Outlet (DFO), tonnes of Cafes and restaurants and heaps more!  Feel a bit Lazy to walk? Tram stop is right in front of the building and the best part is, it is FREE for those who are only travelling around the city! My apartment is well within the Free Tram Zone so it has the added advantage for your convenience! Rental car? No problems! As there are heaps of leasing company right opposite my building (in Southern Cross Station).  Want to take a punt? Crown Casino is just down the road and they operate 24x7! Good luck if you plan to
properties.notes: Linens and towels are provided and cleaners are engaged to clean and thoroughly inspect my place between each stay.  Basic toiletries are provided including towels for each guest.  Complimentary Tea and Coffee are provided too.  Please turn on the rangehood and open window if you cook because the smoke/fire alarm is rather sensitive ABSOLUTELY NO SMOKING inside the apartment, No loud music, No parties of any sort.
properties.transit: Southern Cross Station (main station/transport hub) is just opposite of the apartment, from there you can take SKY bus to the airport, V Line to go by train to country Victoria, Metro train to most suburbs in Melbourne or tram around town.  Apartment is located in the FREE TRAM zone within the Melbourne CBD, literally just outside the building. Just look out for the "FREE tram zone" signs. HOW TO GET HERE? Take a train, tram, bus or taxi and hear towards the Southern Cross Station. Southern Cross Station is located on the western end of the heart of Melbourne CBD grid.  The station is also the main transport hub so it is super convenient and great place to get around!   The apartment is right at the corner of Spencer Street and Little Bourke Street, Melbourne.  For public transport information visit: 'Public Transport Victoria' (Click on the 'Journey Planner' tab and select Southern Cross Station as your destination) From Melbourne Tullamarine Airport? No problems!  There are Airport B
properties.access: Please email/sms/message me or you could also ask questions about anything and in cases of emergency or urgent issues, you can ask the building managers on the ground floor. You will be able to access the apartment naturally and also all the Resort Style facilities including the gym, swimming pool, sauna, BBQ and pool side area, business/social lounge and rock climbing wall with the swipe card. There are three restaurants on-site on the ground floor including an Asian (PHO24), Modern Australian (Higher Grounds) and Breakfast/Grill trendy cafe (Pretty Mama) which all scores very highly amongst Melburnians.
properties.interaction: I am available to answer your queries via Airbnb messaging, SMS or email, and there is also a 24 hours building manager at the ground floor who are able to help you in cases of emergency. Rest be assure that if you message me via Airbnb, my reply is almost instantaneous most of the time. Feel free to drop me a line or questions about anything in Melbourne and I will be happy to help as your local friend or guide.  Also check out my local Guidebook in Airbnb so you can try the many restaurants and Cafés that locals frequent in Melbourne.  I will also be providing you with a 'House Manual' when you book the place and there are Contact phone numbers and Emergency Contact numbers too.

properties.neighborhood_overview: The building is adjacent to Melbourne Central shopping centre, overlooking Queen Victoria (QV) shopping mall, and walking distance to Emporium shopping centre / Myer / David Jones, Queen Victoria Market, Federation Square and Melbourne's famous theaters, galleries, restaurants, cafes and bars/clubs. Large grocery store (Coles) is literally under the apartment building on the lowest underground level. The building itself is an iconic Art deco CBD structure housing many apartments, which are, either owner occupied or leased.
properties.notes: In the apartment the 'Friendly Folder' is provided to help acquaint yourself with our apartment and answer any basic questions. Laundry: Coin operated washer and dryer available on our floor. Rubbish: Small bins are provided in the apartment and please dispose of your rubbish via the rubbish chute which is located in the stairwell on our floor (door located left from the lift).
properties.transit: Apartment is only about 20-30min drive from the Melbourne airport. If you arrive by plane you can travel to the city either by SkyBus to the Southern Cross bus terminal ( 18.00/30.00return per person) or taxi (60-90 per trip depending on the time of the day). When in the apartment you will not be short of transport options with trains, trams, buses and taxis at your doorstep. Melbourne Central train station is literally under the apartment building and the tram stop is just outside the building which operates along Swanston Street to get you anywhere. Melbourne Central Business District (CBD) is a FREE tram zone. If traveling outside the free tram zone or by train each guest requires MYKI card (can be purchased and loaded with money in the Melbourne Central train station). Interstate trains depart from the Southern Cross (Melbourne main) train station.
properties.access: The entire apartment is yours to enjoy.  Security card/key IS required to access: 1. building, 2. foyer, 3. lifts and 4. the apartment itself. On the ground floor lounge area includes pool/billiard tables, table tennis and Pay TV (Foxtel).
properties.interaction: To the best of our availability, we will arrange to meet you at the building's entrance (even late, late evenings), provide a quick tour of the building and apartment (if required) and assist you with any queries you may have. You will have our contact details should there be any need to get in touch during your stay. PLEASE NOTE: We cannot provide safe keeping of your luggage in case of earlier arrival. We hosts, come to greet your at mutually arranged check-in time, and do not live in the apartment. Inside the building is a nice foyer where all visitors are welcome to chill out and wait, with their luggage at their sight.
properties.house_rules: We expect all guests to respect our apartment and keep it clean & tidy as if it was their own home.  No smoking and no pets please. PLEASE, be respectful to your neighbours and keep the noise down after 10pm. Engagement in ANY criminal activity within the apartment and/or building is STRICTLY PROHIBITED! Access card/keys: Swipe card for secure building and apartment entry will be provided to you in person at the building entrance once your arrival time is confirmed. On departure PLEASE LEAVE BOTH CARD/KEYS INSIDE the apartment. Cleaning: Basic cleaning service is available on Tuesdays and Thursdays for a fee of 50. Please enquire and book at the Ground floor reception (9am - 5pm Monday to Saturday). For any stays longer than 14 days, if requested, fresh linen and towels will be provided so please let us know ahead of your booking. We hope you will enjoy your stay :)

properties.notes: Property Bed Guide:  Bedroom: 2 2x Queen Bed  1x Air mattress (extra fees may apply for linens) The LittleStay Benefits Don't let the name fool you, we want to make sure your holiday has a BIG and lasting memory. When staying at a LittleStay home, we want to make sure that you have everything that you could possibly need. Our homes are set up to be just that; homes We always include the following for our guests: - Luxurious linens and Sheridan towels  - Complimentary High-speed wireless internet  - HD TV's with Netflix (some units with Apple TV)  - A portable Bluetooth sound system  - A kitchen with all the cooking essentials from tea spoons to oil and balsamic vinegar.  - Guests staying longer than 7 days will have an optional mid stay freshening of the home  - All essential household items, including designer toiletries, laundry soap, tea towels, makeup removal pads, hair dryer and much more.  - A concierge service that will make dinner reservations, find event and show tickets, arra

The building also features a full gym, 6+ person sauna and steam room, spa and full length lap pool. There is also a great outdoor space for you to use. You will feel like your in your own private courtyard with BBQ and plenty of grass space to picnic in. Check in time: 2pm  Check out time: 10am **We do require Government Issue ID at time of check in. If you are not able to produce your ID, we legally cannot grant you access to the property.** We are happy to check you in at any time. We do charge a 50 surcharge for check-ins from 22h00-08h00 as this is outside normal operating hours. If you have a late flight, we have teamed up with a car service company that is able to check you in to avoid the surcharge. properties.house_rules: The three Golden Rules to every LittleStay Property:  - There is NO partying allowed at any time. Eviction and fees will apply to any parties during your stay.  - Noise must be at a reasonable level during your entire stay. Please make sure that you respect the neighbours as these are homes and not hotel rooms.  - Smoking is never permitted inside the home or in any part of the buildings. Fines will apply if there are odours remaining.
properties.host_about:
LittleStay is a boutique short stay company specialising in homemade hospitality. We are passionate about traveling, exploring, and sharing. Bitten by the travel bug when we were young, we love to jump on a plane and explore the world. Spending our days and nights away from home with new friends, exchanging our experiences, and building new unforgettable memories. LittleStay is here to help create those memories. 

That's the idyllic part, but in our real life we all have bills, mortgages and obligations that we wish we could leave at home and don't have to travel with.

Consequentially LittleStay was born to help with that dream, a company that allow people like us and others to travel, live, experience or start a new life without the everyday struggle of life back “home”.

LittleStay wants you to feel comfortable entrusting us with your largest asset. We will consider your home our home while we manage it. It is our reputation on the line if something is amiss. We do not take that lightly.  LittleStay wants you to be a part of our LittleFamily. We value your partnership and thusly, if you are holidaying and want to stay at one of our properties, you’ll receive insider rates. You can even reserve your own property for your family and friends that are visiting. 

We take care of virtually everything. Our level of cleaning is second to none. Our customer service is beyond compare. Our commitment to you, the owner, our guest, our community is unquestionable. 

We believe a happy home is a filled home so if you have a property that is not happy, please contact us to see how we can help you. 

Or if you're one of our amazing guests helping us, please let us know how we can make your stay more enjoyable. 

Warmest Regards
The LittleStay Team

properties.host_about:
Bridget and I have been together for 10 years now and still loving every moment. We fill our lives with work most days but enjoy spare moments by surrounding ourselves with people, walks, random projects (like renovating our apartment or making our own kitchen table...)

WHAT WE CAN'T LIVE WITHOUT
Sunlight! We've tried apartments with very small windows and now live in one with heaps... don't think we can ever go back!

FAVOURITE THINGS TO DO
Really enjoy looking through and understanding real estate markets in every town or country we visit. A really interesting way to understand the culture of an area, its history and how it has developed.

HOW DO WE TRAVEL
When we travel, its organised chaos, we plan some things ahead but then leave the in between parts up to the imagination. Our latest overseas trip has flowing through Germany, Spain and Austria. We immerse ourselves in the culture to get a good feel of how the locals live.

The infamous graffiti hub of Hosier Lane is right around the corner. It doesn't get much better than this!

properties.neighborhood_overview: Artful, energetic and stylish, staying in Melbourne’s city centre presents a glorious mix of renowned restaurants, epic gardens, stadiums, bars and hidden delights. The beating heart of the city and a magnet for everyone who surrounds it, Melbourne’s CBD is a cultural wonderland. If you’ve got an interest for street art, great restaurants, rooftop bars, tiny cafes, Victorian architecture, historic markets, department stores and designer boutiques, you’ll never get bored in Melbourne.

properties.host_about:
G'day!

Mybnb here and it's nice to meet you! We look after multiple properties throughout Melbourne and the Sunshine Coast in Queensland. We're a complete management solution, meaning we take care of absolutely everything. From creating your listing to having you place cleaned, we do it all! 

Whilst managing properties through Airbnb, we've learnt a lot about the various areas and different nuances Melbourne and the Sunshine Coast have to offer. On top of that, we love meeting honest, genuine and interesting guests, some of whom have become friends too!

Living in the sporting and cultural hub of Australia has it's perks. It's a great city to visit and an even better one to live in. We look forward to sharing it with you!

See you soon :-)

Blake (Mybnb Manager)

properties.host_about:
Bridget and I have been together for 10 years now and still loving every moment. We fill our lives with work most days but enjoy spare moments by surrounding ourselves with people, walks, random projects (like renovating our apartment or making our own kitchen table...)

WHAT WE CAN'T LIVE WITHOUT
Sunlight! We've tried apartments with very small windows and now live in one with heaps... don't think we can ever go back!

FAVOURITE THINGS TO DO
Really enjoy looking through and understanding real estate markets in every town or country we visit. A really interesting way to understand the culture of an area, its history and how it has developed.

HOW DO WE TRAVEL
When we travel, its organised chaos, we plan some things ahead but then leave the in between parts up to the imagination. Our latest overseas trip has flowing through Germany, Spain and Austria. We immerse ourselves in the culture to get a good feel of how the locals live.

properties.name: Chic styled loft in Degraves Street
properties.summary: This urban oasis has been designed ensuring that your trip to Melbourne offers everything you would expect from the worlds most livable city. Enjoy access to Melbourne's laneway cafe culture literally at your doorstep in your New York style loft.
properties.space: This chic loft style designer apartment has been fashioned to provide you with all of the comforts that you would expect in a hotel, but with the added benefit of being in a home away from your own home.  Enjoy the luxury of being located in the epicentre of Melbourne's laneway culture on Degraves street. Degraves street is the heartbeat of the cafe scene in Melbourne offering cheap eats, alfresco dining and excellent coffee all located a stones throw away from Flinders Street Station and Federation Square. In addition to this, enjoy access to an oversized living space with a loft bedroom. With complimentary bathroom amenities, Wifi, 600 thread count cotton sheets, pillow top bed and Sheridan bath towels, we want you to enjoy living in this space as much as you enjoy Melbourne and all it has to offer.  Our space includes; - Full kitchen that has been newly renovated for those budding chefs including dishwasher, oven, microwave and everything that you require to make a feast - Large scr

properties.neighborhood_overview: Our one of a kind loft is located in the heart of the CBD, within walking distance to all amenities. It is located a tram line, within the Melbourne CBD free tram zone. There is a Woolworths express shopping centre at the bottom of our building on Flinders street for any of your last minute needs as well as a BWS liquor store. On Degraves Street itself, you will find restaurants, cafes, coffee shops, cheap eats and Melbourne souvenir shops. You are located only a step away from Melbourne's most iconic laneway, hosier lane. Hosier lane boasts some of the best street art that Australia has to offer and this is only one street away from your loft. In addition to street art, we are located in the best area for food! Enjoy Movida Restaurant, Chin Chins, CODA, The Press Club plus many more just outside your doorstep, only a moments walk away from Degraves Street. Just across the bridge underneath Flinders Street Station you will find Southbank Boulevard and the Crown Casino complex, the perf
properties.notes: LUGGAGE STORAGE  Unfortunately we are unable to store luggage prior to check in or after departure. For luggage storage solutions please visit Travellers Aid at Flinders Street Stations
properties.transit: TO / FROM MELBOURNE AIRPORT The SKYBUS terminal is located at Southern Cross Station only 500m from the apartment complex.  Charges: Single Adult - 18 one way  Family - 25 - 41 one way TAXI Charges vary but are approximately 55 one way PUBLIC TRANSPORT, TRAINS & TRAMS We are located in the free tram zone in the CBD. This means that you can jump on any trams located within the central business district. Outside of this zone, it is only a short fair to pay on a myki card (purchased from any 7/11 or major station) to get to any other destination in Melbourne. CAR RENTAL  You can rent a car from Budget, Avis and Europcar in the Southern Cross Station or at the airport upon arrival.
properties.access: The entire apartment is yours. The apartment is located in a secure building with access only available to those with a vin card swipe key. There is a full intercom system and the building is under 24 hour security for your safety. Access to your apartment is via elevator as we are on the 3rd floor.
properties.interaction: CHECK IN/CHECK OUT TIMES Check in is after 3:00 pm and check out is before 11:00 am daily.  ARRIVAL Either Matt or Lara will meet you on arrival to our building to hand you your keys and show you around the loft if required. As we believe that the most important part of the experience is the personal touch, we will ensure to always meet you - It is asked that you do let us know your estimated time of arrival so that we may plan in advance. We understand that life gets in the way sometimes so are very flexible, we do just ask that if your timings are going to change that you keep us updated :) DURING YOUR STAY We both work in the hospitality and entertainment sectors and so are very knowledgeable in food, wine and coffee as well as what's happening in Melbourne, so are available any time leading up to your stay or during your time in Melbourne to guide you, ensuring that you leave having the best experience possible. We will be happy to answer your calls, texts, emails or airbnb message
properties.house_rules: This apartment is for two people only.  Strictly No Smoking and no pets! (Guide dogs are of course allowed). No parties or functions and please respect the other residents in the building (please keep the volume to an acceptable level).  You are our guests and so are not required to strip the bed or do anything around the house else except be neat and tidy. If rubbish does build up, there is a rubbish room in the basement which is conveniently accessed by the elevator or by the internal stairs!   We have put a lot of effort into making this home an oasis for your enjoyment, please respect this and our belongings.
properties.host_about:
We are an engaged couple who have been together for almost 11 years. We absolutely LOVE to travel and meet new people. 
We love Melbourne and everything that Melbourne has to offer, we have however also lived in Queensland, Ayers Rock and Western Australia and can guide you on your trip to those locations if you wish.
Matt works in the hospitality industry, specifically working with local coffee roasters and Lara works in entertainment - so if you need to know anything about Melbourne and the things that make this city one of the best in the world please do not hesitate to ask us. 

We cant live without coffee, wine or good food. Lara loves the beach and music and Matt loves to get outdoors and compete in Triathlons. 

As a host we are here to make your experience as exciting as possible, as a guest we will probably just keep to ourselves unless we are looking for some unique things that only locals know to do in your city/town.

We look forward to meeting you all!

properties.host_about:
I used to travel all the time for many years as a Systems Engineer. Each city I stayed more than one month, I would find different friends from internet to play soccer, to go to bars and cafe, to go to hiking and explore the city.

For me, every people is a book I can learn. That's why I am so enthusiastic about meeting friends and hearing their stories. Go different places, meet different people, learn different things is always the motivation mades me forward.

Hosting my friends from other cities or oversea is one of my favourite things to do in Melbourne. It's a sense of achievement that all of my friends had great travel experiences  when stayed this most liveable city.

properties.host_about:
Hi, my name is Paul, owner of Complete Host apartments! I am a seasoned traveler and have been fortunate to have visited most countries and experienced the way the locals live by staying at amazing airbnb properties all around the world. From these experiences I have learned a lot about what sort of experiences people are after when visiting a foreign city.

After spending the majority of the last 15 years overseas I am living back in my home town of  Melbourne and now run a short stays business called Complete Host.  As such, I have on offer a number of very comfortable properties in some of the best locations of Melbourne.

If you are interested in one of the properties l have listed but the dates are unavailable, please check my other listings under my profile or email me an inquiry as l will very likely have another property available that will suit your requirements. 

I cant wait to meet you and make your stay in Melbourne a memorable one!

Paul, Complete Host

properties.neighborhood_overview: Melbourne City - voted one of the most liveable city in the world!  You will be in the heart of the CBD right opposite the Southern Cross Station, which is the main hub connecting to the Melbourne International and Domestic Airport, Interstate trains, Bus terminal, Tourism departure point and lots more! Want to explore the city? The location is pretty much close to everything! China town, Crown Casino, Etihad Stadium, Docklands shopping area, Direct Factory Outlet (DFO), tonnes of Cafes and restaurants and heaps more!  Feel a bit Lazy to walk? Tram stop is right in front of the building and the best part is, it is FREE for those who are only travelling around the city! My apartment is well within the Free Tram Zone so it has the added advantage for your convenience! Rental car? No problems! As there are heaps of leasing company right opposite my building (in Southern Cross Station).  Want to take a punt? Crown Casino is just down the road and they operate 24x7! Good luck if you plan to
properties.notes: Linens and towels are provided and cleaners are engaged to clean and thoroughly inspect my place between each stay.  Basic toiletries are provided including towels for each guest.  Complimentary Tea and Coffee are provided too.  Please turn on the rangehood and open window if you cook because the smoke/fire alarm is rather sensitive ABSOLUTELY NO SMOKING inside the apartment, No loud music, No parties of any sort.
properties.transit: Southern Cross Station (main station/transport hub) is just opposite of the apartment, from there you can take SKY bus to the airport, V Line to go by train to country Victoria, Metro train to most suburbs in Melbourne or tram around town. properties.neighborhood_overview: Located in a leafy part of the CBD next to Flagstaff Gardens, the oldest park of Melbourne. It's an area with rich heritage, here you will find the Old Royal Mint, Supreme Court, State Library and Queen Victoria Market.  5 mins walk to Queen Victoria Market. A one stop shop for fresh grocery, handcraft and souvenirs. Wednesday night market is a fabulous place to experience the Melbourne food culture. 5 mins walk to Elizabeth Street and Little Lonsdale Street, with a wide range of Asian eateries for small budget. 10 mins walk to Hardware Lane for a great selection of cafes and restaurants.

Trams also run to Crown Casino, Southbank, Aquarium, Docklands, Royal Botanic Gardens, St Kilda and Melbourne Zoo. -Train (Metro) Flagstaff Station is right across the road, with frequent City Loop services to Flinders Street, Southern Cross Stations and other suburbs. -Bus Bus stop is at the corner of the block with a number of routes to outer suburbs. -Melbourne Bike Share A docking station is 4 minutes walk away, located by Flagstaff Gardens. -Car hire 10 minutes walk will get you to the outlets of Avis, Hertz, Budget and Europcar on Franklin Street. -Airport (Skybus) From Melbourne Airport, you can catch a Skybus to Southern Cross Station in CBD and then ask for a free hotel transfer service to drop you at our building. properties.summary: In the heart of the CBD this 1920's 2 level converted warehouse, what character!  Upstairs is yours - a double sofa bed, your own Powder room. Free WiFi CBD transport steps away.  Please note this is a shared listing with my, Penny your host and my two feline hosts Mokey & Wembley (Cats). I love Melbourne & love to share it with my guests!  Contact me!
properties.space: Hello world I have been hosting on AirBnB for 2 years and have three configurations of my apartment.  I have couch surfed and hosted for 6 years and after a trip to NZ where I used AirBnB I decided to open up my place to AirBnBers for a truly local experience right in the heart of the lively city of Melbourne.   Your trip to Melbourne starts so easily and conveniently at my cool  warehouse conversion right in the middle of Melbourne's Central Business District (CBD).  Situated between William and King Street it is tucked away, off one lane way, off another lane way, so very Melbourne!  But still very secure and well lit.  The apartment is a two storey warehouse conversion on the ground floor of the building; the window looks onto a private heritage lane way. The apartment is completely open plan with a void between upstairs and downstairs.  It is decorated in a funky baroque style, think Dita Von Teese mixed with New York Loft feel.  Perfect for the single traveler.  This is my home an

properties.neighborhood_overview: I love Melbourne CBD, and the Apartment location in Little Bourke Street has a Walk Score of 99 out of 100. This location is a Walker's Paradise so daily errands / sightseeing do not require a car. Right in the heart of the city and in the legal distict, just a couple of blocks from the hustle and bustle of the middle of the city it is safe and well lit.   But like all areas care needs to be taken when walking at night be aware of your surroundings.
properties.notes: Bookings:   My place is open-plan shared space living, so is generally suited to shorter stays of up to a week. If you'd like to make a booking please have a clear photo and description of yourself on your profile and please make an inquiry and let me know a bit about you before you make a booking. Being right in the heart of a lively city there is the usual city noise, I do have double glazing installed.  It is quieter weeknights but if you are sensitive to noise bring earplugs. I work in events and go out a couple of nights per week depending on what's on, there is always something happening in Melbourne!
properties.transit: FREE CBD Travel in the designated CBD Zone on ALL trams, or you can walk everywhere quite easily.   For trips further afield to St Kilda, Fitzroy, South Yarra I have MYKI cards you can top up and use.
properties.access: • Double Sofa Bed in the lounge room on the first floor, you have the entire floor to yourself • Added comfort of 5cm thick brand new Soren memory foam Mattress Topper • Pillow Menu  • Your own toilet / powder room upstairs with sink and mirrors • Bedside drawers, and clothes rail for your use  if requested • Electric panel heating & Electric fan (if required it is a solid double brick building so stays quite temperate)  • Hotel Quality Bed linen and towels provided
properties.interaction: ***Your Host***  • Professional, so I may not necessarily be there during weekday working hours, but I sometimes work from home. • I work on events so sometimes work late or on weekends or go away for the weekend • Friendly, passionate and well traveled, budget traveler have couch surfed for 6 years • Knowledgeable about Melbourne sights, nightlife, arts, theatre and foodie scene   • Is a good cook- you might be lucky enough for me to cook for you one night  • Due to my work commitments check in is at 6pm and check out at 11am.  I can sometimes be flexible but please take this into account when booking.
properties.house_rules: - This is a strictly no smoking apartment and building, you can however smoke freely in the laneway or there is a courtyard at the back of the building. - This is my home, please treat it with respect but make yourself comfortable but also please if using the kitchen clean up after yourself. - I have two feline companions so if you are allergic to cats it is best to perhaps look elsewhere.  The cats reside elsewhere if I am renting the entire apartment.   - Only the guests named and registered in the original reservation are permitted to enter the building. - A second set of keys can be provided to parties of 2 or more. All keys must be returned at check-out; missing keys will result in forfeiture of the security deposit. - In this time of heavy crackdowns, downloading of copyrighted materials is not permitted. - Check-ins before 5 PM and check-outs after 11 AM are not always possible, and subject to the presence of other guests and the hosts' availability. Please inquire before bookin
properties.host_about:
Hello World, I'm sharing my local knowledge with the world... one guest at a time.

I have traveled quite extensively every 2-3 years for usually 3-4 months at a time. The first time I traveled Overseas alone was when I was 16, to the US and Canada.  I lived in the UK for 2 1/2 years and again for 3 months last year and most of my traveling has been backpacking and used other sharing economy websites, staying on couches and letting out my couch.  I used AirBnB during my 3 week trip to New Zealand in 2013 and thought this is perfect for me living right in the heart of the city and working in Tourism and Events I can share my local knowledge with the world... one guest at a time.

I work in Events Management and have worked on such exciting events as the London Olympics 2012, The Commonwealth Games, The Australian Open and the Tim Burton Exhibition Opening at ACMI.

I love horse riding, travel, theatre, comedy shows, live bands and seeing and experiencing what the world has to offer.  I have traveled extensively but I am in love with Melbourne and its many faces.

I am a frugal traveler and love to share my tips and there is a lot to see and do in Melbourne that is free.  I currently work in the Tourism Industry so I know this place pretty well and living in the city well, it give life a completely different flavour, I love it.

Why AirBnB?
Simple as a keen traveler and loving my city I want to share it.  I live in a central location and I have had many friends across the world stay, some whom I have met on my travels, some who became friends after they stayed.

AirBnB will help me stay in my apartment, living in the city can be quite expensive so by utilsing AirBnB I can continue to live in the city I love.

AirBnB has helped me renovate upstairs, removing my carpet and replacing with floorboards.  Installing a custom blind of Melbourne's art centre and skyline.

Next goal your stay is contributing to:  Upgrading the kitchen Kitchen.

Please wash the dishes after used with the detergent provided.  4. Please enjoy your stay in my humble apartment.  5. Please keep the place in a generally clean and tidy state before you checking out.
properties.host_about:
"To see a world in a grain of sand
And a heaven in a wild flower,
Hold infinity in the palm of your hand 
And eternity in an hour."

A poem by William Blake that really parallels my view towards Life. Be thankful with all the little miracles happening... little miracles like the raindrops, the sun rays, and the smile I see on people face.

I'm an extroverted introvert. I can be alone but not feeling lonely; or I can hang out with friends and become crazy. I like to travel, shopping, sightseeing... I like to sleep in a luxurious 5-star hotel. I like mountain climbing, trekking, camping... I enjoy sleeping under the million stars in the wild. What I like most about traveling is to be able to get close to different people and culture. It never fails to amaze me. One of the most unforgettable places would be Nepal.

I like to make people happy... sometimes my jokes may be dumb, but well, at least I've tried. With the Airbnb platform, I have a chance to make my guests happy too... not by cracking dumb jokes thou, but rather, giving them a clean and cosy space, and to make sure that all their needs are in place.

Access to both our apartment and the building is very secure. LOCATION It’s all about location! Our charming chic apartment is in the heart of the city and lies literally a few steps away from cafes, restaurants, shops, theatres etc. Because you are in the heart of the city you can virtually walk anywhere or catch a tram close by - either in Bourke Street Mall or Elizabeth Street. properties.neighborhood_overview: Melbourne is a safe and wonderful city with so much to see and do. It caters to a multitude of desires which includes shopping, theatres, art galleries, sports, cafes, fine dining, libraries, markets, parks and gardens, Melbourne Trams and trains, etc etc.
properties.transit: Melbourne now has a free tram service in the CBD (Central Business District) so you can jump on the free tram network if you are using the Skybus to get to the city.  There is a tram line out the front of the building and another 2 minutes walk away.  Underground railway station - Melbourne Central - is a block away.  You can walk to Flinders Street Station - about 5 minutes walk.
properties.access: You have free access to the heated indoor swimming pool, gymnasium and sauna.
properties.interaction: We like to meet you to hand over the keys and after that we are only an email or phone call away to help you.
properties.house_rules: Sorry, but we do not cater for babies or children.  Adults only and maximum of two. We have a no smoking policy in the building and no pets are allowed. No loud noise or music as it is an apartment block.
properties.host_about:
We live in Melbourne Australia in the heart of the city ourselves and we love traveling around the world and meeting new people.
We love to travel independently and that's why we prefer B&B's as you get to meet some lovely and interesting people.  We always try and live like locals. 
Can't live without great coffee - and the occasional glass of red!

The bay side beaches, St Kilda, shops, Melbourne Sports & Aquatic Centre and of course the city are also in close proximity, serviced by very frequent pubic transport. Our apartment is perfectly located to attend the sporting events hosted in Melbourne (AFL, Cricket, Soccer, Horse Racing, Tennis, Grand Prix & everything else), the Arts/Festivals and the abundance of beautiful restaurants and cafes that line our streets!
properties.notes: The Alfred Hospital, which has a casualty department, is a 5 minute walk from our place and is located at 55 Commercial Rd, Melbourne.
properties.transit: Our favourite form of transport is walking - if that's not your style, there are several tram, bus and trains within easy walking distance.  We have left two "Myki Travel Cards",  which can be topped up at the nearest tram stop, in the downstairs living area in the silver dish next to the TV.  This will allow you to get started using our public transport system - which is the best way to get around Melbourne, other than walking! Please return the cards and top them up prior to leaving our place. There is even a taxi rank on our street and obviously Uber is everywhere!
properties.access: Guests have intercom & security swipe access to the apartment. Guests are welcome to use their security swipe access to use the gym, swimming pool and spa, steam room, sauna and BBQ facilities. Please remember to follow the rules and restrictions posted.  FREE Secure off street car space (2.1m maximum), let us know if you require an additional car space, which we can arrange at a daily rate of 15 FREE WiFi We provide towels, bed linen, shampoos, shower gels, moisturisers and some food for breakfast. The kitchen is also equipped with pots, pans, cutlery and all utensils for cooking. Glassware, crockery, tea/coffee facilities and a toaster is also provided. If you have any minor requests (you've forgotten your toothbrush, need a razor etc.) please let us know so that we can arrange it before you arrive. Nobody is currently living here, so the space is all yours to use.
properties.interaction: We will adjust our interactions to your personal preference. We live in the same building, so we are really happy to offer lots of local tips. The apartment is completely yours and you will be left alone if you want after being given the keys.

Please take full advantage of the kitchen, Laundry and building facilities. 3. Please clean up after yourself and leave everything as you found it. 4. Please ask us for anything that will make your stay comfortable and enjoyable. 5. You are welcome to invite friends to visit you. It is your responsibility to ensure they understand the rules and advise us if they stay overnight. 6. Please don’t smoke inside our apartment.  7. Please don’t bring your pets.  8. Please don’t wear your shoes inside our apartment.  9. Please don’t eat in the bedrooms. 10. Our

properties.notes: A supermarket (IGA Express) is located nearby (open from 7am to 11pm, except Fridays and Sundays when it closes 10pm and Saturdays at midnight). Dry-cleaners are at the rear of our building. There are also several hairdressers nearby. The nearest pharmacy is 2 blocks away. Use the free CBD trams at our doorstep to tour the city.
properties.transit: We are truly in the most convenient location to see Melbourne. Public transport at our doorsteps and about a 10 minute walk to MCG and other sporting venues, Federation Square and the National Gallery, the business district, shopping and fine dining venues several of which are located on Flinders Lane (behind us). Victoria Market is a short and free tram ride around the city. Please ask if you want some information on current activities in Melbourne and how to get there. There is also a tourist information office at Federation Square, which is under 5 minutes walk from us. Many tours start from Federation Square.
properties.access: We are business friendly and will seek to accommodate your requirements, including 24-hour check-in service. Come and go as you please as you will have the entire apartment to yourself for the duration of your stay.
properties.interaction: As we live in the same apartment block, we will usually be available to greet you with a guided tour of our facilities and give you any directions to get around and paint the town red. Whether you are here on a business or vacation, we want guests to have a pleasant and memorable stay in Melbourne so let us know how we can help. Email us to enquire about availability and local information for a business trip or vacation.

No pets are allowed.
properties.host_about: My wife and I recently moved from the suburbs to Melbourne CBD and love the vibrancy of city life. We hope to offer a consistently clean and 5-star equivalent accommodation with a touch of the comforts of home through AirBNB which will make your visit a pleasant one.

properties.neighborhood_overview: It really is the heart of Melbourne. I'm not kidding. Whether you’re here for shopping, food n wine, business, visiting family or sightseeing, this location will take you anywhere you need to go in Melbourne!  My apartment is right opposite the iconic Flinders Train Station and Federation Square with the Melbourne Visitor Centre to help you with all your tourist and booking needs. There are also currency exchange tellers and 3 travel agents all within 50 metres from the apartment building (STA Travel, Backpackers World Travel and Student Flights). There are also free tourist guides (dressed in red), free Melbourne walking tours and the free City Circle Tourist tram right opposite the apartment building - but you can ask me for further information once accommodation is booked. It is walking distance to Melbourne Convention and Exhibition Centre which is also next to the Direct Factory Outlets (DFO), RMIT, Southbank Promenade, Crown Casino, Docklands Stadium, St Kilda Road, Bourke Street
properties.notes: Here are some FAQs. I think the more information the better! It also explains the value and price for my apartment. ***A pedestal fan and portable evaporative cooler is provided for hot days. There is no air conditioning (AC) and it can get hot in summer. This is compensated by the economy pricing of our apartment and the convenience. Keeping the blinds down for the morning sun helps.  ***What are the check in/check out times? Standard check-in time is 2:00pm / 1400hrs.  If you arrive after 5.00pm / 1700hrs, please confirm with me first for my availability to meet you for key handover. Late night/early morning key handover between 10.30pm to 6.30am will incur a 35 fee as I outsource this to a person named Margaret and Jeremy from Personal Concierge. Standard check-out time is 10:00am. In the event we have another guest checking in/out on the same day, then standard check in/check out times apply. But it is flexible as sometimes guest leave early or arrive late - which allows you to st
properties.transit: Flinders Street Station is the main public transport hub to all of Melbourne and is right opposite the apartment, about 20 metres away! Trams in the CBD area is free! To plan your travel around Melbourne, use the PTV journey planner website. You can borrow and top up our MYKI cards (your one card to use any public transport in Melbourne) provided in our apartment or buy one from manned train stations, convenient stores or the Airport Sky Bus terminals. City CBD trams are free! Taxis are 100 metres away at the taxi rank at Flinders Street Station. No parking included but there is paid parking at Federation Square. I don't recommend it because there really is no need for a car. To get to the airport, use SkyBus.  If you have 3 people or more it's usually cheaper to catch a taxi which is only 100 metres away.  SkyBus runs express between Melbourne Airport and Southern Cross Station, 24 hours a day, seven days a week. The service takes approximately 20 minutes to get from the airport to th
properties.access: The apartment is exclusively yours! The apartments in the building are mixed use and is occupied by long term tenants who are either students, owners and full time workers, so it may not instantly appeal to more mature visitors. Access to common facilities (also known as the basement level) include coin-operated laundry with washing and drying machines, a meeting room, large lounge room with a large screen television and free cable FOXTEL TV, pool table and table tennis. All can be accessed via the lift or stairs using your key cards.
properties.interaction: I won't be present during your stay but I am more than happy to be your search engine of Melbourne by phone and email. I am easily contactable via call, sms text, Viber, Whats app and email. We will try to accommodate you check-in and check-out times as best as possible so please confirm with me in your request. Otherwise standard check in/out times are 2pm/10am. Collection of keys are at the reception desk Mon - Fri 9am to 5pm. Reception is closed on weekends and public holidays. If you arrive outside these times Tim (my wonderful partner) and I am more than happy to hand over keys and recommend a few places to go (love food and cocktail bars!). Late night/early morning key handovers between 10.30pm to 6.30am will incur a 35 fee as I outsource this to a person named Margaret and Jeremy from Personal Concierge. Please let us know in your request as I work full time but can be flexible with enough notice.
properties.house_rules: No parties. No smoking. No pets. But most of all, treat it like your own home! We don't provide additional cots or kids amenities, but additional infants & children (under 12) are absolutely welcome at no extra charge. There is a spare doona and pillow you can use. Please note our standard check-in time is 2pm and check-out time is 10am - however let me know your desired arrival and departure times (flight times too) and I will do my best to accommodate them between guests.
properties.host_about:
I love riding my bicycle, discovering new places and amazing food whether it's cheap n street food, mid-range or fine dining! Most importantly I LOVE MELBOURNE! I've lived here since I was a little 1 year old baby. With the arts, music, food and wine scene constantly evolving, I am always rediscovering my own backyard in the nooks and crannies of Melbourne!

I travelled a lot when I was in my 20s to over 20 something countries but now I'm enjoying life with my gorgeous kiwi partner Tim, who loves surfing. 

Why Airbnb? Well I've always wanted to retire running my own Bed and Breakfast with 3 private cottages somewhere surrounded by nature and in tranquil peace (maybe NZ!?). All while Tim chops wood and I make granny treats and welcome couples. But that's a pipe dream when I'm old and grey so I thought I'd get a taste for being a BnB host while young! So instead of being surrounded by nature, you'll be surrounded by Marvelous Melbourne - right in the heart of it all!

An abundance of trams and the Melbourne Central railway station is at your doorstep. Tram services within the city grid are free, just keep an eye out for the 'Free Tram Zone'signs. If you prefer to take in the sights of Melbourne by bike, a Bike Share station is located across the road with bicycles available for hire for a daily fee of around 3. Helmets are now provided when hiring a bike with Melbourne Bike Share.  If you are coming from the airport, you can take a taxi to the apartment (about 60), or alternatively, catch the airport bus to the city and taxi, tram or train to the apartment. If you're travelling by train, get off at Melbourne Central Station and look for the Swanston Street exit. properties.access: Fresh towels and linen are of course provided as well as shower amenities (shampoo, conditioner, shower gel). A fully equipped gourmet kitchen with pots and pans, cutlery, glassware and crockery, dishwasher, coffee machine, toaster and kettle, oven, microwave oven, refrigerator, gas stove-top are available for you to use, all you need are ingredients. A washer and dryer is available in the European laundry as well as an iron and ironing facilities. Apartment features split system aircon heating and cooling. properties.house_rules: This is a private apartment and you will have it all to yourself – you won't be sharing this special space with any strangers during your stay. No smoking inside (you may smoke on the balcony, but please close the door behind you), strictly no parties, yelling or loud music. Please respect our neighbours. We request that guests keep the apartment clean and tidy, washing up in the kitchen / bathroom after themselves. We want you to feel comfortable and at home in our apartment and we ask that you treat our apartment as you would your own home.
properties.host_about: Welcome to Melbourne! My wife and I love Melbourne, food, art, good coffee and travel among many other things. We are passionate about travel and enjoy immersing ourselves in the local culture of the places we visit. We know the importance of having a comfortable home away from home while on adventures and have endeavored to make our apartments a sanctuary. We have two apartments listed on Airbnb - one in the Melbourne CBD which has amazing views opposite the State Library and another light-filled, spacious apartment in the eclectic and Bohemian suburb of Fitzroy. We are proud to share our apartments with all our guests and hope you enjoy your stay and our beautiful city.

Hi, my name is Paul, owner of Complete Host apartments! I am a seasoned traveler and have been fortunate to have visited most countries and experienced the way the locals live by staying at amazing airbnb properties all around the world. From these experiences I have learned a lot about what sort of experiences people are after when visiting a foreign city.

After spending the majority of the last 15 years overseas I am living back in my home town of  Melbourne and now run a short stays business called Complete Host.  As such, I have on offer a number of very comfortable properties in some of the best locations of Melbourne.

If you are interested in one of the properties l have listed but the dates are unavailable, please check my other listings under my profile or email me an inquiry as l will very likely have another property available that will suit your requirements. 

I cant wait to meet you and make your stay in Melbourne a memorable one!

Paul, Complete Host

properties.description: My place is close to Federation Square, Chin Chin Restaurant, and MoVida. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and families (with kids).
properties.host_about:
I was born in Melbourne, and know the attraction of Melbourne is very much about its lifestyle. While it’s still got its “Hustle & Bustle” the magic about Melbourne is how it balances this hectic activity with the arts, sports and entertaining. Melbournian’s have passion for living life and that’s a major element towards Melbourne being voted as one of the world’s most liveable and friendliest cities (EIU's Global Liveability Ranking)

I have spent most of my life on the Mornington Peninsula (one hour south of Melbourne). I work in Melbourne’s CBD and have now also moved into the city to live. I’m an avid traveler, but with so many destinations still explore both in Australia and overseas. 
My greatest memories of traveling are often the people you meet and the experiences that are not found on the main tourist trail. I always love talking to a local character getting that special place to visit or café to dine (usually a cousin’s cafe). 
I have now come to a stage in my life I’d like to share some of Melbourne’s special places with others. These are not only my places of interest but also those hidden secrets that previous guests have found and have been excited to share with us.

I like to think “Abode 316 & 317” are special!  They are less than a year old and designed to be functional, yet have a touch of sophistication. They are fully optioned for the traveler and create that home away from home a hotel just can’t offer. 
Accommodation can often make or break a holiday, but I know the accommodation and hospitality my apartments will add to your Melbourne experience.
Rob

properties.summary: Enjoy our sensational, stylish one bedroom apartment on beautiful St Kilda Road, which is the gateway to the CBD . Journey along the Boulevard by tram to the Arts precinct, including Hamer Hall & the State Theatre. The Botanical Gardens  and the Shrine of Remembrance are just moments away. Southbank is one tram stop further on from the Arts Precinct. Ideally located for travellers who want to be close to the CBD. This apartment offers luxury accommodation for 2 people.
properties.space: This is a beautifully maintained one bedroom apartment that offers fully self contained amenities for guests to make themselves at home. Step on the city bound tram from outside the apartment, taking you directly to the CBD in 5 minutes or less., you will pass our renowned National Gallery, the Shrine of Remembrance,  the beautiful Botanical gardens and Federation Square. Alternatively take the tram southbound to St Kilda and surrounding areas.

properties.notes: For those guests who are arriving from Tullamarine airport, we offer a limousine transfer service in a Mercedes Benz. Arrive in style to your St Kilda Rd address. properties.transit: Tram services run along St Kilda Rd, as well as bus routes. I provide MYKI transport cards for your convenience. The value can be topped up at any 7 eleven store, on some tram platforms and at train stations, including Flinders St, Melbourne Central, Parliament and Flagstaff stations.

properties.host_about:
I'm an Australian now living in a beautiful city apartment near the heart of Melbourne - I've lived all over the world and spent 12 years in Asia (South Korea, Thailand and Indonesia).  I love music, theatre, scrabble and books.  But most of all, I love my beautiful toy poodle, Coco!
As you can probably tell from guest feedback, I consider it a privilege to host people from all over the world in my various apartments and try to make each experience memorable for all the right reasons.  I've been doing this for more than seven years so I hope you appreciate the little differences that such experience means to my guests.
To help you enjoy your next visit, I'm happy to know of any individual requirements and I will try to accommodate them.
As you've probably guessed, I'm a passionate fan of Melbourne so I've put together a list of personal favourites to help you experience this amazing, beautiful and vital city from an insiders perspective.

properties.host_about:
Inspired by and dedicated to Australian contemporary artists, Canvas Suites aims to provide boutique hospitality experience to our guests. Each of our Suites are handpicked, acquired and directly owned by Canvas Suites before being meticulously prepared and setup as the place our guests call home when in Melbourne.

At Canvas Suites, we believe that no visit to a place is complete without immersing oneself in its unique culture and central to any culture is its art. We view each of our art-inspired Suites as carefully curated galleries with walls adorned by original Australian works of art which our guests may enjoy in private during their stay.

But great spaces with great art do not by themselves create great hospitality experience. We know what counts for our guests to have a great stay in Melbourne – a friendly face to meet them, top-of-the-line chiropedic beds made with pristine sheets, the towels and toiletries taken care of to our exacting standards. We also know that our guests want the space and freedom to experience what Melbourne has to offer at their own pace. So we are available 24/7 for when our guests need us, but we step back when they do not.

properties.space: As Melbournians, we walk. Although the free tram service is all around my place, I can walk in any direction and find everything I need. I have lived here my whole life, so please do ask me for any tips on the best eating places. There are new things springing up every year and certain activities are seasonal so I would be more than happy to help you plan your stay. I have eaten almost everywhere, however, even I find some new secret places every now and then.

properties.neighborhood_overview: The location is ideal for all travellers with Swanston Street downstairs, 2-min walk to Melbourne Central Station and Queen Victoria Market, access to Elizabeth Street's Asian eateries, Melbourne's GPO and Hardware Lane are down the road, Emporium and Flinders Street are a free tram-ride away.
properties.notes: Although I pride myself on knowing everything about Melbourne, sometimes people come and share something absolutely new about the city and it makes me fall in love with it all over again. I respect your privacy, however if you want to chat I am always available after work and before midnight on work nights!
properties.transit: I would definitely walk everywhere! That's how you see all of Melbourne's laneways, alleys, side streets and hidden spots. But if you wanted, there is free tram access in all directions on Swanston Street and Elizabeth Street. 2-min walk to Melbourne Central Station for all train lines to visit nearby suburbs. There are also some trams directly to popular inner suburban hotspots (Richmond, South Yarra, Brunswick, South Melbourne).  1 free tram-ride to Flinders Street.
properties.access: You have access to a private inner bedroom of a 2 bedroom apartment. This bedroom has a Queen bed, luxurious and spacious sleeping and storage with a Spectacular floor-to-ceiling window view out to the north. Private rooms are great for when you prefer a little privacy, but still value a local connection. When you book a private room, you'll have a bedroom to yourself, but will share some spaces with others. With a private room, you'll be able to wake up to greet your new friends in the kitchen and have the freedom to bid them adieu at bedtime.

properties.summary: Truly unique inner-city oasis only one block from Swanston Street. This is a queen-bed room in a 3 bedroom, 2.5 bathroom warehouse conversion, with a private courtyard and direct street access.   Take advantage of the cheaper off season pricing!
properties.space: It doesn't get much more inner city than this! This is one of two queen bedrooms available in this 240 sq.m two-storey warehouse conversion that even has it's own backyard.  These rooms, which share one large bathroom, are well sized and fully furnished.    (Bedroom #2 can be booked via  http://www.airbnb.com/rooms/307630?preview=true) Guests have access to the whole house and all facilities - including a full kitchen, separate laundry, large rear courtyard, large living and dining areas.  WiFi is available and a laptop PC is also available if needed.  There are  hundreds of books to read and DVDs to watch - but you'll be far too busy - as the house is only minutes walk from Melbourne's best restaurants, bars, galleries, gardens and shopping; including the Victoria Market. The house is occupied by myself and one very laid back dog called Roger, as well as any other guests. properties.transit: Trams and trains are right outside and the area is serviced by a number of airport bus services. There are Mykis available for guest use.  Trams, trains and buses are all within a block, including the free tourist City Circle Tram.  Mykis are available for guests use.  On street and garage parking is available at a number of nearby locations.  Airport bus shuttle drops offs and pickups can be made to a number of nearby hotels.
properties.access: Guests have access to the whole house and all facilities.
properties.interaction: I work from home and am in the house during the day, as well as after hours.
properties.house_rules: Rooms are a maximum of two people - no additional guests or overnight visitors are allowed. Please exercise a reasonable level of discretion when coming and going - always ALWAYS lock the front door (even if you are just popping in and out) and please don't wake up up the neighbours (or me).  There is no smoking in the house, but you are welcome to smoke out on the back terrace. I have a dog - he likes everybody and will happily take you for a walk around the park if that takes your fancy - otherwise you may comfortably ignore him other than not leaving the front door open. No meals are provided however you have full use of the kitchen and all appliances etc. There is a supermarket across the street if you wish to buy groceries and there is space for you to store your own food. You are welcome to use the tea, coffee etc and condiments which are in the kitchen and also the laundry facilities and supplies.  All linen and towels are provided, there is a hairdryer in the bathroom. Please n
properties.host_about:
Busy, laid back, shopaholic and very social.  I holiday whenever I can afford to and travel internationally at least once a year.   I spend a fair bit of time walking my dog and pretending to get fit.  I am an IT consultant, so I work from home much of the time.

Must have:  Good wine, coffee, music, books (and ear plugs for sleeping)

Can totally do without: reality tv, talkback radio, backpacking and bad food.

Next holiday: Bali (again)
My motto: Does it come in red?
My other motto: Life is short, buy the shoes!

properties.host_about:
Inspired by and dedicated to Australian contemporary artists, Canvas Suites aims to provide boutique hospitality experience to our guests. Each of our Suites are handpicked, acquired and directly owned by Canvas Suites before being meticulously prepared and setup as the place our guests call home when in Melbourne.

At Canvas Suites, we believe that no visit to a place is complete without immersing oneself in its unique culture and central to any culture is its art. We view each of our art-inspired Suites as carefully curated galleries with walls adorned by original Australian works of art which our guests may enjoy in private during their stay.

But great spaces with great art do not by themselves create great hospitality experience. We know what counts for our guests to have a great stay in Melbourne – a friendly face to meet them, top-of-the-line chiropedic beds made with pristine sheets, the towels and toiletries taken care of to our exacting standards. We also know that our guests want the space and freedom to experience what Melbourne has to offer at their own pace. So we are available 24/7 for when our guests need us, but we step back when they do not.

properties.host_about:
Hi, my name is Paul, owner of Complete Host apartments! I am a seasoned traveler and have been fortunate to have visited most countries and experienced the way the locals live by staying at amazing airbnb properties all around the world. From these experiences I have learned a lot about what sort of experiences people are after when visiting a foreign city.

After spending the majority of the last 15 years overseas I am living back in my home town of  Melbourne and now run a short stays business called Complete Host.  As such, I have on offer a number of very comfortable properties in some of the best locations of Melbourne.

If you are interested in one of the properties l have listed but the dates are unavailable, please check my other listings under my profile or email me an inquiry as l will very likely have another property available that will suit your requirements. 

I cant wait to meet you and make your stay in Melbourne a memorable one!

Paul, Complete Host

properties.name: Heritage Elegance and Style on Bourke Street
properties.summary: A unique and luxurious apartment in the absolute heart of Melbourne. High ceilings, antique and vintage furniture, stained-glass windows looking directly over Bourke Street, plenty of books, loads of extras, original artworks and elegant styling.
properties.space: The ceilings are 14 feet high, and the huge stained-glass bay windows look directly out onto Bourke Street, and to the North. The sun streams in, the walls are gallery white, the feather couches are inviting and the architecture is elegant.  In the apartment, you will find: Nespresso coffee machine, with pods. Fresh milk, butter, filtered water, some drinks and staples in the fridge. A brimming bowl of chai sachets, hot chocolates, flavoured coffees and many teas. Complimentary coffee cards (if you're staying during the week) for the café next door, Oli & Levi. Little nibbles and breakfast cereals in the kitchen cupboard in case you arrive famished, and a convenience store 2 doors down for more serious supplies. Toaster, kettle and microwave. Smeg cooktop and range-hood, with basic cooking stuff (in case there's something wrong with the cafés...) Bowls, plates, cups, cutlery, glasses and stemware. A high quality Miracoil pillow-top bed ensemble, made up with quality soft linen. Spare b

properties.neighborhood_overview: The apartment is in the absolute middle of Melbourne. The very centre of it all. Metres from The Bourke Street Mall, one free tram ride from the Skybus drop off point, walking distance to restaurants, shopping, theatres and art galleries.
properties.notes: Please be aware that the bed configuration is one Miracoil pillowtop double bed, for one or two guests. Accommodation for third and forth guests is either a brand new high quality auto-inflatable bed, and/or the huge feather pillowed 3 seater couch (which is the comfiest place on earth). That is - it is not another bed with an innerspring mattress. If you are a twosome but require two beds, please contact me for pricing.  Staying in the heart of Melbourne means there is always some city noise going on around you, and (especially in the warmer months, when you might have the windows open) you will definitely hear the streets and the buzz. The GPO clock chimes, and sometimes the buskers in the Bourke Street Mall are audible too. Close the windows if you prefer quiet. The walls of the apartment are extremely thick.  There is almost no noise inside the building, usually. Please consider my neighbour's enjoyment of this, and move quietly through the passageways. There are no restaurants, ni
properties.transit: Melbourne trams are free in the CBD, so just hop on one that's passing!  The three big Melbourne train stations (Flinders Street, Melbourne Central, and Southern Cross) are all walking distance (500m, 700m & 900m away, respectively) or take a free tram along Bourke or Elizabeth Streets to or from them. Let me know if you'd like me to leave Myki's (the public transport top-up ticketing cards) for you to use during your stay, to take trams trains or buses out of the city, and I will explain how they work. Skybus from Tullamarine Airport runs every 10 minutes, and costs 19 one way. Please ask for directions and instructions if you plan to do this, and I will advise. A taxi from the airport will cost about 55 There's a carpark within the building, and you can park on the same level as the apartment. The fees (paid directly to the machines in the carpark, upon exit) are 15 per day on the weekend, and about 60 per day during the week. Most city carparks are the same, so plan carefully if
properties.access: You'll have full access to all the apartment amenities, and the whole place is yours during your stay.  The apartment is extremely secure; you'll need a magnetic fob to get into the building, and also to have the lift take you to your floor (and no other). These fobs are very time consuming and expensive to replace, so any loses will incur a 100 deduction from your security deposit. Please be careful.
properties.interaction: I respond to Airbnb messages immediately, and am always available if you want tips, advice or help. Otherwise, I'll leave you to enjoy the apartment as if it is your own, and Melbourne as if you live here.
properties.house_rules: The apartment is in pristine condition, the walls are gallery white, the furniture is antique, and the fittings and appliances are in first class order.  If you break something, please leave whatever you imagine it will cost me to repair or replace it, and I will be very grateful. Significant or unreported damages will be deducted from the security bond.  The key and magnetic fob are very particularly recorded and programmed, toward providing high level security. Both are expensive and time consuming to replace, and loses will incur a 100 deduction from your security bond. Please be careful! I will appreciate you tidying and cleaning up the apartment as you depart. Only booked guests may stay in the apartment. No extra guests without prior arrangement, and certainly no parties. Strictly no smoking in the apartment (there is no balcony).
properties.host_about: I am a Melbourne resident (and lover) with a background in business management, health sciences and visual art. I collect books, bowls, mannequins and apartments...

properties.house_rules: - Avoid disturbing the neighbours - Only guests on the booking to be present at the apartment - Noise to a minimum after 10pm - Be mindful of other guests when using the facilities
properties.host_about:
Bridget and I have been together for 10 years now and still loving every moment. We fill our lives with work most days but enjoy spare moments by surrounding ourselves with people, walks, random projects (like renovating our apartment or making our own kitchen table...)

WHAT WE CAN'T LIVE WITHOUT
Sunlight! We've tried apartments with very small windows and now live in one with heaps... don't think we can ever go back!

FAVOURITE THINGS TO DO
Really enjoy looking through and understanding real estate markets in every town or country we visit. A really interesting way to understand the culture of an area, its history and how it has developed.

HOW DO WE TRAVEL
When we travel, its organised chaos, we plan some things ahead but then leave the in between parts up to the imagination. Our latest overseas trip has flowing through Germany, Spain and Austria. We immerse ourselves in the culture to get a good feel of how the locals live.

Due to its historic design, the building is very cool in Summer, and warm in Winter - rare that you need to even put the heater or fans on!

properties.neighborhood_overview: The best part about this neighborhood is that you have the best offerings all on your doorstep. It is true cosmopolitan living. You have Degraves St, Royal Arcade, Block Arcade, the Yarra Boulevard, Federation Square, Southbank Promenade, Arts Precinct & Royal Botanic Gardens all within a 5 minute walk from home.
properties.notes: While the apartment does not have air conditioning, the temperature inside is always cool in summer and warm in winter. We also have a high power fan and heating if ever required. As this is apartment is just behind a busy part of the city, you may expect more outdoor noise filtering inside than you would in a suburban home. During the day you'll hear light street ambience and birds chirping, and on Thurs/Fri/Sat evenings, the laneway will have bars open into the later part of the evening, which means there'll be some street ambience that will filter through the apartment a bit up until late.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Experience everything that the world's most liveable city has to offer. Melbourne is known for its cafés and restaurants, and the apartment is close to plenty of both. Dine on the Yarra, visit China Town further up Little Bourke St, or enjoy authentic Italian on Lygon St (Melbourne's renown Italian district). If shopping is your thing, check out the department stores in Bourke St Mall, the factory outlets in Docklands (both are an easy tram ride inside the free tram zone), or the boutique shopping on Chapel St (3 train stops away). The 86 tram stops right outside the apartment, waiting to take you to the iconic St Kilda Beach and Luna Park. Melbourne is also known for its hidden laneway bars and quirky drinking establishments, all located an easy distance from the apartment, within the CBD. If a day adventure is your thing, drive an hour out of the city and you'll find Yarra Valley wineries, Dandenong Ranges, forest ranges, and (in winter) cross country skiing!
properties.notes: Located on the corner of Spencer St and Little Bourke St- an easy tram ride to China Town. An great place to stay for the weekend. The central location makes it perfect for a weekend getaway or a place to come back to after attending a concert. Only 2 stops to Crown Casino and the Exhibition Centre. There's outlet shopping across the street, and Bourke St Mall is 4 tram stops away (inside the free tram zone). You'll love the beautiful views.
properties.access: Guests will have full use of the apartment and it's cooking and washing facilities, as well as the pool, sauna and gym on level 2. There is also a rock climbing wall and outdoor garden on level 6. Guests are encouraged to use the apartment as though it's their own, including the wifi and complementary tea and coffee (and any other goodies in the fridge and pantry).
properties.house_rules: - Please respect the apartment as if it's your own. - No parties or events.  - No pets or smoking inside. - Shoes off inside.

Hi Everyone,
 I wish you will go through all my listings, 
https://www.airbnb.com.au/rooms/1747852
https://www.airbnb.com.au/rooms/1863200
https://www.airbnb.com.au/rooms/2327860

Being a Airbnb , it is been almost 3 years. I love being a host, because I know that when people, different group of people and family they came to our place, when they feel, it is worth it. I love it and enjoy. That's the happiness that other job may not able to find it. I really love to see when my guests they start to step to the apartment and feel wow and impressed.
Honestly, being a host, it is not easy decision.
We have to make sure every details things in our place are the best to our guests. 
From check-in to check-out. It is an experience not only for guests. it is for us as well. It is the whole responsibilities. 

That’s what I think, the reason which motivates me to be a host.

Melbourne is a very multi-cultural city 
My objective is, if someone come here they should be connected to the right place.
Me, as a host, I think is kind of connecting these different peice together, a kind of connection.
The high point of my stay was how you made me feel. And how you made me feel, it sticks. It sticks with you.”
I have the traditional way to believe.
We believe it is the relationship that provide to the guests they will enjoy,  love the place to stay.
They trust me and I trust them. And that’s the reason it works.
So hospitalities if you ask me, is about care. It s about welcoming. This is about welcoming with open heart.  Welcome you to my Melbourne Apartment.
