properties.notes: My home has central heating, air conditioning and provides private spaces as well as shared spaces. Fan in bedroom. On street parking available. 2 Mykie cards provided for 10 each to get started on the trams! Up to date information available for transport and places of interest.
properties.transit: The access to public transport is excellent with a tram stop only 2 minutes walk away in St Georges Road. Go directly down to Brunswick Street, for the best original Cafe culture or take the No. 96 tram directly to St Kilda Beach When coming from Tullamarine Airport, take the Skybus to Southern Cross Station and the No. 11 tram in Collins Street , directly to North Fitzroy. A Myki card to the value of 10 will be provided to get started upon arrival.
properties.access: The guests have a luxury sized, furnished Private Master bedroom with a Queen sized bed with new feather doona. Built in wardrobe with hanging space and drawers inside. A desk and internet connection suitable for business or holidays makers. A separate large chest of drawers. The shared spaces are the bathroom, a fully equipped kitchen, a comfortable sitting room,  spacious dining room, a casual TV room, furnished front balcony, back garden seating area. Fresh towels and linen provided. Laundry facilities are available in the house if needed. The guests have access to all areas of the property apart from the second bedroom and office. A bedroom key is provided for privacy . Guest pantry with homemade organic Mueslie, tea, coffee, jams and condiments, bread and fresh butter for toast,milk. All cutlery and crockery, and utensils provided.
properties.interaction: I work and so not always at at home and sometimes away on weekends in the country. I am always available for any inquiries. My guests have all the privacy they need but we have enjoyed the interaction when appropriate.
properties.house_rules: I require guests to have respect for property and an appreciation of my asthetic surroundings.
properties.host_about: Hi, I have lived and worked in inner Melbourne for many years in Fashion, and I am still working in French Womenswear. I have a keen interest in the Arts, Interior Design and the Theatre.  I love this area of Fitzroy for its parks and gardens, the community and all my friends and Family nearby. I am active and interested in Cultural events and travel. I have visited Europe, America and Asia and stay up to date with the many events Melbourne has to offer. My home is a reflection of my asthetic interests with paintings, antique and modern furniture and objects. Cooking and Gardening and reading are also high on my priority list, along with my small dog Pierre who lives here too. I stay up to date with contemporary youth culture through my two adult daughters!

properties.neighborhood_overview: Our apartment is located near Southern Cross Station. It is a newly well developed precinct with rising energy from the innovative and creative industry. It is a very quite and relaxing neighbourhood to live in. We are in the area of law firms, financial companies working area in Melbourne CBD. Our apartment has a prime location. It is very close to tram stop, Skybus Airport shuttle, Coles supermarket, pharmacy, cafes downstairs and along little Bourke Street, banks and ATMs. Within 3 minute walk, you can get to Spencer Outlet shopping centre. Downstairs to King street. And you can walk all way to Chinatown.
properties.notes: I expect all guests to respect our property as if it was your own. No parties No smoking inside the house No pets  No drinks or food in the bedroom Please wash and clean the kitchen after using. Using the electric frypan for cooking and light meal only. Please bring your own garbage to the garbage room next to the elevator.  Please be respectful of the neighbours and keep the noise down after 11pm. Enjoy and Relax!
properties.transit: There are several free tram, train and bus stops less than 2 minutes walk. And a taxi rank nearby.  Southern Cross station, where the bus to the airport departs is opposite to our building. You can get Miki cards (the public transport cards) downstairs at the 7-11. Airport transfer:  I recommend using Skybus. You can pre-purchase tickets online or at their kiosk at the airport for 19. The bus departs every 10 - 20 minutes and will take you directly to Southern Cross Station in about 25 minutes. We just opposite to skybus station. If you choose to get a taxi, it will cost you around 45-50.

properties.summary: Stonehill Retreat is a private two bedroom luxury retreat located at the gateway to the Yarra Valley. Situated only 5 minutes from St Andrews and Hurstbridge townships, and a 50 minute drive to Melbourne CBD and Airport, perfect for a country escape.
properties.space: Stonehill Retreat is a new and unique luxury 2 bedroom studio, set on 20 acres of private bushland, just a five minute drive from St Andrews.  The recently built premises boasts floor to ceiling windows in each bedroom and lounge area, with stained customised glass throughout, allowing immersion in the beautiful surrounding garden and bush land. Magnificent stained glass window panels designed by local St Andrews artist Rob Haley are an amazing welcoming feature as you first drive into the private garage to the building. A warm and inviting open plan lounge, kitchen and dining area overlooks the natural bushland and property dams. There is a large smart TV for your viewing of the comprehensive DVD collection and Foxtel.  The lounge has a large Jet master fire place that is wonderful to relax in front of with a glass of wine. All rooms are equiped with split system heating and cooling. The central bathroom has floor heating and all linen, towels, bathrobes and toiletries are provided. M

properties.name: Brilliant Location in Melbourne CBD
properties.summary: Central, clean and welcoming. Join me in the heart of my favourite city. Just a short walk to many great Melbourne attractions, transport and food, enjoy sharing my bright and spacious apartment with the sole use of a bathroom and private bedroom.
properties.space: This apartment is so close to everything Melbourne has to offer. A five minute walk to Crown Casino, Southbank, the Yarra River, Melbourne Aquarium, just two blocks to Southern Cross Station (where the Airport Bus terminates) and Etihad Stadium, and a short walk or free tram ride to Docklands, (yummy) Degraves St, South Melbourne Market, DFO South Wharf (shopping!), Swanston St, Bourke St Mall (more shopping!), Flinders St Station, Federation Square, ACMI, Melbourne Arts Centre, the MCG, Rod Laver Arena, Hisense Arena and the Melbourne Park tennis centre (home of the Australian Open). Best of all there is a brilliant outlook over Southbank and the Yarra River which is lovely for breakfast in the sun or a drink at night to watch the Crown Casino fire show.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Here, you are in the centre of Melbourne - right in the CBD. There are so many great things to do that are just a short walk away.  Some of my top tips for what to do during your stay are: - Check out South Melbourne Market - it is the cooler (and closer!) cousin to the Queen Victoria Market, hip homewares and tasty food - including the famous South Melbourne Market Dim Sims! - Hang out at cool Southbank bars and restaurants (covering all price ranges) and enjoy the lights over the Yarra River - Get a surprise from the Crown Casino flames every hour in the evening when they burn brightly and tower up into the sky (a great view of these from my balcony) - Go shopping on Bourke St (a short walk away) or find bargains at DFO South Wharf  - Stop by Degraves St for an excellent brunch or perfect coffee - Check out a sporting or music event at the MCG, Rod Laver Arena, Hisense Arena or Etihad Stadium - Be the first to find a cool laneway bar or nightspot that no one else knows about... yet!
properties.notes: Note that occasionally I may have a friend visit (we'll make sure we are quiet if people are sleeping), I will do my best to let you know beforehand and if you have any concerns about this please do talk to me and I can try make accommodations.  If there is anything at all during your stay that is not to your satisfaction please let me know, I would rather help and fix it to make you comfortable than find out after your stay.
properties.transit: My apartment is very close to many tram routes and all CBD trams are now free and within walking distance to the two major train stations Flinders St station and Southern Cross Station.  The apartment is a two block walk from where the airport bus (Skybus) terminates at Southern Cross station.  If you need any help, just ask! I can help you plan a route to get pretty much anywhere in Melbourne. In the carpark beneath the building there are two GoGet cars which can be used for short term rental, you can find out information about how to use and book them on their website (I haven't used GoGet personally, but I hear they can be a good alternative to hiring a car for your whole stay - and you don't have to pay parking!)
properties.access: As I have my own en-suite you will have sole use of the main bathroom which includes laundry facilities and is located right next to the guest bedroom. The bedroom contains very large built in robes with some wire draws and hangers available.  I have high speed Wi-Fi which you are welcome to use and extensive kitchen, laundry facilities and appliances. The balcony offers a great view over Southbank, you are very welcome to use it, just be careful opening the door it is very heavy (double glazed for soundproofing) and I don't want you to hurt yourself.
properties.interaction: Hi, my name is Katie, this apartment is my home and I treat it with great care and hope you will too. I work during weekdays and often go out at night so you will have the space to yourself but I do like to share the living area and kitchen when I am home (you may be lucky and catch me in a cake-baking mood).  I am very happy to offer suggestions on the best ways to experience Melbourne and what it has to offer, I have lived here my whole life and know some great secret places.
properties.house_rules: No smoking or pets please. Please make sure you lock the door from the outside and check it by testing the handle when leaving the apartment.
properties.host_about:
I live in Melbourne and love living in the city and enjoying everything it has to offer, going to markets, brunch spots, cool bars and sporting events.
I am a professional person and work in IT but I travel when ever I can get a break from work, I have been to India, Bali, Tahiti, Thailand, Greece, USA, England, France, Italy, Malaysia, Singapore, New Zealand - and I am always looking for suggestions for the next adventure!

Hi Everyone,
 I wish you will go through all my listings, 
https://www.airbnb.com.au/rooms/1747852
https://www.airbnb.com.au/rooms/1863200
https://www.airbnb.com.au/rooms/2327860
https://www.airbnb.com.au/rooms/8341907
https://www.airbnb.com.au/rooms/11656757


Being a Airbnb , it is been almost 3 years. I love being a host, because I know that when people, different group of people and family they came to our place, when they feel, it is worth it. I love it and enjoy. That's the happiness that other job may not able to find it. I really love to see when my guests they start to step to the apartment and feel wow and impressed.
Honestly, being a host, it is not easy decision.
We have to make sure every details things in our place are the best to our guests. 
From check-in to check-out. It is an experience not only for guests. it is for us as well. It is the whole responsibilities. 

That’s what I think, the reason which motivates me to be a host.

Melbourne is a very multi-cultural city 
My objective is, if someone come here they should be connected to the right place.
Me, as a host, I think is kind of connecting these different peice together, a kind of connection.
The high point of my stay was how you made me feel. And how you made me feel, it sticks. It sticks with you.”
I have the traditional way to believe.
We believe it is the relationship that provide to the guests they will enjoy,  love the place to stay.
They trust me and I trust them. And that’s the reason it works.
So hospitalities if you ask me, is about care. It s about welcoming. This is about welcoming with open heart.  Welcome you to my Melbourne Apartment.

No Uber required! I love getting to know people from different parts of Australia and the world, so am always keen for a chat, beer, coffee or bite to eat. I also totally understand if you
properties.neighborhood_overview: Always happy to give you tips (mostly food related) There is so much within within walking distance:  - Eating - Flinders Lane, Southbank, Degraves St, Hardware Lane, Chinatown - Major sporting venues - MCG, Melbourne Park, AAMI Park - Arts Centre  - Federation Square - Shopping - Myer, David Jones, Melbourne Central, Emporium  - Queen Victoria Market  - Melbourne Aquarium  - Crown Casino and Entertainment Complex - Docklands including the Southern Star Wheel and Etihad Stadium
properties.transit: One block to Flinders Street station. Short (free) tram ride to Southern Cross Station. Almost every tram goes past my corner :) You can even get a Skybus shuttle to the building if you're coming from the airport. Hire a bike via Melbourne Bike Share.
properties.interaction: I love getting to know people from different parts of Australia and the world, so am always keen for a chat, beer, coffee or bite to eat. I also totally understand if you want to be left alone... hah!  I will be in the neighbourhood most of the time and always contactable. I have friends in the area that can pop past if I am away, so there'll always be a friendly face to help.
properties.house_rules: Common courtesy will cover most things :)
properties.host_about:
Hi there! I'm Melbourne bred and love this city. The food, coffee, bars, shopping, nightlife, parks, running tracks... I could go on and would gladly do so if you're visiting.

I also dig whisky, frisbee, photography and the colour teal.

Drop me a line and say g'day!

properties.notes: Parking lot is not provided for the unit but off the street parking, in front of the apartment and around the apartment block is free from 7:30pm till 7:30am.  Alternatively, you can rent a secured parking lot from the Milano Serviced Apartment.  Arrangement can be made at the reception located at the same building lobby for 25 per day. My apartment is near to the tram station, city free tram zone & metro station, therefore it's very convenience to move around in the city.  Please feel free to contact your most friendly host for futher information. A prompt reply is most certainly assured. Fresh and clean linen and towels are provided. Washing machine & dryer are only available for those staying more than 5 nights. If usage of washing machine is required for short term rental, please contact host prior to your booking. Extra charges may apply.  Enjoy your stay in Melbourne and please leave a good review after you check out.
properties.transit: TRANSPORTATION  1. Taxi/Uber If you arrive via Melbourne Airport with a group of two to four persons or more and are travelling with big luggage bags, it is more convenient to catch a taxi/Van or Uber which may cost between 60-85 (off peak rate) up to 4/5 person. Duration of journey depends on traffic but can range from 30 minutes up to one hour. Please take note that UberX is not allowed to operate from the Airport Terminal but you may grab an UberX at the MacDonald outlet next to BP petrol station which is 5 mins walk away from Terminal 1. 2. Skybus A single person or a couple who travels light can easily grab the Melbourne Airport Skybus service which provides door-to-door pick-up and drop-off at Milano Serviced Apartment for 19 per person each way. Please refer to the Melbourne Airport Skybus website for more information. 3. Smart Bus 901 from Terminal T4 Bus Stand No. 17 This is the cheapest mode of public transportation to the city/apartment. Total per trip/per person cost is
properties.access: 24-hour access with secure keyless chip to enter the building and use the in-house facilities. Recreational use of gym, pool and sauna are available from 6am to 10pm daily.  Please note that private car park is excluded in your initial reservation but you can liaise with the host in advance to enquire such availability at a daily rental rate of 20 per day. If the host's parking lot is not available prior to your arrival, alternatively you can also rent a secured parking lot from the Milano Serviced Apartment reception desk next to the same lobby building at 25 per day. All you need is to register yourself with an IDs and Host apartment Unit number.
properties.interaction: Host is easily reachable for checking in and out, via Airbnb messaging, mobile number or email.  Host may occasionally offer to pick up or drop off guests from/to the airport.  Fees apply for airport transfers by host.  Please check with host prior to booking. Upon request, I am happy and ever ready to offer tips and share information about the city, tourist attractions, scenic day trips outside Melbourne and places to eat in Melbourne. Otherwise I shall fully respect your privacy as my guest and would like to wish you a truly spectacular holiday in Melbourne.
properties.house_rules: NO CONCIERGE SERVICE My apartment is not a serviced apartment but a private unit, therefore kindly refrain from liaising with the Front Service Desk next to the lobby (Separate side entrance) which is solely for serviced apartment clientele only but you can make an enquiry and book a day trip tour within Melbourne or Victoria or rent a secured parking lot for 25 per day from them.  Any enquiry or emergency in regard to the building you can contact the Building Manager on duty direct at the Lobby Desk inside the Lobby.  Upon arrival and check-in or any other inquiries, please liaise/contact your host directly.   CHECK-IN & SELF CHECK-OUT TIME Standard check in time is from 3pm to 7pm. Self check out time is 12 noon. Additional charges may apply for early or late check in and late check out. Host may occasionally offer to pick up or drop off guests from/to the airport.  Fees apply for airport transfers by host.  Please check with host prior to booking.   NO PETS & SHOES Outside shoes ar
properties.host_about:
I live and love to travel.  Having visited over 40 countries, I am still planning for more trips and vacations.  My personal goal is to hit a total of 50 countries in two years time.  Travelling is in my blood, you can say.

When I am not on foreign soil or some exotic land, I hit the gym, swim or hike around the beautiful Aussie outback. Love the great outdoors and when hungry, I indulge in spicy street food.

I travel within Australia and overseas at least three or four times a year, enjoying the best of Airbnb accommodation most of the time.  Huge interest in scenic photography.  Enjoy making friends and learning different cultures from all over the world.  

I work in the gaming industry and live quite close to Melbourne CBD.  Started hosting in May 2016, I am still quite new to the Airbnb community, but determined to do well and be a great host.  I sincerely hope you will feel at home in my cozy apartment.  Have a fabulous time in Melbourne – the world's best and most liveable city.   

My Motto in Life – Life is too short to be anything but HAPPY! So enjoy, be merry and go on a HOLIDAY!

I am 33 years old & originally from England. I work in the bar/restaurant/hotel industry. Designing, setting them up & running them. I've spent the last 14 years living in 14 countries, mainly Asia & mainly with work. Living in hotels, once for nearly a year. I moved back to Melbourne 3.1/2 years ago after living here 12years ago (because it felt more like home than anywhere I've been). I know Melbourne very well & even give locals advice on where to go. Especially the restaurant, bar, cafe/coffee scene from my work in the industry.

I am very active, so if not at work, in the gym/pool, yoga, climbing, etc.

Eat healthily when i can to balance out when i like to indulge, read a lot, like movies & nice drinks (Everything from 1 of my 100+ Teas to fine Tequila)

I'm very easy going & tend to interact with people based on how they interact with me. So if you want your own space to do your own thing, you'll barely notice me. If you want someone to help make the most of your stay in Melbourne, i'm all yours...

properties.host_about:
Hi my name is Dawei, I started doing Airbnb September 2015. 

I'm a 20 years old undergraduate student currently studying commercial law. I like to watch movies and play video games. Sometimes I could spend my whole day in my room just play games. I thought that there isn't much things to do outside and I thought the World was a boring place. When I'm not playing games, I would read news on the internet just to catch up with the rest of the world. That's how I knew Airbnb. 

One day, my father come to me, talked about doing short term renting. He has got few new apartments that our relatives bought which needs to be rented out. I told him about Airbnb and he thought we could really make it work. So I asked my best friend if he is interested to be my partner for this, and he said yes. We started almost immediately, planning, buying furnitures to started taking guests in just two weeks. 

Then it really changed me.

I met with travellers around the world. Every body was so polite and friendly.  When I talk to them I can feel the excitement and happiness. It's totally  different compare to what I thought people are like. Maybe because this communicate is great, I don't know.  Then I  thought "I want to be people like my guests". I want people around me to feel life is great and there are a lot to look forward to. The guests really gave me a lot motivation towards my work and my life. Here I have to thank you all.

After one month, the revenue was great, however take away the interests and loans, all kinds of fees and salary for my partner, there are really not much left for me. But I think that's enough, I'm still a student, I have to spend time on study and don't have much things to spend money on anyway, being able to save money for a holiday with my girl friend every few month is perfect for me. 

After all these experience, I felt it really changed my life and how I view the world. Doesn't matter if I fail or succeed it's  going to effect the rest of my life in a very positive way, that's something really valuable to me.

properties.host_about:
I love travelling and am when I am not travelling, I live vicariously through my guests and friends' travel experiences. I am a regular guest on a weekly radio travel show "The Escape Pod", with listeners worldwide. 

My partner Rob and I work together in our business, Guest Ready, we coach and train Airbnb hosts and microbusinesses to provide awesome guest experiences and consult on the peer to peer accommodation sector.

My recent trips have included the Airbnb Open in Paris in November 2015 with 5000 other hosts. Rob and I were thrilled to be invited to conduct 2 host educator workshops. 

My travel interests include meeting social entrepreneurs who run social enterprises/not for profits to create social change, and volunteer travel (voluntourism). 

Sampling local food, urban/cultural sites and natural attractions and chillaxing with a good book and meeting inspirational folks are some of the highlights of my recent trips.
 

We enjoy travelling independently and with friends and I am curious about the world and very open minded. I love visiting friends around the world and meeting local people. Small group travel is a recent new and has been a very positive experience.

Melbourne is a very culturally diverse city, and offers amazing food and cultural experiences from across the globe. There are wonderful cultural events (many for free) and restaurants to explore. I am very resourceful and can help connect you with anything/place or interest you have. 

My professional background is in the tourism industry. I have held a variety of roles including guest relations for Ayers Rock Resort, to being a german speaking tour guide at Ayers Rock (Uluru Kata Tjuta National Park) and operating tours for gay and lesbian international travellers and cruise ship excursions. 

I have hosted friends and family and friends of friends for many years. I provide a welcoming space for guests to relax, reflect, experience and recharge.

My other role involves running workshops in governance, strategic planning and risk for not for proift organisations which is very rewarding. Weekends for me are best spent with my partner Rob in a local cafe, reading, planning our next trips, walking and spending time with friends. My friends are an eclectic bunch from a wide range of cultural backgrounds, faiths, sexualities and lifestyles. 

“Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines, sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." – Mark Twain

My apartment is well within the Free Tram Zone so it has the added advantage for your convenience! Rental car? No problems! properties.transit: We are truly in the most convenient location to see Melbourne. Victoria Market is a short and free tram ride around the city. Please ask if you want some information on current activities in Melbourne and how to get there. There is also a tourist information office at Federation Square, which is under 5 minutes walk from us. Many tours start from Federation Square.

properties.neighborhood_overview: The apartment is positions at the theatre and fashion end of Collins st, with the business district within easy access at the other end. While you'll be at the Melbourne hub, the entry is on a quieter laneway lined with restaurants and shops.   Step out of the apartment and start your day with a coffee, or a must-try hot chocolate drink from Ganache Chocolate shop. Two minutes further down Collins st, on your left, is a walkway to Degraves St with its many little restaurants and cafe's spilling out onto the walkway.  Across the road is one of Melbourne's most beautiful arcades, The Block Archade, with its magnificent French Renaissance architecture, stained glass windows and mozaic floors, cafes and retail shops, reminiscent of Paris .  Breakfast, lunch, dinner?  its not a question of where to go, but rather which to choose! TAXIS: There is a taxi rank across the street from the apartment BUS / TRAMS:    *Trams run from 5.30am till late at night, with a number of lines 1-5 minutes walk from the apartment that take you to destinations all over Melbourne and the surrounding areas.  *City Circle Tram - Hop on this free tram service which operates in a circular route passing major tourist attractions, as well as linking with other tram, train and bus routes in and around Melbourne. properties.host_about:
Born in Europe and raised in Melbourne, I feel both fortunate and proud to call this city my home. I totally understand why Melbourne has been voted the most liveable city in the world five years in a row, and hope you will too!
I work in the health and wellbeing sector and believe in living life consciously, lightly and with purpose. I enjoy going for walks or riding my bike along our beautiful river, park and beach-side tracks; I do yoga, meditate, paint and dance latin (all with varying degrees of success :) I also like attending live music events, theatres, galleries, eating out and meeting great people, all of which I can enjoy in this great city of ours. So it gives me great pleasure to think that your stay in my apartment may in some small way enhance your experience of Melbourne, contribute to precious memories of your time here, and that you will want to return!

properties.neighborhood_overview: Where do you start?  Located right in the centre of the city there's everything on your doorstep.  The Queen Victoria Market is a short 5 minute walk.  Sporting venues such as Etihad Stadium, the MCG (AFL football, cricket), AAMI Park (soccer, rugby) and Melbourne Park / Rod Laver Arena (Tennis, concerts etc) are within walking distance or catch a tram.  Southbank and the whole city precinct is a short stroll away. There is an endless array of eateries in Melbourne.  The same goes for bars.  Explore one of the many lane ways and just open the concealed door to find the hidden gems. Melbourne is a shoppers paradise.  Whether you want designer boutiques in the Paris end of town, outlet stores at harbourtown or South wharf or the Melbourne institutions, Myer and David Jones, you'll find it all within walking distance.
properties.notes: We have a cat so if you have a cat phobia of any sort, this probably isn't the place for you.
properties.transit: Being right in the centre of Melbourne there is an abundance of public transport.  We are seconds from Flagstaff train station, which is one of the Melbourne city loop underground stations.  We are also walking distance from Southern Cross station which is the terminus for the Melbourne Airport bus (as well as the main bus terminal and city train station). For those with a car, there is car parking at Harbour Town (next to the Melbourne Observation Wheel).  The car park is open 24 hours with the maximum charge of 10 per 24 hour period.  The car park is a 15 minute walk from our apartment or a 5 minute tram ride on the free trams in the city centre.
properties.access: Access to the apartment is via secure card access.  You will have your own door key to come and go as you please.
properties.interaction: We live in the apartment and are in and out doing our thing.  Ken is a keen cook and we buy most of our produce from the Queen Victoria Market.  The apartment has a full length balcony overlooking Flagstaff gardens.  Join us on the balcony for a drink (of whatever takes your fancy).  We're happy to engage as much as you want.  If you want to do your own thing, sit and chat or ask questions about Melbourne we're fine with it all.
properties.house_rules: Please respect our neighbours and keep noise to  an absolute minimum when leaving or arriving at the apartment. No smoking in the apartment (or on the balcony). The room and our apartment is not baby/child friendly so we are unable to accommodate children under 10 years old. We're not prudes and want everyone to enjoy their stay, but unfortunately we cannot allow joiners (unregistered guests) to stay the night.  The reason for this is security.
properties.host_about:
Hello, we are Ken and Mark.  We live in Melbourne Australia.  Mark works in IT and Ken is a Chiropractor.  We love to travel and in the past few years have been on trips to Europe, Middle East, US, Asia and South America.  We love cruising because it's an easy way to see cities and places of the world without having to see the inside of an airport or lug a suitcase.  In 2013 we did a Transatlantic cruise from Rome to Fort Lauderdale and another from Buenos Aires to Santiago Chile.  When on land we like to stay at b&b's, homestays or private apartments.  The knowledge of local hosts and quality of accommodation in great locations is what we look for.  Local knowledge is invaluable.  

Our favourite cities and places include Rome, Berlin, Jordan (you have to go to Petra and Jarash), Bangkok, Cambodia (try the train trip from Bangkok to Cambodia), Barcelona and Santiago.  
Our bucket list includes Cuba, Galapagos Islands, a Baltic cruise, more of Cambodia and lots more of Europe.  We also want to see more of the USA.   Whilst we think we've done a lot of the US we've only just scratched the surface.  Our bucket list includes driving the winnebago from West to East coast (with lots of zig zagging along the way).   

Ken is an avid cook and Mark an avid Collingwood (AFL) supporter.  Don't hold that against him.  We're long time Melbourne locals.  Both born in Victoria we've lived Melbourne inner city, South, East and on the Mornington Peninsula.  We've also lived in various cities around Australia (Sydney, Brisbane, Perth, Mildura, Warnambool, Bright and Darwin) and have been lucky enough to experience life living overseas in New Zealand and the USA.

For me, every people is a book I can learn. That's why I am so enthusiastic about meeting friends and hearing their stories. Go different places, meet different people, learn different things is always the motivation mades me forward.

Hosting my friends from other cities or oversea is one of my favourite things to do in Melbourne. It's a sense of achievement that all of my friends had great travel experiences  when stayed this most liveable city.

properties.name: Cozy, airy and comfy city pad on Collins
properties.summary: Cozy and comfy apartment in an extremely convenient central CBD location for holiday and corporate guests.  In the free tram zone with a stop right at our door and the grand Flinder train station less than two blocks away.  And easy access to a host of eateries, laneway cafes, supermarkets and shopping centres within Melbourne city.
properties.space: Happy to host you in our cozy home. You will have your own private double bedroom and access to common spaces including the kitchen, living room and the bathroom with a laundry facility (our room wouldn't be accessible though).  The room is smallish, ideal for a couple but is warm and has the most comfortable bed (trust me!).  We also have a sofabed in the living room that can be used if you would be travelling with additional guests who would like to stay with you.  It's a quiet, homely apartment though it is located in the heart of the CBD (city) and in vicinity of restaurants, bars, museums, art galleries.  There is tram stop right outside our building, and Flinders Street train station is only a couple of minutes (literally the next block) away. With free trams within the CBD, you can get to Queen Victoria Market, Parliament, Hosier Lane, State Library amongst many others all through the easily accessible tram network.  Many major companies and banks are situated either on the same

properties.neighborhood_overview: Being in the heart of the CBD, Melbourne's famous laneways, shopping centers and busking spots are just few steps (or free tram journeys) away. Explore the colourful art performances and electic boutiques in the neighbourhood and make sure you do indulge yourself in Melbourne's vibrant cafes'. The city really has a little something for everyone's taste, be it music, art, shopping or if you just love being an epicurean.
properties.notes: Check in times are flexible. And during weekends and outside working hours on weekdays (before 9 am and after 6 pm), we will be there personally to check you in. Although within working hours, we are away at work and would be happy to provide directions and assistance to help you with a self-check in.  There is a storage space for luggage and bags under the bed, and rack to hold clothes and other valuables, however there is no dedicated wardrobe. With regards to the deposit, it will not be deducted unless a damage or loss is reported. We have mainly included it to secure our access keys and amenities.
properties.transit: The tram network in Melbourne is fabulous and comfortable (and free in the city), getting to the famous suburbs of Fitzroy, Carlton, Prahran & St Kilda is a breeze. And as our place is a block away from the grand Flinders Station, where the metro network connects you to the outer suburbs of Brighton, Williamstown, etc. Travel shops (to book tours) and Grocery shops i.e. Coles & Woolies are 50-100 m away, and everything within the CBD is just walkable (although you could also use the free tram service).
properties.access: As part of the common spaces, you have access to the modern kitchen including the appliances, a shared bathroom and toilet and washing machine. Feel free to lounge on the comfy sofa or enjoy some lovely coffee by the large windows in the living room. The sofa also serves as a double bed which is available for use, if you are more than a couple or you are two people who would like individual bed spaces.
properties.interaction: We enjoy a good chat with our guests, and would be happy to share our local knowledge. But if you prefer your privacy, we respect that and would gladly give you your space. Our professional work keeps us busy during the week and we love exploring Melbourne in the evenings, thus many times you will have the house to yourselves, especially during the day. You would mostly interact with me (Varun) and at times with my partner.
properties.house_rules: Our home is a quiet apartment in a residential premise. We encourage guests to be relaxed, take it easy and preferably keep the parties to the neighbourhoods' lively bars and nightclubs. Also we want to have a smoke free atmosphere to allow true relaxation.
properties.host_about: Moved to Melbourne early 2013, and I have thoroughly enjoyed the experience so far. The people are friendly, multi-cultural and the city is an epicurean getaway to a host of cuisines. And the weather keeps you guessing.

properties.neighborhood_overview: (URL HIDDEN) If you love loafers then pack your bags and come to stay! This Melbourne suburb is so very comfortable! Hawthorn is a riverside suburb where northside grit meets southside grace! From professionals to hipsters and families to students it is as diverse as they come but with a welcoming nature inviting to anyone, both visitors and residents.  Our house is perfectly located for you to enjoy and explore abundant restaurants, cute bars, and shopping. Easy walking distance (15 minutes) to a range of cafes, pubs and restaurants, the cinema and the fresh food market, open 5 days a week. The nearest wine bar and local fish and chips are just 2 minutes walk away! Auburn Village, a short stroll away down one of the finest residential strips in Melbourne, is an untouched strip dotted with boutiques and cafes for the sophisticated and friendly clientele that will keep you coming back. A perfect spot to spend a weekend brunching, riverside walking or hitting the shops.  Also in easy wal
properties.transit: Walk or tram to shops, bars & restaurants in Camberwell (Burke Road), Auburn Village, Canterbury (Maling Road). Camberwell station is 15 minutes walk from the house; train to the CBD (city) is 15 minutes. Tram stops are 5 minutes walk from the house. Tram to the house is Tram 72 which runs from Melbourne University to Camberwell, trams commence in Swanston Street near Faraday Street (University of Melbourne) and run via Swanston Street (City), St Kilda Road (Domain Interchange), Commercial Road, Malvern Road and Burke Road to terminate near Cotham Road (Kew). Coming from the city get off at tram stop number 67 and walk 5 minutes to the house.
properties.access: Guests will have access to everything in the house, except one room (not listed above). The kitchen is very well equipped.

I was born in the UK but moved to Melbourne with my family in the late 90's and now call this home. Since then i have been a full time mother and housewife leaving behind a successful career in marketing and design. I love to cook and am amazing housekeeper (like scary efficiency!!) so you'll be guaranteed a clean, well kept place to stay as my guest.

The most important things in my life are my family, my friends, good food, good company, good wine - what more could I need?

Full laundry facilities with washer and dryer. Linen, Shampoo, Conditional, Body wash, body lotion, Hair dryer and towels are also supplied. There is a living room available for your use if you would like a little more space equipped with TV. Also, Fresh linen, towels, body wash,body lotion, shampoo and conditioner are complimentary. NO CARPET NO SWEAT-  We have wooden floor in the flat which is uncommon in Melbourne. If you are not a big fan of carpet which most of Melbourne apartments have, our place is right for you. No need to sweat when you spill some drops of wine or etc on the floor. properties.neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is very welcoming to everyone. The area is great for walks, bicycling, or shopping.  We are in the central business district close to most things. We love that we are close to most things people want to see. If they have to get around it is very easy with all kinds of transit. In close proximity to: * Southern Cross Station * Melbourne Convention and Exhibition Centre * Crown Casino * Eureka Skydeck * Melbourne Aquarium * Shopping Centres and Factory Outlets * Southbank * Flinders Street Station * Docklands * Immigration museum * Etc It doesn't get any better than this when it comes to ease of access to all this fantastic city has to offer.
properties.notes: 1. Cereals/muesli with small milk will be provided for breakfast. We found that people have different preference over milk like organic milk, full cream, skinny, soy milk, etc and would like to avoid milk wastage for environment.  There are two 24/7 convenience stores near by the building. Asian grocery and other super markets are in walking distance. 2. Please return Myki cards( public transport cards) before check-out :) *For those who intend to live in Melbourne for a while. In the past, we had many guests who stayed in our place before they rented their own place for a long term. we are really happy to be your first friends in this amazing city and help you understand how banking, rental, and etc work in Australia when you check in or over dinner or drinks outside if you would like.
properties.transit: There are two main tram services just outside the door. On Flinders street you can catch tram 70, 75, and city circle. On Spencer street you can get the 109,96, and 12 trams. Southern Cross station is only about 8 minute walk. Transport in this location is perfect in the city and is also Free trams in the (Free Tram Zone). You don't need a ticket if you are only traveling in the CBD (Central Business District ).
properties.access: It is your home while you stay here. Feel free to use anything you can find in the flat like a hair dryer, a dishwasher, toaster, kitchen, a laundry machine, a dryer, a vacuum cleaner and etc. Also, Fresh linen, towels, body wash,body lotion, shampoo and conditioner are complimentary.
properties.interaction: Hi - we are Adam and Ally, great to meet you! We like to think of ourselves as an unlikely couple; international, and well-travelled. It is our hope that you will make the most of your visit. We used Airbnb on our travels to great success and are delighted to offer up this beautiful apartment as hosts. We live close by and are happy to assist in person, over the phone, via SMS or email.
properties.house_rules: - Please NO ADDITIONAL GUESTS apart from those listed in the booking.  - We have very good neighbours and would like to keep a good relationship with them so please NO PARTIES AND AND NO AUDIBLE NOISE. - SORRY.. NO PETS. - Please TURN OFF lights and air-conditioning or heating before going out.  - Additional cleaning fee may apply if the apartment is left in an unacceptable condition - ENJOY YOUR STAY IN MELBOURNE! :-) Thank you for helping us keep this flat fantastic!
properties.host_about:
Hello everyone :-)

We are an easygoing international couple who like eating good food and socialising with people. 
Whenever we travel we always use Airbnb to get some local advice and an interaction with local hosts. We are well-traveled so we know needs of our guests while traveling.  We are happy to help our guests to have a good stay and enrich their experience in Melbourne. 

I, Ally, am from South Korea originally and have many hospitality experiences in Hotels, cafes, Restaurants, Stadiums. Also, I sell few items via my website or other online shopping platforms so I am always looking for unique ideas or items :-)    
I can speak English and Korean.   

Adam is from Austria (Small but beautiful country next to Germany and Switzerland in Europe) but he is a half Australian too( His father is Austrian and mother is Australian ). Adam is studying computer science and working as a software engineer in art-oriented IT company.  
He can speak English and German( Understand a little bit of french and Russian too)
   
We have been in Melbourne for many years so we feel we are locals here.

We love Airbnb because Airbnb has been letting us to make some friends and learn new culture by hosting our guests.

We can not wait to share information about Melbourne with our guests!

properties.neighborhood_overview: Maidstone is multi-cultural, close to the city and has easy access to Melbourne and Victoria's great attractions. Remember Melbourne is continually rated as one of the world's most liveable cities. We are very proud of her.
properties.notes: This space is ideal for Business Travellers: laptop friendly workspaces, large number of double power-points, fast wifi/internet accessible throughout the apartment, clothes hangers, iron and ironing board,  hairdryer, hand and body wash, shampoo, conditioner etc., and a secure off-street garage, and a second off-street car park.  A 24-hour check-in service is also available.
properties.transit: 3 Buses stop within 500 metres of the apartment. Bus directly to the city: 500 metres away. Bus to Footscray railway station (then train onto the city): 100 metres away Bus to Highpoint Shopping Complex: next door (and opposite). We are 10 minutes drive to the M1 highway that takes you to:  - Avalon Airport, Geelong, West Coast: Great Ocean Road, Lorne, Anglesea, Bells Beach, Torquay, and Queenscliff. Geelong (Victoria's second largest city) is 68 km or 55 minutes away. - Or take the M1 to the other side of Melbourne via the Monash Freeway or Nepean Highway. Why not head over to see the penguins at Phillip Island?  15 minutes drive to the M8 highway that takes you to Ballarat (Sovereign Hill, Kryal Castle) and Daylesford. Ballarat is 100 km or 1 hour drive away. Bendigo is 145 km away via M8 and then the Calder Highway.
properties.access: You will have access to a secure undercover car park and an extra off-street car space (2 spaces in total), access to the entire apartment, bathroom, fridge, washing machine, dishwasher, 2 clothes lines , wifi internet and tv.
properties.interaction: We will try to greet and welcome you, but on occasions may not be able to, due to work commitments. 24-hour check-in also available. You can contact us on our mobile phone numbers if you have any queries during your stay.
properties.house_rules: We only accept bookings from people who have completed the airbnb verification process with a minimum 3 forms of verification, including at least 1 off-line form of government-issued identification.  We will require you to present your passport or photo identity at the time of check-in (or earlier, by prior arrangement), for security purposes.  As this is one of 5 apartments in a residential neighbourhood, we require you to be respectful to neighbours, and please no loud music or noise after 11 pm. No additional guests are allowed without prior permission. There is a cleaning fee charged for general cleaning of the property after your departure, however in order for us to keep this fee at a minimum, we ask that you leave the property tidy by removing all excess rubbish/recycling that does not fit into the Yellow and Red-top bins, clearing the fridge and washing and drying dishes.  Out of courtesy to other guests, please do not put cigarette butts into the  bins inside the apartment.  A
properties.host_about:
I live in Geelong, but have an apartment in Melbourne (one of the world's most liveable cities).
I have had some wonderful European vacations with my husband and adult children where we visited the homes of our ancestors and where we enjoyed the sights, sounds, flavors and history of Italy, France, Spain, U.K, and Ireland. We have stayed in 13 Airbnb properties in 5 countries and have loved feeling much more connected with the local experience.
We are food and wine lovers who are musicians and keen walkers. Love musical comedies, jazz, rock and light opera. 
We look forward to welcoming you to our Melbourne!

properties.neighborhood_overview: Sleeping up to 6 adults, you are on the doorstep of all of Melbourne's best attractions.  Located on the corner of City Road and Clarendon Street, behind the Crown Entertainment Complex, with the 12 tram at your front door, you would be hard pressed to find a better location for your Melbourne stay! 5 minute walk to Melbourne’s best restaurants at Crown, Southgate & the new Southwharf precinct or stroll across the river into the CBD where the options are endless. Or walk southwards along Clarendon street to all the smaller restaurants with a multitude of culinary options. Like to shop? Southwharf DFO and the iconic South Melbourne Market are all a walk away as well the gorgeous little shops in Clarendon Street & Conventry Street, South Melbourne. The 12 tram will take you to Brunswick Street, Fitzroy one way & Fitzroy Street, St Kilda the other. Need to be close to the Melbourne Convention Centre? The apartment is 450m away!  F1 Fan? 1.2kms straight down Clarendon Street to the Albert

Similarly, breakages or maintenance issues should be advised so we can attend to the issue immediately.
properties.host_about: Thank you for visiting this property. We are professionals and run several businesses.  As private landlords we own a number of upmarket rental properties (some tenanted long term). Our private clients and colleagues rent from us regularly and we are selective about tenancy. We also have a strong following of regular and return visit Airbnb clients. We tend to add value to a stay rather than provide large discounts. If your dates are not available please always feel free to make an enquiry as we have several properties listed on Airbnb. We look forward to your visit and making your stay in Melbourne a memorable one. We are also honoured to be asked to co-host other properties to help hosts new to Airbnb.

properties.neighborhood_overview: The apartment being 50 meters from Bourke Street Mall, everything is walking distance.  You can take an easy walk through the grand old Royal Arcade to Centre Place filled with street art and tiny lunch spots and onto Degraves st laneway bars and cafes, when you come out of Degraves you're at Flinders st station, cross the road to Federation Square.   Or walk from Bourke St Mall through Myer to the Emporium to Melbourne Central to the State Library of Victoria or QV.   There's a tourist information both in Bourke St Mall (within 100 meters of the apartment) if you need to find out any information about Melbourne or run out of ideas of what to do.  You can't beat the location.

properties.transit: From Melbourne Airport: - The best way is to get the SkyBus Express bus, which operates every 10 minutes all day, every day. One-way tickets are 19 for adults. After you arrive in Southern Cross station, you can take the free hotel shuttle bus from there, to 'City Edge apt hotel', then you'll arrive in my street.  'City Edge apt hotel' is just cross street of our building. - There is also a public bus service, which takes 45 minutes and 2 buses, for around 8. A top up ‘Myki’ card can be purchased on the bus, which is used for all public trains, trams and buses in Victoria. - A taxi will take about 30 minutes, depending on traffic, and should cost around 60.

- Started as an Airbnb host since I was in Paris many years ago.
- We're happy to make a lot of new friends from all over the world! 
- Like to take a lot of photos 
- Hang out with friends 
- Learn new words!

properties.neighborhood_overview: City centre location – free tram zone - on LaTrobe St between William & Queen Sts - in the heart of the legal district (so its quiet enough to get a good nights sleep!). properties.transit: Trams stop out front of the apartment (its free to ride within the CBD). Access the Melbourne city loop underground rail system via Flagstaff station 1 minute away or Melbourne Central station 1 block away in the other direction. Car Rental: there are 4 car rental companies located in Franklin St - just one block away.

properties.neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located on one of Melbourne's premier inner city streets with cafes, and other amenities (including a post office) at your doorstep.  Both of the city's main train stations are within a few minutes for easy access to and from the airport. I am happy to recommend great places for coffee and eating in the area. Check out my guestbook guide for a selection of places to eat, shop and see in the area. Melbourne is one of the world's great food and coffee cities so don't miss trying the many amazing options!
properties.transit: The apartment is located within Melbourne's inner-city free tram zone. There is a tram stop a few paces from the front entrance of the building. Myki travel cards are also provided (to save you buying at 6 per card) for travel outside of the free tram zone - for tram or train. Most of Melbourne's inner city attractions are a short walk away and both of the city's main train stations are close by for journeys to regional Victorian cities on VLine fast trains - I am happy to  help with advice on traveling. For life and sightseeing in inner city and surrounding inner suburbs of Melbourne there is really no need for a car, and no car space is provided. Bike hire is also close by - and a day along the bike paths is a great way to see the city. Please note that no parking is provided.
properties.access: The  apartment living areas, kitchen and bathroom facilities are all shared  spaces with myself  - you are welcome to relax, prepare meals (thoughI prefer that guests don't cook with oil - and make yourself comfortable.  You are also welcome to use all cookware, TV  etc. Make yourself at home!
properties.interaction: I am very busy and work for myself so am in for the whole day some days, other times am out and about! Always available to help with any queries you may have. I occasionally cook on weekends you are welcome to share a meal, but you will also fall in love with the fantastic eating options and great coffee everywhere in this food oriented city!
properties.house_rules: Please clean up after yourself in the kitchen and keep bathroom clean. Guests are not required to do anything with their linen after use, nor to do the larger cleaning jobs. This will be done for you as part of the cleaning fee. Keep noise levels low (no parties) and please respect the space and other residents in the building. No smoking thanks.
properties.host_about: A travel lover myself, I love to host people wherever I am in the world. I have been living and working in China for three years - in Nanjing and Shanghai - and my life continues to be a "Tale of Two (Great Design) Cities" - Shanghai for business, friends and pleasure, and Melbourne  which is my home and family base. Professionally I am a Landscape Architect, an artist, writer and photographer. Along with architecture and design I have a passion for great food and coffee - see my blog 'Letters from Cafe Noir'  for more tips on great coffee in Melbourne -  Australia's Coffee and Culture Capital!! I look forward to meeting you and to sharing my  spaces in Melbourne's fabulous CBD.

properties.neighborhood_overview: You're right in the heart of Melbourne and there's plenty of brochures in the apartment to show you what's around.
properties.transit: The apartment is located in a FREE tram zone which covers most of the city center (be careful to check where the zone starts/stops - there's a brochure in the apartment for this).  There is also a free 'City Circle' tram which is lovely old tram and a nice way to tour around the outside of the city and hop on/off for free. Outside of the free tram zone you need a MYKI (transport) card for Public Transport around Melbourne, these can be purchased from Southern Cross Station across the road (there's often spares in the apartment for you to borrow so check there before you buy!). Alternately, 5-10min walk in any direction will almost always get you where you're wanting to go! We also highly recommend UBER as opposed to taxis (and more specifically UberX which is cheaper than a taxi) to use this you must download the 'Uber' App onto your phone and set up an account.  After setting up an account go to 'promotions' and enter 07rxn as a promo code to get 10 off your first ride - WINNING! If
properties.access: Fresh towels are provided on arrival and we have supplied shampoo, conditioner, body wash and hand soap too.   You'll find the washing machine/clothes dryer in the bathroom which you are welcome to use. In the kitchen there are some basics to get you started - milk, sugar, tea and coffee - there is also a coffee machine (with milk frother!) for your official daily caffeine fix (although there are plenty of coffee shops nearby too).  If you feel like cooking, there are plenty of utensils and gadgets as well as a few condiments and items such as salt and pepper.       If want to burn off a few of the extra calories or just keep fit during your stay have access to the building's onsite gym and pool/spa area too!
properties.interaction: As seasoned airbnb hosts and true Melbournians we absolutely love to share our knowledge and give you guidance wherever we can.   Please let us know if there's anything special you would like to do or see during your stay as we would be happy to recommend some amazing places to eat, drink and explore or even day trips to go on if you wish to see the Penguin Parade or the famous Great Ocean Road and 12 Apostles.   The apartment has a number of brochures to help you out too.
properties.house_rules: Whilst we want you to enjoy your stay as much as possible and feel at home, we do ask that you respect some basic rules in our home: Please treat our home like you would your own in terms of cleanliness and respect. Check-in is strictly between 2pm and 10pm. For check-in between 10pm & 12am a one off fee of 44 applies; for check-in between 12am & 2am a fee of 66 applies outside of these times require prior agreement only.   Please advise us of your expected arrival time as early as possible and notify us of any changes to this.  Please enquire if you wish to check-in early and we will attempt to accommodate where possible, alternately we can guide you to suitable luggage storage facilities nearby in the interim. Please be respectful of our lovely neighbours and keep noise to a minimum after 10pm, and before 8am. Noise complaints from our neighbours will result in immediate eviction and you forfeiting your security deposit.  Only registered guests are permitted in the apartment unless
properties.host_about:
Lovers of fine wine, fabulous food and travel -  often found hunting down the best eats in town whether it's fine dining or that quirky little local restaurant that's not to be missed! 

Also fitness fanatics so when food's not involved we'll be found hitting the gym or heading out for a run where for Sarah it's as much about the social side as keeping fit and healthy!

We're generally quite social and love a chat and good laugh, and when it comes to traveling are as happy camping as five-starring it.

This tram will take you down stylish Collins St and past the "Paris end" where the designer stores are.  This tram is also free around the CBD precinct
properties.access: By staying at the apartment, you will have access to the gym, sauna and pool  on level 2 (opening hours 6am to 11pm).  There is a common room on level 6 to relax and mingle.
properties.interaction: I have a few properties so there is a good chance i'll be in the complex if you want to have a chat or need help :)  I love meeting new people and having a chat. I also am respectful of guests privacy so if they just wish to rent the apartment and be left to their own devices, happy with that too!

properties.neighborhood_overview: The apartment is perfectly located on the corner of McKillop and Little Collins Streets. A short stroll in either direction will lead you to Melbourne’s renowned laneways, hip cafes, hidden bars, pre-eminent restaurants and shopping precinct.  The Arts Precinct, Federation Square and Melbourne’s sporting venues are also located within walking distance .. nothing is too far away!
properties.transit: Trams and trains are at your doorstep to transport you to the surrounding suburbs of Fitzroy, Collingwood, Richmond or to the beach side suburb of St Kilda. I provide guests with a myki (my-key) re-usable smart card for public transport  for use during your stay which you can top up  as needed. Starting 1 January 2015 there is a new free tram zone around the Melbourne CBD which is a bonus for guests.
properties.interaction: My aim is to greet guests on arrival as it's  always a pleasure to meet new airbnb members. I am more than happy to assist  guests with information and provide recommendations and suggestions from good places to eat, things to see, what tram to catch and any other Melbourne related questions you may have.
properties.house_rules: Please be respectful of my home and belongings and take care to leave the  apartment in the same condition that you found it. Please limit Wi-Fi to email & internet access only downloads for movies/music etc may be charged for additional usage. Smoking is not allowed in the apartment, however guests can smoke outside on the balcony. I am unable to accommodate pets in the apartment. Please contact me to ask about something if you don't know how it works or need advise.

properties.host_about:
Hi Everyone,
 I wish you will go through all my listings, 
https://www.airbnb.com.au/rooms/1747852
https://www.airbnb.com.au/rooms/1863200
https://www.airbnb.com.au/rooms/2327860
https://www.airbnb.com.au/rooms/8341907
https://www.airbnb.com.au/rooms/11656757


Being a Airbnb , it is been almost 3 years. I love being a host, because I know that when people, different group of people and family they came to our place, when they feel, it is worth it. I love it and enjoy. That's the happiness that other job may not able to find it. I really love to see when my guests they start to step to the apartment and feel wow and impressed.
Honestly, being a host, it is not easy decision.
We have to make sure every details things in our place are the best to our guests. 
From check-in to check-out. It is an experience not only for guests. it is for us as well. It is the whole responsibilities. 

That’s what I think, the reason which motivates me to be a host.

Melbourne is a very multi-cultural city 
My objective is, if someone come here they should be connected to the right place.
Me, as a host, I think is kind of connecting these different peice together, a kind of connection.
The high point of my stay was how you made me feel. And how you made me feel, it sticks. It sticks with you.”
I have the traditional way to believe.
We believe it is the relationship that provide to the guests they will enjoy,  love the place to stay.
They trust me and I trust them. And that’s the reason it works.
So hospitalities if you ask me, is about care. It s about welcoming. This is about welcoming with open heart.  Welcome you to my Melbourne Apartment.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Our home is located in the heart of the CBD, within walking distance to all amenities. It is located next to many major tram lines and Flinders St station (with trains to everywhere else) is opposite. We are located within the Melbourne CBD free tram zone which means all trams within the city are free for you to use.  There is a Woolworths express shopping centre at the bottom of our building on Flinders street as well as a BWS liquor store.  On Degraves Street itself, you will find many restaurants, cafes, coffee shops, donuts/cupcakes and speciality boutiques. At the end of the Street you will find a money exchange. You are located a skip away from Melbourne's most iconic laneway, Hosier lane that boasts some of the best street art that Australia has to offer. We are also right next to Federation Square for other dining and extensive entertainment options many of which are free.  For the best food - Enjoy Movida Restaurant, Chin Chins, CODA, The Press Club plus many more on your door

properties.host_about:
I'm an Australian now living in a beautiful city apartment near the heart of Melbourne - I've lived all over the world and spent 12 years in Asia (South Korea, Thailand and Indonesia).  I love music, theatre, scrabble and books.  But most of all, I love my beautiful toy poodle, Coco!
As you can probably tell from guest feedback, I consider it a privilege to host people from all over the world in my various apartments and try to make each experience memorable for all the right reasons.  I've been doing this for more than seven years so I hope you appreciate the little differences that such experience means to my guests.
To help you enjoy your next visit, I'm happy to know of any individual requirements and I will try to accommodate them.
As you've probably guessed, I'm a passionate fan of Melbourne so I've put together a list of personal favourites to help you experience this amazing, beautiful and vital city from an insiders perspective.

properties.name: Bright, Light & Chic, Opposite Federation Square.
properties.summary: A freshly renovated, squeaky clean, bright, light, stylish and relaxing apartment in the absolute centre of Melbourne CBD. Opposite Flinders Street Station and Federation Square, with free trams outside the door, and walking distance to restaurants, galleries, sports, shopping and more.
properties.space: This beautiful quiet apartment is in the very heart of bustling busy Melbourne City. It is opposite Flinders Street Station and Federation Square, with free trams outside the front door, and walking distance to the MCG, Galleries, Flinders Lane restaurants, shopping and the Casino. There is an Indian restaurant in the building, a 24 hour convenience store next door, the Yarra River out the front, and EVERYTHING is walking distance.
properties.description: A freshly renovated, squeaky clean, bright, light, stylish and relaxing apartment in the absolute centre of Melbourne CBD. This beautiful quiet apartment is in the very heart of bustling busy Melbourne City. It is opposite Flinders Street Station and Federation Square, with free trams outside the front door, and walking distance to the MCG, Galleries, Flinders Lane restaurants, shopping and the Casino. There is an Indian restaurant in the building, a 24 hour convenience store next door, the Yarra River out the front, and EVERYTHING is walking distance. You'll have full and private access to the apartment, as well as shared access to the facilities in the basement, which include a huge TV, Foxtel, billiard table, meeting room, bike storage, coin laundry and drinks vending machine. The apartment is extremely secure; you'll ne
properties.neighborhood_overview: This apartment is in the middle of everything; opposite Flinders Street Station, Federation Square and St Paul's Cathedral, and a few doors down from Young and Jacksons. Funky Degraves Street is handy for breakfast, you can walk to NGV, Southbank, The Bourke Street Mall, Emporium, Melbourne Central, and QV shopping precincts. The MCG is very close Crown Casino is just down the river, and you can tram or train to anywhere from just outside the door.  For dining out, there are many restaurants in Fed Square. Chin Chin, Cumulus Inc, the Movidas and Tonka are all very close, and  Grossi Florentino, Vue de Monde, and the China Town and Hardware Lane restaurant precincts are within stroll-home distance.  Although the building is in the heart of the action, the apartment has a quiet outlook onto Flinders Lane, and is quite high up (level 11). There is little street or city noise to interrupt your sleep. There's a 24 hour Convenience Store right out the front.
properties.notes: The kitchen has basics for independent cooking. No-one ever does, though... it's the middle of Melbourne! There is a Nespresso coffee machine and pods, a brimming bowl of coffee sachets, tea bags, hot chocolate chai, etc, on the bench, some cereals and snacks in the pantry, and fresh milk, butter, and basics in the fridge. There will be clean towels, body and hand wash, and shampoo and conditioner for you to use, plus a cabinet full of the sorts of things that are handy in a bathroom, in case you've forgotten an essential. Please be aware that the apartment is studio style - that is, there is no separate bedroom. The bed configuration is; one brand new Miracoil pillow top double bed, the 3 seater feather couch made up into a single bed, if you are a threesome, plus a high quality auto-inflate single bed made up and ready, if there are 4 of you. If you are a twosome but require separate beds, please contact me for pricing.
properties.transit: Trams are free in the CBD, and you're staying on the corner of the two main thoroughfares of Melbourne (Flinders and Swanston Streets) so just hop on one that is heading in the right direction. Flinders Street Train Station, Melbourne's oldest and grandest, is right opposite, and Southern Cross Train Station (where Skybus from the airport arrives) is a few blocks away. Let me know if you'd like me to leave Myki's (the public transport top-up ticketing cards) for you to use during your stay, to take trains out of the city, and I will explain how they work. Skybus from Tullamarine Airport runs every 10 minutes, and costs 19 one way. Please ask for directions and instructions if you plan to use this, and I will advise. A taxi from the airport will cost about 55 There are many carparks very close to the apartment, and they will cost from 15 per day on the weekend to about 70 per day during the week. Please plan carefully, and study the price list completely, before you use any of them,
properties.access: You'll have full and private access to the apartment, as well as shared access to the facilities in the basement, which include a huge TV, Foxtel, billiard table, meeting room, bike storage, coin laundry and drinks vending machine. The apartment is extremely secure; you'll need a magnetic fob to get into the building, and a programmed swipe to get into the apartment. These are very time consuming and expensive to replace, so any loses will incur a 100 deduction from your security deposit. Please be careful.
properties.interaction: I respond to Airbnb messages immediately, and am always available if you want tips, advice or help. Otherwise, I'll leave you to enjoy the apartment as if it is your own, and Melbourne as if you live here.
properties.house_rules: Please take good care of the apartment, it's fixtures and fittings, and report any damage or concerns as soon as they are evident. Unreported breakages or significant mis-use repair costs will be deducted from your security deposit. The apartment was renovated in January 2017, and everything is new, clean and working.  Please turn lights and heater or air-con off as you leave, take all your things and leave the apartment as close as possible to the state you found it in.  The apartment swipe key and magnetic fob are very particularly recorded and programmed, toward providing high level security. Both are expensive and time consuming to replace, and loses will incur a 100 deduction from your security bond. Please be careful! Only booked guests may stay in the apartment. No extra guests without prior arrangement, and certainly no parties. Strictly no smoking in the apartment.

properties.summary: Level 28 top floor art-inspired newly completed penthouse, boasting an unobstructed view of the Yarra River and Port Phillip Bay. A tram stop within the Free Tram Zone right at your doorstep, short stroll to Crown and Southern Cross Station. Check-in/out terms and conditions under House Rules.
properties.space: Spread over Level 28 and 29, the top two levels of the building, this penthouse boasts unobstructed views of the Yarra River, Port Phillip Bay and the Dandenong Ranges. Housed within a newly completed building along Flinders Street, complementing the exceptional views is the thoughtfully decorated art-inspired interior of the penthouse. The walls around the penthouse are adorned with a collection of original oil paintings by talented Australian artists - Ben Tankard, Niki McDonald, Michelle Avery and Cherry Demir. The penthouse features two bedrooms, one on Level 28 and the other on Level 29, offering maximum privacy and is the perfect accommodation for 2 couples. Both bedrooms have ensuite bathrooms and if you have visiting guests, there is also a powder room available for their use. We provide professionally laundered fresh towels, hand towels, bed linens and premium Crabtree & Evelyn bathroom amenities. properties.host_about:
Inspired by and dedicated to Australian contemporary artists, Canvas Suites aims to provide boutique hospitality experience to our guests. Each of our Suites are handpicked, acquired and directly owned by Canvas Suites before being meticulously prepared and setup as the place our guests call home when in Melbourne.

At Canvas Suites, we believe that no visit to a place is complete without immersing oneself in its unique culture and central to any culture is its art. We view each of our art-inspired Suites as carefully curated galleries with walls adorned by original Australian works of art which our guests may enjoy in private during their stay.

But great spaces with great art do not by themselves create great hospitality experience. We know what counts for our guests to have a great stay in Melbourne – a friendly face to meet them, top-of-the-line chiropedic beds made with pristine sheets, the towels and toiletries taken care of to our exacting standards. We also know that our guests want the space and freedom to experience what Melbourne has to offer at their own pace. So we are available 24/7 for when our guests need us, but we step back when they do not.

This apartment is centrally located in the heart of Melbourne's CBD where you can just walk into a bustling and vibrant city to the shops, restaurants and entertainment areas. The apartment is family friendly and wheelchair accessible. properties.host_about:
We are a happily married couple with a son named Justin who is 3 years old and a daughter, Chloe who is 8 months old. We love getting away travelling and attending events. We enjoy using AirBnb when travelling because it allows us to communicate with a local and the accommodation makes us feel at home and suits our needs with 2 small children. When we went to Europe in 2013 we used AirBnB to find accommodation in Spain (Barcelona, Madrid, San Sebastian and Valencia) in UK (Bath, Kensington and Plymonth) and in Malta. We met some lovely people and had some great experiences, and would definitely use Airbnb for our future travels.

As AirBnb hosts we enjoy meeting people from around the world who come to visit this great city of ours. We hope to provide our guests with a welcoming, relaxing and positive experience and we hope they enjoy our apartment just as much as we do!

It has a open plan living area including the lounge with a full kitchen, a sleeping loft, dinning area, laundry facilities and a functional shower room.  I have a full size double bed in my apartment for the first 2 guests and a sofa bed which pulls out into another double size bed for 2 more guests (3rd and 4th guests), convenient for those who are travelling on a budget. properties.neighborhood_overview: Melbourne City - voted one of the most liveable city in the world!  You will be in the heart of the CBD right opposite the Southern Cross Station, which is the main hub connecting to the Melbourne International and Domestic Airport, Interstate trains, Bus terminal, Tourism departure point and lots more! Want to explore the city? The location is pretty much close to everything! China town, Crown Casino, Etihad Stadium, Docklands shopping area, Direct Factory Outlet (DFO), tonnes of Cafes and restaurants and heaps more!  Feel a bit Lazy to walk? Tram stop is right in front of the building and the best part is, it is FREE for those who are only travelling around the city! My apartment is well within the Free Tram Zone so it has the added advantage for your convenience! Rental car? No problems! As there are heaps of leasing company right opposite my building (in Southern Cross Station).  Want to take a punt? Crown Casino is just down the road and they operate 24x7! Good luck if you plan to
properties.notes: Linens and towels are provided and cleaners are engaged to clean and thoroughly inspect my place between each stay.  Basic toiletries are provided including towels for each guest.  Complimentary Tea and Coffee are provided too.  Please turn on the rangehood and open window if you cook because the smoke/fire alarm is rather sensitive ABSOLUTELY NO SMOKING inside the apartment, No loud music, No parties of any sort.
properties.transit: Southern Cross Station (main station/transport hub) is just opposite of the apartment, from there you can take SKY bus to the airport, V Line to go by train to country Victoria, Metro train to most suburbs in Melbourne or tram around town.  Apartment is located in the FREE TRAM zone within the Melbourne CBD, literally just outside the building. Just look out for the "FREE tram zone" signs. HOW TO GET HERE? Take a train, tram, bus or taxi and hear towards the Southern Cross Station. Southern Cross Station is located on the western end of the heart of Melbourne CBD grid.  The station is also the main transport hub so it is super convenient and great place to get around!   The apartment is right at the corner of Spencer Street and Little Bourke Street, Melbourne.  For public transport information visit: 'Public Transport Victoria' (Click on the 'Journey Planner' tab and select Southern Cross Station as your destination) From Melbourne Tullamarine Airport? There are three restaurants on-site on the ground floor including an Asian (PHO24), Modern Australian (Higher Grounds) and Breakfast/Grill trendy cafe (Pretty Mama) which all scores very highly amongst Melburnians.
properties.interaction: I am available to answer your queries via Airbnb messaging, SMS or email, and there is also a 24 hours building manager at the ground floor who are able to help you in cases of emergency. Rest be assure that if you message me via Airbnb, my reply is almost instantaneous most of the time. Feel free to drop me a line or questions about anything in Melbourne and I will be happy to help as your local friend or guide.  Also check out my local Guidebook in Airbnb so you can try the many restaurants and Cafés that locals frequent in Melbourne.  I will also be providing you with a 'House Manual' when you book the place and there are Contact phone numbers and Emergency Contact numbers too.
