Fantastic little Espresso bar (Bonnie Coffee) for coffee, pastries and newspapers  in the morning also opposite our building. There's a dry cleaner one block away in Flinders Lane. Endota Spa is also literally around the corner for massages, facials, etc, There's also Barre classes (Aleenta Barre) in the same building if you feel like a work out!
properties.transit: Our apt is in the free tram zone so hop on a tram and explore. There is a tram stop outside the building. Melbourne's central train station is just a couple of blocks away in Flinders Street.  There's car parking on the other side of our street. The rates are on the board out the front. A couple of other parking options are nearby in Flinders Street and Flinders Lane as well.

properties.host_about:
Welcome to Melbourne!

This is the city we live, play and work, it's incredibly beautiful, vibrant and diverse!

Imagine a city where nobody is judged by the color of their skin, the money they make, their religion, address or sexual preference. Imagine a city where people relate to each other as one big community. 

That's what we're out to find out....

properties.space: Wake up and smell the coffee on iconic Degraves St!  This dual level loft style apartment is stylishly furnished and is located in one of Melbourne's most famous laneways.  Flinders St train station, Federation Square and the banks of the Yarra river are right at your doorstep too. Inside, the well appointed kitchen features European appliances - including a dishwasher, stone bench top and a pantry with provisions.   The king size bedroom includes a hardwood king size bed and is accessible on the mezzanine level via the spiral staircase off the living area.   The lounge room features a soft leather couch that also doubles as a sofa bed, for additional guests.  Two double ceiling height windows let in filtered light and provide privacy.   A stylish occasional chair and unique artwork complete the comfortable ambience that resonates throughout the apartment. A modern bathroom, including a laundry cupboard with a clothes washer and dryer, and are also available to you.  The apartment has

properties.neighborhood_overview: Only a stones throw from the high end shopping precinct of Collins Street, walking distance to the theatres in Spring, Exhibition and Collins Streets.  The location is ideal for experiencing Melbourne's finest bars and restaurants.   As there are so many within the area I have left a list of my personal favourites in the apartment for your information, feel free to take a copy!
properties.notes: The apartment is located on the 3rd floor and unfortunately there is no lift as it is a National Trust-Registered Building with only 8 apartments.  I guess you could look at it as good exercise! There are facilities to cook with in the apartment which if you decide to use I recommend using the exhaust fan as the building's fire alarm is linked directly to the fire brigade so if the alarm is triggered it can be a costly exercise. I'm a fan of conserving energy so while I provide air conditioning to the property if they are left on after you vacate the apartment there will be an additional charge. The apartment is set up for 4 people but should you require it there is a double sofa bed in the lounge room which accommodates another 2 people. The flat is in walking distance to most places in and around the city and the public transport links are great but if you are driving and need parking there is a 24 hour carpark directly across the street. There is Wifi and Netflix connected for you t
properties.transit: On Bourke Street there are two trams the 96 which will take you to Nicholson Street heading north or St.Kilda beach via the city in the opposite direction and the 86 which will take you to Smith Street, Fitzroy and the City/Docklands in the opposite direction.   Both of these trams will take you to and from Spencer Street station which is where the Skybus arrives and departs for the airport every 10 to 15 minutes. Parliament train station is 50m away at the corner of Bourke and Spring Streets. One block away is Collins Street where you can get the 48 tram to Brunswick Street Taking a tram within the city grid is free, make sure you are aware of where the free tram zone ends as travelling outside this zone without a valid ticket could result in a fine which isn't my idea of a great souvenir!  For public transport in Melbourne we have a smartcard ticketing system called myki. You can use myki to travel on trains, trams and buses. Always remember to touch on and off your myki each time yo

properties.house_rules: I would hope that you treat the apartment with the same respect you would your own home, it is a pretty quiet building and I would also ask that you respect the neighbours during your stay. If there is anything you are unsure of please feel free to contact me about it.

Chu and Maris

properties.summary: The 1BR apartment is a refurnished heritage sanctuary offering the best of both worlds. Perfect for those looking to explore Melbourne without forgoing the luxury of a serene environment.  It features a fully-equipped kitchen, an open-plan dining and living area, a spacious bedroom with a large connecting bathroom accommodating up to 4 guests. Public transport is very accessible, with the nearest tram stop at your doorstep.  Check-in/out terms and conditions under House Rules.
properties.space: The apartment is located within an 1884 brick building on Wills Street, originally used by the Victorian Telephone Exchange Company as Victoria's second telephone exchange from 1884 to 1910, after outgrowing their first exchange.  Recently refurnished with brand new floor boards, paint and kitchen appliances, you may watch the world go by through the heritage sash windows within the comfort offered by the apartment itself.  Complementing the heritage character and charm is the thoughtfully decorated art-inspired interior of the apartment where we hope to welcome like-minded guests who appreciate aesthetics in design, art and the functionality of space. The walls around the apartment collectively act as a carefully curated gallery, showcasing the artworks of various talented Australian artists.  We provide professionally laundered fresh towels, hand towels, bed linens and premium Crabtree & Evelyn bathroom amenities. The bed is complete with four luxurious mini pocket-spring pillows and

properties.host_about:
Inspired by and dedicated to Australian contemporary artists, Canvas Suites aims to provide boutique hospitality experience to our guests. Each of our Suites are handpicked, acquired and directly owned by Canvas Suites before being meticulously prepared and setup as the place our guests call home when in Melbourne.

At Canvas Suites, we believe that no visit to a place is complete without immersing oneself in its unique culture and central to any culture is its art. We view each of our art-inspired Suites as carefully curated galleries with walls adorned by original Australian works of art which our guests may enjoy in private during their stay.

But great spaces with great art do not by themselves create great hospitality experience. We know what counts for our guests to have a great stay in Melbourne – a friendly face to meet them, top-of-the-line chiropedic beds made with pristine sheets, the towels and toiletries taken care of to our exacting standards. We also know that our guests want the space and freedom to experience what Melbourne has to offer at their own pace. So we are available 24/7 for when our guests need us, but we step back when they do not.

My place is comfy and furnished with everyday use amenities, and the building has a pool, gym, sauna, BBQ area, visitor sitting lounge, and also a rock climbing wall! It has a open plan living area including the lounge with a full kitchen, a sleeping loft, dinning area, laundry facilities and a functional shower room.  I have a full size double bed in my apartment for the first 2 guests and a sofa bed which pulls out into another double size bed for 2 more guests (3rd and 4th guests), convenient for those who are travelling on a budget. Else the sofa bed can fit your kids nicely and they may love the novelty of sleeping on a pull out bed :-)

properties.neighborhood_overview: Melbourne City - voted one of the most liveable city in the world!  You will be in the heart of the CBD right opposite the Southern Cross Station, which is the main hub connecting to the Melbourne International and Domestic Airport, Interstate trains, Bus terminal, Tourism departure point and lots more! Want to explore the city? The location is pretty much close to everything! China town, Crown Casino, Etihad Stadium, Docklands shopping area, Direct Factory Outlet (DFO), tonnes of Cafes and restaurants and heaps more!  Feel a bit Lazy to walk? Tram stop is right in front of the building and the best part is, it is FREE for those who are only travelling around the city! My apartment is well within the Free Tram Zone so it has the added advantage for your convenience! Rental car? No problems! As there are heaps of leasing company right opposite my building (in Southern Cross Station).  Want to take a punt? Crown Casino is just down the road and they operate 24x7! Good luck if you plan to
properties.notes: Linens and towels are provided and cleaners are engaged to clean and thoroughly inspect my place between each stay.  Basic toiletries are provided including towels for each guest.  Complimentary Tea and Coffee are provided too.  Please turn on the rangehood and open window if you cook because the smoke/fire alarm is rather sensitive ABSOLUTELY NO SMOKING inside the apartment, No loud music, No parties of any sort.
properties.transit: Southern Cross Station (main station/transport hub) is just opposite of the apartment, from there you can take SKY bus to the airport, V Line to go by train to country Victoria, Metro train to most suburbs in Melbourne or tram around town.  Apartment is located in the FREE TRAM zone within the Melbourne CBD, literally just outside the building. Just look out for the "FREE tram zone" signs. HOW TO GET HERE? Take a train, tram, bus or taxi and hear towards the Southern Cross Station. Southern Cross Station is located on the western end of the heart of Melbourne CBD grid.  The station is also the main transport hub so it is super convenient and great place to get around!   The apartment is right at the corner of Spencer Street and Little Bourke Street, Melbourne.  For public transport information visit: 'Public Transport Victoria' (Click on the 'Journey Planner' tab and select Southern Cross Station as your destination) From Melbourne Tullamarine Airport? No problems!  There are Airport B
properties.access: Please email/sms/message me or you could also ask questions about anything and in cases of emergency or urgent issues, you can ask the building managers on the ground floor. You will be able to access the apartment naturally and also all the Resort Style facilities including the gym, swimming pool, sauna, BBQ and pool side area, business/social lounge and rock climbing wall with the swipe card. There are three restaurants on-site on the ground floor including an Asian (PHO24), Modern Australian (Higher Grounds) and Breakfast/Grill trendy cafe (Pretty Mama) which all scores very highly amongst Melburnians.
properties.interaction: I am available to answer your queries via Airbnb messaging, SMS or email, and there is also a 24 hours building manager at the ground floor who are able to help you in cases of emergency. Rest be assure that if you message me via Airbnb, my reply is almost instantaneous most of the time. Feel free to drop me a line or questions about anything in Melbourne and I will be happy to help as your local friend or guide.  Also check out my local Guidebook in Airbnb so you can try the many restaurants and Cafés that locals frequent in Melbourne.  I will also be providing you with a 'House Manual' when you book the place and there are Contact phone numbers and Emergency Contact numbers too.

properties.name: CBD Art-Inspired Home - Superb Location!
properties.summary: Set in the centre of Melbourne CBD, our 1-bedroom apartment is situated on the 28th floor of an architecturally unique tower, and beautifully furnished with top quality fixtures.  Fantastic spot with tram stops few minutes walk away, on Swanston, Elizabeth & La Trobe St, connecting you to all other parts of the city. Melbourne Central only 5-minute walk away, connecting you to Emporium Melbourne & Bourke Street Shopping Precinct. Check-in/out terms & conditions under House Rules.
properties.space: Recently furnished with top quality furniture and appliances, this centrally located CBD art-inspired home is perfect for solo travelers, couples, and even a group of four or a family with 2 children.  Situated on the 28th floor, the north-facing apartment provides unobstructed high-floor view of Melbourne, giving you an opportunity to wind down from the bustling city. It is a perfect location for those looking for a city getaway.  Complementing this is the thoughtfully decorated art-inspired interior of the apartment where we hope to welcome like-minded guests who appreciate aesthetics in design, art and the functionality of space. The walls around the apartment collectively act as a carefully curated gallery, showcasing the artworks of various talented Australian artists – Lesley Taylor and Lauren Danger.  We provide professionally laundered fresh towels, hand towels, bed linens and premium Crabtree & Evelyn bathroom amenities. The bed is complete with four luxurious mini pocket-spri

properties.neighborhood_overview: Very close to favourite eateries such as Wonderbao, Joomak, Darac Bar & Grill. Within minutes walk to Melbourne Central Shopping Complex and Train Station.
properties.notes: When the reservation is booked for 2 adults, the sofa bed in the living room will not be made up. For the sofa bed to be made up, please kindly select 3 adults. We seek for your understanding that this extra charge is to cover for the linen cost.
properties.transit: There is a tram stop on Swanston St, which is 2-min walk from the apartment.
properties.interaction: We are a team of people who genuinely care to provide you with a flawless stay experience in Melbourne. Do not hesitate to ask us any questions that you may have, we will be more than happy to assist you.
properties.house_rules: Check-in/Check-out: *IMPORTANT* Please enquire to arrange for other check-in times BEFORE booking with us. Late check-in is possible with an extra fee of 25 (after Airbnb service fee would be approximately 30), however it is not guaranteed if not made prior arrangement.  Standard check-in time is 3pm-6pm. Standard check-out time is 10am.  Check-in Procedures:  After confirming your booking, we will be in touch with you to schedule a suitable check-in time. Please ensure your arrival time is reasonably accurate  as our host will be waiting for you at the front of the property on that day. It is possible to arrange early or late check-ins, conditioned upon availability.  A late check-in will incur a fee mentioned above.  Our lovely host will help you settle in and will be able to provide information you need to know about the apartment. For other enquiries during your stay, please contact us directly on Airbnb. Smoking & Drugs: Smoking is strictly prohibited inside the apartment. Guest
properties.host_about:
Inspired by and dedicated to Australian contemporary artists, Canvas Suites aims to provide boutique hospitality experience to our guests. Each of our Suites are handpicked, acquired and directly owned by Canvas Suites before being meticulously prepared and setup as the place our guests call home when in Melbourne.

At Canvas Suites, we believe that no visit to a place is complete without immersing oneself in its unique culture and central to any culture is its art. We view each of our art-inspired Suites as carefully curated galleries with walls adorned by original Australian works of art which our guests may enjoy in private during their stay.

But great spaces with great art do not by themselves create great hospitality experience. We know what counts for our guests to have a great stay in Melbourne – a friendly face to meet them, top-of-the-line chiropedic beds made with pristine sheets, the towels and toiletries taken care of to our exacting standards. We also know that our guests want the space and freedom to experience what Melbourne has to offer at their own pace. So we are available 24/7 for when our guests need us, but we step back when they do not.
properties.street: Central Business District, Melbourne, VIC 3000, Australia

properties.name: The Perfect City Pad -Flinders Lane
properties.summary: Stylish light filled space with mix of contemporary furniture in a quiet block converted from a 1940s textiles factory.
properties.space: Spacious, spotless 2 bedroom space featuring 4.2m ceilings and huge windows running down the whole length of the apartment. Huge bedroom with QS bed, crisp sheets and lots of closet space. Second large bedroom, DS bed, with original warehouse windows. Big bathroom with a big shower. WiFi, TV, ipod/iphone player, washer & dryer, fully equipped kitchen. Complete with a welcome pack - like your very own boutique hotel! Security entrance with lift access (although it is up 10 steps from ground) to level two of this 4 level boutique block. Located at the top end of the CBD in famous Flinders Lane. Minutes away are some of the city's best restaurants (Cumulus, MamaSita, NamaNama, ChinChin, The European), art galleries (ArcOne, FlindersLaneGallery, Craft Victoria, Anna Schwartz) and Kino arthouse cinema, with Treasury and Fitzroy Gardens less than 50m from your door.  In the heart of Melbourne but at the quieter top end of the city - we are only 10 minutes walk from the major shopping precinc

properties.host_about:

properties.neighborhood_overview: Melbourne is an eclectic and vibrant city where there's lots to do and plenty to see. Near the apartment complex you'll find some of Melbourne best Korean BBQ restaurants! Across the road is a large Coles supermarket where you can grab most things, as well as an Asian Grocer. There's also another Asian Grocer directly downstairs to the building and a 711 across the road.  Just a stroll away there are plenty of restaurants, cafes and small eateries. Wander down to DFO Southwharf and you'll find plenty of eateries and bars. Walk towards the central CBD to visit Emporium shopping centre or catch a movie at Melbourne Central. Southbank can be accessed by tram or enjoy the walk on foot down Spencer Street.
properties.notes: A secure car park within the building can be arranged for an additional 15 per night. Check-in after 10:30pm will incur an additional 20 fee and will require key pick up from a locker. Please note the building's concierge is at the apartment until 11pm latest, so if you are checking in later and are not sure exactly what time you're arriving, it's best to request key to be placed in a locker.  Please note for bookings of 2 people and less which require use of the sofa bed, there is an additional 20 charge to cover costs of laundering. Due to shoes leaving marks on the floorboards, I would really appreciate if shoes could be removed while in the apartment.
properties.transit: Across the road (1 min walk) is the sky bus which connects you to Melbourne's Tullamarine airport is across the road  (2 min walk), various car rental companies including Hertz and Europcar, as well as Southern Cross station which connects you to all train lines as well as the V-Line (Victoria's rural train network). The apartment is located within the Melbourne CBD free tram network.
properties.access: Guests are welcome to the whole apartment, including private bedroom, private balcony, living space, kitchen and modern bathroom. The apartment sleeps a maximum of four people. Guests are welcome to use the complementary WiFi, NetFlix , coffee and tea, washing machine, dryer and ironing facilities. The building is also equipped with a stunning pool and gym, free for guests to use. Freshly cleaned bedding and towels are provided for all guests.
properties.interaction: I live about 30mins away so am available to be contacted during your stay or prior if you require a local's advice about Melbourne. Either myself or Marnie will personally check you in, however depending on your check-in time or extenuating circumstances, you can pick up the keys from the building's concierge or lockers across at Southern Cross Station.
properties.house_rules: Check-in / Check-out Check-in is available after 3pm, and check-out is by 12pm Midday but if your require some flexibility just let me know, I'll try my best to accommodate.  Please note check-ins after 10pm will attract a fee of an additional 20 and you will need to collect the keys from the lockers across the road at Southern Cross Station. For a smooth check in process and to avoid a return-to-property fee of 30, please arrive within 1 hour of agreed check in time and keep us informed if there any changes.  Replacing keys are expensive (Swipe 100 Key 60) so when you're checking out, keys can be left in the mailbox :)  Cleanliness We kindly ask that prior to leaving, you clean and put away any dishes or kitchenware used and dispose of your rubbish - the rubbish chute is located to the right of the lifts. Damage Unfortunately wearing shoes in the apartment causes scuffs & marks on the floorboards, as such we would appreciate if you could please remove your shoes whilst in the apar
properties.host_about:
I'm a netflix addict, fitness fanatic, foodie and crazy cat lady. I live with my partner in Melbourne, Victoria, Australia with our two ragdoll cats. I love to travel and my favourite place in the world is Tokyo, Japan. My main gig is being a Career Coach and I love helping others realise and achieve their career aspirations. 

As a host, I make sure my guests feel completely comfortable and supported during their stay and am happy to provide recommendations on local attractions, travel info and most importantly, where to eat!

properties.name: Little Bourke St, Melbourne
properties.space: Spacious apartment fully equipped for the short to medium stay.  Located at the top end of Chinatown in an area surrounded by some great restaurants and close to all of the main theaters. A short walk in most directions will take you into the gardens or the major shopping areas. The apartment is a one bedroom layout but at 85m2, is set up to offer a second private sleeping area and modern kitchen, dining and lounge areas.   High ceilings and large opening windows overlook a quite lane.  Situated in the heritage classified "Gordon Place" in a quiet corner of the building, guests can use the common areas which include many private seating ares inside and a swimming pool. There is a small cafe at the front of the building and plenty of places nearby to buy your food and supplies. You are situated very close to a number of Melbourne's best and/or favourite restaurants. The apartment is located just a short walk from Parliament railway station or the Bourke St tram networks.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Set in the theatre district makes for easy access by foot to all theatres.  Close to the treasury and exabihion gardens for early morning walks. And in the heart of China town for great eating. Many good Itialian restaurants at this end as well.
properties.notes: Located in the heart of Melbourne. Close to Melbourne Central,Emporium and Melboune Universary,local cafes and restaurants.
properties.transit: CBD now has free tram travel in zone 1. Which covers the main city area. Parliament station is just around the corner for train use. And cabs pass the front door regularly.
properties.access: The apartment is in a three storey heritage listed building with two cafes in the atrium through which the building is entered. Both have their own charm and make very good coffee and delicious home made pastries.  There are common areas through out the building giving you a feel of space where ever you go. The bbq area is out side in the pool courtyard and is wonderful in the warmer months. The charm of this building is the age and architecture. A lift is available to the apartment or you can use the stairs which make for quick access in and out of the building.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Melbourne City - voted one of the most liveable city in the world!  You will be in the heart of the CBD right opposite the Southern Cross Station, which is the main hub connecting to the Melbourne International and Domestic Airport, Interstate trains, Bus terminal, Tourism departure point and lots more! Want to explore the city? The location is pretty much close to everything! China town, Crown Casino, Etihad Stadium, Docklands shopping area, Direct Factory Outlet (DFO), tonnes of Cafes and restaurants and heaps more!  Feel a bit Lazy to walk? Tram stop is right in front of the building and the best part is, it is FREE for those who are only travelling around the city! My apartment is well within the Free Tram Zone so it has the added advantage for your convenience! Rental car? No problems! As there are heaps of leasing company right opposite my building (in Southern Cross Station).  Want to take a punt? Crown Casino is just down the road and they operate 24x7! Good luck if you plan to
properties.notes: Linens and towels are provided and cleaners are engaged to clean and thoroughly inspect my place between each stay.  Basic toiletries are provided including towels for each guest.  Complimentary Tea and Coffee are provided too.  Please turn on the rangehood and open window if you cook because the smoke/fire alarm is rather sensitive ABSOLUTELY NO SMOKING inside the apartment, No loud music, No parties of any sort.
properties.transit: Southern Cross Station (main station/transport hub) is just opposite of the apartment, from there you can take SKY bus to the airport, V Line to go by train to country Victoria, Metro train to most suburbs in Melbourne or tram around town.  Apartment is located in the FREE TRAM zone within the Melbourne CBD, literally just outside the building. Just look out for the "FREE tram zone" signs. HOW TO GET HERE? Take a train, tram, bus or taxi and hear towards the Southern Cross Station. Southern Cross Station is located on the western end of the heart of Melbourne CBD grid.  The station is also the main transport hub so it is super convenient and great place to get around!   The apartment is right at the corner of Spencer Street and Little Bourke Street, Melbourne.  For public transport information visit: 'Public Transport Victoria' (Click on the 'Journey Planner' tab and select Southern Cross Station as your destination) From Melbourne Tullamarine Airport? properties.access: Please email/sms/message me or you could also ask questions about anything and in cases of emergency or urgent issues, you can ask the building managers on the ground floor. properties.host_about:
My name is Maria and I have lived in Melbourne, Australia for most of my life.  
I love being with people who are easy going and don't take themselves too seriously. I'm a foodie, enjoy most genres of music and can't go past a romantic flick; also the occasional action movie. Travelling opens up whole new worlds and when you visit Melbourne, I'd like to offer you a taste of our world.

I am one of many who agree that Melbourne is indeed a wonderful and very liveable city. The diversity of cultures is interwoven very well, and with something happening in this great city all the time, why not experience it for yourself? I'm delighted to share our city apartment with you, your family and friends, and let you live our Melbourne culture. 

I look forward to meeting you.

Maria

properties.summary: In the heart of Melbourne's cosmopolitan CBD, the apartment is located in one of the city's most well-respected buildings on the corner of Russell Street and Little Collins Street. The Hero Apartments are a stunning makeover of a classic art deco building by architect Nonda Katsilidis.
properties.space: This apartment offers a stylish home away from home. From the moment you step inside  you can relax in your own city pad. In Melbourne for work? The living area is next to the front door if you are hosting meetings and the Postal Hall cafe (Mon-Fri) at the entrance to the building is an excellent meeting location. The apartment is very close to the eastern end of Collins Street, noted for its high-end corporates and consultancies in the towers above the global fashion boutiques. If that's not your thing, the more eclectic fashion trade does a roaring business along Little Collins Street, while a few steps away Melbourne's Chinatown (increasingly pan-Asian) offers an amazing variety of restaurant options. Being Melbourne, you are never more than a minute or two from a great cafe. The Hero Apartment building has strong green credentials, with recycling, solar power for all public lighting and a worm farm to compost all green waste. properties.host_about:
Hello all, 
I am originally from Melbourne, Australia and enjoy travelling. I have lived in London, Tokyo, Singapore and Berlin. My preference is for apartments and boutique hotels over commercial hotels. It is great to stay somewhere with a community feel from local cafes, restaurants, markets and shops. I enjoy exploring new cities, whether it is galleries, museums, gardens, concerts and notable buildings. Also, I can't live without good coffee…
I have my own apartment in central Melbourne, which is on Airbnb whilst I travel, so I appreciate the importance of reliable and considerate guests. 
Life is a voyage of discovery, enjoy!

properties.transit: Melbourne’s trains, trams and buses are an easy way to see all of the city’s best attractions, sporting venues and shopping precincts. A 'myki' card is Melbourne’s transport ticket. I have complimentary 'myki' cards for guests at 'Abode 317' to use during there stay on request.   You cant get easier access to Melbourne's Public transport system from the apartment. Flinders St Station (Melbourne's main train station) is 300 meters away.  Tram stop is at the front door.  From January 1st 2015, Trams in the Melbourne CBD can now be traveled for no charge. (maps are available to show the free tram zone) The free visitors City Circle Tram travels the perimeter of the CBD, taking in many of Melbourne’s landmarks.  The iconic W-Class tram offers an automated summary of the points of interest along the route and stops at the front of the building. Melbourne Airport transport Melbourne’s taxis are a convenient way to get from Melbourne airport to the apartment. You can catch a taxi from designa
properties.access: *Free WIFI *Free Car space (1 car) *Modern fully-equipped Gym,  *2 night bookings may be available on request
properties.interaction: *Contact will be made with guests a few days before their arrival to confirm arrangements. *I'm keen to greet the guests when they arrive at "Abode 317", and show them around the apartment and highlight amenities available to them. *The apartment is now their home and their privacy will be respected.  *They are welcome at anytime to contact me by phone or email to ask any question.
properties.house_rules: -I want the apartment to be your home, but it's also the home of your neighbours, so we'll all appreciate noise to be kept at a suitable level. -Respect the apartment as their own house.  -The complex is a Non-Smoking building. -No Pets are allowed -Enjoy Melbourne!
properties.host_about:
I was born in Melbourne, and know the attraction of Melbourne is very much about its lifestyle. While it’s still got its “Hustle & Bustle” the magic about Melbourne is how it balances this hectic activity with the arts, sports and entertaining. Melbournian’s have passion for living life and that’s a major element towards Melbourne being voted as one of the world’s most liveable and friendliest cities (EIU's Global Liveability Ranking)

I have spent most of my life on the Mornington Peninsula (one hour south of Melbourne). I work in Melbourne’s CBD and have now also moved into the city to live. I’m an avid traveler, but with so many destinations still explore both in Australia and overseas. 
My greatest memories of traveling are often the people you meet and the experiences that are not found on the main tourist trail. I always love talking to a local character getting that special place to visit or café to dine (usually a cousin’s cafe). 
I have now come to a stage in my life I’d like to share some of Melbourne’s special places with others. These are not only my places of interest but also those hidden secrets that previous guests have found and have been excited to share with us.

I like to think “Abode 316 & 317” are special!  They are less than a year old and designed to be functional, yet have a touch of sophistication. They are fully optioned for the traveler and create that home away from home a hotel just can’t offer. 
Accommodation can often make or break a holiday, but I know the accommodation and hospitality my apartments will add to your Melbourne experience.
Rob

I have a dog - he likes everybody and will happily take you for a walk around the park if that takes your fancy - otherwise you may comfortably ignore him other than not leaving the front door open. No meals are provided however you have full use of the kitchen and all appliances etc.  There is a supermarket across the street if you wish to buy groceries and there is space for you to store your own food.  You are welcome to use the tea, coffee etc and condiments which are in the kitchen and also the laundry facilities and supplies.   All linen and towels are provided, there is a hairdryer in the bathroom.  Please note that the bathroom is shared between two bed
properties.host_about:
Busy, laid back, shopaholic and very social.  I holiday whenever I can afford to and travel internationally at least once a year.   I spend a fair bit of time walking my dog and pretending to get fit.  I am an IT consultant, so I work from home much of the time.

Must have:  Good wine, coffee, music, books (and ear plugs for sleeping)

Can totally do without: reality tv, talkback radio, backpacking and bad food.

Next holiday: Bali (again)
My motto: Does it come in red?
My other motto: Life is short, buy the shoes!

This has given me the flexibility to spend more time doing the things I love, like getting married, travelling and cooking up a storm.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Melbourne City - voted one of the most liveable city in the world!  You will be in the heart of the CBD right opposite the Southern Cross Station, which is the main hub connecting to the Melbourne International and Domestic Airport, Interstate trains, Bus terminal, Tourism departure point and lots more! Want to explore the city? The location is pretty much close to everything! China town, Crown Casino, Etihad Stadium, Docklands shopping area, Direct Factory Outlet (DFO), tonnes of Cafes and restaurants and heaps more!  Feel a bit Lazy to walk? Tram stop is right in front of the building and the best part is, it is FREE for those who are only travelling around the city! My apartment is well within the Free Tram Zone so it has the added advantage for your convenience! Rental car? No problems! As there are heaps of leasing company right opposite my building (in Southern Cross Station).  Want to take a punt? Crown Casino is just down the road and they operate 24x7! Good luck if you plan to
properties.notes: Complimentary Tea and Coffee are provided too.  Please turn on the rangehood and open window if you cook because the smoke/fire alarm is rather sensitive ABSOLUTELY NO SMOKING inside the apartment, No loud music, No parties of any sort.
properties.transit: Southern Cross Station (main station/transport hub) is just opposite of the apartment, from there you can take SKY bus to the airport, V Line to go by train to country Victoria, Metro train to most suburbs in Melbourne or tram around town.  Apartment is located in the FREE TRAM zone within the Melbourne CBD, literally just outside the building. Just look out for the "FREE tram zone" signs. HOW TO GET HERE? Take a train, tram, bus or taxi and hear towards the Southern Cross Station. Southern Cross Station is located on the western end of the heart of Melbourne CBD grid.  The station is also the main transport hub so it is super convenient and great place to get around!   The apartment is right at the corner of Spencer Street and Little Bourke Street, Melbourne.
properties.access: Please email/sms/message me or you could also ask questions about anything and in cases of emergency or urgent issues, you can ask the building managers on the ground floor. There are three restaurants on-site on the ground floor including an Asian (PHO24), Modern Australian (Higher Grounds) and Breakfast/Grill trendy cafe (Pretty Mama) which all scores very highly amongst Melburnians.
properties.interaction: I am available to answer your queries via Airbnb messaging, SMS or email, and there is also a 24 hours building manager at the ground floor who are able to help you in cases of emergency. Rest be assure that if you message me via Airbnb, my reply is almost instantaneous most of the time. Feel free to drop me a line or questions about anything in Melbourne and I will be happy to help as your local friend or guide.  Also check out my local Guidebook in Airbnb so you can try the many restaurants and Cafés that locals frequent in Melbourne.  I will also be providing you with a 'House Manual' when you book the place and there are Contact phone numbers and Emergency Contact numbers too.

properties.notes: The 1 x Single bed in the second bedroom is small - just big enough for a single bed and a small closet - it does the job but if you're tall then it may not be the most comfortable bed for you The large and comfortable double sofa bed (Cinema room) or the double bed in the main bedroom would be more comfortable for you friendly giants There is also a fold out mattress for the brave ones (6th person), it just fits in the second bedroom or easily in the cinema room

CHECK-OUT: Please leave the Cinema Cove as you found it Ensure: - everything is left as it was - dishes are clean and packed away - don't worry about making beds (linen will be replaced) - empty bathroom and kitchen bins into the dumpster downstairs (past the lifts in the car park) Cleaning fees include vacuuming, washing linen and basic cleaning. properties.name: Spacious Warehouse Apartment on Flinders Lane.
properties.summary: This beautifully designed apartment is unique, open plan and light-filled space. The guest bedroom has a comfortable Sleigh bed fitted with fine quality linen. The Guest lounge has big comfy sofas for you to relax on, check your emails or enjoy a glass of wine. Flinders Lane has Galleries, Boutiques and fabulous Restaurants & Bars; a safe and exciting neighbourhood. Perfect position to stay for Travellers, Conferences & Business. Trains & Trams are close by.
properties.space: We live in a spacious and light filled warehouse, furnished with French provincial furniture and Contemporary Art. The building was a Fashion House, converted to Apartments in the 90's; it has very high ceilings with Architectural details defining the space, the bathrooms have an industrial edge with a stainless steel fit out. We have comfy sofas for when you need to relax with a coffee or a glass of wine after a busy day of work or sightseeing.

properties.neighborhood_overview: The area of Flinders Lane has a history of Fashion and Art for over a century; the area has changed over the last 2 decades tho' it has always remained edgy, Boutiques, Galleries and now fabulous foodie Restaurants, there are also several Live music venues and Bars all tucked away in Laneways.
properties.notes: The location is in the middle of Flinders lane, filled with Galleries, Fashion boutiques, and fabulous Restaurants.Melbourne has diverse entertainment, the International Spring Carnival of Racing, the Australian Tennis Open, the Grand Prix and Blockbuster Exhibitions at the NGV and the Melbourne Food & Wine Festival. " Broadsheet " & "Timeout " are online papers, an excellent resource for up to date info on what's happening in Melbourne.
properties.transit: The City of Melbourne is perfectly planned to make walking around the streets and laneways, a delightful experience. The Public transport in Melbourne is exceptional, Trams, Trains and Buses cover the Metropolitan area, we provide a MYKI card with some credit, this can be topped up as needed. Taxis are available close by, and if you wish to Hire a car, the major companies all have a city office.
properties.access: The guest bedroom is furnished with a Sleigh bed fitted with fine quality linen, TV and WiFi. An En-suite bathroom has Bathrobes and L'Occitane de Provence products. You will be able to enjoy fresh Espresso or Teas from our kitchen, and I will provide a continental breakfast. For friends travelling together, we have a comfortable single bed with a thick latex mattress to be put in the Guest Room. There is a guest lounge furnished with 3 comfortable sofas.
properties.interaction: Melbourne is the Most Livable City in the world. We have been residents of this amazing Cosmopolitan city for many years and will happily assist with information from the perspective of a local; this will ensure a truly unique experience. When travelling around Australia and the World, the website; Rome2rio, developed by 3 Australians, gives Transport Options and Prices, well worth checking out. We recommend for our International guests to download (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) to their mobile, it's free, wifi is available in many places, and in our home.
properties.house_rules: We ask that our guests respect the privacy of our neighbours, and are quiet when coming into or out of our building. For our Privacy and Security, we prefer no extra guests come into our home. Wifi is available; we do ask you use only for email and looking for info. We have a no smoking policy. The floor of the Apartment is painted white concrete; we ask you to wear soft sole shoes or socks inside, please. When you are here for more than a few days, the washing machine and dryer are available to use. Also, you might enjoy shopping at our fabulous Queen Victoria market and preparing a delicious dinner. We prefer not to have guests under 12.
properties.host_about: I worked in the Airline industry for many years,this gave me the opportunity to travel extensively,one of the best experiences was making contact with locals, to be introduced to the real countryside or city from their perspective.I would like to share my city with you,having lived in the center of Melbourne for 20 years I can give you an insight into a local experience.

properties.host_about:
Hi Everyone,
 I wish you will go through all my listings, 
https://www.airbnb.com.au/rooms/1747852
https://www.airbnb.com.au/rooms/1863200
https://www.airbnb.com.au/rooms/2327860
https://www.airbnb.com.au/rooms/8341907
https://www.airbnb.com.au/rooms/11656757


Being a Airbnb , it is been almost 3 years. I love being a host, because I know that when people, different group of people and family they came to our place, when they feel, it is worth it. I love it and enjoy. That's the happiness that other job may not able to find it. I really love to see when my guests they start to step to the apartment and feel wow and impressed.
Honestly, being a host, it is not easy decision.
We have to make sure every details things in our place are the best to our guests. 
From check-in to check-out. It is an experience not only for guests. it is for us as well. It is the whole responsibilities. 

That’s what I think, the reason which motivates me to be a host.

Melbourne is a very multi-cultural city 
My objective is, if someone come here they should be connected to the right place.
Me, as a host, I think is kind of connecting these different peice together, a kind of connection.
The high point of my stay was how you made me feel. And how you made me feel, it sticks. It sticks with you.”
I have the traditional way to believe.
We believe it is the relationship that provide to the guests they will enjoy,  love the place to stay.
They trust me and I trust them. And that’s the reason it works.
So hospitalities if you ask me, is about care. It s about welcoming. This is about welcoming with open heart.  Welcome you to my Melbourne Apartment.

properties.summary: 100 meter above Melbourne, 5min walk to Melbourne Central station and Queen Victoria Market. 2 min walk from Flagstaff Station.  2min walk to the famous hardware lane and Melbourne shopping district.  In the middle of Melbourne's best restaurants and bars. Panoramic views to the bay, city and Dockland. Free high speed national broadband network Wifi. Free access to swimming pool and gym. Basic breakfast included. The entire apartment is yours to enjoy. Cheapest car park in town nearby.
properties.space: What's on in Melbourne:  Queen Victoria Market (QVM, the biggest market in the Southern Hemisphere) is hosting " Saturday and Sunday Market" every... you guessed it, Saturday and Sunday. The theme of each Saturday and Sunday is different, from multi-cultural street food to arts and crafts.  While you are there, enjoy the best coffee in town from Market Lane Coffee. Yum...  Mica's Home:  Stay in, watch a perfect sunset, then the vista of lights and fireworks,  or go out to explore a city that never sleeps.  Our brand new home is at the heart of Melbourne city, surrounded by famous attractions, lane ways, restaurants, boutique cafes and bars, shopaholic districts and soul cleansing green spaces.  Living here, and you will know why Melbourne is voted the most liveable city on earth. properties.neighborhood_overview: We are situated next to the federal police department and various courts.  So, this is possibly the safest part of town.  Our neighbourhood is densely packed with restaurants, bars, cafes, shops and more.  But we are also next to Flagstaff Garden, which is one of the most beautiful and tranquil green space in Melbourne.  You will love living here as much as I do.
properties.notes: 走路5分钟到Melbourne central购物中心及火车站. 走路2分钟到Flagstaff火车站｡ 走路5分钟到市中心购物区｡ 走路5分钟到维多利亚市场(回国礼品,最新鲜食物市场, 南半球最大市场) 走路10分钟到唐人街,旅游巴士出发点｡ 位于免费电车区, 免费市区所有电车,10分钟免费电车到皇冠赌场｡
properties.transit: Although walking is the best way to discover Melbourne, our home is conveniently across the road from Flagstaff metro station and 5 minutes walk from Melbourne Central metro station.  We are also in the free tram zone, so ride them to your heart's content.  If you decide to discover Melbourne on a bicycle, we have a secured bicycle storage room on the ground level.  Just remember that by law, you will have to wear a helmet when riding a bicycle.
properties.access: The entire home, everything in our fridge, draws, cabinets and all of our brand new appliances are yours to enjoy.  You wont' be sharing anything with strangers. and I don't live in the building during your stay. Free access to our swimming pool, gym and bicycle storage. Car parking next to my apartment only charges 35Aud a day, unlimited exit and entry.  (Other parkings in town charge at least 60Aud a day and you can't get your car out during the day without paying more).  After 1pm, its only 20Aud a day and after 3pm it's 5 for the night.
properties.interaction: I can greet you and show you to your new home and I am always contactable by email, phone, SMS, WhatApp and WeiChat.  I also offer an easy to follow and convenient self check-in option.  Which means getting to my home is easy regardless of your arrival time. I will also provide a summary of what I love about Melbourne.  Its must see attractions, must try food and surrounding amenities.
properties.house_rules: Any children must be strictly supervised by responsible adults when accessing the balcony. Enjoy the amazing views but PLEASE STAY SAFE! Check-in is after 2PM (flexible) Maximum 3 people.  No smoking inside, balcony is ok No party or loud music please Please take your personal belonging when you check out. Please use the key to lock the door when you leave the apartment, and always take the key with you, as you can't use the lift without a swipe key. Please Turn on range hood and open window when cooking.  (Fire alarm is very sensitive so in the presence of building manager or fire fighters, you will be liable for the cost of it.) Loss of Swipe Card and Key is chargeable at AUD 150.00. Check-in time is to be confirmed 2 days before your arrival.
properties.host_about:
I love summer, travel, animals and all things beautiful.  I love decorating my home and making it warm and cosy.  When I travel, I like to stay at a place where I can feel at home. 

I hope that my home will also be your home away from home.

Right opposite of Southern Cross Station, a great stay for interstate/overseas business travellers, tourists and weekenders alike. Stylish and modern place with all essentials provided including cotton linens, toiletries, towels. properties.space: The WHOLE apartment ALL TO YOURSELF directly across Southern Cross Station (Main train station and transport hub) making this efficiently designed, inner-city place ideal for weekenders, business travellers or holiday goers.  My place is comfy and furnished with everyday use amenities, and the building has a pool, gym, sauna, BBQ area, visitor sitting lounge, and also a rock climbing wall! Roomy and comfy for 1 or 2, just nice for 3, accommodates a maximum of 4.  Inside the apartment  is modern, nice and comfy. It has a open plan living area including the lounge with a full kitchen, a sleeping loft, dinning area, laundry facilities and a functional shower room.  I have a full size double bed in my apartment for the first 2 guests and a sofa bed which pulls out into another double size bed for 2 more guests (3rd and 4th guests), convenient for those who are travelling on a budget. Else the sofa bed can fit your kids nicely and they may love the novelty of sleeping on a pull out bed :-)

properties.neighborhood_overview: Melbourne City - voted one of the most liveable city in the world!  You will be in the heart of the CBD right opposite the Southern Cross Station, which is the main hub connecting to the Melbourne International and Domestic Airport, Interstate trains, Bus terminal, Tourism departure point and lots more! Want to explore the city? The location is pretty much close to everything! China town, Crown Casino, Etihad Stadium, Docklands shopping area, Direct Factory Outlet (DFO), tonnes of Cafes and restaurants and heaps more!  Feel a bit Lazy to walk? Tram stop is right in front of the building and the best part is, it is FREE for those who are only travelling around the city! My apartment is well within the Free Tram Zone so it has the added advantage for your convenience! Rental car? No problems! As there are heaps of leasing company right opposite my building (in Southern Cross Station).  Want to take a punt? Crown Casino is just down the road and they operate 24x7! Good luck if you plan to
properties.notes: Linens and towels are provided and cleaners are engaged to clean and thoroughly inspect my place between each stay.  Basic toiletries are provided including towels for each guest.  Complimentary Tea and Coffee are provided too.  Please turn on the rangehood and open window if you cook because the smoke/fire alarm is rather sensitive ABSOLUTELY NO SMOKING inside the apartment, No loud music, No parties of any sort.
properties.transit: Southern Cross Station (main station/transport hub) is just opposite of the apartment, from there you can take SKY bus to the airport, V Line to go by train to country Victoria, Metro train to most suburbs in Melbourne or tram around town.  Apartment is located in the FREE TRAM zone within the Melbourne CBD, literally just outside the building. Just look out for the "FREE tram zone" signs. HOW TO GET HERE? Take a train, tram, bus or taxi and hear towards the Southern Cross Station. Southern Cross Station is located on the western end of the heart of Melbourne CBD grid.  The station is also the main transport hub so it is super convenient and great place to get around!   The apartment is right at the corner of Spencer Street and Little Bourke Street, Melbourne.  For public transport information visit: 'Public Transport Victoria' (Click on the 'Journey Planner' tab and select Southern Cross Station as your destination) From Melbourne Tullamarine Airport? No problems!  There are Airport B
properties.access: Please email/sms/message me or you could also ask questions about anything and in cases of emergency or urgent issues, you can ask the building managers on the ground floor. You will be able to access the apartment naturally and also all the facilities including the gym, swimming pool, sauna, BBQ and pool side area, business/social lounge and rock climbing wall with the swipe card. There are three restaurants on-site on the ground floor including an Asian (PHO24), Modern Australian (Higher Grounds) and Breakfast/Grill trendy cafe (Pretty Mama) which all scores very highly amongst Melburnians.
properties.interaction: I am available to answer your queries via Airbnb messaging, SMS or email, and there is also a 24 hours building manager at the ground floor who are able to help you in cases of emergency. Rest be assure that if you message me via Airbnb, my reply is almost instantaneous most of the time. Feel free to drop me a line or questions about anything in Melbourne and I will be happy to help as your local friend or guide.  Also check out my local Guidebook in Airbnb so you can try the many restaurants and Cafés that locals frequent in Melbourne.  I will also be providing you with a 'House Manual' when you book the place and there are Contact phone numbers and Emergency Contact numbers too.

properties.host_about:
Hi, my name is Paul, owner of Complete Host apartments! I am a seasoned traveler and have been fortunate to have visited most countries and experienced the way the locals live by staying at amazing airbnb properties all around the world. From these experiences I have learned a lot about what sort of experiences people are after when visiting a foreign city.

After spending the majority of the last 15 years overseas I am living back in my home town of  Melbourne and now run a short stays business called Complete Host.  As such, I have on offer a number of very comfortable properties in some of the best locations of Melbourne.

If you are interested in one of the properties l have listed but the dates are unavailable, please check my other listings under my profile or email me an inquiry as l will very likely have another property available that will suit your requirements. 

I cant wait to meet you and make your stay in Melbourne a memorable one!

Paul, Complete Host

properties.name: Cosy Central CBD Studio Apartment
properties.summary: Amazingly close to all famous restaurants, cafes and shops. Located within a 5 minute walk to Melbourne Central, Chinatown, trams, State Library of Victoria, RMIT University, Woolworth supermarket. Fast wifi with a Smart TV, washer dryer and all necessary amenities provided.
properties.space: Located in retail and restaurant end of the CBD, this studio apartment has everything you need for a comfortable stay in Melbourne. The apartment is sunny and bright with a great view across the CBD.  A short stroll to the nearest tram lines let you access the whole of Melbourne with ease and travel within the CBD is free so no need to walk long distances. That means that you can access Queen Victoria Market, Federation Square, Docklands, Crown Casino and all other places just by hopping on and off trams.  I provide towels, bed linens and premium toilet amenities. The bed has a down pillow and goose down quilt for ultimate comfort. If you have any minor request, let me know and I will try my best to arrange it for you.  The kitchen is fully equipped with pots and pans, utensils, crockery, salt, pepper and oil if you want a simple home cooked meal.  You can have unlimited coffee from a pod machine and a range of teas and hot chocolate.  There will be a curated list and map of nearby res

properties.neighborhood_overview: Walking distance to almost everything you need. Restaurants ranging from world class degustation to small eateries and takeaways are easy accessible from this location.  Chinatown is just one block down and there are late night eateries and pubs and bars littered around the area.
properties.notes: I can only provide one set of security fobs and keys for access. There is a top of the range Clei wall bed in the apartment. It features a queen sized memory foam mattress and is easy to pull down and up with just one hand.  I am not able to provide an alternative but it is important to know before you book this apartment.
properties.transit: Travel with public transport is free within the CBD. Trams and trains are just a short walk away. For parking access there is a multi storey carpark directly opposite the apartment.  Myki cards can be purchased in 7-11s around the CBD or at the ticket machines.
properties.access: I will meet and greet guest and provide them with a quick tour of the apartment.  The apartment requires security key fob access to enter the apartment and up the lifts.  You have the whole apartment to yourself.
properties.interaction: I am available to show you around the CBD if I am not busy. Let me know what your interests are and I can tell you where to go and walk you there. I am also available on the phone if you need my help with anything. I can help with restaurant bookings and finding general information.  I can rent you a wifi mobile router if you need internet access while out of the apartment. You will have to provide you own prepaid sim.
properties.house_rules: - Check in/out time is flexible, let me know in advance and I will try to make it work. - Treat things nicely like you would at home. Be respectful to my neighbours, no loud music and TV. Smoking with a view allowed on the balcony.  - Keep my apartment neat and tidy, put the dishes away and move furniture back to its original position. - You are comfortable with the idea that the bed is a wall bed and not a regular bed. Please Youtube "Clei Nuovoliola" to see the bed in action.

properties.host_about: Hi! I am Henny and I now call Melbourne home. I was born and brought up in Indonesia. When my 3 children decided to live permanently in Australia, I made the biggest and bravest decision in my life to move to Australia, leaving behind my extended family and friends. Now settling in Melbourne, I can understand why Melbourne has been the most liveable city in the world for so many years. Its friendliness, its cultures, its coffee and many many other things. I love to share these with anyone in the world and I am proud to be a host in Melbourne city. With the warmest heart, I welcome you to Melbourne.

The apartment is light, clean, comfortable, fully equipped, offering a queen bed with high-quality, high-performance mattress, bathrobes, pantry basics, little extras. Melbourne's many delights are on the doorstep and  most things are within walking distance. Transport is easily accessible and we provide Myki cards for you to use on public transport.

properties.neighborhood_overview: The apartment is in Melbourne's lively Chinatown district, with lots of restaurants, bars, cafes right on the doorstep. It's also the theatre district; Her Majesty's theatre is right across the lane, the Princess and Comedy Theatres are close by, and the Regent, Aethenaum and Capitol theatres are all a short walk away. The Kino cinema is a couple of blocks  - and if you're sporty, you can easily get to the MCG, Rod Laver AAMI and Etihad. In fact, it's easy to get to anything from here.
properties.notes: The apartment is in the residential section of the building, so we do ask that you observe good neighbourly practices and keep noise to a minimum. If you need to buy household things, QV shopping Centre is very close, and has everything you might need, from a Woolworths supermarket, Officeworks, liquor store and much more (URL HIDDEN)
properties.transit: The city is walkable and pedestrian friendly. Public transport by tram, train or bus is easily accessible and free within the CBD area. We provide Myki cards for public transport should you need to go further afield; you may need to top them up if you use them for more than a couple of trips. Taxis are available via booking, the taxi apps or hailing them when you see one.
properties.access: Access is limited to when we can meet you; Michael or Karen can meet you during the day, up until early evening (7pm). If you're arriving outside of check-in times please don't book until we have confirmed access is possible. We are over an hour away from the apartment - so while we're happy to be as flexible as possible, late or early check-ins may not work. We supply one set of keys for your use, but if you really need two sets, talk to us.
properties.interaction: You'll have the apartment to yourself,  and we won't bother you, but should you need anything one or the other of us will generally be able to help, and we're only a phone call away.
properties.house_rules: Guests agree to bearing the costs of replacing keys & swipe card, and changing locks if they leave with the keys and do not return them within seven days.
properties.host_about:
Hi, we're Michael and Karen, a political researcher/musician and a clinical psychologist/writer. We're interested in people, music, art, literature, theatre, good coffee and food, family and friends. One of us is a passionate fan of Aussie Rules Football and the other is ... not. 

We live in in both country Victoria and Melbourne city, so ask us about visiting Central Victoria as well.  We love both and consider ourselves lucky to have the best of both worlds!

When we travel, even though hotels can be very nice,  we prefer to stay in places that are friendly, comfortable and have that personal touch; we use Air BnB too and plan to use it a lot more.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Directly opposite Southern Cross station, it is an ideal location for travellers.  20 minute ride to and from Melbourne Airport via the skybus.  The bus departs and arrives literally one minute from the apartment.  Close to the centre of Melbourne CBD for shopping, food and attractions. properties.notes: Please give me notice as to when you arrive so I can escort you into the complex.  It is a secure building. You may cook, but please clean up after yourself and do your dishes in a timely manner. Also be warned do not open the front door of the apartment while cooking to ventilate smoke, as the fire alarm in the hallway may go off, so in the event it goes off, there is a very high chance that the fire engine will arrive, which has a fee of 2500 which you will be liable to pay.
properties.transit: The Bourke St tram stop is a 30 second walk from the apartment.  It is now free to travel by tram around the CBD Zone. This tram will take you down stylish Collins St and past the "Paris end" where the designer stores are.  This tram is also free around the CBD precinct

properties.summary: Live like a local in one of the most expensive and exclusive apartments in the CBD of Melbourne. Enjoy your stay in your own spacious private double room with a private bathroom in a large stylish apartment with an amazing view. Relax in the jacuzzi, heated pool or sauna and keep yourself fit in the gym.
properties.space: You will live in a modern, clean and tidy apartment with sweeping views from every room. There is a queen size bed in your room and also a built-in wardrobe with hangers. In your private bathroom you will find a mirror cabinet. A toiletries starter pack of shampoo, shower gel, soap, fan and towels will be provided for your convenience. Feel free to use the living room/kitchen as well as the balcony. A washing machine and a flat iron is also available. You will have fast wifi and you are welcome to use our Netflix.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Our Apartment is located on Collins Street in the CBD. In our neighbourhood, you will find a lot of restaurants, bars, supermarkets and convenience stores. The Southern Cross Station (which has a pretty good candy store) and the SkyBus terminal is only 3 minutes by walk and gives you an easy access to and from the airport and to other parts of the city. Etihad Stadium is a short 7 minute walk and the Melbourne Convention and Exhibition Centre can be reached by 10 minutes walk. Pokemon Go player will find a lot of PokeStops here with active modules.
properties.notes: In case you check out and have a few hours left before your flight or you arrive very early when the room is not ready yet, you are welcome to store the luggage at our place.
properties.transit: We will provide you with a local map and help direct you to get you where you want to go. You are staying in the free-tram-zone, which means you don't have to pay for any tram rides you take within the CBD-district. If you would like to go out of this zone, we will provide you the required myki cards.
properties.access: You will have access to a full spa with an amazing view of the city, where you can enjoy and unwind in the sauna and jacuzzi, work on your cardio and get fit in the gym or just go for a swim in the heated pool.
properties.interaction: You will have our mobile numbers so you can contact us if you require assistance throughout your stay. We welcome your questions anytime and can assist with suggestions.  We understand that some people enjoy their privacy and some maybe interested in getting to know a local. We welcome and respect either way.
properties.host_about: My name is Julia and I am from Berlin. After studying Economics in Sydney, I decided to move with my boyfriend to live in Melbourne. I enjoy to host people from all different nations and candy and chocolate are my weak spots.

properties.host_about:
Hi, my name is Paul, owner of Complete Host apartments! I am a seasoned traveler and have been fortunate to have visited most countries and experienced the way the locals live by staying at amazing airbnb properties all around the world. From these experiences I have learned a lot about what sort of experiences people are after when visiting a foreign city.

After spending the majority of the last 15 years overseas I am living back in my home town of  Melbourne and now run a short stays business called Complete Host.  As such, I have on offer a number of very comfortable properties in some of the best locations of Melbourne.

If you are interested in one of the properties l have listed but the dates are unavailable, please check my other listings under my profile or email me an inquiry as l will very likely have another property available that will suit your requirements. 

I cant wait to meet you and make your stay in Melbourne a memorable one!

Paul, Complete Host

properties.summary: A light filled minimalist one bedroom apmt. Located in the 'Paris' end of the CBD nestled on Lonsdale St backing on to China Town. Our rooftop pool is always heated and has gorgeous views across the city. Fits 3 guests. Renovations have just been completed late 2016, lots of new goodness to enjoy, but still very homely.
properties.space: Gorgeous little apartment on Lonsdale Street, recently renovated by myself and my architect husband from Archier. We used to rent out to guests occassinally when we were travelling or working away however have since moved just north of the city to a larger apartment (room for a baby...) so do Airbnb full time now at Lonsdat St. This apartment was our home for 5 years- it is very convenient, with all the comforts that you need. It's 48 sqm, with a small balcony, and roof top pool (heated so you can even use it in winter!) and a master bedroom.  The location doesn't get better - with the city centre at your doorstep, offering convenient trains, buses, trams, Chinatown and endless shopping. The Skybus from the airport will deliver you straight to the doorstep via it's free shuttle bus or one of the city's free trams (86 or 96 will get you very close to our place) can bring you up from the Souther Cross Station drop off. If you're in town as an explorer, you can walk to all the central hot

properties.neighborhood_overview: You are at the heart of Melbourne - and can enjoy whichever side of the city you want. Everything is at your fingertips.
properties.notes: We have boycotted the iron and ironing board! We provide a garment steamer which is so much faster and easier to use in our opinion. We also don't have a TV by choice - there is always something the keep you busy in Melbourne and if you're really keen to stay in... there's always our fast wifi.
properties.transit: Our front entrance is on Lonsdale st, and the back entrance is Little Bourke st (China Town). We are SO central, we are within the free tram zone in the city. We are also within the city loop of trains so you can walk to Melbourne Central or Parliament station. There are also buses on our doorstep.. and the Skybus free shuttle can drop you to the hotel next door for airport transfers. Couldn't get any more accessible.
properties.access: Guests have full privacy in this one bedroom apartment with a spacious bedroom, lounge area, small balcony, bathroom and basic kitchen area. The lounge room is minimal with a couch and city view - that means no TV but fast/free wifi compensates for that. Close to the apartment is a shared laundry and on the rooftop is a shared pool.
properties.interaction: I will meet guests upon check-in if I'm available, but usually for everyone's convenience will leave keys in a coded key-safe outside the building - some guests have described this as an urban treasure hunt! This means the guests can turn up without worrying about being late.  I live nearby so if any problems were to arise I'm not far away. I like to give my guests space and privacy - but also like them to know I'm always available by phone or can come visit in person for any help needed.
properties.house_rules: Please respect our neighbours - no loud noise from 9pm preferrably, strictly no loud noise after 10pm. No smoking inside. No smokey cooking inside . There are sensitive smoke detectors in the hallway which attract a 3,000 from the Melbourne Fire Brigade as they are automatically alerted if the smoke alarms are set off (we have experienced this!). This has never happened to a guest before, but we let you know as a precaution.
properties.host_about:
Hello! 

I am Miranda, and live with my partner Chris. We live in the heart of Melbourne City in our own apartment which we have spent a lot of time renovating. We live with our placid little black Cavoodle dog Charlie .
 
We love living in Melbourne, especially enjoying its great parks and cafes. Chris is an architect/ industrial designer and I am a model, as well as a recently qualified primary school teacher.

We've been together 9 years, and in that time have travelled to a lot of places throughout Asia and Europe. When we travel it's always relaxed. We love discovering new things - not necessarily the typical tourist attractions. We look forward to exploring the Americas and more of Europe when time permits :) 

We hope you like staying at our place!

properties.name: Ensuite Luxury Living in Heart of Melbourne
properties.summary: This is the most affordable, luxurious, and spacious apartment in the Heart of Melbourne. We offer you a Spacious Ensuite in a shared apartment. With a Walk Score of 100/100, my home is surrounded by Melbourne's Top Restaurants, Cafes, Bars, Shopping and Entertainment. Whether it be Melbourne's secret hidden laneways, late night hotspots, day-time activities, or education institutions, my place is at the Heart of it all! Oh, and Melbourne's best Karaoke at K-Box is next door!
properties.space: As Melbournians, we walk. Although the free tram service is all around my place, I can walk in any direction and find everything I need. I have lived here my whole life, so please do ask me for any tips on the best eating places. There are new things springing up every year and certain activities are seasonal so I would be more than happy to help you plan your stay. I have eaten almost everywhere, however, even I find some new secret places every now and then.

With a private room, you'll be able to wake up to greet your new friends in the kitchen and have the freedom to bid them adieu at bedtime. We can communicate in English, 中文 and Tiếng Việt. 我們可以用中文交談. properties.transit: If you are arriving from the Melbourne Airport, please see the info below:  You have the option to use "The SKYBUS" Service. SKYBUS will drive you from Airport to Southern Cross Station ( Spencer Street). Then at Southern Cross Station you need to board another SKYBUS FREE Service called "HOTEL Shuttle Service" (red mini buses), and get dropped off at the "Marriot Hotel" (corner of Exibition st and Londsdale st) in Melbourne CBD. The Marriot is only two (2) blocks away from the house. Please check on your GPS once you receive the address. Finally if you would like to get a taxi from Southern Cross Station to the house, it will be around 10min depending on traffic (2.5Km) and could cost from 20 average :) Trams within the City (Green Area) are free. You do not even have to buy the transport card (Miky Card) unless you decide to travel outside the Green area.  Please get all this info verified with the current websites, since they always update and improve their services! Let me know if

properties.house_rules: - Definitely not a party House. - Do not throw or clean floors with towels. - Do not wet the floors, specially the bathroom when using it. - Do not stain SHEETS or bedding. - Please DO NOT remove MAKE UP using towels or SHEETS. - Please Use Aircon and lights looking after the enviroment and ensure they are turned off every time you leave the place. - NO MORE PERSONS are allowed to stay (ONLY the ones included in the booking) - Make sure you READ and understand all the instructions to avoid delays to your trip and plans. - Please verify and check amounts, days and number of people before making payment. - No Loud Noises. - No more than 4 people for booking. - Sofa Bed Accommodates Maximum 2 extra people - Queen size bed (1 room) accommodates Maximum 2 people - No Pets allowed. - No smoking allowed. - Not allowed to move furniture around. - Wifi Password will be located on Booklet placed in the room.
properties.host_about:
Hi My name is Ernesto and I have been using Airbnb for more than 2 years already in some countries around the globe. It has been a great experience so far and I have been having so much fun while travelling or hosting. 

A bit of myself... I am a working professional engineer who has worked and lived in South America, USA & Australia. I am normally very busy and spend a lot of time out the apartment. I am currently studying a Master Degree and have a busy schedule during the whole week from early morning until late in the afternoon. 

I enjoy socializing, however I am also very respectful of other's privacy. I have also done a bit of traveling in the past 10 years within 4 continents visiting around 15 countries. I believe in having a balance in life enjoying it and living it to the fullest! 

I love travelling, dancing Latin music, basketball and anything related with outdoors activities.

I am very passionate with everything I do and always try my best.  I also enjoy business and believe in good service and customer satisfaction. 

Life is too short! "Eat dessert first"

Ernesto!


Important points to note:

- I am VERY COMMITTED to respond my messages and sort things out as quick as possible. Even in the middle of the night!

- I also enjoy meeting POSITIVE AND GRATEFUL people that really make day and give me more reasons to work for my guests better and harder. 

- I also consider that words like "Hello",  "thanks" & "Please" are always a good sign of consideration and respect for others. 

- I will ALWAYS commit to accommodate your arrival times as well as other needs (if possible) as much as I can.  However, please be aware that it does not only depend on my times but also cleaner's and previous guest's times. 

- Also, it is always nice & rewarding to meet people that appreciate "the extra effort that WE DO" to accommodate them, as well as people the  clearly understand the line between "OBLIGATION" and "HELPING OUT"

- I also believe in communication, planning and  problem  solving. Please be aware that it is nearly impossible not to encounter inconveniences one day, however; what makes the difference is how quick they get solved.

Thanks a lot for understanding and I will make sure you have a great experience!

properties.neighborhood_overview: A short stroll away from trams, Flinders Street Station, Federation Square and Melbourne's sporting precincts, you won't have to go very far at all to get the most out of your Melbourne stay. Flinders Lane is arguably Melbourne's best street for food and nightlife and is also home to many art galleries and boutiques from Melbourne's best designers.
properties.notes: There is no minimum nights stay. Check out 10am Check in 2pm
properties.transit: The apartment is close to all forms of public transport so you won't have any issues getting around. Everything in the city is walking distance. If you are here for one of Melbourne's world class sporting events, Rod Laver Arena, Melbourne Park and the MCG are all less than 15 mins away by foot. There is also a bike share station just around the corner.  The apartment is a walk or tram ride from the SkyBus terminal at Southern Cross Station if you are coming from the airport. Please note that the apartment doesn't include parking. But there are paid undercover parking complexes in the same block.
properties.access: This booking is for the entire 2 bedroom apartment.

properties.house_rules: We just ask you to be respectful of the space and all the nice things that we have put in the apartment to make your stay (and the stay of fellow travellers) a pleasant one.  No pets and smoking in the apartment. No non-booked guests staying over please. And NO PARTIES PLEASE as we want to be respectful of the neighbours. Noise travels in the apartment block so we ask that our guests keep noise levels low after hours.
properties.host_about:
Originally from Melbourne (Australia), we are a fun-loving couple who love exploring and meeting fellow travellers.

Steve loves cycling (and building bikes), rugby, the share market, his guitar and live music.

Gajia loves food (cooking and eating), fair weather cycling, olympic weightlifting, shopping and hanging out with her three little nephews.

We met at university in Melbourne and later lived and worked in London for several years. We've seen lots of the world but still have so many more places on our list. Currently, we live our home in a beachside suburb in the inner suburbs of Melbourne.
