If shopping is your thing then the CBD, South Yarra, Prahran, St Kilda and South Melbourne can be reached easily by tram, bike or on foot.   Albert Park Lake and Melbourne Sports and Aquatic Centre are in easy walking range and offer great leisure and exercise facilities. The Melbourne Wine Store on the opposite side of St Kilda Road provides a great range of wines and boutique beers and a tram ride to Prahran or South Melbourne markets will help you to fill the fridge.

properties.host_about:
I love the opportunity that I have to experience and enjoy the food, fun and cultural events in Melbourne whilst always having a beautiful and restorative place to escape to. I enjoy reading, bushwalking, swimming in the surf, seeing bands and attempting to grow vegetables.

Hi, my name is Paul, owner of Complete Host apartments! If you are interested in one of the properties l have listed but the dates are unavailable, please check my other listings under my profile or email me an inquiry as l will very likely have another property available that will suit your requirements. 

I cant wait to meet you and make your stay in Melbourne a memorable one!

Paul, Complete Host

If you are not able to produce your ID, we legally cannot grant you access to the property.** We are happy to check you in at any time. We do charge a 50 surcharge for check-ins from 22h00-08h00 as this is outside normal operating hours. If you have a late flight, we have teamed up with a car service company that is able to check you in to avoid the surcharge. They will verify your ID, have you sign the required paperwork from LittleStay, and, finally, hand you the keys and information sheet
properties.interaction: We would love to welcome you to the apartment and show you around. If you have any issues, concerns, just need a restaurant recommendation or just need ideas to do, we will be a phone call away. **We do require Government Issue ID at time of check in. If you are not able to produce your ID, we legally cannot grant you access to the property.**
properties.house_rules: The three Golden Rules to every LittleStay Property:  - There is NO partying allowed at any time. Eviction and fees will apply to any parties during your stay.  - Noise must be at a reasonable level during your entire stay. Please make sure that you respect the neighbours as these are homes and not hotel rooms.  - Smoking is never permitted inside the home or in any part of the buildings. Fines will apply if there are odours remaining.
properties.host_about:
LittleStay is a boutique short stay company specialising in homemade hospitality. We are passionate about traveling, exploring, and sharing. Bitten by the travel bug when we were young, we love to jump on a plane and explore the world. Spending our days and nights away from home with new friends, exchanging our experiences, and building new unforgettable memories. LittleStay is here to help create those memories. 

That's the idyllic part, but in our real life we all have bills, mortgages and obligations that we wish we could leave at home and don't have to travel with.

Consequentially LittleStay was born to help with that dream, a company that allow people like us and others to travel, live, experience or start a new life without the everyday struggle of life back “home”.

LittleStay wants you to feel comfortable entrusting us with your largest asset. We will consider your home our home while we manage it. It is our reputation on the line if something is amiss. We do not take that lightly.  LittleStay wants you to be a part of our LittleFamily. We value your partnership and thusly, if you are holidaying and want to stay at one of our properties, you’ll receive insider rates. You can even reserve your own property for your family and friends that are visiting. 

We take care of virtually everything. Our level of cleaning is second to none. Our customer service is beyond compare. Our commitment to you, the owner, our guest, our community is unquestionable. 

We believe a happy home is a filled home so if you have a property that is not happy, please contact us to see how we can help you. 

Or if you're one of our amazing guests helping us, please let us know how we can make your stay more enjoyable. 

Warmest Regards
The LittleStay Team

properties.house_rules: 1. Our home is strictly for paying Airbnb guests.  2. Only 1 set of keys (including swipe) will be provided between 2 guests. Key and swipe replacement plus swipe deactivation is expensive and can cost approximately AUD 230. Re-keying of front door cost AUD 250.  3. Please remove outdoor shoes when entering our home. Clean house slippers can be worn indoors. 4. No smoking indoors. Removal or tampering with smoke detectors will attract serious penalties from our building and local authorities. 5. No animals indoor (including the balcony area). 6. Please do not eat or drink on or near the bed.  7. Please ensure exhaust fan in kitchen is used when cooking. 8. Please use place mats or round cork coasters mats. Do not place hot items directly on glass, stone or wooden surfaces. Please use drink coasters for cups. 9. Please do not remove make-up, sunscreen or fake tan with bath towels or hand towels. 10. When leaving home, please close A/C systems, lights and balcony door. Ensure apartment
properties.host_about:
Welcome Airbnb members!  

Please read all information carefully to decide if our home is suitable for your stay, therefore no misunderstandings. Any questions or concerns, please ask!

*Your Airbnb Profile*
- Profile photo of yourself.
- Location details (state and country).
- Two verifications.

*Enquiring/ Reservations*
- New members cannot book for other guests.
- Please carefully check calendar dates for availability.
- Please do not ask for further discounts.

*Your Pre-Arrival*
- Please provide your flight number.
- Please communicate 1-2 days before arrival (optional).

*Check in procedure*
- Please message when leaving Melbourne Airport.
- Please go direct to accommodation, as we are waiting for you.
- Weekday check-in between 12:15PM to 1:45PM and anytime after 5PM.
- Weekend check-in is flexible after 10AM.
- We will meet guest(s) at our home and provide quick tour.
 
*Our Home*
- Please treat our furnishing with care. 
- Please keep our home tidy.
- Please do not move or rearrange our furniture. 

* Bed linen/ towels/ hand towels*
- Please note some slight discolouration or minor markings. 
- All bed linen, towels and hand towels are washed after each guests check out.

*Damage/ loss*
- Please report any minor/ major damage or loss.
- Any unreported damage discovered will be claimed against your security bond.

*Check out*
 - When checking out, please send a courtesy message to tell us you are leaving.

properties.name: 在墨尔本CBD市中心38层看风景City View on 38 Floor MelbourneCBD
properties.summary: 本房源位于公寓楼38层,视野非常开阔。您可在精心设计的阳台上俯瞰墨尔本城的美丽风光:蓝天、白云、晚霞、落日、星辰;海湾、船只、大桥、摩天轮、体育馆……     夜晚,这里更是万家灯火、霓虹交映、流光溢彩、妩媚璀璨、美不胜收……     如您愿意,学中文的好客女主人还可与您喝茶谈天,增添旅行情趣。本房源更有温馨的卧室,雅致的客厅、完备的厨房、清洁的卫生间、齐全的个人洗漱用品等。房源公寓楼地理位置优越,在墨尔本Tram电车免费区域内,周边交通极为便捷,直达墨尔本最繁华街区的Tram 86路Lonsdale St站就在楼下路口处。对面的南十字星火车站有Skybus空中巴士直达机场。房源周边购物方便、餐饮丰富,有各式商店及咖啡厅、美食广场,比邻Coles大超市及亚冠华人超市。房源公寓楼内9层设有室内恒温游泳池和健身房,您可以据自己的爱好而一显身手。公寓楼设有24小时大堂可为您提供服务。这些设施定会为您的旅行带来轻松、愉悦、舒适、难忘的感受。
properties.space: 1、本房源为二居室,其中一间卧室女主人自住,另一间卧室供房客居住,两间卧室均有门有锁,有很好的私密性。女主人与房客共用一个卫生间。 2、为方便客人,本房源提供拖鞋、牙刷、牙膏、梳子、香皂、浴帽、洗发水、沐浴液、润肤乳、浴巾、毛巾、卫生纸、雨伞等。 3、本房源距南十字星火车站约200米,那里有24小时运行、每10分钟一班的机场空中巴士(Skybus),去机场非常方便。 4、本房源旁有许多电车、公共汽车站。电车在CBD区域里免费。直达墨尔本最繁华街区的Tram86路电车Lonsdale St站就在楼下路口处。) 5、距本房源约100米处,有大的Coles超市和亚冠华人超市。 6、周边有美食广场、咖啡厅、各式商店、餐馆,餐饮、购物非常方便。 7、本公寓楼设有24小时大堂,随时为您提供服务。 8、本公寓楼9层设有室内恒温游泳池和健身房。 9、本房源阳台风景极好,可以欣赏到壮美日落和壮观的海平线,女主人很乐意为您拍摄浪漫美照。 10、从机场到达本房源,您可以选择这样的路线:您在机场可以乘坐Skybus 到Southern Cross Station 下车,然后出车站向左走,走到Coles超市门前,(您站在Coles超市大门前抬头向前看,能看到我的公寓大楼,大楼外观上写着“CENTRAL EQUITY”,是蓝色的竖排的字)然后过马路,直行大约100米,你就走到我公寓的大门前。(公寓大门是绿色的,在台阶上,外墙是古建筑的样子。)到大堂后,您给我打电话,我下楼来接您。(您也可在Coles门前时就给我打电话,我去那里接您。)

properties.notes: We also rent out our another two bedrooms: https://www.airbnb.com.au/rooms/7638760 https://www.airbnb.com.au/rooms/8355418
properties.transit: From Melbourne Airport: - The best way is to get the SkyBus Express bus, which operates every 10 minutes all day, every day. One-way tickets are 19 for adults. After you arrive in Southern Cross station, you can take the free hotel shuttle bus from there, to 'City Edge apt hotel', then you'll arrive in my street.  'City Edge apt hotel' is just cross street of our building. - There is also a public bus service, which takes 45 minutes and 2 buses, for around 8. A top up ‘Myki’ card can be purchased on the bus, which is used for all public trains, trams and buses in Victoria. - A taxi will take about 30 minutes, depending on traffic, and should cost around 60.
properties.access: You're welcome to use our kitchen, living room and balcony. Gym and swimming pool time: 6am-10pm You will also have access to all of the apartment building facilities of a gym, swimming pool, spa and sauna. *Smoking only allowed in our balcony.
properties.interaction: If you need anything during your stay, just ask! We will always try to provide you with everything you need. - Please be aware of the kitchen's fire alarm when you're cooking. - Shoes off in the apartment. - Please be respectful of the other guests and not make too much noise in the evening.
properties.house_rules: - Please be respectful, this is our home^^ - Please keep everything clean, especially the kitchen - If you need to smoke, please do it on the balcony - Shoes off in the apartment please
properties.host_about:
We are a young couple who love to travel everywhere! And we love to meet travellers from all over the world too!

- Adam is local from Melbourne.
- Beryl is Shanghainese^^ Has lived in China, Belgium, France, and now I have come to live in Melbourne, Australia! 
- Started as an Airbnb host since I was in Paris many years ago.
- We're happy to make a lot of new friends from all over the world! 
- Like to take a lot of photos 
- Hang out with friends 
- Learn new words!

properties.name: Fully Equipped City Central APT*Yarra river
properties.summary: Perfect location!  Close to attractions, Melbourne convention and exhibition centre, shopping malls, restaurants and Crown entertainment. Lovely yarra river is only a minute walk. Perfect for travellers or business executives.  Trams are at your doorstep and free within the Free Tram Zone, covering the whole of Melbourne CBD.  The apartment is beautifully furnished, spacious and welcoming and providing an oasis for you to relax after a full day out.
properties.space: Modern renovated appartment near Crown, DFO, and Southern Cross station with free trams just outside the front of the building. (As long as you stay in the Free Tram Zone). No extra charge for use of Free WiFi internet access, and HD digital TV. Perfect for single, couples, family, Friends or business executive. The skybus to and from the airport goes direct to Southern Cross Station which is only 8 minutes walk away. Full laundry facilities with washer and dryer. Linen, Shampoo, Conditional, Body wash, body lotion,Hair dryer and towels are also supplied. There is a living room available for your use if you would like a little more space equipped with TV. properties.neighborhood_overview: We are in the central business district close to most things. We love that we are close to most things people want to see. If they have to get around it is very easy with all kinds of transit. Lovely yarra river is only a two minute walk. In close proximity to: * Southern Cross Station * Melbourne Convention and Exhibition Centre * Crown Casino * Eureka Skydeck * Melbourne Aquarium * Shopping Centres and Factory Outlets * Southbank * Flinders Street Station * Docklands * Immigration museum * Etc It doesn't get any better than this when it comes to ease of access to all this fantastic city has to offer..!
properties.notes: Cereals/muesli with small milk will be provided for breakfast. We found that people have different preference over milk like organic milk, full cream, skinny, soy milk, etc and would like to avoid milk wastage for environment.  There are two 24/7 convenience stores near by the the building. Asian grocery and other super markets are in walking distance. Please return Myki cards( public transport cards) before check-out :) *For those who intend to live in Melbourne for a while. In the past, we had many guests who stayed in our place before they rented their own place for a long term. we are really happy to be your first friends in this amazing city and help you understand how banking, rental, and etc work in Australia when you check in or over dinner or drinks outside if you would like. A private night walking tour might be available on request( 40 for 1.5 hour tour) - walking around yarra river from City to Docklands via southbank.
properties.transit: There are two main tram services just outside the door. On Flinders street you can catch tram 70, 75, and city circle. On Spencer street you can get the 109,96, and 12 trams. Southern Cross station is only about 8 minute walk. Transport in this location is perfect in the city and is also Free trams in the (Free Tram Zone). You don't need a ticket if you are only traveling in the CBD (Central Business District ).
properties.access: Feel free to use a hair dryer, a dishwasher, a laundry machine,a dryer, a vacuum cleaner. Also, Fresh linen, towels, body wash,body lotion, shampoo and conditioner are complimentary.
properties.interaction: Hi - we are Adam and Ally, great to meet you!:-)  We like to think of ourselves as an unlikely couple; international, and well-travelled. It is our hope that you will make the most of your visit. We used Airbnb on our travels to great success and are delighted to offer up this beautiful apartment as hosts. We live close by and are happy to assist in person, over the phone, via SMS or email.
properties.house_rules: - Please NO ADDITIONAL GUESTS apart from those listed in the booking.  - We have very good neighbours and would like to keep a good relationship with them so please NO PARTIES AND AND NO AUDIBLE NOISE. - SORRY.. NO PETS. - Please TURN OFF lights and air-conditioning or heating before going out.  -NO SMOKE INSIDE APARTMENT.  Please smoke outside the building.  - Additional cleaning fee may apply if the apartment is left in an unacceptable condition - Please do not place any cups on the couch. also, Let us know in advance if you would like to use the couch as a bed. - ENJOY YOUR STAY IN MELBOURNE! :-) Thank you for helping us keep this flat fantastic!
properties.host_about:
Hello everyone :-)

We are an easygoing international couple who like eating good food and socialising with people. 
Whenever we travel we always use Airbnb to get some local advice and an interaction with local hosts. We are well-traveled so we know needs of our guests while traveling.  We are happy to help our guests to have a good stay and enrich their experience in Melbourne. 

I, Ally, am from South Korea originally and have many hospitality experiences in Hotels, cafes, Restaurants, Stadiums. Also, I sell few items via my website or other online shopping platforms so I am always looking for unique ideas or items :-)    
I can speak English and Korean.   

Adam is from Austria (Small but beautiful country next to Germany and Switzerland in Europe) but he is a half Australian too( His father is Austrian and mother is Australian ). Adam is studying computer science and working as a software engineer in art-oriented IT company.  
He can speak English and German( Understand a little bit of french and Russian too)
   
We have been in Melbourne for many years so we feel we are locals here.

We love Airbnb because Airbnb has been letting us to make some friends and learn new culture by hosting our guests.

We can not wait to share information about Melbourne with our guests!

properties.neighborhood_overview: Docklands is a new developed precinct with the combination of high quality commercial headquarters and well designed residential buildings. It is as convenient as CBD, but it provides a much more beautiful view of the sea and a much more quiet and safe place to live. It is the best place to start your Melbourne tour. -Free Tram Zone: tram 11&48 -Nice restaurants, bars and cafes all around -Library at The Dock is just downstairs. -South Wharf DFO is 800 meters away -Crown Complex is 1000 meters away
properties.transit: FREE TRAM ZONE: Tram 48 and 11 just downstairs -3 mins to Southern Cross Station -5 mins to CBD, the central part of Melbourne -10 mins to Crown Casino -trams run along Collins Street, one of the most beautiful and stylish historical streets in Melbourne. It contains many luxurious brand stores and famous cafe shop and restaurants. -Bourke Street which is adjacent to Collins Street, where the biggest shopping chain Myer and David Jones locate. As well as many fashion boutiques. Walking Distance -1 mins to restaurants downstairs -3 mins to Woolworth Super Market, Asian Grocery, Pharmacy Hire a Bike downstairs -Docklands has well designed bike lane and bike hire spot, we highly recommend you to hire a bike and have a different experience in Melbourne! properties.neighborhood_overview: The top of Flinders Street is considered part of the Paris end of the city, named after the architecture and many French and Italian luxury retail stores located in this end of town. Moments walk to the beautiful Treasury and Fitzroy Gardens, churches, IGA mini mart, cafes, restaurants, boutique cinema and theatres.  10 min walk to Rod Laver arena or 1 tram stop. This is a superb location that has a very limited supply of luxury furnished apartments of this calibre.
properties.notes: 1 x Queen size bed in the bedroom 1 x Full size single bed via the King Furniture Delta convertible sofa in the living room. We will show you how to set this bed up by request. Molton Brown London liquid soap, shampoo & conditioner supplied Laundry liquid & dish washing liquid supplied. We apologise in advance "if" we are unable to extend check-in/out times or store luggage as we require several hours between guests to carefully prepare the apartment to a high standard.
properties.transit: Tram is right at the Flinders Street door of the apartment bock, taxis or Uber and the major train station is one block away. You are very unlikely to require a car whilst in Melbourne however, there are nine GoGet car pods within a 1 km radius of the apartment, Avis car rental agency located in the Grand Hyatt, less than a block away.  Parking station next door which may be booked online, ask us for more info.
properties.access: David or I will meet all guests at an agreed check-in time on premises. We will run through basic major appliance/air con controls, rubbish disposal, fire exits and answer any questions you may have. We are never far away and always happy to answer mobile calls, SMS or Airbnb email messages for further information or assistance at anytime during your stay and thats a promise.
properties.interaction: As much as you need.
properties.house_rules: We kindly request guests are respectful of this beautifully appointed apartment where little expense has been spared in the finish provided. *Smoking is strictly prohibited inside the apartment, on balcony and in the common areas of the building via strata by-laws. Unreported breakages or damage caused by mis-use may be deducted from your security deposit. Please turn off electrical items as you leave, remember to take all your personal belongings and kindly leave the apartment as close to as possible the state you found it in would be greatly appreciated. Motto: You get what you pay for, hence I will often spend more to get quality long lasting products and services.

properties.neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located right near Chinatown which has many great places to eat. Recommended places would be Crystal Jade for Yum Cha, Shujinko, and Hataka Gensuke for Japanese Ramen, and Shanghai Street Dumpling. Hoffbrahaus for German food and Beer is also highly recommended! Also nearby is Flinders Lane which has plenty of high-end and fine dining restaurants, bars and desert venues. Recommended places are Cumulus Inc, Chin Chin, Supernormal, and for nice desserts Om Nom. Lygon Street is located northwards on Russell St from the apartment and hosts the largest section of Italian Restaurants in Melbourne CBD. There are plenty of fantastic other gems nearby if you are willing to explore!
properties.notes: This is a private unit ALL TO YOURSELF and you WON'T be sharing this with any strangers during your stay. The "INSTANT-BOOK" function is enabled so you may instantly book the place if the dates you want are available. Please be sure to notify us of your arrival times so that we can hand the keys to you personally. This pad accommodates 6 adults comfortably but a max of 7 overnight. Any more than 4 adult guests overnight will attract an extra AU25 per night, per additional guest.
properties.transit: Trams run frequently along Collins Street and Bourke Street which allow visitors to travel Melbourne CBD easily, and more importantly for free. Please remember that there is a Free Tram Zone, and that if you do not have a tapped-on Myki Card, outside the zone you may risk a fine. Trams 96 and 109 on Collins Street brings you straight to Crown Casino for free, however make sure to get off within the Free Tram Zone, which ends one stop prior.  Tram 96 takes you to St Kilda Beach, and Tram 86 takes you to Docklands. These locations are outside the Free Tram Zone. Many of the city landmarks are close to the apartment, and are walking distance, such as Parliament House, Royal Botanic Gardens, Yarra River, Flinder's Street Station and Federation Square plus many more.

properties.neighborhood_overview: If the epicentre of Melbourne is the Town Hall (also the focal point for the comedy festival) or Federation square or Young and Jacksons, the place is less than a 5 minute walk from the centre.  The place is twenty paces from Huxtaburger (CBD) and Maha bar restaurant.  The other side of the CBD (say the Library or Bennetts Lane) is a 25 minute walk tops.  The river and all its splendid bars is rolling distance.  You can walk to Fitzroy, the MCG / Rod Laver - probably a good 30 minute walk, much less on the tram.  Docklands is in the order of 20 minute walk.

properties.notes: The apartment is connected to the NBN (national broadband network) service. We provide guests with complimentary internet access for normal day to day usage within our service provider's monthly cap. However, we can assist you with a high volume internet connection if required for business purposes.
properties.transit: You are in the heart of Melbourne. City Trams are free within the city grid. Trams, trains and buses service the city, suburbs and greater Melbourne area. We have an arrangement with Safe City Carpark for reasonable parking rates. There is also a multi-storey carparking station opposite the complex. In this complex the car hire company "Red Spot" operates. The Skybus from Melbourne airport terminates at Southern Cross Station with connecting free hotel buses (with wifi) that will drop you at the front of the Sheraton hotel.
properties.access: If you want access to the well equipped gymnasium, swimming pool and spa in Sheraton (extra charges apply) we can put you in touch with the Day Spa/Gym Manager.
properties.interaction: We meet and greet on check in and provide easy check out procedures. We are also available via text, email or phone throughout your stay to answer any queries. Our House Manual provides details on check out procedures.
properties.house_rules: We provide complimentary WiFi and Netflix. We have a strict no party policy. Please respect our home as if it was yours. We would really appreciate it if on departure you leave the place as you found it so the next guest gets to enjoy the same comforts. Similarly, breakages or maintenance issues should be advised so we can attend to the issue immediately.
properties.host_about: Thank you for visiting this property. We are professionals and run several businesses.  As private landlords we own a number of upmarket rental properties (some tenanted long term). Our private clients and colleagues rent from us regularly and we are selective about tenancy. We also have a strong following of regular and return visit Airbnb clients. We tend to add value to a stay rather than provide large discounts. If your dates are not available please always feel free to make an enquiry as we have several properties listed on Airbnb. We look forward to your visit and making your stay in Melbourne a memorable one. We are also honoured to be asked to co-host other properties to help hosts new to Airbnb.

properties.interaction: Whilst we don't actually live at the apartment, we try to visit every day and are just down the road and available on mobile at any time if needed. We will do everything we can to make your stay a pleasant one so please let us know if there is anything specific you need and we will try our best to accommodate.  Happy to assist with ideas of places to see whilst you are in Melbourne - where to eat, where to shop, and where to just relax and enjoy the day go by.
properties.house_rules: - Avoid disturbing the neighbours - Only guests on the booking to be present at the apartment - Noise to a minimum after 10pm - Be mindful of other guests when using the facilities
properties.host_about:
Bridget and I have been together for 10 years now and still loving every moment. We fill our lives with work most days but enjoy spare moments by surrounding ourselves with people, walks, random projects (like renovating our apartment or making our own kitchen table...)

WHAT WE CAN'T LIVE WITHOUT
Sunlight! We've tried apartments with very small windows and now live in one with heaps... don't think we can ever go back!

FAVOURITE THINGS TO DO
Really enjoy looking through and understanding real estate markets in every town or country we visit. A really interesting way to understand the culture of an area, its history and how it has developed.

HOW DO WE TRAVEL
When we travel, its organised chaos, we plan some things ahead but then leave the in between parts up to the imagination. Our latest overseas trip has flowing through Germany, Spain and Austria. We immerse ourselves in the culture to get a good feel of how the locals live.

properties.name: Stylish Art-deco in South Yarra's Domain Precinct.
properties.summary: South Yarra is a fantastic suburb... the Domain precinct is the best and most prestigious part of it, bordered by the Botanic Gardens and Fawkner Park.  Walking distance to many of the major events (MCG, F1 Grand Prix, Australian Open tennis) and close to many of Melbourne's main attractions. It is only one block from the trams on St Kilda Rd which will take you into the city or down to St Kilda.  My Apartment is ideally suited to people looking to make the most of their time in Melbourne.
properties.space: This large newly renovated art-deco apartment would suit someone considering a boutique hotel.  I have equiped it to ensure your stay is as comfortable as possible.  With extensive kitchen and laundry facilities, air conditioning in the living area which is powerful enough to cool the entire apartment and a parking permit. Apartment includes:  • Wifi internet, 50" Samsung TV, Apple TV with Netflix access • Bose soundbar attached to TV with Apple Music subscription • Hotel quality towels and linen • Designer furniture - Queen size sofa bed  • Queen-sized bed same brand as available in Art Series hotels • Coffee machine • Washing machine/dryer combo If you book for 2 people I assume you'll be sleeping in the same bed, if not please let me know and I'll provide linen for the sofa bed. If you book for more than 2 people I will provide sheets for the sofa bed automatically.

properties.neighborhood_overview: South Yarra is one of the best neighbourhoods in Melbourne.  Whether you're here for the Australian Open Tennis, AFL at the MCG, Formula 1 Grand Prix at Albert Park, shopping and eating on Chapel Street or a wedding in the Botanic gardens you will be perfectly positioned.  The CBD is a leisurely stroll through the Royal Botanic Gardens or a quick tram ride away.   There are a number of excellent cafes and small shops within a few minutes walk.
properties.transit: There is shared parking for the apartment block, if a space is not available a visitors parking permit is provided to enable you to park in the street for free. There are plenty of public transport options 1 block away and many of the attractions are within walking distance - Royal Botanic Gardens, Shrine of remembrance, National Gallery of Victoria, Albert Park.
properties.access: Access all areas! I have the check in time set as 3pm, if you need to check in earlier please let me know when you enquire about the apartment - if the previous guests have left early then It's generally ok for you to drop your bags off for access the flat before 3pm.
properties.interaction: If you read some of the reviews for my apartment you will see that I take great pride in making sure every guest has a memorable stay. I will contact you when you have arrived to check everything is ok and will be available at any time to deal with any issues.  We live about 20 mins drive to the south in a bayside suburb called Elwood so can reach the flat quickly if there is an issue.  If you are from outside of Melbourne and would like to meet up to discuss what you could do during your stay let me know and I'll meet you at the flat.
properties.host_about:
I'm originally from the UK, moving to Australia in 2001.  Since then I've married an Aussie and had two children.  In addition to being an Airbnb host I consult to organisations on how they can engage with an audience by creating and sharing content on Social Media.

I enjoy travelling and eating out.  I've lived in 4 Melbourne suburbs: St Kilda, Williamstown, South Yarra and Elwood and have lots of suggestions for things to do and see in Melbourne.

- Nate :)

Access to the Overland rail service to Adelaide, and NSW TrainLink XPT services to Sydney. Europcar, Budget and Avis rental car depots are just opposite the building in the Southern Cross station, so picking up and dropping off a rental car is super easy! There is also a tram stop right outside the main entrance on Spencer Street. Most importantly, all trams within the city grid are FREE. Just look out for the "FREE tram zone" signs. properties.host_about:
Bridget and I have been together for 10 years now and still loving every moment. We fill our lives with work most days but enjoy spare moments by surrounding ourselves with people, walks, random projects (like renovating our apartment or making our own kitchen table...)

WHAT WE CAN'T LIVE WITHOUT
Sunlight! We've tried apartments with very small windows and now live in one with heaps... don't think we can ever go back!

FAVOURITE THINGS TO DO
Really enjoy looking through and understanding real estate markets in every town or country we visit. A really interesting way to understand the culture of an area, its history and how it has developed.

HOW DO WE TRAVEL
When we travel, its organised chaos, we plan some things ahead but then leave the in between parts up to the imagination. Our latest overseas trip has flowing through Germany, Spain and Austria. We immerse ourselves in the culture to get a good feel of how the locals live.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Melbourne CBD has lots to offer for the singles, couples and families. A vibrant and multicultural city with plenty of cafes, bars and restaurants. It truly lives up to its name of the most livable city in the world. The location of this apartment is central and convenient. It is situated close to Queen Victoria Market, Melbourne Central Train Station, RMIT University, State Library and Flagstaff Garden.
properties.notes: Getting Here: From Melbourne Airport: One of the cheapest mode of transport is to take the SkyBus Express which take you to the Southern Cross Station. From there you can request for a free hotel shuttle transfer from the Southern Cross Station to 'City Edge Apartment Hotel' on A'beckett Street. The apartment is located on the diagonal building on the other side of the street. You can also take the tram from southern cross station to the stop at Elizabeth/Latrobe intersection and the apartment is a short 2 minute from that tram stop. You can also catch a cab which will take you right to the doorstep of the apartment building.
properties.transit: There is a tram stop just round the corner approximately 2 minute walk away from the apartment which conveniently sits within the Melbourne Free Tram Zone which will take you to most stops for free in the city. There are also plenty of car rentals (Thrifty, Budget, Avis) within short walking distance if you're planning to take a drive out of Melbourne City for sight seeing. The studio does NOT come with a parking on-site but there are a few secured commercial parking buildings close-by. I'm happy to help point out a few parking options depending on your needs.
properties.interaction: I am more than happy to show you around the apartment when I hand the keys over. If you have any issues or concerns with the place, please do not hesitate to contact me. I am also happy to point out my favourite restaurants, cafes, and bars around Melbourne. You can ask me any questions about your stay in Melbourne and what it has to offer and I'll try my best to answer them.
properties.house_rules: Strictly no smoking, house parties, and pets. Locksmith shall be contacted for any lockouts after hours. Locksmith charges applies.
properties.host_about:
I moved to the beautiful city of Melbourne in 2009 and loved every bits of this city has to offer.

I love  food and travel and have managed to explore other wonderful cities and cultures in the world. On top of my travel wish list is to visit America and Japan.

I am a friendly person who is more than happy to help accommodate  you in the beautiful city of Melbourne. Feel free to contact me if you have any questions regarding your stay in Melbourne.

properties.name: 2 Bedroom w/ Study - CBD Apartment with Character
properties.summary: Situated in the historic 'Madison Apartments', this urban oasis has a simple 1930s Art Deco charm. Relish the vibrancy of Melbourne's CBD, whilst simultaneously having a convenient retreat up to a private space in this tranquil 10th floor residence. Located on the corner of Flinders Lane, my beloved home is in close proximity to Melbourne's eclectic laneways, art precincts, MCG, Crown Casino and public transport hubs.
properties.space: The versatile, dynamic floor plan includes:  - Combined living/dining area with a plethora of natural light. - Well equipped kitchen  - Bright and functional study.  - Bathroom with shower over bath, as well as washing machine and clothes dryer.  While there are 2 bedrooms, one is divided from the lounge room by a glass wall and a floor to ceiling curtain to ensure maximum privacy.  Both have built in robes. The building's history and art deco style can be seen not only outside, but inside of the apartment - as the beautiful steel casement windows have not been altered since the building's development in the 1920s.  Through the historic windows, residents can enjoy views of Flinders Lane roof tops and slices of the Yarra River. Most windows open, providing a gentle breeze or the opportunity to soak up the sun during a lazy afternoon.  Internet access, TV and an abundance of books and magazines allow continued entertainment even when guests are tired from the day's events. A HDMI cable

properties.neighborhood_overview: The building is located almost at the heart of the Melbourne's CBD, tucked away in a quiet section of Flinders Lane allowing residents to enjoy both vibrancy and tranquility.  This particular part of Melbourne is famous for its laneways and cafes, with the renowned Degraves laneway in very short walking distance.  Another feature of this area is the abundance of heritage buildings that exude all the magnificence of Gothic and Edwardian architecture. The highly centralised location is perfect to facilitate both tourism and business travel.
properties.notes: Sustainability is very important to me so I would appreciate it if guests could turnoff any lights or appliances that they aren't using.
properties.transit: The apartment is only a few hundred metres away from Flinders Street station - Melbourne's main train station - allowing access to the city's entire train network.  Southern Cross Train Station is also nearby, which provides inexpensive regional travel. The airport bus stop is also nearby. Every bus and tram line runs through nearby areas, allowing for shorter distance travel.  In addition, Melbourne's Uber network is extremely quick and reliable. I have also found that Uber rides to this location are very inexpensive due to its central location.
properties.access: Guests have access to all areas of the home - be aware I do live here some of the time so there are a few belongings in one of the cupboards.
properties.interaction: I will meet you upon arrival. I am also a phonecall away at anytime, and am within 5 minutes distance should there be any issue.
properties.house_rules: Madison is my home and I have good relationships with my neighbours so this definitely not a party house. Cheers Leo
properties.host_about:
My son Leo and I run this Airbnb to help him pay his way through university. I am a professional visual artist - I exhibit regularly, teach sessionally at RMIT University and do the occasional commission. Leo studies classical piano and is doing an Arts degree at University of Melbourne.
We don't travel a lot but when we do we tend to go to one place and stay for an extended period - like our one month stay in NYC in 2014.  We are interested in world events and the arts.
This is our third AirBnB property - however we share the 2 places in St Kilda. We have kept these listings so you can read our reviews.
We have really enjoyed hosting people from other places and offer more than a place to stay.

properties.name: Perfect LOCATION! SECURE, COZY apt & FRIENDLY host
properties.summary: My place is in a terrific location right downtown - it's across the street from The Melbourne Visitors Centre, Flinders Street Station & Federation Square.  It's within the Free Tram Zone & overlooks the fabulous Degraves Street. It's within walking distance of the MCG, Rod Laver Arena, Yarra River, Botanical Gardens, National Gallery, Southern Cross Station & Etihad Stadium. A supermarket is next door. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and families (with kids).
properties.space: Security:  The security in the building is just fantastic and a real feature - there are 3 doors that require a fob to gain access into the building and lift area.  The room swipe card a couple of times once you get up into the floors and into the apartment.   Make sure you have your key at all times to not get locked out.  This access is only available for approved residents of the building which gives it that fabulous added security and piece of mind.  Space:  The space is a really well proportioned 35 meter square apartment and is in a terrific location and close to everything in the heart of Melbourne.   WiFi:  The login details are written down and available in the room next to the TV. properties.neighborhood_overview: The neighbourhood is cool, urban & central to everything . Transportation in and out of Melbourne is close with Flinders Street Station, Southern Cross Railway Station and the Skybus from the airport close by.  If you want to enjoy and open and fresh air The Botanical Gardens & the Yarra River are a five minute walk away. All the major events that come to Melbourne are easy to get to due to the epicenter location of the apartment.
properties.notes: Laundry facilities:  - Washing machines, dryers (fees apply) and ironing boards are located at the basement level of the building.   - These can be accessed only by one lift (the right hand as you look at them front on) or accessed via the stairs next to the lift.   - You'll need your swipe card and fob to access this area too.   Bike storage: - The bike storage area is in this area as well.  Cable TV - FOXTEL cable TV is in the common area just next to the laundromat area in the basement.  You'll need your fob to access this area.
properties.transit: The top 12 things to do whilst visiting the central business district are:  - The Star Observation Wheel - Queen Victoria Market - Old Melbourne Goal - Melbourne Zoo - Melbourne Museum - Federation Square - Melbourne Cricket Ground - Royal Botanical Gardens - National Gallery of Victoria - Eureka Skydeck - Melbourne Aquarium - Crown Casino  All of these activities are close and within either walking distance,  or a quick tram ride from the apartment.  Most of these activities  can be accessed via using the "City Circle Tram" which is a free service that loops around the city - I've put a map of this and a image of the tram & route in with my photos.    I think a trip via car to the Dandenong Ranges would be worth a visit with the kids and a ride on "Puffing Billy" and a visit to Healsville Sanctuary is great too.  Koala's, kangaroos, wallabies, wombats,  platypuses and other Australian native animals can be found there.     The fairy penguins at Philip Island and the drive down the sur
properties.access: Guests will have access to their own fully furnished apartment in a downtown location with heating, air conditioning and WiFi in a very secure building with bike storage, staffed reception Monday - Friday until 6pm.  Clothes washing & drying facilities are on site - fees apply.  Ironing facilities are available too. Cable TV Foxtel is located in the common area.
properties.interaction: If you arrive in the CBD before the check in time of 2.00pm or need to leave the CBD well after the check out time of 10.00am - you can store your bags at Flinders Street Station directly across the street from the apartment at the "Travellers Aid" area for a fee so you can go explore the city or continue to enjoy it.   To find it, enter the station at the main entrance under the Flinders Street Station clocks.  Speak to a staff member at the turnstiles and they'll let you in and direct you where to go.  You won't need at ticket to enter the station.  There is a Flinders Street Station "Travellers Aid" website that you can check out on line which outlines the scope of what they offer at this convenient service.I'll be as available via the Airbnb website, telephone and email.
properties.house_rules: - The apartment is located in a residential building, no party's please. Please respect the other residents and keep noise to a minimum at all times. - Reception is opened Monday - Friday from 8.30am - 6.00pm each day. If I'm unable to greet upon your arrival, I will leave the keys at reception for you to collect. I will endeavor to touch base with you during your stay to make sure you are comfortable. - Two Wilson Car Parking garages are close by if you need to park your car during your stay - There is a secure bike storage room on the premises available for guests to use free of charge. - There are washing machines, dryers and ironing facilities located on the premises. Fees apply. - Only one set of keys will be distributed to guests. - I'd love you to have a terrific time whilst visiting the City of Melbourne, however please keep in mind this apartment is located within a residential building. Please take your party elsewhere and respect the other residents by keeping your noise to
properties.host_about:
Melbourne, Australia is my adopted city and country.  It's home. 

Born in the USA,  my family moved to Germany at a young age where we stayed for nine years before moving to Australia when I was in my early teens. 

I have experience in hospitality having worked full time for two years as Concierge in one of Melbourne's 5 star hotels. 

My husband was also born overseas - in Bucharest, Romania.  
After escaping the former communist regime, he lived in both Germany and France before finally settling in Australia in his early 20's. 

Both of us, having lived in many different countries as well as having traveled a bit, love exploring and experiencing a new place.  We also appreciate the importance what a great location and amenity can offer when visiting a place for a while or a short time. 

Between us we can speak 5 languages - English, German, Romanian, French and Italian to varying levels of ability, if it helps you out. 

We hope you book in and enjoy your stay in our cool apartment and get to love our adopted city of Melbourne as much as we do.

Both of us are rowing Commonwealth Games Gold and Olympic Bronze medalists - ironically.....for Australia.   

Rowing is still very much part of our lives.  We're very active in the local rowing community and operate the only private rowing school in Australia called Rowing School Victoria - it's been located on the stunning Yarra River since 2007.    We love it.

We're generally up and about or nearby the apartment.  We spend quite a bit of time coaching our rowing students as we ride our bikes alongside them on the stretch of river that runs from Princes Bridge in the City, to just past Chapel Street, South Yarra.    

We'll be easily available via mobile, email, text or in person if needed.

properties.name: 2 bedroom apartment in City Melbourne
properties.summary: The apartment is located right in the heart of one of Australia's most vibrant and exotic cities. Immerse yourself in unique and thriving culture and be sure to catch a world-famous show at one of the many nearby theatres. Indulge in the quirky cafes, restaurants and bars and appreciate the striking street art down every street and alley. We offer stylish and sophisticated accommodation, close to the city.
properties.space: Wyndham Hotel Melbourne is a luxurious four-and-a-half star hotel offering modern and spacious accommodation, including studio rooms and one, two and three-bedroom apartments, featuring spacious balconies.  All apartments include fully equipped kitchens with tasteful European appliances, integrated refrigerators, dishwashers, gas cook tops and sleek stone bench tops. Wireless internet and a direct dial telephone are also accessible to keep in touch with loved ones. All apartments boast stunning lounge and dining areas to kick back and relax or entertain friends and family. Apartments also have the benefit of a spacious and furnished balcony, ironing facilities and shared laundry facilities on every floor.

properties.summary: Welcome to our compact modern Studio perfectly located in the North-East heart of Melbourne's CBD. You will find yourself surrounded by quiet laneways, chic cafes, & a stone's throw from QV, Central, Chinatown & the UNESCO heritage listed Carlton Gardens.
properties.space: Your home away from home in Melbourne: This Studio Apartment is located in a quiet laneway just off Little Lonsdale Street. It has just been re-designed and renovated into a chic, deceptively small but very comfortable retreat from the hustle and bustle of Melbourne’s CBD. The studio also shares a small entrance with our other property (a one bedroom flat), but each apartment has a separate lock with separate keys.  Please note that there is NO PARKING included with this studio, but we highly recommend using the ParkHound website (the Airbnb of parking) as a way of searching for daily/weekly/monthly options and often has some really good deals!    What makes this studio so unique is the transformable living space. Thanks to the Italian designed sofa/wall bed, you have a comfortable living area for lounging (or working), then a comfortable full sized queen bed at night. properties.neighborhood_overview: You will be staying in the ‘Theatre Precinct' of Melbourne, which is towards the North East corner of the CBD. Enjoy a variety of local food and coffee places literally on your doorstep downstairs, or wander a couple of blocks to the Eastern end of Chinatown on Little Bourke Street for a huge selection of Asian cuisines.    A quick walk to North East takes you up to the hip food and fashion spots of Getrude, Brunswick and Smith Streets in Fitzroy/Collingwood. Stroll through the new Museum in the UNESCO Heritage Listed Carlton Gardens or bring a picnic to lounge in the grass on a pleasant day, it's only a block away.   Hop on a free tram travelling West down Latrobe Street and indulge yourself at the Queen Victoria Market's extensive range of fresh fruit, vegetables, and elaborate deli offerings. properties.host_about:
I've been a professional Musician for over  20 years. Currently based in Melbourne. I love most creative audio and visual forms and have dabbled in quite a few throughout my career.

My wife Elizabeth and I met and married in Hong Kong before moving back to Melbourne in 2014. 

We have a passion for Movies, animation, great art exhibitions, writing, food made with heart and wandering aimlessly around new cities. 

I have travelled a lot through my work and just randomly. My favourite places include The Greek Islands, Istanbul, NYC, Paris, Hong Kong, Tokyo, Italy, Ticino in Switzerland, Peru and Fiji. :)   

I travel as lightly as I can having developed a keen skill for it over the years of touring in my band.

We have a two year old son called Cassius who keeps us on our toes and up at night.

properties.host_about:
Bridget and I have been together for 10 years now and still loving every moment. We fill our lives with work most days but enjoy spare moments by surrounding ourselves with people, walks, random projects (like renovating our apartment or making our own kitchen table...)

WHAT WE CAN'T LIVE WITHOUT
Sunlight! We've tried apartments with very small windows and now live in one with heaps... don't think we can ever go back!

FAVOURITE THINGS TO DO
Really enjoy looking through and understanding real estate markets in every town or country we visit. A really interesting way to understand the culture of an area, its history and how it has developed.

HOW DO WE TRAVEL
When we travel, its organised chaos, we plan some things ahead but then leave the in between parts up to the imagination. Our latest overseas trip has flowing through Germany, Spain and Austria. We immerse ourselves in the culture to get a good feel of how the locals live.

properties.name: Best location in town!
properties.summary: A beautiful oasis in the beating heart of Melbourne’s café precinct, Sliding Doors' architecturally inspired, warehouse-style apartment is ideal for business or pleasure.  Bright & spacious, with Juliet balcony overlooking Hardware Street - perfect!
properties.space: Arguably the BEST location in town!   Sliding Doors' Hardware Street Apartment offers you the charm of a bygone era combined with flair and verve!  This perfect boutique city hideaway provides convenient access to all of what Melbourne CBD offers.  The city’s major retailers are but a block away and an array of clubs, cafes and restaurants are literally at your doorstep.  On the move?  No drama - Melbourne Central train station is all of a 4-minute walk away! All of this yet feel the serenity!  Step through the shuttered French doors and  onto the pretty Juliet balcony overlooking the laneway, and absorb the laneway vibe. What the apartment offers:   Myki cards for transport; Free wifi; Large Screen Sony Bravia TV; Netflix; Bose stereo speaker system doubles as iPhone charger; Nespresso Coffee Machine; Double glazed windows; Keyless entry; Serenity and yet right in the beating heart of the action! Please note the apartment is suitable for a maximum of 2 people.
properties.description: A beautiful oasis in the beating heart of Melbourne’s café precinct, Sliding Doors' architecturally inspired, warehouse-style apartment is ideal for business or pleasure. No drama - Melbourne Central train station is all of a 4-minute walk away! All of this yet feel the serenity!  Step through the shuttered French doors and  onto the pretty Juliet balcony overlooking the laneway, and absorb the laneway vibe. What the apartment offers:   Myki cards for transport; Free wifi; Large Screen Sony Bravia TV; Netflix; Bose stereo spea
properties.neighborhood_overview: Looking down from the Juliet balcony you'll see Hardware Societe café - one of the best laneway cafes in Melbourne and ever popular with the crowds.  Next door is the Bowery to Williamsburg café which is also owned by Hardware Societe and to the right is Hash which makes the BEST hot chocolate.  CJ Lunchbar is a couple of doors away and is brilliant for a 6 or 7 meal.  Just around the corner at 361 Little Lonsdale Street is the groovy bar/restaurant 1000poundbend - they do weekday early bird 3 coffees and 5 breakfast burgers.  It’s a fantastic atmosphere morning, noon and evening. This location is truly awesome.  Hustle and bustle of Melbourne below yet the apartment is so tranquil and the serenity is divine.  The natural light makes your heart sing.  You are a five minute walk from the Bourke Street Mall and all the retail shopping you could dream of including the QV Centre which is only an 8 minute walk away.  The Crown Casino, the MCG, and Etihad Stadium are also only a short tr
properties.notes: With a walking score of 100, everything is within easy reach.  The nearest cafe & restaurant is less than 30 seconds door to door, and all the retail shops are 5 minutes walk away.    You'd prefer to stay in?  That's ok, with a 42 inch Sony Bravia on the wall, Netflix, and a Bose (Apple compatible) docking station, I am sure you'll be entertained!  Hot outside? No drama, open the door overlooking the laneway or turn on the air-con!  Yearning peace and quiet instead?  No problem, the double glazed windows and shutters keep the hustle and bustle at bay and the serenity is bliss.  Hungry? With 7 meals on offer just a hop, skip and a jump away what more could you want in your are home away from home. This special pocket of town has something for everyone.
properties.transit: Melbourne Central Station is a 4 minute walk away; trams at your doorstep and there is a high rise car park at 380 Lonsdale Street Melbourne, just round the corner from the apartment so all bases are covered.  Melbourne is home to the tram and the City Loop train system so getting around is a breeze. Tram travel is free within the CBD. I have provided 2 Myki cards for your use if travelling by transport in Melbourne.   Getting from the airport you can catch the shuttle bus from the airport to town which is about a 20 minute bus ride. It's quick, easy and very affordable - 18 one way for an adult. The closest taxi rank is the Queen Street Rank between Little Collins Street and Bourke Street, in the heart of the city's nightclub precinct.   Operating times: Midnight Friday to 5.00am Saturday; Midnight Saturday to 5.00am Sunday.
properties.access: The entire apartment is all yours.  There is security entry to the apartment building and keyless entry to  the apartment so you don't have to worry about keys.  Use the lift or walk up the stairs to the second floor.
properties.interaction: If assistance is needed I am a phone call away.  I am on hand to help make your stay as enjoyable as possible.
properties.house_rules: •We have great neighbours so please be respectful.   •Please keep the noise to a minimum level in the evening.    •Please leave the apartment as you found it.   •When you leave, please turn off the lights and heater / air conditioner. •Not suitable for young children because of balcony. •No smoking please.
properties.host_about:
Hi I'm Juls. Welcome to my profile.  I am warm, honest and have a very positive, happy outlook on life.  I love living in the moment and experiencing all that life has to offer.  What gives me great joy is seeing people in their bliss.  That's what I love about being an Airbnb host.  Being able to provide people with having a memorable and rewarding experience.  

I am very blessed as I have such an amazing family.  My husband and I have been together for 18 years.  We make a great team and we have 2 incredible kids who have had some amazing travel experiences already in their young lives including going to Summer Camp in the US for 8 weeks.  

Melbourne is my home and I love that there is something for everyone in this vibrant, eclectic city to explore.  Food, coffee, wine, sports, theatre, trams - it's a town of licorice all sorts.  I also spend time in California (another place full of licorice all sorts) where I get to visit my big sister and her family, and spend time with my astrology community as one of my many gifts is that of a Medieval Astrologer.

properties.host_about:
LittleStay is a boutique short stay company specialising in homemade hospitality. We are passionate about traveling, exploring, and sharing. Bitten by the travel bug when we were young, we love to jump on a plane and explore the world. Spending our days and nights away from home with new friends, exchanging our experiences, and building new unforgettable memories. LittleStay is here to help create those memories. 

That's the idyllic part, but in our real life we all have bills, mortgages and obligations that we wish we could leave at home and don't have to travel with.

Consequentially LittleStay was born to help with that dream, a company that allow people like us and others to travel, live, experience or start a new life without the everyday struggle of life back “home”.

LittleStay wants you to feel comfortable entrusting us with your largest asset. We will consider your home our home while we manage it. It is our reputation on the line if something is amiss. We do not take that lightly.  LittleStay wants you to be a part of our LittleFamily. We value your partnership and thusly, if you are holidaying and want to stay at one of our properties, you’ll receive insider rates. You can even reserve your own property for your family and friends that are visiting. 

We take care of virtually everything. Our level of cleaning is second to none. Our customer service is beyond compare. Our commitment to you, the owner, our guest, our community is unquestionable. 

We believe a happy home is a filled home so if you have a property that is not happy, please contact us to see how we can help you. 

Or if you're one of our amazing guests helping us, please let us know how we can make your stay more enjoyable. 

Warmest Regards
The LittleStay Team

Live in Melbourne.

properties.transit: Melbourne uses Myki cards for all public transportation. If you are within the CBD and docklands, you are likely within the free tram zone. You will not need to have a Myki card or pay any fare. The tram operator will let you know when you are leaving the free tram circle. If you are traveling outside the free tram circle you will need one for each passenger. You can get your myki card from any major train station or 7-Eleven.  We can provide myki cards for your holiday. There will be a 10 replacement fee if the Myki cards are not returned and a 5 (+negative balance) top up fee if the cards are left with a balance owing. Melbourne also has a bikeshare program throughout the city. They are easy to find with the bright blue bikes and stations. There is a minimum age of 15 and you will need an adult to subscribe for anyone under 18. When the weather calls for it, and sometimes when it doesn’t, we suggest walking the city. You’ll find little shops that you didn’t even know you would love

Welcome to Melbourne!

This is the city we live, play and work, it's incredibly beautiful, vibrant and diverse!

Imagine a city where nobody is judged by the color of their skin, the money they make, their religion, address or sexual preference. Imagine a city where people relate to each other as one big community. 

That's what we're out to find out....

properties.summary: Enjoy Melbourne's 'Laneway Culture' in this newly renovated apartment nestled in the very best part of the city, 200m from Melbourne Central and among some of the city's finest restaurants/bars/cafés... It's perfect!
properties.space: Everything you'd expect from a Melbourne city apartment and more! Sleeping up to 5 guests with a queen bed, two singles and a double sofa bed, this apartment can cater for many requirements (plus 2 porta cots if required at no extra charge). The apartment is equipped with unlimited wi-fi and the TV is fitted with Chromecast and a DVD & Blue Ray player. The kitchen has ample cooking facilities and a dishwasher, all towels and bedding are provided.  Aside from being a contemporary, clean and spacious apartment the key feature is it's location. Set right amongst Melbourne's premier restaurants, bars and cafes this is an ideal place for the out of towner.

properties.neighborhood_overview: There really is something to be said about this part of Melbourne it's vibrant, fun and full of charm. By day it's a popular cafe corner and when the night rolls around this area is alive with dining and classy entertainment spots. If you're looking to experience some of Melbourne's 'laneway culture' then this place cannot be beat! It's also only a short tram ride to Melbourne's major sports and entertainment precincts, the Arts precinct or the city's popular shopping areas.
properties.notes: The cafe next door is one of the best & most popular breakfast/brunch cafes in Melbourne which can mean there can be people waiting outside the atrium entry in the mornings and early afternoons. The apartment is set back from the street so this does not affect privacy or security of guests.  There are many amazing breakfast options at the nearby Cafes but if you want to eat at the apartment we provide milk, cereal, muesli, fruit, tea, coffee & hot chocolate. We also have oil, butter, spreads, sauces if you want to cook. We provide umbrellas, a hair dryer & some toys for kids, so if you want to pack lighter you can keep this in mind.
properties.transit: Melbourne is an easy city to navigate with our 'grid' CBD surrounded by beautiful parks, gardens and promenades. From the apartment you could walk to any area of the CBD or just hop on a tram - it's free within the CBD and Docklands areas! The train station is just a short walk away at Melbourne Central. We supply the apartment with a few Myki cards (public transport top up cards) but it's guests responsibility to ensure they are topped up to use. Myki cards are needed to get out into the inner urban and outer suburban areas. Here is a list of attractions so you can check how far they are from the apartment; City Circle Tram Stop - 200m Melbourne Central (Shopping & Train Station)- 250m Emporium Shopping Centre - 250m Bourke Street Mall - 500m The Victorian State Library - 500m China Town - 600m Flagstaff Gardens- 400m The Queen Vic Market- 500m The Old Melbourne Goal- 800m The Yarra River- 1km The Aquarium- 1km Federation Square- 1.2km ACMI- 1.2km The Arts Centre- 1.4km Crown Casino &
properties.access: Guests will have private access to all areas of the apartment. Please note that there is unfortunately no car space provided with the apartment. It is best to arrive by taxi, Sky bus or public transport if possible. At the moment there is some construction happening on Hardware St and there may be some days where car or pedestrian access is restricted.
properties.interaction: Please feel free to contact us through mobile (calls or text) or via email at anytime. We will endevour to meet all of our guests for key exchange whenever possible. If we are unable to meet you personally we will leave the keys in a lock box to give you flexibility of arrival time. We understand that communication with guests is crucial in order to provide guests with a great travel experience, we try to answer all messages promptly and keep our phones on 24hrs a day for your convenience.
properties.house_rules: We are really proud of this property and take great care to ensure it's presented in the best possible manner. We do expect guests to treat it nicely, to use fittings and appliances properly. No additional guests without approval and the apartment is not to be used for parties. Please report any damage or breakages and leave the apartment clean and tidy on departure. The unlimited wi-fi is a great benefit to guests and we welcome you to make the most of it however we expect you to use it legally. Please be respectful of the neighbours and keep noise to a minimum at night time. Please note there is no smoking allowed in the apartment, thank you.
properties.host_about:
Hi all, we are Airbnb hosts Simone and Jarrod.

We live in Melbourne's eastern suburbs with our three children and as a family we love travelling and going on adventures in our own city. Jarrod loves soccer and sports in general and is learning to speak french. I love anything arts and crafts and enjoy selling my creations whenever I get a chance. 

Jarrod & I have really enjoyed our Airbnb experience of sharing our place with holiday makers from around the world. We take great care in ensuring that our apartment is cleaned and presented to a high standard and our guests are happy & comfortable.

Please send us a message any time if you would like to ask any questions or make a booking.

properties.host_about:
Hi I'm Heather,

My husband Phil and I live on the Mornington Peninsula and love our city apartment.  We hope you do too.  I have been a nurse/midwife for over 30 years and Phil has been a fire officer for just as long.  

The apartment is fully self contained but we rarely cook. Why would you when there are so many dining choices only a few minutes away?  We enjoy being able to walk to all the city attractions, or catch the free tram if we're feeling lazy.  As we near retirement we look forward to more holidays and travel which will obviously include France. (Again!)  Our ideal holiday involves minimal moves from place to place and soaking up the local culture.  Days are planned around the best local eateries.  

If by some chance one of us cannot greet you on arrival, our daughter Justine who lives a few minutes away will happily welcome you.  Please contact us if you have any questions about the apartment, or if you need assistance with activities in Melbourne.

Phil has recently retired and has been delegated most of the greeting duties.

Warmest Regards

Heather & Phil

The tram (free within Green Zone) is just at your doorstep or the free City Circle Tram is just 3 minutes stroll away. properties.transit: Melbourne’s trains, trams and buses are an easy way to see all of the best attractions, sporting venues and shopping precincts. Flinders Street Station (Melbourne's main train station) is 300 meters away.  There is a tram stop near our front entrance. Trams within Melbourne CBD are free of charge. A free visitors City Circle Tram travels the perimeter of the CBD, taking in many of Melbourne’s landmarks. The iconic W-Class tram offers an automated summary of the points of interest along the route and stops at the front of the building. There are also free trams for those going to major events (Australian Open Tennis and the Grand Prix). Melbourne Airport transport Melbourne’s taxis are a convenient way to get from Melbourne airport to the apartment. You can catch a taxi from designated taxi ranks located on the ground floor outside Terminal 1 and between Terminals 2 and 3. Approximate cost of fare from Melbourne airport to the Apartment is about 65 (may vary with traffic). Alternativel

properties.neighborhood_overview: Enjoy the convenience of Coles supermarket, Woolworth Express and over 40 retail stores and cafes, with direct access to Etihad Stadium, Melbourne's Docklands precinct, the CBD and Spencer Outlet Centre. Explore famous Bars & Clubs on King St. Take further free tram trips to Swanston & Bourke St Shopping  hotspots, then walk up to China Town, Melbourne Central, State Library. Or, catch up free trams down to Collins St & Flinders St to meet where local goes, share the multi-cultural and diversities with everybody in shops and cafes. Jump on tram 96 to the rich making spot - Crown Casino, I'm sure you will become millionaire soon. Breathe fresh air along the Yarra River, deep in the city night view at south bank's fine dinning restaurants and you will never want to leave Melbourne.
properties.notes: CAR PARKING Indoor private car park is available for 20 per day, please let me know in advance if you need car parking. properties.transit: Hop on board the Skybus for a quick, convenient and cost effective way to airport is just a minute walk from where you stay. Europcar, Budget and Avis rental car depots are just opposite the building in the Southern Cross station, so picking up and dropping off a rental car is super easy! There is also a tram stop right outside the main entrance on Spencer Street.Take tram 86 to Dockland harbour to share the amazing seafood buffet, or opposite way to Melbourne Bourke street shopping mall. All trams within the city grid are FREE. Just look out for the "FREE tram zone" signs.

properties.host_about:
I've been living in Melbourne for more than 10 years. I love this one of the most amazing cities in the world. 

Everyday I walk through old and morden buildings, streets and lanes, enjoy the foods and coffees from different corners of the world. I make friends with people from all over the world, share the multi cultures from everyone I'v been with.

I invite you to come to Melbourne and spend somedays with me. You will find how amazing this city is. You will find how you will be impressed by everything in this city. Every day here is different, it is time for you to explore.

properties.name: Central City Warehouse Apartment
properties.summary: Absolutely in the centre of Melbourne, this converted, open-plan warehouse is full of natural light and character. Easy walking distance to all points in the city as well as Southbank, Docklands, Carlton and Fitzroy. One of a kind laneway experience. Parties not permitted.
properties.space: One-of-a-kind warehouse conversion in an unbeatable city location for shoppers, foodies and culture lovers. See a video of this apartment on the Sydney Weekender website when it was featured by AirBnB. Search for AirBnB and Melbourne and it should come up. My apartment is located seconds from the official centre of Melbourne, yet it's in a quiet lane with excellent natural light. The centre of Melbourne is known for its many laneways which are full of smart bars, cool cafes, art galleries and some world class graffiti art. One of the nations' premier coffee houses, Brother Baba Budan (aka the cafe with the chairs hanging from the ceiling) is located on the corner of the laneway. Gourmet Travellers pick for the nations' best new restaurant is Tipo 00 on the other corner.  The apartment is the top level which is level 2 (Ground, 1 then 2) and is the only residential floor int this building dating back to 1887. It's an open plan set-up with a spacious mezzanine bedroom, separate toilet an

properties.neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in the centre of Melbourne, not just the CBD but the actual middle of everything. Plus it is in a laneway, one of Melbourne's most beloved features with two excellent cafes, one at each end.
properties.notes: The spa function of the bath tub does not work.
properties.transit: Yes, minutes to trains, trams and buses but most places are an easy walk including Fitzroy, the Queen Victoria Market, MCG, Docklands and the convention centre. There is no train service between the airport and the city but the Skybus leaves every 10 minutes and stops just 15 minutes walk away. Skybus offers a shuttle service to city hotels so if you don't feel like the walk tell them you're staying at City Garden Hotel on Little Bourke St which is just 50 metres from the apartment. Skybus tickets can be purchased online in advance which I recommend to avoid queuing. It's sad watching the bus leave while you're waiting to buy a ticket.
properties.access: Guests have full access to the apartment but are requested to avoid the upper level of the rooftop where the bee hives are kept.
properties.interaction: Interaction at their initiation.
properties.house_rules: Whatever gets taken up to the roof must be brought down. Special care needs to be taken to ensure that nothing is left that can block the drains. No smoking.
properties.host_about:
Melbourne girl, business owner, publisher, traveller, wannabe gardener and dog owner (but not).

Current mission: Pursuing a luxe minimalist approach to life. The pursuit of great life experiences over acquisition of stuff. Digitising photos, music, movies, documents and getting rid of stuff. Travelling, a lot. Thanks to AirBnB I'm 'living the dream' which generally excludes cliches.

As a guest I'm super low maintenance. I'll be happy with a the wifi password and a place to sleep. And chances are I'll have a big list of underground places to visit before I even arrive.

properties.transit: Tram is usually the most convenient and user friendly way to get to your destination or you can walk to most places from here as well. There are many car share options including GoGet and green share in the neighbouring streets.

properties.interaction: We will make every effort to meet guests at the property to exchange keys. We do, however, utilise a lockbox often to accommodate checkins 24 hours a day. During your stay we are always available by email.
properties.house_rules: Check in: Check-in time is from 2pm. Please notify us at least one day prior to your check in day what time and by what mode of transport you will be arriving at the property. Please refer to the key exchange method outlined in our welcome message and dropbox link.  Check out: Check out time is 10am or before. If you plan to leave the property prior to this time, please notify us at least 48 hours prior to your checkout what time you will be planning on leaving the property so that we can liase with our cleaners and have them arrive at the property at the appropriate time to collect the keys. Keys must be left INSIDE THE PROPERTY in the cutlery drawer. Ensure that where applicable, in some cases you must remove your car from the parking garage first before returning to the apartment to leave the keys in the cutlery drawer.  Lockboxes: In cases where there was a lock box used for key collection, please ensure that the lockbox is brought inside the property and left on the dining room ta
properties.host_about:
Hi, my name is Paul, owner of Complete Host apartments! I am a seasoned traveler and have been fortunate to have visited most countries and experienced the way the locals live by staying at amazing airbnb properties all around the world. From these experiences I have learned a lot about what sort of experiences people are after when visiting a foreign city.

After spending the majority of the last 15 years overseas I am living back in my home town of  Melbourne and now run a short stays business called Complete Host.  As such, I have on offer a number of very comfortable properties in some of the best locations of Melbourne.

If you are interested in one of the properties l have listed but the dates are unavailable, please check my other listings under my profile or email me an inquiry as l will very likely have another property available that will suit your requirements. 

I cant wait to meet you and make your stay in Melbourne a memorable one!

Paul, Complete Host
properties.street: Melbourne, VIC 3000, Australia

properties.name: A Resort in the City - Southbank
properties.summary: Great place to come home to after a busy day.  Free Wifi.   If this apartment is not available for your dates please check my other apartments, Resort in the City 2 , Resort in the City 3 and Melbourne River View.
properties.space: Resort style living in the city  Whether you’re in town to explore the city, experience the nightlife, catch one of Melbourne’s many sporting events, attend a business event, visit friends or just relax by the pool – this is the ideal place to base yourself. Regardless of whether it’s for three nights or one month. A modern two bedroom apartment located in a resort style complex (complete with pool, spa, gym and tennis court) right next to the city in the heart of the Arts precinct; the Arts Centre, Melbourne Recital Centre, Australian Centre for Contemporary Art, National Gallery of Victoria and the Malthouse Theatre are all within a very short walking distance.  And the heart of the city and the heart of South Melbourne are both just a walk or short tram ride away.  Along with the central location and great atmosphere of the village-style complex, the apartment has many features:·      Free Wifi Internet 2 bedrooms - With a queen sized bed in each. And a comfortable pull out sofa bed

properties.house_rules: Definitely no smoking, and a need to respect the neighbours with regard to noise and behaviour.  I want guests to be able to relax and enjoy their stay.  Would appreciate the rubbish being put out in bin enclosure next to garage gate on Sturt Street. Please be mindful that this is not a hotel and we expect you to leave the apartment reasonably clean and tidy.
properties.host_about:
I love to travel, and have a daughter married living in Switzerland and another daughter in the tourism industry, so there is always an excuse to get away.  Eating out, going to the movies, the spring racing carnival are other events I enjoy.
I aim to provide people with a comfortable retreat in a central location, so they can enjoy all Melbourne has to offer.
I look after a Resort in the City, A Resort in the City 2, A Resort in the City 3 and Melbourne River Retreat.  I look forward to communicating with you about your forthcoming holiday, and helping to make it a great experience.
properties.street: Southbank, Melbourne, VIC 3006, Australia

properties.summary: Hip and luxurious - this CBD Laneway apt has everything you need for a great stay in the best part of town; Chinatown meets the theater district.  Close to great bars & restaurants, theatres, Royal Exhibition, MCG, Rod Laver and all CBD Delight
properties.space: This **beautiful, warm, light filled space** has been filled with eclectic pieces of art and treasures sourced from all over the world. There is 1 main bedroom with queen sized bed and a comfortable inner spring queen sofa bed. Sleeps 4 comfortably. The apartment is AMAZINGLY QUIET, despite being in the thick of the action, so you'll sleep well! You'll have a fully stocked kitchen with coffee, tea, pots, pans, utensils, spices for any self-catering.  The apartment comes equipped with *super-fast-unlimited wifi*, TV, dishwasher, washing machine, dryer. Luxury linen and towels.
