properties.neighborhood_overview: The apartment is situated in a fantastic part of Melbourne. Situated in Chinatown within meters of amazing bars, restaurants and cafes such as Rice Paper Scissors, Long Grain, Mamasita, Double Happiness Bar, Ginger Boy, Melbourne Supper Club, The European, Pelligrinis, Grossi Florentino, New Gold Mountain, Traveler...you'll need a lifetime to try them all. Located in the Bourke Hill Precinct where Chinatown meets the theatre district. Convenient to Trams & Trains, Princess Theatre, Her Majesty's Theatre, The Palace Theatre, Exhibition Building, chic boutiques, galleries, gardens, parliament and walking distance to the MCG , Fitzroy & Carlton- it doesn't get any better!
properties.transit: 30 minutes by taxi or skybus to the city from the airport.  Trams are now free in Melbourne CBD - It is also very easy to get around Melbourne by foot.

properties.interaction: We are currently living overseas and have an amazing host Katherine, who will assist you with all your enquiries and will be your contact in Melbourne.  Katherine will work with you to confirm your check-in, key exchange and provide you with restaurant recommendations and suggestions on activities to do in Melbourne.  She will be available via email, (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) SMS and mobile.
properties.house_rules: Guests are expected to keep noise levels to a reasonable level and respect our neighbours. No smoking inside. Please turn heating and air-con off when you leave.
properties.host_about:
We are Greg, Cara, Safia (9) & Eloise (5) - lovers of travel, beautiful locations, amazing & exotic spaces, food, music, books, yoga, tropical climates, & mojitos. 

We are delighted to welcome you to either our teak villa in Ubud, or our funky lane-way Melbourne apartment.  We love being airbnb hosts because it means we get to meet fellow travellers and share our favourite places, inside knowledge and beautiful spaces with them. Please don't hesitate to call on us to assist with anything during your stay, we love to be able to make your stay memorable and special, by passing on our invaluable local knowledge - we equipped to recommend great restaurants, bars, good coffee, sights, day-trips, yoga studios, massage parlours and more!

properties.name: Lovely Hip Studio, Child Friendly & Great Location
properties.summary: -Sunny, cosy and neat family home in Melbourne City with a touch of love. -Convenient to food, transport, convention center and entertainments. -Perfect for solo traveler, couples, business travelers & especially family with children, you'll love it here! NOTE: For the benefits of parents with young children, the bedroom is separated from living area through sliding blinds.  We have decided to keep it that way because we find it easier to monitor young children while resting in the bedroom.
properties.space: Welcome to our home.  We hope you will enjoy your stay here.  Being a young family of 2 toddlers we hope we are able to provide more to make your travel experience easier especially if you have children like us. Suitable for up to 4 people. -Spacious living room with a wall mounted TV, XBox and games -Long study desk for business people & even children to do read & draw -Books, travel information, board games -Fast internet connection and 2 MyKi Passes (you can top up for travelling around Victoria and put the passes back before checking out) -Fully equipped artistic kitchen, cosy bedroom and sofa bed to fit 2 adults comfortably (extra linens and blanket provided) -Central heating/cooling -Welcome booklet introducing you to Melbourne with information like emergency contacts, places to visit, recommended food & entertainment, and public transport explained. properties.neighborhood_overview: I have lovely neighbours and building management team in the building.  Therefore we would be grateful if you can maintain the peace and not causing any disruption to these lovely people.
properties.notes: At the moment I will be doing all the cleaning and key handling myself as I wish to provide the best in cleanliness and hospitality.  Please be aware that security deposit could be deducted if I have to call in special cleaning team (Yep, I had a 3 hours cleaning nightmare before which delayed the Check-in time for the next guest).   Therefore I would greatly appreciate it if you can be on time for check-in and check-out.  If you need special arrangement, kindly let me know in advance so that I can work out my time to accommodate your need the best that I can BEFORE you make the booking.  This is due to unfortunate reason that I'm also a full time housewife, a cook/cleaner at home, a driver to 2 kids and 24/7 emergency medical service to my kids.  If you're a parent, you'll know what I'm talking about. :)  Therefore there might also be days that you get to see my little troopers tagging along.
properties.transit: Directly downstairs: -7-Eleven -Japanese/Korean restaurant -Nandos -Domino's & Healthy Pizza takeaways -Di Parsia cafe -Local tour company -Free tram stop (right outside the door on the left) Walk to: -Great kebab place across the road (you can tell by the night queue) -3 mins walk to a variety of cuisines along Southbank & Crown Casino. My favourite, risotto at Cervo) -3 mins walk to 24 hours Crown Casino (retails, cinema & arcade inside as well) -3 mins walk to Sealife Melbourne Aquarium and Melb Convention Center -7 mins walk to Southern Cross Station, Skybus and Coles supermarket TIPS for those with children: Grab a picnic basket and let your little ones have a run at the park just behind the building.  If lucky, they might even see helicopters! You can also rent a bicycle and ride around the city.
properties.access: -Check in time is 1pm, NO LATER than 2pm -Check out time is 10am NOTE: Please let me know if you need an earlier or later check in/out BEFORE you confirm your booking to ensure that I can accommodate your time to save the trouble of cancellation. -The apartment is monitored 24/7 by the building management team, evening security team and security camera on the common area. -Access card is needed to enter the building and lift, and a key for the apartment. Very secure. -Lovely lounge area & free 15 mins visitor carpark -Street parking & 24 hours parking just behind the building are available. Parking fee varies.
properties.interaction: I live about 30-40 minutes away but can be contacted anytime. Therefore I'm unable to do a 24 hours check in but I'm more than happy to drop in when needed.
properties.house_rules: - Check-in and Check-out time are set to allow for cleaning back-to-back stays - If you need slightly different Check-in OR Check-out please check with me BEFORE you confirm your booking to avoid any cancellation. - Kindly leave shoes off inside the house. - Do not rub off the chalk wall and cupboard. - Please keep the apartment clean and tidy and understand that this is also a home for our family. - For your convenience, especially for longer stays, please dispose of rubbish by placing in the Garbage Room which is located at the Ground Floor, next to the lift. - Guests are welcome to have your own guests over for a meal or coffee but no parties or events in the apartment please. - Smoking is strictly prohibited on the premises. If the fire alarm is triggered causing fire engine despatched to the property, you will be liable for any penalties applied. - For those with young children, please keep the children toilet seat and bathtub clean. - Please look after your children and do not le
properties.host_about:
Fluent in English, Mandarin, Malay and a bit in Cantonese.  Hi, I'm Samantha and I'm a mother of 2 kids and I love to travel.  Most of the time I feel like I'm packing half of my home to go travelling with because you'll never know what kind of emergency you'll end up when travelling with children.  Therefore I always appreciate places that are kids friendly and have kids facilities nearby such as park, restaurant with high chair, parents restroom etc.

As a guest and a host, I love things being clean.  As parents we are bit obsessed with cleanliness especially when kids were younger and crawling.  You'll never know what they will pick up from the floor and put into the mouth.  I like places with a bit of touch of home and convenient to food and transport.  Therefore as a host myself, you can be sure that my place is just as what I wish everyone can enjoy, especially the little ones.

properties.neighborhood_overview: Directly opposite Southern Cross station, it is an ideal location for travellers.  20 minute ride to and from Melbourne Airport via the skybus.  The bus departs and arrives literally one minute from the apartment.  Close to the centre of Melbourne CBD for shopping, food and attractions. properties.notes: Please give me notice as to when you arrive so I can escort you into the complex.  It is a secure building. You may cook, but please clean up after yourself and do your dishes in a timely manner. Also, please do not open the front door of the apartment while cooking to ventilate smoke, as the fire alarm in the hallway may go off, so in the event it goes off, there is a very high chance that the fire engine will arrive, which has a fee of 2500 which you will be liable to pay.
properties.transit: The Bourke St tram stop is a 30 second walk from the apartment.  It is now free to travel by tram around the CBD Zone.  The Bourke St tram will get you to such attractions as Myer and David Jones (shopping).  The Collins St tram stop is slighty further (2-3 minute walk).  This tram will take you down stylish Collins St and past the "Paris end" where the designer stores are.  This tram is also free around the CBD precinct
properties.access: By staying at the apartment, you will have access to the gym, sauna and pool (opening hours 6am to 11pm)
properties.interaction: I have a few properties so there is a good chance i'll be in the complex if you want to have a chat or need help :)  I love meeting new people and having a chat.  I have lived in Melbourne my whole life so happy to help with suggestions for places to visit, places to eat and generally places to have fun!  I also am respectful of guests privacy so if they just wish to rent the apartment and be left to their own devices, happy with that too!
properties.house_rules: • Check-in time is 4PM. Loss will incur a fee of 200 due to replacement fees
properties.host_about: I recently came back from a 5 and a 1/2 month holiday around the world where I got to see many new things and meet a lot of people!  I stayed in a lot of airbnb's and loved the experience!  I love chatting to people and making new friends!

The separate open plan living and dining area with dining setting for 4, an LCD TV, DVD player and a study nook. properties.neighborhood_overview: Melbourne Soul's neighbourhood is vibrant and exciting with restaurants, bars, cafes and entertainment within easy reach. Due to its close proximity to a number of public gardens, it is also a very relaxing neighbourhood, making it the perfect base for your stay, whether you are on holiday or business. If sport is your interest, take a short walk to the iconic MCG (cricket and Australian football), Melbourne Park which comprises several sporting facilities including Rod Laver Arena for some of the biggest local and international events like the Australian Open tennis and other sporting and musical events. Take a short tram ride to Melbourne's F1 Grand Prix Circuit, the Melbourne Sports and Aquatic Centre and the National Ice Sports Centre.  Just across the road is the vibrant Federation Square for visitor information, free entertainment, cafes, restaurants, museums, ACMI cinemas and public broadcasting service. Day Tours also depart from Federation Square. A little further along is the
properties.notes: Locations where photos were taken are all within 3 min walk. For your information the blue folder contains recommendations for dining, nearest grocery stores, liquor stores, hospitals, free transport zone and other handy tips.
properties.transit: The tram stops outside the building (free tram zone), Flinders Street Railway Station is a mere block away for travel to virtually any destination. Take advantage of the Melbourne City Tourist Shuttle which also stops opposite Federation Square.
properties.access: The apartment is in a low rise residential unit in one of Melbourne's historic buildings. There is life access as well as emergency stair access. Upon entering the building, there are 5 steps before reaching the elevator. The apartment itself is on the third floor.
properties.interaction: Before your stay: From the point of first contact through to arrival, I liaise with guests via email and/or telephone to ensure they have all the required information about the apartment and how to get here.  Arrival: Guests are met at the apartment for key delivery and to show them the workings of the apartment.  During occupation: While guests are in occupation, they are welcome to contact me during reasonable hours to answer queries, or in case of an emergency, at any time.
properties.house_rules: NO smoking apartment. Check-in 1pm, Check-out 10am. Rubbish to go in Council bin on leaving. Dishes, pots etc washed, dried, put away. Turn off lights and appliances when going out. Observe general conditions emailed on booking.
properties.host_about:
My name is Maria and I have lived in Melbourne, Australia for most of my life.  
I love being with people who are easy going and don't take themselves too seriously. I'm a foodie, enjoy most genres of music and can't go past a romantic flick; also the occasional action movie. Travelling opens up whole new worlds and when you visit Melbourne, I'd like to offer you a taste of our world.

I am one of many who agree that Melbourne is indeed a wonderful and very liveable city. The diversity of cultures is interwoven very well, and with something happening in this great city all the time, why not experience it for yourself? I'm delighted to share our city apartment with you, your family and friends, and let you live our Melbourne culture. 

I look forward to meeting you.

Maria

properties.host_about:
Inspired by and dedicated to Australian contemporary artists, Canvas Suites aims to provide boutique hospitality experience to our guests. Each of our Suites are handpicked, acquired and directly owned by Canvas Suites before being meticulously prepared and setup as the place our guests call home when in Melbourne.

At Canvas Suites, we believe that no visit to a place is complete without immersing oneself in its unique culture and central to any culture is its art. We view each of our art-inspired Suites as carefully curated galleries with walls adorned by original Australian works of art which our guests may enjoy in private during their stay.

But great spaces with great art do not by themselves create great hospitality experience. We know what counts for our guests to have a great stay in Melbourne – a friendly face to meet them, top-of-the-line chiropedic beds made with pristine sheets, the towels and toiletries taken care of to our exacting standards. We also know that our guests want the space and freedom to experience what Melbourne has to offer at their own pace. So we are available 24/7 for when our guests need us, but we step back when they do not.
properties.street: Central Business District, Melbourne, VIC 3000, Australia

properties.name: Cute Melbourne Central Apartment
properties.summary: Cute &  classy studio apartment in a gorgeous Heritage Building.  Quiet, private & very safe with great security. Peaceful & quiet as windows double glazed . Tastefully furnished, queen bed, quality linen &  fittings. Free wi-fi & free use of outdoor swimming pool and laundry on site. Surrounded by Melbourne's best restaurants & cafes & a few minutes walk  from the free tram network. Walking distance to shops, supermarkets & cafes, gardens, theatres, St Vincent's Hospital etc. No parking.
properties.space: LOCATION We have just recently installed double glazing to make your stay more comfortable. It’s all about location! Our charming, boutique apartment lies literally a few steps away from cafes, restaurants, shops, theatres, China-Town etc.   You can catch the free City Circle Tram which will take you from nearby St Patrick's Cathedral to St Paul's Cathedral, Federation Square, the Melbourne Museum, and Victorian State Library, the new Docklands area and the famous Melbourne Crown Entertainment Complex and Casino... It goes on and on, and a lot of these are within walking distance.  You are also close to the trams in Bourke Street or Spring Street and the underground railway station. Shopping is so close by - just a couple of blocks away there are lots of arcades with interesting and individual shops, department stores, Bourke Street Mall, Melbourne Central Mal

properties.neighborhood_overview: Richmond is urban city suburb (but not manic!) filled with hidden gems of cafes, eateries, galleries and breweries! It's vibrant, it's multi-cultural and easy to get to! Trams and trains are right at your door step or at close proximity. Bridge Road, is known for its boutique bars and food, as well as Swan Street, with its Greek streak, and Victoria Street, known as Little Saigon for its Vietnamese restaurants. It’s also just a punt kick from some of the city’s best sporting venues, including the MCG for AFL, Melbourne Park for tennis and AAMI Park for soccer and rugby league, and gardens. Get exploring!
properties.notes: I'm more than happy to accommodate and work with your check in/ check out times as I've travelled and understand how important timing can be, so please message me in advance so we can work something out. ***Lost of house keys and toggle is 125***
properties.transit: The main public transport in Melbourne are trams (and trains)! But before you hop on/off one, you'd need to get a pass (daily, weekly, monthly) at the local newsagent (in the shopping centre) which is conveniently located just across the street. The 109 tram on Victoria Street (just on the corner, 2 min walk) takes you straight into the city in 15 minutes. Or just grab your first FREE ride with Uber (download the app) and using this code: jesslynm24ue There is free parking on Burnley Street. Please read parking signs for time restrictions. There is also 5 overnight parking at the shopping centre across the street when you enter after 6PM and leave before 7AM the next day.

Enjoy the privacy of your own queen bedroom in this top-floor, 2-story apartment above a great Hotel complex. Perfect combination of the convenience of hotel facilities with the creature comforts of a lovingly maintained home.

Guests get to enjoy the privacy of their own bedroom with: - queen bed - plenty of wardrobe space - sun filled room with floor to ceiling windows - fresh linen and towels - your own kettle with tea & coffee provided Please note that the rest of the apartment you will be sharing with me... including the bathroom, kitchen, living room and sunroom space.

The apartment is two stories with your bedroom and the bathroom downstairs and the rest of the space upstairs including living room, kitchen and my bedroom. With this set up, you can really enjoy the privacy of your own floor and choose how m
properties.neighborhood_overview: I love this neighborhood and would be happy to give you tips and advice about what to see while you're here!  EVERYTHING is within walking distance. Just a short stroll to: - the Arts Centre - Hamer Hall - Federation Square - Flinders Street Station - Southern Cross Station - Queen Victoria Markets - Melbourne Sealife Aquarium - Southbank  - Degraves Street Trams at the doorstep and easy access to all the cafes, graffiti lane-ways and boutique shops Melbourne is world famous for. It doesn't get more central to the action than this! My top tip? Find a balance between planning excursions and spontaneous adventures. Melbourne is known for it's street performers, graffiti artists and pop up shops and cafes. As much as you can research and plan in advance, many of the best experiences my guests have had have happened when they weren't expecting them! Make sure you leave some time for aimlessly wandering around the city and discovering unexpected gems!
properties.transit: Trains: - 8-minute walk to Flinders Street Station - 9-minute walk to Southern Cross Station Trams: - right outside the apartment, there's a tram station with trams departing every few minutes. Uber: - quickly replacing taxis here in Melbourne, an uber driver is never more than 10 minutes away and is usually that fastest way to get where you need to go! Bike Hire: - there is a City of Melbourne bike hire stand right outside the apartment. Biking is a beautiful way of getting around the city with a lot of bike lines and special bike tracks along the beach and river. Airport Transfers: - I recommend using Skybus. You can pre-purchase tickets online or at their kiosk at the airport for 19. The bus departs every 10 - 20 minutes and will take you directly to Southern Cross Station. It's a short 10-minute stroll along Collins Street to the apartment from there. Or, even better, Skybus also offers a complimentary hotel transfer service! Just check in at their "hotel transfer booth" and they
properties.access: The apartment is two stories with your bedroom and the bathroom downstairs and the rest of the space upstairs including living room, kitchen and my bedroom. With this set up, you can really enjoy the privacy of your own floor and choose how much you want to come upstairs and interact with me. Bathroom: - shower, toilet & sink with plenty of cupboard space you can use - guest towels & face cloths - hair dryer, hair straightener & curling tongs Hotel Facilities: - pool - gym - coin-operated washing machines and dryers - 24-hour hotel concierge - restaurant offering full buffet breakfast at 25 per person  - bar with great burger and steak menu! Residents (and their guests) receive 25% discount on all food items on the menu. You can choose to dine in the bar or bring your food up to the apartment to enjoy your meal in privacy.
properties.interaction: Weekdays, I am usually very active working during the day and attending classes in the evenings so you will mostly have the apartment to yourself (with Sarabi the cat). I am much more free on the weekends to chat and show you around the city. I love this area and am always happy to share my favourite spots with travellers!  I love cooking and having friends over for Sunday brunches and Friday dinners, if this happens while you're staying, you're always more than welcome to join in! Maybe prepare a dish from your home country or contribute a bottle of wine. I've had some lovely shared meal experiences with guests and it's one of my favorite parts of being an Airbnb host!
properties.house_rules: No strict rules but please remember that this is my home and we'll be sharing the space so I'm looking for common courtesy and respect. I love cooking and having friends over for Sunday brunches and evening meals, if this happens while you're staying, you're always more than welcome to join in! Maybe prepare a dish from your home country or contribute a bottle of wine. I've had some lovely shared meal experiences with guests and it's one of my favorite parts of being an Airbnb host! :-)
properties.host_about:
Hey guys,
My name is Daniella and I'm a Preschool Ballet Teacher living in Melbourne, Australia. I'm passionate about my coffee, shopping and art so Melbourne was an obvious choice for me! It's a beautiful city and I'd be happy to share my favorite spots with guests.
I've done a bit of travelling but there's still so many places I  can't wait to see. So far, I've checked out:
- around Australia (top recommendation: check out Hobart especially during the annual MONA FOMA festival!)
- New Zealand (I grew up in Auckland)
- United States (New York, DC, Baltimore, Philadelphia, San Francisco, Black Rock City)
- Singapore
- Bali
- Fiji
- New Caledonia
Would be great to share travel stories with guests and get tips and advice as to where I should be heading next!

It has a open plan living area including the lounge with a full kitchen, a sleeping loft, dinning area, laundry facilities and a functional shower room.  I have a full size double bed in my apartment for the first 2 guests and a sofa bed which pulls out into another double size bed for 2 more guests (3rd and 4th guests), convenient for those who are travelling on a budget. Else the sofa bed can fit your kids nicely and they may love the novelty of sleeping on a pull out bed :-)

properties.neighborhood_overview: Melbourne City - voted one of the most liveable city in the world!  You will be in the heart of the CBD right opposite the Southern Cross Station, which is the main hub connecting to the Melbourne International and Domestic Airport, Interstate trains, Bus terminal, Tourism departure point and lots more! Want to explore the city? The location is pretty much close to everything! China town, Crown Casino, Etihad Stadium, Docklands shopping area, Direct Factory Outlet (DFO), tonnes of Cafes and restaurants and heaps more!  Feel a bit Lazy to walk? Tram stop is right in front of the building and the best part is, it is FREE for those who are only travelling around the city! My apartment is well within the Free Tram Zone so it has the added advantage for your convenience! Rental car? No problems! As there are heaps of leasing company right opposite my building (in Southern Cross Station).  Want to take a punt? Crown Casino is just down the road and they operate 24x7! Good luck if you plan to
properties.notes: Linens and towels are provided and cleaners are engaged to clean and thoroughly inspect my place between each stay.  Basic toiletries are provided including towels for each guest.  Complimentary Tea and Coffee are provided too.  Please turn on the rangehood and open window if you cook because the smoke/fire alarm is rather sensitive ABSOLUTELY NO SMOKING inside the apartment, No loud music, No parties of any sort.
properties.transit: Southern Cross Station (main station/transport hub) is just opposite of the apartment, from there you can take SKY bus to the airport, V Line to go by train to country Victoria, Metro train to most suburbs in Melbourne or tram around town.  Apartment is located in the FREE TRAM zone within the Melbourne CBD, literally just outside the building. Just look out for the "FREE tram zone" signs. HOW TO GET HERE? Take a train, tram, bus or taxi and hear towards the Southern Cross Station. Southern Cross Station is located on the western end of the heart of Melbourne CBD grid.  The station is also the main transport hub so it is super convenient and great place to get around!   The apartment is right at the corner of Spencer Street and Little Bourke Street, Melbourne.  For public transport information visit: 'Public Transport Victoria' (Click on the 'Journey Planner' tab and select Southern Cross Station as your destination) From Melbourne Tullamarine Airport? No problems!  There are Airport B
properties.access: Please email/sms/message me or you could also ask questions about anything and in cases of emergency or urgent issues, you can ask the building managers on the ground floor. You will be able to access the apartment naturally and also all the Resort Style facilities including the gym, swimming pool, sauna, BBQ and pool side area, business/social lounge and rock climbing wall with the swipe card. There are three restaurants on-site on the ground floor including an Asian (PHO24), Modern Australian (Higher Grounds) and Breakfast/Grill trendy cafe (Pretty Mama) which all scores very highly amongst Melburnians.
properties.interaction: I am available to answer your queries via Airbnb messaging, SMS or email, and there is also a 24 hours building manager at the ground floor who are able to help you in cases of emergency. Rest be assure that if you message me via Airbnb, my reply is almost instantaneous most of the time. Feel free to drop me a line or questions about anything in Melbourne and I will be happy to help as your local friend or guide.  Also check out my local Guidebook in Airbnb so you can try the many restaurants and Cafés that locals frequent in Melbourne.  I will also be providing you with a 'House Manual' when you book the place and there are Contact phone numbers and Emergency Contact numbers too.

properties.summary: Centrally located in the heart of vibrant Melbourne is this fantastic 2 bedroom designer apartment. properties.space: Please check my other properties if this is not available on your preferred dates. I offer huge discounts for last-minute bookings and specials for longer bookings too; just ask me! This architecturally inspired building is only a year or so old and is set right between Albert Park Lake and the botanical gardens precinct. It is the premier location for any visit to Melbourne: the trams along St Kilda road will drop you in the city within 5 minutes and also the funky and vibrant restaurants and cafes of St Kilda are only a few tram stops or a short walk away.  The space includes 2 bedrooms, open plan kitchen with a wonderful entertainers balcony with views to Albert Park lake and Port Phillip bay and beyond.  Each bedroom contains 1 comfortable bed (queen in main and double in second). If you have any concerns about the sleeping arrangements for the 5th person please contact us prior to making the booking to ensure it is suitable.

However, we have some options (secure lock box, cafe option etc) which are much more convenient for guests that allow them to turn up at a time of their choosing after 2pm - we might use one of these methods instead.
properties.house_rules: Check in: Check-in time is from 2pm. Please notify us at least one day prior to your check in day what time and by what mode of transport you will be arriving at the property. Please refer to the key exchange method outlined in our welcome message and dropbox link. Check out: Check out time is 10am or before. If you plan to leave the property prior to this time, please notify us at least 48 hours prior to your checkout what time you will be planning on leaving the property so that we can liase with our cleaners and have them arrive at the property at the appropriate time to collect the keys. Keys must be left INSIDE THE PROPERTY in the cutlery drawer. Ensure that where applicable, in some cases you must remove your car from the parking garage first before returning to the apartment to leave the keys in the cutlery drawer. Lockboxes: In cases where there was a lock box used for key collection, please ensure that the lockbox is brought inside the property and left on the dining room tabl
properties.host_about:
Hi, my name is Paul, owner of Complete Host apartments! I am a seasoned traveler and have been fortunate to have visited most countries and experienced the way the locals live by staying at amazing airbnb properties all around the world. From these experiences I have learned a lot about what sort of experiences people are after when visiting a foreign city.

After spending the majority of the last 15 years overseas I am living back in my home town of  Melbourne and now run a short stays business called Complete Host.  As such, I have on offer a number of very comfortable properties in some of the best locations of Melbourne.

If you are interested in one of the properties l have listed but the dates are unavailable, please check my other listings under my profile or email me an inquiry as l will very likely have another property available that will suit your requirements. 

I cant wait to meet you and make your stay in Melbourne a memorable one!

Paul, Complete Host

properties.name: Absolutely central Melbourne
properties.summary: Apartment is small but sunny and light, with a nice outlook. Surrounded by restaurants, bars and student cafes. Trams at doorstep, next to Melbourne Central railway station. Opposite State Library, close to main sports arenas and universities.
properties.space: Close to the best of Melbourne: State Library, Federation Square, Victoria Art Gallery, MCG, Melbourne Park (Australian Open), Botanical Gardens, Melbourne University, RMIT, restaurants, cinemas, shopping.
properties.description: Apartment is small but sunny and light, with a nice outlook. Surrounded by restaurants, bars and student cafes. Trams at doorstep, next to Melbourne Central railway station. Opposite State Library, close to main sports arenas and universities. Close to the best of Melbourne: State Library, Federation Square, Victoria Art Gallery, MCG, Melbourne Park (Australian Open), Botanical Gardens, Melbourne University, RMIT, restaurants, cinemas, shopping. Small but adequate kitchenette. Surrounded by eateries of every variety. Coin washer and dryer available next to apartment. I will either meet you at the apartment, post you a keycard or leave it for you at reception if you are arriving during reception hours. Apart from that, you'll be on your own, but I am available if you have any problems. Swanston Street is a hot spot for music and food. The State Library forecourt, overlooked by the apartment, is a great gathering place. Please note this is the central city so if you are seeking a quiet s
properties.neighborhood_overview: Swanston Street is a hot spot for music and food. The State Library forecourt, overlooked by the apartment, is a great gathering place. Please note this is the central city so if you are seeking a quiet spot, this is not for you. Melbourne University and RMIT University are a few minutes away. A Unilodge operates from the building but my apartment is not part of Unilodge.
properties.notes: There are ceiling fans but there is no air conditioner (it's a heritage building) so it does get hot after a succession of hot summer days. Melbourne can be very hot in summer. On the other hand, it can be mild. If you feel the heat, you might want to choose another place in summer.
properties.transit: Trams are at the doorstep.  The Melbourne Central railway station is underneath the flat, two floors down.  Tram travel around the central city is free. You will need to pay to use trains or trams outside the central city. To travel, you need a MYKI card, which I will leave for guests.  You will need to load them up it's about 8 a day for all-day travel. Bicycles for hire across the road for a daily fee of 2.80. You will need to use a credit card.  Heaps of attractions within a few minutes walk. From airport, take a taxi to the apartment (about 50), or catch the airport bus to the city and get them to drop you off near the intersection of Little Lonsdale and Swanston Street. If you're travelling by train, get off at Melbourne Central Station and look for the Swanston Street exit.
properties.access: Small but adequate kitchenette. Surrounded by eateries of every variety. Coin washer and dryer available next to apartment.
properties.interaction: I will either meet you at the apartment, post you a keycard or leave it for you at reception if you are arriving during reception hours. Apart from that, you'll be on your own, but I am available if you have any problems.
properties.house_rules: Please consider my neighbours.
properties.host_about: I'm a dual New Zealand and Australian citizen. I'm a newspaper journalist.  I lived in Melbourne for many years. I now live in Wonthaggi but have a small flat in the city.

The balcony has 2 chairs from which you can take in the stunning views of Albert Park Lake and St Kilda Rd.  Open plan lounge and dining area adjoin a fully equipped kitchen complete with Smeg gas stove and oven, dishwasher, fridge and coffee machine.  The bathroom includes a European laundry with washing machine and ironing facilities.

properties.interaction: This property is managed by ellecor Holiday Home Management on behalf of its owner. ellecor can be contacted via email or phone prior to and during your stay.
properties.house_rules: Check-in is after 2pm Check out is before 10am This is a non smoking apartment Strictly no parties or events Due to the proximity of our neighbours, noise must be kept to a minimum after 9pm On departure please dispose of all non-perishable food items, wash and return all dishes, place used towels on the washing machine, turn off all lights and heating/cooling and dispose of all rubbish in the appropriate garbage/recycling bins. Thank you
properties.host_about:
This property is managed by ellecor Holiday Home Management on behalf of Lou. 
Born in Tasmania but now living in Melbourne, Lou has a passion for world travel. She is well versed with Airbnb having used the site to source accommodation in many countries. 

I’m Lauren, the Director of ellecor Holiday Home Management who specialise in professional short-term property management.
Be assured if you book an ellecor property your travel experience will be seamless and hassle free! We pride ourselves on providing prompt, personalised and professional customer service and are always happy to help you with any queries you may have before, during or after your stay!

I am an experienced real estate property manager and have also worked for many years in both the travel and customer service industries with a double degree in Tourism and Business Management. Further to this, I am extremely well versed with Airbnb and other holiday home listing sites, as I have owned and managed my own holiday home ‘The Queenslander’, located in Noosa Heads, Queensland since 2014. Unable to find a suitable managing agent for my home I created my business, ellecor Holiday Home Management.

My passion for travel has taken me all around the world and I love that on a daily basis I am able to make other people’s travel dreams become a reality!
